notes_H1: Information on COVID situation continues to be published regularly.  https://archive.ph/fsV0k  https://web.archive.org/web/20210601002340/https://mepyd.gob.do/tablero-de-seguimiento-covid-19-30-de-mayo-2021
notes_H2: On May 19, the Ministry of Public Health Republica Dominicana realized testing task force, especificed PCR in Santo Domingo Area II and recommended that population looking for health centre for gratuite testing.  See in Ministry of Public Health of Republica Dominicana’s website, archived:  https://web.archive.org/web/20210523132903/https://www.msp.gob.do/web/?p=11723
notes_C7: No change. No restrictions on intercity or interstate travel.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210531163930/https://do.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C2: Authorities in the Dominican Republic have extended the current curfew restrictions and other domestic COVID-19-related measures until at least June 16.  Most public and private establishments are allowed to operate at a 50 percent capacity limit in accordance with industry-specific protocols.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210614215620/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/489126/dominican-republic-authorities-to-extend-curfew-and-other-domestic-covid-19-measures-until-at-least-june-16-update-34
notes_H3: "I also want to invite the entire population to follow the recommendations of experts and health authorities.  This means taking the necessary hygiene measures to prevent the Coronavirus: washing your hands frequently, keeping your distance if you have a cough or sneeze, and seeking medical attention in case of fever or respiratory distress.  Likewise, we must bear in mind that the health authorities will request that people who have been in contact with infected patients also remain isolated, even if they are asymptomatic." http://web.archive.org/web/20201116073439/https://coronavirusrd.gob.do/2020/03/12/gustavo-montalvo-comision-de-alto-nivel-dara-seguimiento-permanente-para-respuesta-a-coronavirus/
notes_E1: QEC and FASE I expired at end of April but the government announced a new program targeted to reach the most heavily affected sectors—it will be a targeted FASE program running from May until July 2021 for workers in the tourism sector.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210614213453/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19
notes_C1: In the period from May 11 to 15 schools are partially open. See UNESCO website, archived:   https://web.archive.org/web/20210523174407/https://en.unesco.org/covid19/educationresponse
notes_H7: Since 10 May 2021, vaccine availability has been expanded to the population 18+ with comorbidities and soon after it was planned to expand to the entire population 18+. No confirmation was found of the actual date for this roll-out but number of vaccines administered increase every day and new mobile centres are opening.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210601093014/https://vacunate.gob.do/  https://web.archive.org/web/20210601093502/https://www.msp.gob.do/web/?p=11805
notes_C3: All public events forbidden: "In the same way, following the WHO protocols and the practices in place in different countries, events and concentrations of all kinds are suspended for 15 days.  This includes national and international events, public shows, cultural, artistic, and sporting events, as well as activity in bars and discos, among others."  https://web.archive.org/web/20200427180440/https://www.msp.gob.do/web/?p=6627
notes_C8: Due to the covid variant in the UK, travelers from the UK are required to present a negative polymerase chain reaction (PCR) test taken no more than 72 hours before travel. UK arrivals without a negative PCR certificate will be tested upon arrival and must complete a seven-day quarantine at a government facility at their own expense.  http://web.archive.org/web/20210419185149/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/467556/dominican-republic-authorities-extend-covid-19-related-curfew-hours-and-other-measures-through-may-16-update-30
notes_C4: Group gatherings are to be limited to no more than 10 people in public spaces.  http://web.archive.org/web/20210419185149/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/467556/dominican-republic-authorities-extend-covid-19-related-curfew-hours-and-other-measures-through-may-16-update-30
notes_C6: "Beginning December 31, the government of the Dominican Republic has issued a curfew nationwide.  Failure to follow the curfew, including for U.S. citizens, may result in arrest and/or fines.  Full details on the curfew can be found at https://presidencia.gob.do/            December 31:  Curfew will begin at 7pm.              January 1-10 (M-F):  Curfew from 5pm to 5am, with a grace period for transit until 7pm each day.              January 1-10 (Sa-Sun):  Curfew from 12pm to 5am."    https://web.archive.org/web/20210103135354/https://do.usembassy.gov/u-s-citizen-services/covid-19-information/
notes_H6: On May 21, the Dominican Republic's Ministry of Public Health reactivated its epidemiological bulletin and presented the recommendation guide for the prevention of covid-19. In this place, it is informed that citizens must wear masks throughout the space included in open places such as parks, squares, boardwalks.  See in Ministry of Public Health of Republica Dominicana’s website, archived:  https://web.archive.org/web/20210523131813/https://www.msp.gob.do/web/?p=11738
notes_H8: "Santo Domingo, Dominican Republic.- The Minister of Public Health, Rafael Sánchez Cárdenas, announced the issuance of Resolution 0018, by virtue of Law 42- 01 General de Salud, which declares this epidemic in the national territory with the aim of controlling the spread of the coronavirus (COVID-19).    The suspension of economic, social and recreational activities is available from 8:00 pm to 5:00 am every day of the week, with the exception of some," he said.  This document establishes the following provisions:    (...) people over 60 must stay at home and maintain social distancing measures, limit leaving the home, go out only when necessary."    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20200811192246/https://www.msp.gob.do/web/?p=7826
notes_C5: Public transportation are required to operate at limited capacity. Masks are required in public transportation.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210523131813/https://www.msp.gob.do/web/?p=11738  https://web.archive.org/web/20210614215946/https://do.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/

name: Algeria
notes_H1: Government communication on covid-19 appears to have been forthcoming: https://web.archive.org/save/http://www.premier-ministre.gov.dz/fr/mediatheque/videos/pm-djerad-30-03-2020.html
notes_H2: COVID-19 Testing    Are PCR and/or antigen tests available for U.S. citizens in Algeria? Yes.  If so, are test results reliably available within 72 hours? No. Not always. Can depend on volume of tests in processing.  Consult with the testing facility.   https://web.archive.org/web/20210315232547/https://dz.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C7: As per last update, internal movement operation is limited with strict adherence to SOPs  Quote: "Travel between provinces is now permitted though public transport options remain limited."  Archive Link  http://web.archive.org/web/20210516171815/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/algeria/coronavirus  _________________________________________________________  Quote: "Are there restrictions on intercity or interstate travel? Yes"  Archive Link  http://web.archive.org/web/20210523190717/https://dz.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/  ________________________________________________________  Quote: "National rail services are operating, with passengers subject to body temperature scans before boarding trains. Domestic flights are operational."  Archive Link  http://web.archive.org/web/20210523205156/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/480766/algeria-authorities-cancel-plans-to-reopen-land-borders-due-to-covid-19-international-flights-to-resume-june-1-update-4
notes_E2: Key Policy Responses as of February 4, 2021    FISCAL  A national socio-economic recovery plan was discussed at a conference on August 18 and 19. Among other things the plan aims to ensure food and pharmaceutical security, promote a favorable business climate, and foster high value added sectors and international trade and FDI. A supplementary finance law (SFL) was enacted on June 4. It includes provisions amounting to 70bn dinars to mitigate the health and economic impacts of the COVID-19 crisis. For the health sector, this includes 3.7bn for medical supplies, 16.5bn for bonus payments to health workers, and 8.9bn for the health sector’s development. For the economic impact, the law includes 20bn for allowances to the unemployed because of COVID, and 11.5bn for transfers to poor households. Overall, in order to adjust to the new low oil price environment, the SFL plans for a reduction in current and capital spending by 5.7 percent (representing 2.2 percent of 2019 GDP) compared to the initial 2020 budget law. In response to the economic impact on household and enterprises of the lockdown measures, the authorities also announced that: (i) the declaration and payments of income taxes for individuals and enterprises have been postponed except for large enterprises; and (ii) contractual deadlines would be relaxed and penalties for companies that experience delays in completing public contracts would be suspended.    I recorded this as a 1(narrow) because it includes only tax exemption and nothing else like utilities    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20210215151708/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19
notes_C2: As per last update , most businesses have started reopening with strict adherence to SOPs  Quote: "The types of businesses and services allowed to reopen nationwide include construction companies, real estate agencies, travel agencies, produce markets, bakeries, car rental companies, and government institutions. Restaurants and cafes have reopened in most provinces; hotels and mosques can also reopen. Residents must wear protective face coverings when in public, including in vehicles."  Archive Link  http://web.archive.org/web/20210523205156/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/480766/algeria-authorities-cancel-plans-to-reopen-land-borders-due-to-covid-19-international-flights-to-resume-june-1-update-4
notes_H3: The government statement says that it aims to -     Strengthen epidemiological surveillance by conducting in-depth investigations, especially about people in contact, in order to break the chain of spread of infection. In this context, the human and material means necessary to implement these investigations will be provided by placing land and air transport at the disposal of the Ministry of Health in order to enable it to intervene quickly and effectively to resolve the problems raised across all states of the country      https://web.archive.org/web/20200707001319/http://www.premier-ministre.gov.dz/ar/premier-ministre/activites/com-29-06-2020-ar2.html
notes_E1: As per last update, some support was provided to unemployed and poor along with support to healthcare sector   Quote: "Key Policy Responses as of May 3, 2021  For the economic impact, the law includes 20bn for allowances to the unemployed because of COVID, and 11.5bn for transfers to poor households. "  Archive Link  http://web.archive.org/web/20210525005728/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19
notes_C1: Schools are fully open with precautionary measures in place.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210516155333/https://en.unesco.org/covid19/educationresponse
notes_H7: Which vaccines are available in Algeria? SPUTNIK-V, SINOPHARM, ASTRA-ZENECA  The Algerian Ministry of Health has a website to register for a COVID-19 vaccine. It has also announced that individuals may register at public health units: “établissements publics de santé de proximité (EPSP).”  There is a prioritization which includes age group, but the Ministry has not published specifics.  Archived Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20210607191807/https://dz.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C3: As per last update , there is ban on large gatherings in 19 provinces   Quote: "There is a ban on gatherings such as marriages and funerals in the 19 provinces under curfew."  Archive Link   http://web.archive.org/web/20210516171815/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/algeria/coronavirus
notes_C8: President Abdelmadjid Tebboune announced in a televised speech on Tuesday, March 17, the closure of all land borders and the suspension of all air and maritime links - except for those transporting goods - to limit the spread of coronavirus (COVID-19).    The decision follows the announcement that all travel via air and sea to and from Europe will be suspended from Thursday, March 19. Air Algerie is scheduled to arrange flights for citizens returning from France. The airline will also temporary suspend its flight services to and from Tunis, Cairo, Dubai, Doha, and Amman from March 17. Prime Minister Abdelaziz Djerad had previously announced the suspension of flights to several African destinations including Senegal, Mali, Niger, Mauritania, Cote d'Ivoire, and Burkina Faso from March 19.    Link - http://web.archive.org/web/20200611151823/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/323986/algeria-government-closes-land-borders-and-suspends-air-and-sea-transport-due-to-covid-19-march-17-update-6
notes_C4: There is a ban on gatherings such as marriages and funerals in the 19 provinces under curfew.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210516171815/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/algeria/coronavirus
notes_C6: The government lifted the full lockdown in Blida on 24 April and replaced it with curfew between 14:00 to 07:00. Night time curfews in other provinces to continue.  Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20200426141624/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/335791/algeria-authorities-ease-covid-19-restrictions-for-ramadan-april-24-update-12
notes_H6: The wearing of facemasks became mandatory on 24 May in all public spaces, including when using public transport, and within private cars and taxis.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200910153722/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/algeria/coronavirus
notes_H8: "Algeria will ease confinement measures from the first day of the holy month of Ramadan on Friday by shortening a night curfew and lifting a full lockdown for a province near the capital Algiers, the prime minister’s office said on Thursday.    It said the full lockdown in the Blida province south of Algiers will be replaced with a curfew from 2 p.m. to 7 a.m. while a 3 p.m.-7 a.m. curfew in nine provinces, including Algiers, will be shortened to run from 5 p.m. to 7 a.m."    Source: https://archive.vn/rPpZF
notes_C5: As per last update, public transport have started operating, however, in some provinces are reduced/closed down at specific times  Quote: "Public transport is operating in all 58 of the nation's provinces. Taxis and app-based ride-sharing services have also begun running again, albeit under certain capacity limitations. "  Archive Link  http://web.archive.org/web/20210523205156/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/480766/algeria-authorities-cancel-plans-to-reopen-land-borders-due-to-covid-19-international-flights-to-resume-june-1-update-4  _______________________________________________________________  Quote: "A curfew is in effect from midnight to 4am in 19 provinces including the capital Algiers. The other provinces covered by the curfew are: Adrar, Laghouat, Batna, Bejaia, Blida, Tébessa, Tizi-Ouzou, Jijel, Sétif, Sidi Bel Abbes, Constantine, M’Sila, Ouargla, Oran, Boumerdes, El Oued, Tipaza and Touggourt."  Archive Link  http://web.archive.org/web/20210516171815/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/algeria/coronavirus

name: Ecuador
notes_H1: The government launches the official website on all COVID-19 related information. Retrieved from: https://web.archive.org/web/20200409110834/https://coronavirusecuador.com/
notes_H2: Ministry of Health responsible for continuation of issuing required health prevention measures, including PCR tests     https://web.archive.org/web/20210308175157/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/ecuador/coronavirus
notes_C7: SPECIAL, ADDITIONAL ENTRY REQUIREMENTS FOR THE GALAPAGOS ISLANDS: Any international traveler wishing to transit via Quito or Guayaquil International Airport to the Galapagos should first arrive in-country with proof of a negative COVID test taken in the last three days (as per instructions above). In addition, all persons present in Ecuador (regardless of nationality or residence status) wishing to travel to the Galapagos Islands must present negative results from a RT-PCR test taken no more than 96 hours prior to arrival in the Galapagos.  This can be the same test as the test used to get into Ecuador, assuming it was taken within 96 hours of arrival to the Galapagos.  If the initial test was not taken within 96 hours of arrival to the Galapagos, the traveler will need to take a second test in Ecuador at a laboratory recognized by the Quality Assurance Agency of the Services of Health and Prepaid Medicine (ACESS), at their own expense.  They will need to wait for the results of this test before traveling to the Galapagos.  http://web.archive.org/web/20210525090359/https://ec.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information-ecu-2/  http://web.archive.org/web/20210525084848/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/ecuador/coronavirus
notes_E2: The Ministry of Energy and Non-Renewable Natural Resources ordered that all the electricity and water distribution companies in the country not cut service to residential users who have unpaid bills.  /web/20200503195024/https://www.eluniverso.com/noticias/2020/03/15/nota/7783146/emergencia-sanitaria-no-se-cortaran-servicios-agua-o-electricidad    13-apr. A Law Project has been sent to Congress to forbid evictions but this has not yet been approved  /web/20200503195220/https://www.eluniverso.com/noticias/2020/04/13/nota/7812147/ley-inquilinato-emergencia-covid-19-arriendos-inquilinos-defensoria
notes_C2: The 28-day state of emergency for the provinces of Azuay, Pichincha, Imbabura, Carchi, Tungurahua, Cotopaxi, El Oro, Esmeraldas, Guayas, Loja, Manabi, Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas, Santa Elena, Los Rios, Sucumbios and Zamora Chinchipe, declared by the President on 21 April, has ended. There are no longer lockdown and weekend curfew measures in place in the above provinces.    Ecuador’s National Emergency Operations Committee (COE) has announced that from Friday 21 May all social mass events and public gatherings continue to be suspended, mixed on-line/in person schooling is prohibited, inter provincial buses can operate at 75% capacity, and that both public and private sectors should continue prioritising virtual working.  http://web.archive.org/web/20210525084848/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/ecuador/coronavirus

name: Egypt
notes_H1: The Egyptian government has launched an information campaign 'Stay at Home' to raise awareness about COVID-19 urging citizens to follow the social distancing advice. The Ministry of Health has also established a dedicated COVID-19 hotline to answer any queries from the public.    Source (in Arabic):https://web.archive.org/web/20200528220904/https://news.un.org/ar/story/2020/03/1051932
notes_H2: 20 May 2020     Egypt signalled an expansion of testing for the new coronavirus on Wednesday, announcing that all the country’s 320 general hospitals would offer testing to people showing symptoms of the illness.   https://uk.reuters.com/article/us-health-coronavirus-egypt/egypt-to-offer-coronavirus-testing-in-all-general-hospitals-idUKKBN22W2UI
notes_C7: Is a curfew in place? No  Are there restrictions on intercity or interstate travel? No    https://web.archive.org/web/20210129191754/https://eg.usembassy.gov/u-s-citizen-services/covid-19-information/
notes_E2: Individual life, medical and car insurance policyholders are given a grace period to meet their financial obligations. Mortage and financial leasing companies are to grant a six month grace period without imposing any delay fines. See Financial Regulatory Authority document, archived: https://web.archive.org/web/20200823154518/http://www.fra.gov.eg/jtags/efsa_en/media/Initiatives.pdf
notes_C2: Egypt lifts coronavirus restrictions on June 1st for improve economy through tourism sector says Egypt Cabinet. Websites Egypt Cabinet and Ministry of Health and Population were not available. See in Reuters website, archived: https://web.archive.org/web/20210606233442/https://www.reuters.com/world/africa/egypt-lifts-coronavirus-restrictions-june-1-cabinet-says-2021-05-30/
notes_H3: No information was gathered on this placeholder. Please see: https://web.archive.org/web/20210329055352/https://www.facebook.com/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.facebook.com%2Fegypt.mohp%2F
notes_E1: Pensions have been increased by 14 percent. Expansion of the targeted cash transfer social programs, Takaful and Karama, are also being extended to reach more families. A targeted support initiative for irregular workers in most severely hit sectors has been announced, which will entail EGP 500 in monthly grants for 3 months to close to 1.6 million beneficiaries.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201109105435/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19
notes_C1: There are also restrictions on schools, universities, cafes, bars, clubs, hotels and tourist locations operating at a reduced capacity.  http://web.archive.org/web/20210525015717/https://platform.twitter.com/widgets/widget_iframe.06c6ee58c3810956b7509218508c7b56.html?origin=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.arabnews.com
notes_H7: On May 30 th it completed vaccinating workers in all hotels in Southern Sinai and Red Sea provinces. Vaccines - Astrazeneca ( by Covax) See in Reuters website, archived: https://web.archive.org/web/20210606233442/https://www.reuters.com/world/africa/egypt-lifts-coronavirus-restrictions-june-1-cabinet-says-2021-05-30/
notes_C3: Egypt lifts coronavirus restrictions on June 1st for improve economy through tourism sector says Egypt Cabinet. Websites Egypt Cabinet and Ministry of Health and Population were not available. See in Reuters website, archived: https://web.archive.org/web/20210606233442/https://www.reuters.com/world/africa/egypt-lifts-coronavirus-restrictions-june-1-cabinet-says-2021-05-30/
notes_C8: The Egyptian Government has announced that all passengers travelling to Egypt (including Egyptians) must be in possession of negative PCR test certificate for COVID-19, taken at a maximum of 72 hours before their flight departure time.  However, passengers travelling from Japan, China, Thailand, North America, South America, Canada, London Heathrow, Paris, and Frankfurt will be allowed to provide the test certificate performed at a maximum of  96 hours prior to flight departure, due to the long travel and transit period from these airports.   Are U.S. citizens required to quarantine? No    https://web.archive.org/web/20201109104301/https://eg.usembassy.gov/u-s-citizen-services/covid-19-information/
notes_C4: Egypt lifts coronavirus restrictions on June 1st for improve economy through tourism sector says Egypt Cabinet. Websites Egypt Cabinet and Ministry of Health and Population were not available. See in Reuters website, archived: https://web.archive.org/web/20210606233442/https://www.reuters.com/world/africa/egypt-lifts-coronavirus-restrictions-june-1-cabinet-says-2021-05-30/
notes_C6: Egypt is implementing 14-day quarantine periods and other preventative measures in all cases for people who test positive for COVID-19 while in Egypt. Individuals who do not adhere to precautionary measures such as wearing a mask indoors may be subject to an immediate fine or prosecution.  Large indoor weddings, funerals, festivals, or other mass gatherings are canceled indefinitely. Businesses such as restaurants and cafes must operate 50 percent of capacity or less, with penalties of 4,000 LE to temporary business closures.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210419080558/https://eg.usembassy.gov/u-s-citizen-services/covid-19-information/
notes_H6: The Government of Egypt has announced that commencing Sunday, January 3, 2021, individuals who do not adhere to precautionary measures such as wearing a mask indoors may be subject to an immediate fine or prosecution.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210117105308/https://eg.usembassy.gov/u-s-citizen-services/covid-19-information/
notes_H8: See C6
notes_C5: Egypt lifts coronavirus restrictions on June 1st for improve economy through tourism sector says Egypt Cabinet. Websites Egypt Cabinet and Ministry of Health and Population were not available. See in Reuters website, archived: https://web.archive.org/web/20210606233442/https://www.reuters.com/world/africa/egypt-lifts-coronavirus-restrictions-june-1-cabinet-says-2021-05-30/

name: Eritrea
notes_H1: No update. Regular announcements and advice continue to come from the Ministry of Information.
notes_H2: A program of random population testing for Covid was announced on May 16 2020 to "gauge the spread of COVID-19 in the country in a comprehensive and more reliable manner". Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20201115164748/https://shabait.com/2020/05/17/first-phase-of-random-and-extensive-covid-19-testing-launched/     The Ministry of Health noted on October 12 2020 that "targeted testing of quarantined individuals, febrile and other patients with COVID-19 symptoms in all clinics and hospitals throughout the country; as well as Aggressive Contact Tracing continue to constitute the three key pillars of the Preventive Strategy." - source https://web.archive.org/web/20201115163833/https://us.embassyeritrea.org/2020/03/28/covid-19/"    Tests are generally taken at one of the Eritrean government’s 82 testing center and are free-of-charge. All testing samples are sent to Asmara’s Central Lab for evaluation. Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20201115141839/https://er.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C7: Restriction on all movement, with a ban on the use of private cars unless by key workers. https://web.archive.org/web/20200605224007/http://www.shabait.com/news/local-news/30407-guidelines-from-the-high-level-task-force-on-covid-19
notes_E2: There is no data touching on this from the IMF. Please see: https://archive.ph/gxVRM
notes_C2: Eritrea's Ministry of Information has stated that as of this month, people are now able to return to work   https://web.archive.org/web/20210425112835/https://shabait.com/2021/04/24/safe-return-to-work/
notes_H3: There is some evidence of contact tracing taking place (reported on 9 February) but not clear that this meets the bar for being "comprehensive". Reverting to coding of "Limited" - https://web.archive.org/web/20210314174819/https://shabait.com/
notes_C1: Eritrea's Ministry of Information has stated that as of this month, people are now able to return to school   see here: https://web.archive.org/web/20210425112835/https://shabait.com/2021/04/24/safe-return-to-work/  see here: https://web.archive.org/web/20210425113536/https://er.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C3: All public gatherings, sport and cultural events that assemble a crowd of more than 10 people are prohibited.  Cinemas and night-clubs to remain closed until further notice. Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20200605214149/http://www.shabait.com/news/local-news/30342--ministry-of-health-public-guidelines-no-3
notes_C8: All borders are officially closed, as is Asmara international airport. There is no indication of when the airport will re-open. Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20200915213606/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/eritrea/entry-requirements
notes_C4: All gatherings of over 10 people are prohibited without a government permit. - https://web.archive.org/web/20210404142327/https://er.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C6: There is no curfew in place, essential shops and services are open, but stringent movement restrictions imply that staying at home is recommended - https://web.archive.org/web/20210404142327/https://er.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_H6: According to the Eritrean government, wearing masks is to be strictly observed. Please see: https://web.archive.org/web/20210411220417/https://shabait.com/2020/12/21/guidelines-from-the-high-level-task-force-on-covid-19-5/
notes_H8: There are no protection measures beyond that of the general population in place for elderly people  see here: https://web.archive.org/web/20210425113536/https://er.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C5: Public Transportation is on reduced service, and private cars are banned from the road without a permit.  see here: https://web.archive.org/web/20210425113536/https://er.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/  https://web.archive.org/web/20210425112835/https://shabait.com/2021/04/24/safe-return-to-work/

name: Spain
notes_H1: Following the coronavirus outbreak in China, the Government of Spain has promoted a number of public information channels for gathering all the relevant information from the various ministerial departments. The purpose is to allow anyone interested in this topic to access information from reliable expert sources.  /web/20200430102339/https://www.lamoncloa.gob.es/lang/en/gobierno/news/paginas/2020/20200131info-coronavirus.aspx
notes_H2: "Early detection of Covid-19 infection will be done by performing a PCR (or any other molecular diagnostic technique considered adequate) to ALL CASES SUSPECTED of infection in the first 24 hours." Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20200511201542/https://www.mscbs.gob.es/profesionales/saludPublica/ccayes/alertasActual/nCov-China/documentos/instruccionesPruebasDiagnosticasEmpresas.pdf
notes_C7: Restrictions and nighttime curfews have been lifted in Valencia, the last region to have them in place. Precautions and prevention measures are still required to follow by citizens.    Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20210614002118/https://www.abc.es/espana/comunidad-valenciana/abci-nuevas-restricciones-coronavirus-valencia-desde-este-martes-8-junio-202106071818_noticia.html
notes_E2: Economic assistance measures approved which  1) bans electricity, gas and water shutoffs to all households during the coronavirus health crisis  2) Provides rent and housing support, including:   "Suspension of evictions: once the state of emergency has ended, and for the next six months, it is suspended for all those people who are in a vulnerable situation and are pending eviction.  Microcredits: banks will offer tenants microcredits without interest or commissions guaranteed by the state. Who is eligible? People who have lost their jobs, who are under an ERTE, who have had to reduce their working hours and self-employed who cannot make their payments. These microcredits may be repaid in six years and may be extended by another four years.  Extraordinary extension: leases that expire during the next two months after the entry into force of this rule are extended to six months.  Moratorium on payment: when the owner of the housing, physical or legal person, has an investment fund, the tenant may request a moratorium on payment of rent as long as the state of emergency is in effect. On the other hand, tenants may also apply for specific public aid."   ARCHIVED:  https://web.archive.org/web/20200522185146/https://www.mitma.gob.es/el-ministerio/sala-de-prensa/noticias/mie-01042020-0735  https://web.archive.org/web/20200522185152/https://www.shbarcelona.com/blog/en/coronavirus-crisis-how-will-it-affect-rents-in-spain/  https://web.archive.org/web/20200522185157/https://smartwatermagazine.com/news/smart-water-magazine/spain-bans-water-shutoffs-during-coronavirus-pandemic
notes_C2: * The High Court of Justice of the Community of Valencia has ordered the reopening of gambling venues.  Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20210420002702/https://www.lasprovincias.es/economia/tsjcv-aperturas-salones-juego-20210415152110-nt.html  *updated to add additional source because first link was behind a paywall  http://web.archive.org/web/20210425192247/https://www.theolivepress.es/spain-news/2021/04/20/no-big-relaxations-to-covid-restrictions-in-costa-blanca-area-of-spain-ahead-of-may-9-says-valencian-president-ximo-puig/
notes_H3: 24th Feb- first person tests positive in mainland spain. Catalan health authorities have isolated 25 people with whom she came into contact and are carrying out tests to see if they have the virus.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200408121902/https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2020/02/1000-tourists-tenerife-quarantine-coronavirus-diagnosis-200225115101427.html
notes_E1: The government announced a New Social Agreement that maintains until 30 June the support to furlough/unemployment insurance to the workers of those enterprises who will not be able to get back to work due to force majure.    https://web.archive.org/web/20200511211456/https://www.lamoncloa.gob.es/presidente/actividades/Paginas/2020/110520-acuerdo-social.aspxhttps://www.lamoncloa.gob.es/presidente/actividades/Paginas/2020/110520-acuerdo-social.aspx
notes_C1: According to this article, it is not even recommended that schools should close:  "the Health Ministry does not believe the rising trend will impact the return to school, which has already happened in some regions, and will begin on Monday in others. When asked about the possibility of closing schools on Thursday, health official María José Sierra replied: “We do not recommend it.”  https://web.archive.org/web/20210110182152/https://english.elpais.com/society/2021-01-08/coronavirus-cases-in-spain-officially-top-two-million.html
notes_H7: - A: Key workers, nationally covered.  - B: clinically vulnerable people are eligible for vaccination nationally. But Spain does not include patients with COPD, diabetes and obesity within groups of clinically vulnerable people.  - C: People over 80 are fully covered at the national level with two doses, but there are some differences in regional coverage and doses received in 70-79 and 60-69 ages groups.   - New groups are included in the last update of the Vaccines National Strategic Plan, but vaccines to those groups are not being administered yet.     * Vaccines administered: Pfizer / BioNtech, Moderna, AstraZeneca / Oxford, Jansenn.    Sources:     https://web.archive.org/web/20210522224421/https://www.elconfidencial.com/tecnologia/ciencia/2021-05-18/obesidad-punto-ciego-vacunacion-uci-ancianos_3079295/ *** https://web.archive.org/web/20210522224443/https://www.consalud.es/pacientes/especial-coronavirus/enfermedades-cronicas-sanidad-dejado-grupo-vacunacion_95666_102.html *** https://web.archive.org/web/20210518173830/https://www.mscbs.gob.es/profesionales/saludPublica/ccayes/alertasActual/nCov/documentos/Informe_GIV_comunicacion_20210518.pdf  *** https://web.archive.org/web/20210519190407/https://www.mscbs.gob.es/profesionales/saludPublica/prevPromocion/vacunaciones/covid19/docs/COVID-19_Actualizacion7_EstrategiaVacunacion.pdf
notes_C3: A massive sports event took place in Madrid on June 4. Madrid has also authorized bullfighting events and concerts will be allowed soon.    Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20210605070535/https://www.cope.es/actualidad/sociedad/noticias/wanda-metropolitano-prueba-fuego-para-los-eventos-masivos-sus-antecedentes-pandemia-espana-20210604_1326713
notes_C8: Borders have been opened for EU flights only. Screening protocols in place in all airports.     Source:  https://web.archive.org/web/20200626011838/https://www.infobae.com/america/mundo/2020/06/21/espana-abre-sus-fronteras-y-apuesta-al-turismo-para-maquillar-su-peor-tragedia-economica-desde-la-guerra-civil/
notes_C4: Restrictions on gatherings up to 6: Catalunya, Aragón and La Rioja.  Restrictions on gatherings up to 10: Valencian Community and Castilla.   Restrictions on gatherings up to 15 people: Extremadura.  No restrictions: Navarra, Basque Country, Cantabria, Asturias, Castilla y León, Madrid, Murcia and Andalucía.    Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20210520134259/https://cincodias.elpais.com/cincodias/2021/05/07/economia/1620344546_297829.html
notes_C6: Restrictions and nighttime curfews have been lifted in Valencia, the last region to have them in place. Precautions and prevention measures are still required to follow by citizens.    Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20210614002118/https://www.abc.es/espana/comunidad-valenciana/abci-nuevas-restricciones-coronavirus-valencia-desde-este-martes-8-junio-202106071818_noticia.html
notes_H6: Masks are required for everyone age six or older in enclosed spaces and public areas and on public transport.    https://archive.vn/vYbV5
notes_H8: 19th March 2020,  Order SND / 265/2020, of March 19, the measures adopted related to residences for the elderly and social-health centers, in the face of the health crisis caused by COVID -19.   This Order of the Ministry of Health includes measures referring to all personnel, health and non-health, who provide their services in residences for the elderly and other socio-health centers, as well as related to the location and isolation of patients with COVID- 19 in such centers, and applicable provisions for cleaning them.    *recoded from a 3 to a 1*  - The ongoing lockdown measures apply to the elderly by default. No evidence of additional measures was found.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210112110602/https://www.imserso.es/imserso_06/mas_informacion/covid19/norm/index.htm
notes_C5: Spain’s Government to Allow 100% Passenger Occupation on Public & Private Transport from Monday June 8. Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20200611033954/https://www.euroweeklynews.com/2020/06/06/spains-government-to-allow-100-passenger-occupation-on-public-private-transport-from-monday-june-8/

name: Estonia
notes_H1: No policy change. Information available on government Covid-19 website.    Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20210517191107/https://www.kriis.ee/en
notes_H2: Tests available for anyone symptomatic or people returning to Estonia from 'high-risk' countries.    Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20210517191731/https://www.kriis.ee/en/testing-virus
notes_C7: "As of tomorrow, the restriction on freedom of movement will be lifted, people can travel feely between the islands and the mainland Estonia, and from one island to another, regardless of their place of residence. Since the risk of spreading the coronavirus due to movement between the islands and the mainland has decreased considerably, lifting the movement restriction is a proportional response." (http://web.archive.org/web/20200604215302/https://www.kriis.ee/en/news/special-notice-tomorrow-movement-restrictions-between-islands-and-mainland-estonia-will-be)
notes_E2: No policy found.    Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20210517210053/https://valitsus.ee/en/node/24880
notes_C2: https://web.archive.org/web/20210508182825/https://www.kriis.ee/en/news/government-approved-order-concerning-amended-covid-19-restrictions
notes_H3: If people in Estonia have received a close contact notification from the Health Board, the HOIA application or the patient they came in contact with, it is important that they remain self-contained. A person assigned to self-isolation may not go to work, school or public places or use public transport. Due to the latency period for COVID-19 infectious disease, the government of Estonia asks people to stay at home for 10 days from close contact and monitor their health. Although testing is not mandatory, the Health Board recommends that close contacts undergo SARS-CoV-2 testing at the end of the 10-calendar-day quarantine period to detect possible asymptomatic disease.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210601212258/https://www.terviseamet.ee/et/olen-lahikontaktne
notes_E1: No policy change. The Unemployment Insurance Fund pays the employee a compensation of 60% of the employee's average monthly wage in a month, but not more than 1,000 euros (gross). Self-employed persons whose business income in 2020 was at least 50% lower than in 2019 can also apply for a subsidy of 584 euros.    Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20210517210053/https://valitsus.ee/en/node/24880
notes_C1: From 17 May, contact learning will be allowed for all students of general education schools, vocational schools, universities of applied sciences, and higher education institutions. The general health protection requirements and the instructions and recommendations of the Ministry of Education and Research must be taken into account when organising studies. Indoors, care must be taken to ensure air quality through ventilation.      Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20210517193455/https://www.kriis.ee/en/news/government-approved-order-concerning-gradual-easing-covid-19-restrictions
notes_H7: As of 17 May, all Estonian people can get vaccinated against COVID-19. Vaccines: Janssen, Moderna, Pfizer (also the AstraZeneca vaccine, which is not offered to people under the age of 50).    Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20210517205007/https://vaktsineeri.ee/en/covid-19/getting-a-vaccination/    https://web.archive.org/web/20210517205116/https://www.kriis.ee/en/vaccination-estonia
notes_C3: From 3 May, religious services and other public religious activities may be held, subject to the time, space, and occupancy restrictions set out above. All other indoor public events, both cultural and entertainment events, will be subject to the current restrictions. Public meetings and religious services as well as all other public outdoor events in the field of culture and entertainment can be attended by a maximum of 150 people. People must be in groups of up to 10 members that do not come into contact with each other. Events may be held from 6 a.m. to 9 p.m.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210508182825/https://www.kriis.ee/en/news/government-approved-order-concerning-amended-covid-19-restrictions
notes_C8: Due to the coronavirus, the government of Estonia is recommending everyone to avoid travelling if there is no urgent need. Entry into Estonia is possible. Estonian citizens and residents are allowed into the country regardless of whether they are symptomatic or not. Citizens and residents of the Schengen area are allowed to enter the country if they are not symptomatic. Only asymptomatic citizens who are coming to Estonia to study or work or under some other exception are allowed to come to Estonia from third countries. A person is not subject to a movement restriction if he arrives into Estonia from a European Union, European Economic Area or Schengen area country where the infection indicator is less than 150 people per 100 000 residents within the past 14 days. If the indicator is higher, the person must adhere to the 10-day movement restriction. The 10-day self-isolation and COVID-19 testing requirements are not applied to persons who have had the COVID-19 disease and no more than six months have passed since they were declared recovered by a doctor, or have been fully vaccinated against the COVID-19 disease and no more than six months have passed since the completion of the vaccination. People may do the PCR test no more than 72 hours before arriving in Estonia or immediately after arriving in Estonia. The second test must be done no earlier than six days after doing the first test. The 10-day movement restriction can be ended early if the results of both tests were negative.     https://archive.vn/ElOuy
notes_C4: From 11 June, a maximum of 600 people will be allowed to attend events indoors, subject to dispersal and a 50% occupancy requirement. A maximum of 1,000 people are allowed to take part in events in a restricted outdoor area.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210614100437/https://www.kriis.ee/en/news/covid-19-restrictions-be-relaxed-11-june
notes_C6: No restrictions.    Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20210517194759/https://www.kriis.ee/en/restrictions-force-estonia-starting-march-11
notes_H6: On the 10th of November, the government announced recommendations that would come into place on the 12th of November. These included:  -A requirement to wear a face covering on the nose and mouth in public transport, in the service halls and public areas of commercial enterprises, at conferences, concerts, theatres and cinemas. Carriers/event organisers/ employers are asked to monitor this. Excepts are allowed e.g those with asthma.   -Carriers are asked to put up signs asking passengers to wear face coverings.  https://web.archive.org/web/20201114191537/https://www.kriis.ee/en/news/government-announced-new-measures-stop-spread-coronavirus
notes_H8: Starting from May 3, all people who are 50 years old or will be turning 50 in the course of this year can get vaccinated against COVID-19.     https://web.archive.org/web/20210509122927/https://www.kriis.ee/en/vaccination-estonia

name: Ethiopia
notes_H1: From the ministry of health and Ethiopian Public Health Institute. For example, see: http://web.archive.org/save/https://www.facebook.com/ephipage/?ref=nf&hc_ref=ARRual-vb-0bHTsHys3NU-8N4iOccXLMtg1BLfDFVz2GTNcrFJUcdKKzGiDbgiC6Etc
notes_H2: https://web.archive.org/web/20210408195828/https://www.wmcethiopia.com/ these testes are however relatively expensive for most of the citizen to afford. most test are available in government hospitals testing patients with symptoms and eligible for the test asymptomatic people can get tested in drive through testing facilities, or even in government health care facilities te
notes_C7: Local travel restrictions that were put in place due to unrest in the Ethiopian Tigray region, have been lifted however some clashes still exist, and applying caution is advised. To date, no local restrictions are in place due to COVID 19.   https://archive.fo/wZw4x
notes_E2: No household support provided.  Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20200505235808/https://institute.global/policy/economic-policy-response-covid-19
notes_C2: It was noted on 18 June that nightclub and entertainments outlets must remain closed. Per guidance issued on October 5th, the hospitality industry (cafes, bars, restaurants and coffee shops) may offer service to up to 3 people per table, with social distancing, mask wearing, provision of ventilation and PPE, disinfection procedures. Nightclubs may operate with limited capacity and social distancing and other measures. Sports tournaments are permitted, but without spectators. Cinemas, thaters and art gallers are permitted to open with mandated cleaning protocols, provision of PPE, reduced capacity. Details are contained in Part 8, "Cautionary Measures To Be Complied with By Recreations, Hospitality Services, and Sport Tournaments" of Directive No 30/2020, "A DIRECTIVE ISSUED FOR THE PREVENTION AND CONTROL OF COVID-19 PANDEMIC" issued on October 05, 2020 by the Ethiopian Public Health Institute. https://web.archive.org/web/20201016015706/https://www.ephi.gov.et/images/Registerd-COVID-19-Directive-2013_Final_051020.pdf
notes_H3: On 5th March, the EPHI has announced, only 1326 contacts were identified for 5714 new cases .  https://archive.vn/aJV1C
notes_C1: Schools announced to reopen provided they meet safety criteria.  Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20201109162755/https://www.globalcitizen.org/en/content/ethiopia-schools-covid-19-child-marriage-labor/
notes_H7: A,B,C: Astrazenica  -The vaccines are available by donation, individuals don't pay for the vaccines however its difficult to label this as government funded.  -key workers and clinically vulnerable groups like front line workers were given priority to the vaccine followed by the elderly.   https://web.archive.org/web/20210408202823/https://www.facebook.com/EthiopiaFMoH/photos/a.246374842199993/1784694475034681/
notes_C3: The following guidance came into effect on October 5, 2020:    "It is recommended, as much as possible, not to hold holidays in a public square involving too many people until the prevalence of the pandemic is stabilized."     https://web.archive.org/web/20201121145133/https://www.ephi.gov.et/images/Registerd-COVID-19-Directive-2013_Final_051020.pdf
notes_C8: http://web.archive.org/web/*/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/ethiopia/entry-requirements
notes_C4: No Policy Change. http://web.archive.org/web/20210215001037/https://www.ephi.gov.et/images/Registerd-COVID-19-Directive-2013_Final_051020.pdf
notes_C6: No curfew is in place.  Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20201109160856/https://et.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_H6: Wearing of face masks is mandatory in all public places (except for children under 6 years or those with a relevant provable condition)    Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20210322111639/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/ethiopia/coronavirus
notes_H8: There is no specific directive or policy adopted by the government and health minister for the elderly  except vaccination priorities.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210408202823/https://www.facebook.com/EthiopiaFMoH/photos/a.246374842199993/1784694475034681/
notes_C5: Public transport providers must comply with relevant coronavirus measures, including reduced passenger loads, mask-wearing and ventilation.    Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20210322111639/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/ethiopia/coronavirus

name: Finland
notes_H1: Covid Coordination group announced on Feb 27th https://vnk.fi/en/article/-/asset_publisher/hallitus-sai-laajan-katsauksen-koronavirustilanteesta-ja-paatti-lisakoordinaatiosta; dedicated, regular info from government maintained as of 24 April: https://web.archive.org/save/https://thl.fi/en/web/infectious-diseases/what-s-new/coronavirus-covid-19-latest-updates
notes_H2: THL recommends coronavirus testing at a low threshold with symptoms. However, they don’t test persons who are asymptomatic, since it does not always provide reliable results. Virus testing currently has a capacity of over 13,000 tests per day.  Link: http://web.archive.org/web/20200716034706/https://thl.fi/en/web/infectious-diseases-and-vaccinations/what-s-new/coronavirus-covid-19-latest-updates/symptoms-and-treatment-coronavirus/coronavirus-tests
notes_C7: Government Q&A:  Is travel within Finland allowed? Travel within Finland is allowed as long as health and safety guidelines relating to coronavirus are observed.  All travel must be avoided when ill. During travel, it is important to observe good hand and respiratory hygiene. It is important to avoid unnecessary physical contact Tourism businesses must pay particular attention to cleaning, preparedness planning and training of staff. https://web.archive.org/web/20200523104305/https://valtioneuvosto.fi/en/information-on-coronavirus/current-restrictions  Old note: Starting from May 29, the Government is encouraging domestic travel. All travel should be avoided when sick, and social distancing should still be practiced.   https://web.archive.org/web/20200523104305/https://valtioneuvosto.fi/en/information-on-coronavirus/current-restrictions
notes_E2: Government announced on 5 June a removal of value added tax on PP&E and other goods vital  to fight the pandemic. This will sacrifice around 7 million euros of government revenue over 2020.     http://archive.vn/NWn81
notes_C2: In general, working from home is recommended and workplaces remain open. In Helsinki, public spaces have been closed, which means the closure of some sectors, including all urban indoor sports facilities, cultural centers, museums, youth facilities and the zoo. This measure is in place from 30 Nov 2020 until 31 Jan 2021.     https://web.archive.org/web/20210108142952/https://www.hel.fi/helsinki/korona-fi/koronaneuvonta/voimassa-olevat-suositukset-ja-rajoitukset
notes_H3: 28th Feb Contact tracing “Officials said they will contact such persons individually who may have been exposed” from new case.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200408214223/https://yle.fi/uutiset/osasto/news/new_coronavirus_infection_confirmed_in_helsinki/11234516
notes_E1: From March 16, the government has removed waiting periods and abolished some conditionalities on the duration of employment etc. to make unemployment benefits more accessible for people who have lost their jobs due to the pandemic. 'The five-day waiting period has been abolished starting 16 March. Unemployment benefits will be available from the first day of unemployment. The normal five-day waiting period will be applied again as of 7 July 2020.' 'The work requirement for qualifying for unemployment allowance has been reduced temporarily (.. ) The change will be effective until 6 July 2020.'     The Finnish benefits system is complicated, so it's not possible to clearly define whether income support is set at above or below 50% of normal earnings. There are multiple different types of benefits a person can receive depending on factors such as employment history and union membership. The amount of the base unemployment benefit provided by KELA is means-tested; increases to the base amount will be granted depending on conditions such as the number of children and the availability of other sources of income. Many people who lost their jobs will also be union members who receive earnings-related benefit that are calculated on the basis of duration of employment; in many cases this will be larger than the base amount.     https://web.archive.org/web/20200523110355/https://www.kela.fi/web/en/unemployment-benefit-corona
notes_C1: In Helsinki, institutions of upper secondary education (upper secondary schools and vocational schools) will move to distance learning. The needs for necessary contact teaching will still be secured. Contact teaching will be offered, among other groups, to disabled students receiving special needs education and to students who need individual support for any reason. Distance learning will begin at the start of the new evaluation period on 3 December 2020 and continue until 31 December 2020.     https://web.archive.org/web/20201221175327/https://www.hel.fi/helsinki/coronavirus-en/childhood-and    In the rest of the country, schools remain open but with social distancing measures in place.     https://web.archive.org/web/20201221175732/https://valtioneuvosto.fi/en/information-on-coronavirus/questions-and-answers
notes_H7: Code changed to 4G as regions are now vaccinating broad groups may include a large group of adults (eg. all those aged over 45).     Espoo - As of Tuesday 1 June, coronavirus vaccination appointments are available to Espoo residents who turn 35–39 this year (i.e. those born between 1982 and 1986).  https://archive.vn/YjX0q     Helsinki - Coronavirus vaccinations begin for Helsinki residents aged 30–34 https://archive.vn/UUFPe and https://archive.vn/HBgOn     Central Ostrobothnia - everyone over the age of 30 in Soite’s area and 16-64-year-old persons who belong to risk group 1 or 2 and have an illness or condition that is very highly or highly predisposing to severe coronavirus disease. https://archive.vn/Bh7lS     East Savo - Vaccination is now open for those aged 45 and over and for risk groups 1 and 2 from the age of 16. https://archive.vn/XM7bi and  https://archive.vn/KOcHT     Aaland – Vaccinating 45 years and older and 16 years and older and belongs to the risk group. https://archive.vn/AWVII     Vaccines - Pfizer-BioNTech, Moderna, AstraZeneca, and Johnson & Johnson.  https://archive.vn/JH0K0     Up-to-date vaccination coverage: first dose 46.3%, second dose 10.3%  Vaccinated subjects included in the coverage calculations: First dose 2571773, second dose 572912  Total doses of coronary vaccine administered: First dose 2582439, second dose 574902  https://archive.vn/TGIUf
notes_C3: From 2nd June regions generally are permitting events in different sizes depending on the municipality mostly due to graduation parties. While areas like Kainuu have no restrictions on number of people at events, regions like Helsinki and central Ostrobothnia a maximum of 10 people indoors for events.    Helsinki and Espoo - All public events and meetings held indoors or outdoors will be prohibited for a limited time. However, 1–22 June 2021 public events and meetings of a maximum of 10 participants will be allowed indoors and similar gatherings of a maximum of 50 people will be allowed in delineated outdoor areas. Private events are recommended, as of 1 June 2021, to be limited to a maximum of ten people indoors a maximum of 50 people outdoors.  https://archive.vn/QrEfX  and https://archive.vn/FGxBz     Central Ostrobothnia - the number of participants at public events and public gatherings is limited to 10 people indoors. Outdoors, the restriction is 50 people. These regulations regarding gatherings are in effect from 2nd of June to 15th of June 2021.  https://archive.vn/QDjrV     Southern Finland - Public and private events and general meetings of more than 10 people indoors and more than 50 people outdoors in regionally restricted areas are prohibited. https://archive.vn/IRH1Z     Kainuu - No restrictions concerning number of attendants in public meetings or events. https://archive.vn/roJlK
notes_C8: Statutory restrictions on border traffic will be lifted in cross-border traffic across the Schengen internal borders by allowing employment or commission-related commuting and other essential traffic.  For the time being, recreational travel abroad is not recommended    https://web.archive.org/web/20200514124101/https://valtioneuvosto.fi/en/information-on-coronavirus/current-restrictions
notes_C4: There is no policy for private events, but several regional authorities recommend that people adhere to the regional guidelines for (public) indoor gatherings in private as well. I have therefore coded this as 4, since at the regional level, indoor gatherings are restricted to max 10 people (see also the note under C3).     https://web.archive.org/web/20201221180827/https://valtioneuvosto.fi/en/information-on-coronavirus/current-restrictions    The regional authority for Helsinki for instance recommends:     "It is recommended that no private events be held. A private gathering also means family events. An exception to the recommendation is small-scale (up to 10 people) commemorative events that can be organized."    https://web.archive.org/web/20201221185524/https://www.hus.fi/ajankohtaista/koronavirus-covid-19/alueellinen-koronavirusepidemiatilanne-ja-suositukset
notes_C6: ***Recoded to reflect that Lapland no longer recommends working from or staying home.   Previous coding note -  The authorities recommend working remotely to the extent possible in both the public and private sectors. http://web.archive.org/web/20210604204345/https://valtioneuvosto.fi/en/information-on-coronavirus/current-restrictions     Current national telework recommendation is in effect until June 30 and applied in almost all regions. https://archive.vn/CF7sy    However on 11 June, the Lapland (LSHP Corona Coordination Group) Stated that there are no longer any epidemiological grounds for the telework recommendation in the Lapland Hospital District. https://archive.vn/yOx1Z
notes_H6: Recoded from 1G to 2T to reflect "As of 13 March 2021, all those aged 12 or over must wear a face mask when using HSL public transport. The only acceptable reason for not wearing a mask is if you are unable to do so for medical reasons." http://web.archive.org/web/20210313204055/https://www.hel.fi/uutiset/en/helsinki/face-masks-mandatory-on-public-transport-from-13-march
notes_H8: Following Midsummer 2020 (24. June), the blanket ban on visitors (except to meet seriously ill residents), was replaced by a policy that remains in place as of Jan 2021: • 1-3 visitors at a time, agreed in advance • Asymptomatic, good hygiene, safe distance 1-2 m, wear masks • Limited access in/to facilities • Personnel to advise visitors  As strict guidelines for isolation, hygiene in LTCFs, some limitations on external visitors and/or restrictions protecting elderly people at home remain in place (only by advance "booking" etc.), 2G is closest fit (see previous note for more information).   https://web.archive.org/web/20210111235456/https://unece.org/fileadmin/DAM/pau/age/Policy-Seminar/Pia-Pulkkinen-Policy-Seminar-on-Ageing.pdf

name: Fiji
notes_H1: Regular public advisories on social media and government websites released starting from Jan 22:    https://web.archive.org/web/20200609073437/http://www.health.gov.fj/media-release-1-2019-novel-coronavirus/    https://web.archive.org/web/20200609073613/https://www.facebook.com/MoHFiji/photos/pcb.1771720962959435/1771720439626154/?type=3&theater=
notes_H2: Prioritised for symptomatic people, high-risk people such as asymptomatic close contacts of a case of COVID-19, or international travellers, who have completed 14 days of the total of 28 days of quarantine. Asymptomatic healthcare workers who have completed 14 days quarantine after directly caring for confirmed cases and patients with acute respiratory illness may also be tested.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210410152056/http://www.health.gov.fj/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/CRITERIA-FOR-TESTING-FOR-COVID-19-FOR-FIJI_upload.pdf
notes_C7: - Authorities have announced lockdowns of several areas, including the Nadi/Lautoka area and the Wainitarawau Settlement in Suva’s Cunningham neighborhood.  - Travelers on the island of Viti Levu are currently barred from traveling to other parts of Fiji. Those who are on outer islands are allowed to travel back to Viti Levu.    URL: https://web.archive.org/web/20210425115731/https://fj.usembassy.gov/u-s-citizen-services/covid-19-information/
notes_E2: The government has offered a tax and tariff reductions, and loan repayment holidays (up to F$ 400 million of the total envelope) aim at protecting public health, supporting the economy and ensuring food security. A second fiscal package was announced as part of the FY2020-21 budget for the fiscal year beginning in August. The stimulus mainly consists of sizeable tax and tariff cuts. Fiscal and import excise duties on over 1,600 items were reduced or eliminated. Similarly, the budget includes cuts to the service turnover tax, environmental tax and departure tax.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210531135356/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19
notes_C2: Authorities have tightened regulations on businesses in Fiji amid ongoing COVID-19 concerns. Under the latest measures, all companies that wish to operate must limit capacity to 50 percent; capacity limits do not apply to manufacturing facilities where additional employees are required.   https://web.archive.org/web/20210531132057/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/481511/fiji-authorities-tightening-restrictions-for-businesses-nationwide-as-of-may-21-due-to-covid-19-concerns-update-6
notes_H3: Upon confirmation of COVID-19 (first case), the Ministry's highly-trained contact team –– which effectively contained last year’s measles outbreak with the same contact-tracing methods –– was immediately put into action to identify all those with whom the patient has been in close contact. Those points of contact are currently being sought out and quarantined. The capacity of our contact team has been further strengthened by the Republic of Fiji Military Forces and the Fiji Police Force, heightening our capacity to trace and quarantine all those potentially exposed to the virus.     https://web.archive.org/web/20200509173949/https://www.fiji.gov.fj/Media-Centre/Speeches/PM-BAINIMARAMA%E2%80%99S-STATEMENT-ON-THE-FIRST-COVID-19-C
notes_E1: -Fijians in the informal sector who tested positive for the virus to be paid a one-off sum of $1,000  -Informal sector in the lockdown areas entitled to one-off Government relief payment of $150 where holding a street trader or hawker license  -Government to fund 21 days COVID- 19 leave for Fijian employees earning less than $30,000 who have tested positive for the virus    https://web.archive.org/web/20200420154422/https://fijisun.com.fj/2020/03/27/covid-19-response-budget-government-to-top-up-accounts/    https://web.archive.org/web/20200609102409/https://home.kpmg/xx/en/home/insights/2020/04/fiji-government-and-institution-measures-in-response-to-covid.html
notes_C1: Fiji’s Ministry of Education has issued a statement to say that all schools nationwide will remain closed.  Schools will re-open for face-to-face classes and classroom teaching when we are once again COVID-contained.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210531131741/https://www.fijitimes.com/covid-19-schools-will-remain-closed-until-fiji-is-covid-contained-moe/
notes_H7: The vaccines are been delivered to the following groups: "frontline staff at the borders, all healthcare workers (including those in private healthcare), police and military officers, tourism and hotel workers, and civil servants. Also eligible to receive the vaccine are those over the age of 60 and people with medical conditions that increase the risk of severe disease if they do get infected with COVID-19." All vaccines doses are AstraZeneca which have been received by COVAX Facility.    https://archive.vn/q9lD2  https://archive.ph/PzLLY
notes_C3: Religious and other public gatherings are banned, though funerals may take place with up to 20 people.   https://web.archive.org/web/20210531132057/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/481511/fiji-authorities-tightening-restrictions-for-businesses-nationwide-as-of-may-21-due-to-covid-19-concerns-update-6
notes_C8: The change of code to a 3 reflects the immigration rule concerning yachts in the "Blue Lanes" scheme.  As yachts are allowed entry if they satisfy various requirements of the Fiji authorities, the conclusion is that - although limited in scale - the borders are open to some who are not citizens of Fiji.  As such, a code of "4" referring to banning arrival from all regions or total border closure would not reflect the situation.  "Fiji has established a safe “blue lanes”, open to those yachts and pleasure craft sailing to Fiji. Any boat coming to Fiji will be carefully considered on a case-by-case basis. The only port of entry will be Port Denarau Marina. If this pilot project and if successful, extending blue lanes to other ports and marinas will be considered."  Link: http://archive.today/2020.10.12-080639/http://www.immigration.gov.fj/
notes_C4: Gatherings are limited to up to 100 individuals. This limit applies to weddings, funerals, cafes, restaurants, conferences and other community indoor spaces are restricted to 50% of the capacity of the venue.    https://archive.vn/lEX11  https://web.archive.org/web/20210409210700/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/fiji/coronavirus  https://web.archive.org/web/20210408153231/https://www.mcttt.gov.fj/doc_uploads/Fijian%20COVID%20Safe%20Economic%20Recovery%20Framework.pdf
notes_C6: https://web.archive.org/web/20210531132057/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/481511/fiji-authorities-tightening-restrictions-for-businesses-nationwide-as-of-may-21-due-to-covid-19-concerns-update-6  The government continues to impose tighter measures on Viti Levu where COVID-19 transmission is occurring. An 18:00-04:00 curfew remains in effect islandwide. Officials have extended a lockdown in the Nadali area of Nausori until early June to enable widespread testing. Residents must stay home, except for emergencies, and cannot exit the town. Returning individuals can enter Nadali but cannot leave again.
notes_H6: Employers must ensure that employees and customers wear appropriate protective equipment, including facemasks, check temperature checks before entry, and consistently enforce 2-meter (6.5-foot) distancing.   https://web.archive.org/web/20210614193018/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/481511/fiji-authorities-tightening-restrictions-for-businesses-nationwide-as-of-may-21-due-to-covid-19-concerns-update-6
notes_H8: Prime minister in public address: "We should also all refrain from visiting elderly homes, prisons or patients in hospitals."    https://web.archive.org/web/20201203063422/http://www.health.gov.fj/pm-bainimaramas-statement-on-the-first-covid-19-case-in-fiji/
notes_C5: URL: https://web.archive.org/web/20210425115731/https://fj.usembassy.gov/u-s-citizen-services/covid-19-information/

name: France
notes_H1: FAQ of government: Information posters rolled out nationwide at train stations; https://web.archive.org/web/20200402111143/http://www.essonne.gouv.fr/content/download/30487/234871/file/FAQ%2520-%2520COVID-19%2520-%2520260220.pdf
notes_H2: Tests are free and can be carried out without a medical prescription and on non-symptomatic patients since July 25, 2020. https://web.archive.org/web/20200915140317/https://twitter.com/MinSoliSante/status/1297149019739873280?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw%7Ctwcamp%5Etweetembed%7Ctwterm%5E1297149019739873280%7Ctwgr%5Eshare_3&ref_url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.linternaute.fr%2Factualite%2Fguide-vie-quotidienne%2F2489431-test-covid-19-publics-prioritaires-tentes-de-depistage-ce-qui-va-changer%2F  "Afin de faciliter le dépistage de la Covid-19, les tests PCR sont totalement pris en charge par l'assurance maladie et ne nécessitent pas de prescription d'un médecin". https://web.archive.org/web/20200915135127/https://www.gouvernement.fr/info-coronavirus/tests-et-depistage  https://web.archive.org/web/20200915135513/https://solidarites-sante.gouv.fr/soins-et-maladies/maladies/maladies-infectieuses/coronavirus/tout-savoir-sur-la-covid-19/article/se-faire-depister-lieux-et-conditions
notes_C7: Restrictions on travel outside of a person's home region were lifted on 3 May - https://web.archive.org/web/20210507204759/https://www.gouvernement.fr/info-coronavirus
notes_E2: According to French government website and IMF website, postponement of rent and utility payments only apply to microenterprises and SMEs.   Cannot find any information about debt or contract relief specific to households.  https://archive.vn/NWam2  https://archive.vn/nyT1l#selection-9613.928-9613.1016
notes_C2: From May 19, the reopening of shops, terraces, museums, cinemas and theaters with limited gauges http://web.archive.org/web/20210522142042/https://www.gouvernement.fr/info-coronavirus
notes_H3: ***Updated from 2 to 1    There is a contact tracing app; however can't find evidence of comprehensive contract tracing in practice. Past coding for this indicator seems to either say 'no change in policy' or reference vague government statements. This whole column should be reviewed.     https://web.archive.org/web/20210126053343/https://www.healthcareitnews.com/news/emea/france-launches-new-contact-tracing-app-tousanticovid    See previous source:   https://web.archive.org/web/20210131165659/https://www.gouvernement.fr/en/coronavirus-covid-19
notes_E1: L’État a mis en place, avec les Régions, un fonds de solidarité doté d’1,7 milliard d’euros pour le mois de mars qui permettra le versement d’une aide défiscalisée allant jusqu’à 1500 euros aux plus petites entreprises, aux indépendants, aux micro-entrepreneurs et aux professions libérales touchés par la crise du coronavirus. Ce fonds sera maintenu autant que durera l’urgence sanitaire.https://web.archive.org/save/http://hauts-de-france.direccte.gouv.fr/Coronavirus-COVID-19-mouvements-sociaux-la-Direccte-vous-accompagne
notes_C1: From May 3rd, high school students returned to school half time, and middle school students returned full time. Hybrid distance/in-person learning is in place for 3rd and 4th grades of middle schools located in the 15 departments most affected by Covid-19. https://web.archive.org/web/20210503005204/https://www.gouvernement.fr/info-coronavirus/education    From 17 April, all staff aged over 55 in contact with pupils have been able to avail themselves of dedicated vaccination appointments, per https://web.archive.org/web/20210503005204/https://www.gouvernement.fr/info-coronavirus/education and details of dedicated support services for teachers are available at https://web.archive.org/web/20210501135223/https://www.education.gouv.fr/covid19-mesures-pour-les-ecoles-colleges-et-lycees-modalites-pratiques-continuite-pedagogique-et-305467
notes_H7: A,B,C:    Pfizer/BioNTech, Moderna, AstraZeneca and Janssen vaccines are being administered.     From 12 May, all adults are elegible for vaccination and can make an appointment, provided "doses are available the day before for the next day", in addition to the following groups:     - 16-17 year olds with certain serious diseases(a very high-risk, serious condition)with the Pfizer-BioNTech vaccine;  - adults with disabilities, housed in specialized foster homes or nursing homes;  - people over the age of 18 with a body mass index of more than 30;  - included 18-49 year olds with a very high-risk condition of Covid-19 or one or more comorbidities;  - included in their 50s regardless of their situation  - adults living in the same household as a severely immunosuppressed person, child or adult (transplanted from solid organs, recent bone marrow transplants, dialysis patients, patients with autoimmune diseases on strong immunosuppressive treatment such as anti-CD20 or anti-metabolites);  - Pregnant women from the second trimester of pregnancy;    https://web.archive.org/web/20210513102023/https://www.gouvernement.fr/info-coronavirus/vaccins
notes_C3: From May 19, limited forms of events with restrictions are allowed. For example, resumption of outdoor seated festivals: 35% gauge up to 1,000 people.   http://web.archive.org/web/20210520082504/https://www.gouvernement.fr/les-modalites-et-le-calendrier-des-reouvertures  http://web.archive.org/web/20210520082504/https://www.gouvernement.fr/les-modalites-et-le-calendrier-des-reouvertures
notes_C8: New regulations for entry to France were implemented on 9 June, with a system of green/orange/red list countries and different rules for travelers arriving from these lists, and exceptions for certain classes of traveler. Full details at https://web.archive.org/web/20210612160728/https://www.diplomatie.gouv.fr/fr/conseils-aux-voyageurs/informations-pratiques/article/coronavirus-covid-19    In summary:     "Green List" - travellers from a country in the European area or from Australia, South Korea, Israel, Japan, Lebanon, New Zealand, and Singapore, are not subject to "compelling reasons" requirements for visiting France. Must provide evidence of a negative PCR test taken within 72 hours before departure, OR proof of complete vaccination with an EMA-approved vaccine.     "Orange List" - from all countries not specified in other lists, must:     - all must present negative results of a PCR test taken 72 hours before departure or an antigen test taken 48 hours before departure  - vaccinate travelers not subject to "compelling reasons" test for entry  - unvaccinated travelers are subject to "compelling reasons", and must self-isolate for 7 days after arrival    "Red List" - travelers from a country listed in the order of the Ministry of Health identifying the areas of active circulation of the epidemic or the spread of variants (currently Argentina, Bahrain, Bangladesh, Bolivia, Brazil, Chile, Colombia, Costa Rica, India, Nepal, Pakistan, South Africa, Sri Lanka, Suriname, Turkey, Uruguay) must:     - have a "compelling reason" to visit France  - negative results of PCR test taken up to 48 hours before departure  - mandatory antigen test on arrival  - mandatory 10 day quarantine on arrival, unless fully vaccinated in which case 7-day self isolation    The "Compelling Reasons" allows the following to enter France: French nationals, their spouses and children, nationals of the European area as well as their spouses and children having their principal residence in France or who join, in transit through France, their main residence in a country of the European area or the country of which they are nationals.
notes_C4: Social gatherings are banned. Everyone found outside has to carry a written statement justifying their journey.   'Places of worship may remain open for weddings (with a maximum of six people) and funerals (with a maximum of 30 people).'    https://web.archive.org/web/20201102183825/https://www.gouvernement.fr/en/coronavirus-covid-19
notes_C6: The nationwide night-time curfew remains in place, people must remain at home between 7pm and 6am with limited exceptions & self-certification required for those outside the home during these hours.     From 7pm on 3 April for a period of 4 weeks, the containment measures implemented in 19 departments have been extended nationwide. People are allowed to be outside within a 10km radius of their home between the hours of 6am and 7pm with proof of residence, but must produce a certificate explaining the essential nature of their travel if further than 10km from their residence.     https://web.archive.org/web/20210404151725/https://www.gouvernement.fr/info-coronavirus
notes_H6: From 17 June, "the end of wearing a mask outdoors with exceptions (gatherings, queues, markets, stadiums...). The prefectural orders on the wearing of masks will be amended as of Thursday, June 17. On the other hand, wearing a mask in enclosed environments remains mandatory" - https://web.archive.org/web/20210618164516/https://www.gouvernement.fr/info-coronavirus
notes_H8: The French government announced families will be allowed to visit residents once again starting 20 April. This is kept at 2G here since there will be special requirements in place to make this happen, ie. mask requirements and additional hygiene measures. France’s health minister said the form these visits will take will be decided by nursing homes – family members will most likely not be allowed to touch their loved ones.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200429005849/https://www.euronews.com/2020/04/20/coronavirus-and-the-elderly-what-s-life-inside-a-french-retirement-home-amid-covid-19-pand
notes_C5: True return to normal for almost all public transport in Paris and Ile-de-France. All metro stations will be open from June 22, 2020. Almost all RATP buses, tram, metro and RER are working at 100%. The same goes for the majority of Transilien SNCFs. https://web.archive.org/web/20200722155345/https://www.francebleu.fr/infos/transports/transports-en-commun-en-ile-de-france-toutes-les-stations-de-metro-seront-ouvertes-a-partir-du-22-1592483057

name: Faeroe Islands
notes_H1: established campaign on what to do/not do  https://web.archive.org/web/20210227082629/https://corona.fo/recommendations-and-measures?_l=en
notes_H2: 23rd March 2020, Currently, over 2.200 tests have been conducted in the Faroe Islands. Tests are conducted at the hospitals in the Faroe Islands, and the samples are examined by the Faroese Food and Veterinary Authority.  The Faroe Islands seem to hold the record for most tests conducted per million inhabitants – at least compared to Scandinavia and other countries, which have a high amount of cases, statistics from the website Our World in Data reveal.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201113034623/http://local.fo/covid-19-the-faroe-islands-conduct-the-most-tests/
notes_C7: No evidence of restrictions    https://web.archive.org/web/20210517162114/https://corona.fo/recommendations-and-measures?_l=en
notes_E2: The government website only lists support packages for businesses, not for households.     http://web.archive.org/web/20210201203926/https://corona.fo/arbeidi-og-lon?_l=fo
notes_C2: No evidence of closing of any sectors but guidelines are in place:  A physical distance of two metres between people should be maintained. In organized settings, such as in restaurants, theatres, and cinemas, one metre is sufficient.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210517162114/https://corona.fo/recommendations-and-measures?_l=en
