notes_H3: 10th April 2020, Special corona strategy saves lives  The Faroese strategy has placed a strong focus on suppression, with world record high test numbers relative to the population as a means of suppressing the virus entirely by trying to catch cases early and trace all contacts.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201208075454/http://kvf.fo/greinar/2020/04/10/special-corona-strategy-saves-lives
notes_E1: 15th March 2020, The remuneration structure applies to all Faroese companies, some in the period 31 March to 30 June 2020 have at least a 50 per cent decline in sales combined with the same period last year. Fishing, aling, fisheries, etc. are not covered by the order.    Treytir fyri at fáa remuneration is, among other things, that the companies will not pay out the prize money for the next three years, and that a joint exhibition for managers and management members is not more than 600,000 ISK. this year.     https://web.archive.org/web/20201208091337/https://corona.fo/user_login?_redirect=%2Fhjalparpakki2%3F_l%3Den
notes_C1: Schools and daycare centres are advised not to hold larger events to which people from outside the institution are usually invited. This includes events which would normally be attended by parents and other family members.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210227082629/https://corona.fo/recommendations-and-measures?_l=en
notes_H7: A,B:  Two vaccines approved for use: Comirnaty and Moderna  https://corona.fo/upload/files/gronur-faldari-kunning-um-koppseting-ensktpdf_a9a6244a234d85366380869cab588db6975decb9.pdf
notes_C3: Events with 200 people can take place however, they ask all organizers to contact the official Covid-19 support (koronaráðgevingin) for more information on how to manage arrangements according to official recommendations.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210321102549/https://corona.fo/news/887/government-eases-covid-19-restrictions?_l=en
notes_C8: 13th Nov 2020, The Government tightens border controls and travel advice. Anyone travelling to the Faroe Islands should provide evidence of a negative COVID-19 test which has been taken no more than three days before departure.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201208142327/https://corona.fo/news/704/the-government-tightens-border-controls-and-travel-advice?_l=en    https://web.archive.org/web/20201208142611/https://corona.fo/news/706/new-recommendations-in-effect-from-13-november-and-for-the-rest-of-the-year?_l=en
notes_C4: 200 people may gather in organized groups. (An organized group is a group, where tracking and tracing will be straightforward, if necessary). This is subject to hygiene and social distancing measures and will be evaluated in Easter.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210321102549/https://corona.fo/news/887/government-eases-covid-19-restrictions?_l=en
notes_C6: Shopping: Special emphasis should be placed on social distancing hand and hygiene and. It is advisable that only one person in the household does the shopping, rather than going several together. It is also advisable to go shopping when there are fewer people.  Face masks are recommended when a lot of people are in a shop.   https://web.archive.org/web/20210227082629/https://corona.fo/recommendations-and-measures?_l=en
notes_H6: Even though domestic guidelines don't state face-covering requirement. According to the US Embassy & Consulate in the Kingdom of Denmark, public transport passengers are required to wear face masks or shields. Airline passengers must wear surgical face masks from the moment they enter a terminal and while onboard a flight until they leave the terminal after their arrival.     https://archive.vn/Fm4DQ   https://archive.vn/p0TnS
notes_C5: SSL buses will now resume their normal schedule on all routes, with no requirement for prior booking. Some restrictions will still apply. A maximum of 22 passengers can travel with the larger buses, 10 with the medium size buses and 5 with people with the small buses.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201208121019/https://corona.fo/news/431/reopening-faroese-society-phase-3?_l=en

name: Gabon
notes_H1: Start of publishing Facebook videos/graphics to spread awareness of health measures to take.    https://web.archive.org/web/20200622141442/https://www.facebook.com/PresidenceGabon/videos/272794397185865/
notes_H2: According to UNICEF situation overview Gabon has been testing symptomatic patients since March 12th. However, as of April 24 testing scope broaden to general availability albeit lagging in results. https://reliefweb.int/report/gabon/unicef-gabon-covid-19-situation-report-02-reporting-period-15-30-april
notes_C7: Restricted movement; source: /web/20210419235517/https://ourworldindata.org/grapher/internal-movement-covid?country=MCO~MOZ~MAR~MDA~MNG
notes_E2: The Amended Budget Law approved in end-June 2020 proposed the control of non-priority expenditure and redirects savings and development partners support of FCFA 73.9 billion (USD 138.1 million or 0.83 percent of GDP) to COVID-19 related spending. The government also plans to allocate additional FCFA 108 billion (USD 194.1 million or 1.2 percent of GDP) as an economic response, including through food stamps, electricity and water subsidies, direct support to SMEs and tax holidays. The Minister of Finance has created a fund available at their Caisse de Depots et Consignation (CDC) and designated a public accountant in order to facilitate disbursements of the health-related spending of that fund. An additional mechanism of around USD 375 million has further been announced to facilitate access to commercial banks financing for private (formal and informal) companies, including SMEs. The promulgated 2021 Budget Law allocates FCFA 3 billion (USD 6 million) for additional Covid-19 expenditures.    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20210517173957/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19
notes_C2: Gabon-Specific Information    The prevalence of COVID-19 cases in Gabon has recently increased, and government restrictions have tightened. On January 30, land borders were closed except for government-approved crossings.  On February 14 the government extended the curfew hours to 18:00 to 05:00.   The government is monitoring the situation closely and has warned it will impose strong restrictions again should the situation worsen appreciably.  Churches and indoor dining are currently open at a maximum occupancy of 30 people. Fines for exceeding the 30-person limit on gatherings will range from 100,000 to 5,000,000 FCFA.  The wearing of facemasks is obligatory in all public spaces, to include riding or driving in a vehicle with two or more persons inside. If driving alone, the driver is required to have a facemask to be used immediately upon exiting the vehicle.  Fines for not wearing a facemask will range from 25,000 to 200,000 FCFA.  Social distancing and other hygiene requirements continue.    See: http://web.archive.org/web/20210517175002/https://ga.usembassy.gov/u-s-citizen-services/coronavirus-update/
notes_H3: The last sitrep posted on the 19th of March 2021 did not include information on the contact tracing efforts by the health team. Please see:   https://web.archive.org/web/20210322070048/https://infocovid.ga/conference-de-presse-du-vendredi-19-mars-2021/
notes_E1: Right now I don't think there is any current income support from the information I read.    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20210131145930/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19
notes_C1: Pre-primary and primary school students returned to class on 9 November, while middle and high school students return on 17 November.     https://web.archive.org/web/20201109221657/https://gabonactu.com/la-rentree-scolaire-plombee-par-la-galere-de-taxi/ AND  https://web.archive.org/web/20201212040603/https://www.rfi.fr/fr/afrique/20201110-gabon-covid-ecoles-rouvrent-maternelle-et-primaire-rentr%C3%A9e
notes_H7: A,B: Sinopharm vaccine. Vaccination started on March 23, 2021 with the Minister of Health announcing a national vaccination strategy in which health workers dealing with Covid-19 and patients with severe comorbidities will be vaccinated first. Please see:   https://web.archive.org/web/20210405151544/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19
notes_C3: As of June 12, 2020, gathering is limited to 20 persons, festivals and fundões are prohibited; source: /web/20210104112036/https://ga.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C8: International flights are limited to three flights per airline a week.    Land and sea borders are closed. Cargo transportation and essential services are permitted entry with prior authorization.    Foreigners intending to enter the country require a letter of permission. All passengers must provide a negative polymerase chain reaction (PCR) taken no longer than five days before arrival.    All passengers must take a compulsory COVID-19 test upon arrival at Libreville International Airport (LBV). Passengers must then quarantine for 48 hours while awaiting test results.    Please see: https://web.archive.org/web/20210405145858/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/463076/gabon-covid-19-measures-unchanged-as-of-april-3-update-17
notes_C4: Restriction lifted from 10 to 30 people.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201109223513/https://gabonactu.com/deconfinement-quelques-allegements-et-une-batterie-des-nouvelles-contraintes/
notes_C6: "There is no change in the restriction’s measures since May the 11th when the Government  ended the State of Emergency and relaxed some of the lockdown constraints while  maintaining and enforcing strict social distancing guidelines with compulsory mask  wearing along all the other prevention actions, school shutdown and the ban of  commercial flights and interprovincial traveling. However, With the lockdown relaxed in  greater Libreville area, compliance with rules on social distancing and use of facemasks  is inadequate."  https://web.archive.org/web/20210327170154/https://reliefweb.int/sites/reliefweb.int/files/resources/UNICEF%20Gabon%20COVID-19%20Situation%20Report%20%E2%80%93%20%2304%20Reporting%20period%20-%2017-28%20May%202020.pdf    Still a 6pm-6am nationwide curfew.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200622131034/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/gabon/staying-during-coronavirus
notes_H6: Masks are still required in public and social distancing and hygiene requirements will continue. The government cautioned that restrictions may be reinstated in certain locations or throughout the country if new outbreaks occur.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210104112036/https://ga.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_H8: Although the National State of Health Emergency expires on May 11, 2020, 2G is maintained as mandatory restrictions and a nationwide curfew for the whole population of Gabon is still in place.    "Restrictions on movement, a nationwide curfew from 19:30 to 06:00, and the mandatory wearing of face masks are among the measures that will continue to be imposed. Gatherings remain prohibited, schools are closed, and nonessential movements within and between cities has been reduced. Those working in industries deemed essential by the government are exempt from the measures. Local media sources reported that a heightened security presence has been deployed in the capital to enforce the measures."    https://web.archive.org/web/20200605070319/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/341016/gabon-covid-19-state-of-emergency-lifted-may-11-update-8
notes_C5: According to the UK government's page on travel to Gabon, taxis are only permitted to carry up to three passengers. Please see: https://web.archive.org/web/20210405145040/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/gabon/coronavirus

name: United Kingdom
notes_H1: UK Public Health Campaign Launched https://web.archive.org/web/20200427142157/https://www.gov.uk/government/news/coronavirus-public-information-campaign-launched-across-the-uk
notes_H2: UK expands testing so that 'Everyone in England, Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland with coronavirus (COVID-19) symptoms can now get a test.'  https://web.archive.org/web/20200621175239/https://www.gov.uk/government/news/everyone-in-the-united-kingdom-with-symptoms-now-eligible-for-coronavirus-tests
notes_C7: Glasgow moves from Level 3 to Level 2 on 5 June. At Level 2 movement is permitted within Scotland    https://web.archive.org/web/20210617220823/https://www.gov.scot/publications/coronavirus-covid-19-protection-levels/pages/protection-level-2/    https://web.archive.org/web/20210530205037/https://www.gov.scot/news/protection-levels-update/
notes_E2: UK gov reaches agreement with energy companies to ensure people receive power throughout coronavirus crisis even if they fall into debt on payments  "Measures include ensuring prepayment and pay-as-you go customers remain supplied with energy through challenging times and supporting all customers in financial distress  industry agreement signed by all UK domestic suppliers and will come into force immediately"   https://web.archive.org/save/https://www.gov.uk/government/news/government-agrees-measures-with-energy-industry-to-support-vulnerable-people-through-covid-19
notes_C2: From April 12, all nonessential shops can reopen in England, meaning there are no longer any targeted complete closures of nonessential businesses.   https://archive.vn/OGr5y
notes_H3: There is clear evidence that the track and trace system in England is not functional to the level of a "comprehensive" coding, as the UK government in the form of the health minister has conceded in mid-September ("might take a fortnight to resolve"). Therefore, 1 seems a more appropriate coding. Coded this since end of August, as difficult to pin down an exact date. https://web.archive.org/web/20200928232343/https://www.theguardian.com/world/2020/sep/14/utter-shambles-gps-and-medics-decry-nhs-test-and-trace-system
notes_E1: Measures introduced to include self-employed workers:   "Self-employed workers can apply for a grant worth 80% of their average monthly profits to help them cope with the financial impact of coronavirus"; up to £2,500 a month in a single lump sum; paid in June; open to those who earn under £50,000 a year - up to 3.8 million of the 5 million people registered as self-employed.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200410025157/https://www.bbc.com/news/uk-52053914
notes_C1: From April 12, schools open across Northern Ireland and Scotland meaning pupils are back at in-person schooling across all four devolved states. Note that restrictions apply. For instance, for higher education in England, only students in practical courses are returning at the moment.     http://web.archive.org/web/20210412235518/https://assets.publishing.service.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/977566/COVID-19_Roadmap_Posters_STEP_2_2021_-_digital_.pdf ; http://web.archive.org/web/20210411073700if_/https://www.belfastlive.co.uk/news/belfast-news/northern-ireland-lockdown-restrictions-change-20322775 ; http://web.archive.org/web/20210414134851/https://www.gov.scot/publications/coronavirus-covid-19-timetable-for-easing-restrictions/pages/timetable/
notes_H7: As of March 17, all 4 nations have broadened their vaccine availability to warrant a 4 coding nationwide- as on 17 March in Scotland "As groups 6 and 7 progress, we have begun scheduling appointments for the next priority groups which are group 8 (age 55-59 years) and 9 (age 50-54 years) and vaccinations for these groups began at the start of this week.: http://web.archive.org/web/20210318171627/https://www.gov.scot/news/vaccination-programme-reaches-two-million-people/
notes_C3: Glasgow moves from Level 3 to Level 2 on 5 June. At Level 2 events can go ahead with restrictions    https://web.archive.org/web/20210617220823/https://www.gov.scot/publications/coronavirus-covid-19-protection-levels/pages/protection-level-2/    https://web.archive.org/web/20210530205037/https://www.gov.scot/news/protection-levels-update/
notes_C8: passengers travelling from South Africa into England from 9am Thursday 24 December will not be permitted to enter, reflecting increased risk from new strain of coronavirus    https://web.archive.org/web/20210115174613/https://www.gov.uk/government/news/travel-ban-implemented-to-protect-public-health-following-south-africa-covid-19-outbreak
notes_C4: From Monday 3 May, two households, plus another person living on their own, are able to meet and have contact indoors in Wales.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210507095605/https://www.bbc.com/news/uk-wales-55333756
notes_C6: Northern Ireland is the last nation to lift the stay at home order on 12 April. There are no longer any Stay at home orders    12 April- Stay at home order lifted, people told to stay local and work from home where possible.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210423091947/https://www.bbc.com/news/uk-northern-ireland-56689203
notes_H6: Northern Ireland's facial covering rules expand, meaning that all four nations are now at a 3 code, hence the jump to T coding    Since 14 October, banks and other similar businesses, restaurants, cafes and pubs, and offices that deliver Government services, have also become relevant places and you must wear a face covering. This jump warrants an increase in coding to a 3    https://archive.vn/xhwI6#selection-509.0-509.196
notes_H8: Wales is the last nation to ease visiting rules, and all nations drop to a 2 coding    indoor care home visits will restart for single designated visitors.     https://web.archive.org/web/20210312151925/https://www.theguardian.com/uk-news/2021/mar/12/wales-set-to-ease-covid-lockdown-restrictions-from-saturday
notes_C5: https://web.archive.org/web/20200320191027/https://www.gov.uk/government/news/government-announces-further-measures-on-social-distancing  “The closures announced today will not impact the running of public transport, and government continues to work closely with transport operators to ensure that people who need to get to work can continue to do so.  Yesterday, the government and rail industry agreed a plan that will see a gradual reduction in train services across the country to reflect lower passenger demand as people change their travel patterns to help reduce the spread of coronavirus, while keeping vital rail services running.”

name: Georgia
notes_H1: The Action Plan developed by the government seeks to provide the public and media with correct information, to which end the Public Broadcaster of Georgia has been requested to supply the public at large with correct and useful information on coronavirus and ways to mitigate its risks: http://archive.vn/k9FQ8
notes_H2: State-funded proactive testing of symptomatic patients and systemic groups continues (testing of teachers will be carried out once every 2 weeks).  Link: https://archive.fo/j9UJT
notes_C7: The nationwide curfew, between 9 PM and 5 AM, is still in place. Intercity transport resumed on 25th of February.  Link: https://archive.fo/wip/Mg0xd
notes_E2: A budget of 270 million GEL for 1.1 million households for utility bills was available between November 2020 and February 2021.  Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20210302140540/https://stopcov.gov.ge/en/daxmarebebi
notes_C2: on 23 May 2020, The state of emergency was concluded. All types of economic activities became permitted, with the following exceptions o Providing customers with on-site catering services in restaurants, bars, cafes, or diners of any type; o Trading in clothes and shoes (permitted online); 15 o The operation of trade centers (shopping malls) and open-air markets (with the exception of open agrarian markets); o Organizing or holding sporting, cultural, or entertainment activities; o The operation of currency exchange points.  http://web.archive.org/web/20200718152025/https://stopcov.ge/Content/files/COVID_RESPONSE_REPORT__ENG.pdf  According to the US Embassy COVID-19?information for Georgia?updated on July 17,?2020, Many swimming pools and gyms have reopened, after passing a health inspection.  Restaurants and hotels have reopened subject to periodic ongoing health inspections. Customers in restaurants are required to wear masks when moving about indoors, and to maintain social distancing measures, with a maximum of six people allowed at one table.   http://web.archive.org/web/20200718145003/https://ge.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information-on-georgia/
notes_H3: The first case of infection with a new type of coronavirus was recorded in Georgia, said Health Minister Yekaterina Tikaradze: https://web.archive.org/web/20200515025948/https://ria.ru/20200226/1565252642.html
notes_E1: 1,200-GEL assistance for individuals who have lost their employment: Formal sector employees who will temporarily lose their jobs will receive assistance in the amount of 200 GEL for six months starting from January 2020. Estimated number of beneficiaries: 125,000 individuals. Budget: 150 million GEL.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210302140540/https://stopcov.gov.ge/en/daxmarebebi
notes_C1: Preschool educational facilities, both public and private, will resume on March 1, with obligatory testing for 20% of the staff every other week.  Starting on March 1, schools of higher and vocational education will be able to resume clinical, practical, and laboratory activities and to hold in-person examinations.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210302132808/https://stopcov.gov.ge/en/News/Article/Irakli_Garibashvili_Presents_Plan_for_Gradually_Easing_Restrictions
notes_H7: On 15th of March, started the vaccination of health workers with AstraZeneca vaccine. On 25th of March starts the vaccination of people over 65 years aged, having the possibility to make a choice between the vaccines from Pfizer and AstraZeneca.    Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20210328092056/https://agenda.ge/en/news/2021/797
notes_C3: Any and all types of conferences, training sessions, cultural or entertainment events are restricted. Only virtual formats will be permitted online.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201130172338/https://www.stopcov.ge/en/shezgudvebi
notes_C8: The Government of Georgia has urged airlines to deny boarding to foreign nationals if they have no negative PCR test results administrated in the past 72 hours or a document evidencing a full spectrum of COVID-19 vaccine. There are in place health screening procedures at airports and other ports of entry. All passengers, who have travelled to the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland within the last 14 days will be placed in mandatory quarantine at personal expense for 12 days upon entry.   Link: https://archive.fo/9JiCX
notes_C4: "No more than 10 people can participate in social gatherings such as weddings and funerals, indoor or out. There is no limit on gatherings for political or election-related activities."  http://web.archive.org/web/20201017081634/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/georgia/coronavirus
notes_C6: Between the hours of 9pm and 5am, public and private transportation, including walking, is not permitted, unless it is for an essential need (for example, medical services).    https://web.archive.org/web/20210130011411/https://ge.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information-on-georgia/    https://web.archive.org/web/20210129020507/https://www.stopcov.ge/en/shezgudvebi
notes_H6: Face masks must be worn in all enclosed public spaces, including taxis and public transportation. Violators of face musk rules are subject to a 20 GEL (about 6 USD) fine. There are some exceptions for children under 6, people with disabilities, or who have health problems that prevent them from wearing a face covering.  Link: https://archive.fo/FJtFx
notes_H8: There is in place a recommendation for people over the age of 70 to remain at home. A nationwide curfew, between 9 PM and 5 AM and.  Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20210315064255/https://archive.fo/wip/LiNtX, https://web.archive.org/web/20210315060623/https://archive.fo/FJtFx and  https://web.archive.org/web/20210302132808/https://stopcov.gov.ge/en/News/Article/Irakli_Garibashvili_Presents_Plan_for_Gradually_Easing_Restrictions
notes_C5: Municipal transport will operate on weekends as well.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210302132808/https://stopcov.gov.ge/en/News/Article/Irakli_Garibashvili_Presents_Plan_for_Gradually_Easing_Restrictions

name: Ghana
notes_H1: A coordinated public informational campaign through this webpage. https://web.archive.org/web/20200315001922/https://ghanahealthservice.org/covid19/
notes_H2: Changing coding based on the reworking of this data point.    -----  https://web.archive.org/web/20210613185345/https://gh.usembassy.gov/ghana-covid-19-information/  https://web.archive.org/web/20210613185359/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/ghana/coronavirus  https://web.archive.org/web/20210529120136/https://www.ghanahealthservice.org/covid19/  https://web.archive.org/web/20210613185423/https://www.smartraveller.gov.au/COVID-19
notes_C7: With the lifting of the partial lockdown of Accra and two other cities on April 19th, there does not appear to be any limits to internal movement  https://archive.vn/sW0wL
notes_E2: Policy ended in June
notes_C2: Some workplaces are closed.  Weddings, concerts, theatrical performances, and parties are banned. Large sporting events, political rallies, and festivals are suspended until further notice. Nightclubs, bars, beaches, and cinemas also remain closed until further notice.   ------------  https://web.archive.org/web/20210314160821/https://gh.usembassy.gov/ghana-covid-19-information/  https://web.archive.org/web/20210314160321/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19  https://web.archive.org/web/20210314160944/https://www.graphic.com.gh/news/general-news/update-on-covid-19-a-year-down-the-lane.html
notes_H3: No new data regarding contact tracing  The most recent information is an article from WHO in October 2020  http://web.archive.org/web/20210406075706/https://www.afro.who.int/news/strengthening-contact-tracing-covid-19-greater-accra-region
notes_C1: According to the Ghana Health Service, all schools are open. https://web.archive.org/web/20210208172409/https://www.ghanahealthservice.org/covid19/cancelled.php
notes_H7: Among eligible persons for the vaccination program includes healthcare workers, frontline security personnel, persons with underlying medical conditions, persons 60 years and above, and frontline members of the executive, legislature, and judiciary.  http://web.archive.org/web/20210406082136/https://www.unicef.org/ghana/information-covid-19-vaccine  http://web.archive.org/web/20210406082550/http://www.xinhuanet.com/english/2021-03/03/c_139778718.htm
notes_C3: "Large sporting events, political rallies, conferences, all religious events and festivals are suspended until further notice. This policy set by the national health services applies nationwide. Religious services can operate at full capacity with the following protocols in place: the two-hour duration, one-metre social distancing, mask wearing, use of sanitizers, and the presence of veronica buckets, liquid soap, and rolls of tissue paper.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210305000252/https://ghanahealthservice.org/covid19/cancelled.php     https://web.archive.org/web/20210215153929/https://presidency.gov.gh/index.php/briefing-room/speeches/1859-update-no-23-measures-taken-to-combat-spread-of-coronavirus    https://web.archive.org/web/20210305021003/https://gh.usembassy.gov/ghana-covid-19-information/"
notes_C8: Changing status to screening as yes the boarders are closed but international travelers are able to cross with negative testing.    --------------  https://web.archive.org/web/20210515231010/https://www.smartraveller.gov.au/destinations/africa/ghana  https://web.archive.org/web/20210515231010/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/ghana/coronavirus  https://web.archive.org/web/20210515231016/https://gh.usembassy.gov/ghana-covid-19-information/  https://web.archive.org/web/20210515231025/https://www.primenewsghana.com/business/ghana-has-managed-very-effectively-the-covid-19-outbreak-imf.html  https://web.archive.org/web/20210515221219/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19
notes_C4: " All public gatherings, including conferences, workshops, funerals, festivals, political rallies, sporting events and religious activities, such as services in churches and mosques, have been suspended for the next four (4) weeks. Private burials are permitted, but with limited numbers, not exceeding twenty-five (25) in attendance"  https://web.archive.org/web/20200510225459/https://www.moh.gov.gh/president-akufo-addo-addresses-nation-on-measures-taken-by-govt-to-combat-the-coronavirus-pandemic/
notes_C6: Per Government Speech (01/31) recommending to stay home to slow the spread.  Additionally IMF's site recommends an increase in shifts & telework at workplaces.  ---------------------------------  https://web.archive.org/web/20210215153929/https://presidency.gov.gh/index.php/briefing-room/speeches/1859-update-no-23-measures-taken-to-combat-spread-of-coronavirus  https://web.archive.org/web/20210502143709/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19
notes_H6: The President of Ghana said in his speech on 14 June that, 'the wearing of masks is now mandatory. Leaving our homes without a face mask or face covering on is an offence. The Police have been instructed to enforce this directive, which is the subject of an Executive Instrument.'    https://archive.vn/4PIDh
notes_C5: Market places, work places, public transport, and constitutional and statutory bodies such as the Electoral Commission, the National Commission for Civic Education and the National Identification Authority, whose activities were exempted from the outset from these restrictions, must conduct their activities in accordance with social distancing and the necessary hygiene and safety protocols.    https://web.archive.org/web/20200604215546/http://www.presidency.gov.gh/index.php/briefing-room/speeches/1597-update-no-10-measures-taken-to-combat-spread-of-coronavirus

name: Guinea
notes_H1: The Minister of Health makes a press release urging Guineans to take precautions to protect themselves from COVID-19. He also informs the public about the actions being taken by the government regarding the issue.     https://web.archive.org/save/https://sante.gov.gn/communique-du-gouvernement-sur-lepidemie-de-coronavirus-declaree-par-la-chine/    https://web.archive.org/save/https://mobile.facebook.com/story.php?story_fbid=2725823084198063&id=685140344933024&_rdc=1&_rdr
notes_H2: Tests may be scheduled online at https://www.insp-guinee.org/ or completed at one of the various test sites. See: https://web.archive.org/web/20210322094321/https://gn.usembassy.gov/u-s-citizen-services/covid-19-information/
notes_C7: Is a curfew in place?  Yes  Are there restrictions on intercity or interstate travel?  Yes  Land borders between Guinea and Senegal, Guinea Bissau, Côte d’Ivoire, and Libera are open.  https://archive.vn/j3BSx#selection-2331.0-2347.91
notes_E2: Even though some selected measures are anticipated to continue in 2021, there were no specific policies nor available dates for the policy implementation, no further record of information was found.   http://web.archive.org/web/20210531151529/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19
notes_C2: All cultural and artistic activities, mass gatherings, baptisms, weddings, funerals, nightclubs and discos are prohibited/closed until further notice.   Many businesses have been allowed to reopen with use of masks and social distancing measures required.  https://archive.vn/j3BSx
notes_H3: No data found about contact tracing
notes_E1: Even though some selected measures are anticipated to continue in 2021, there were no specific policies nor available dates for the policy implementation, no further record of information was found.   http://web.archive.org/web/20210531151529/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19
notes_C1: Schools have reopened  https://web.archive.org/web/*/https://gn.usembassy.gov/u-s-citizen-services/covid-19-information/
notes_H7: After the launch of the vaccination campaign the state of Guinea has been able to vaccinate around 340,000 citizens with the Sinopharm and Sputnik V vaccine. Vaccines are being administered on a limited basis in Guinea. And medical staff,  people in key positions, religious practitioners and elderly people over 65 are being vaccinated with the amount of around 0.7-1.2% of the total population wich does not qualify for a universal coverage of vaccination being administered.  http://web.archive.org/web/20210531111947/https://gn.usembassy.gov/u-s-citizen-services/covid-19-information/  http://web.archive.org/web/20210531115539if_/https://graphics.reuters.com/world-coronavirus-tracker-and-maps/countries-and-territories/guinea/
notes_C3: "All cultural and artistic activities, mass gatherings, baptisms, weddings, funerals, nightclubs and discos are prohibited/closed until further notice."    https://web.archive.org/web/20210308183723/https://gn.usembassy.gov/u-s-citizen-services/covid-19-information/
notes_C8: Are health screening procedures in place at airports and other ports of entry?  Yes   Arriving passengers:  testing must be completed no more than 72 hours prior to arrival in Guinea or the traveler will be tested upon arrival and be required to quarantine for 14 days.  Arriving passengers with proof of a negative test within the 72 hours prior to arrival will not undergo any additional testing or quarantine in Guinea.  Arriving passengers with symptoms or who test positive for COVID-19 will be sent to a designated treatment center until two negative tests are completed.  https://archive.vn/j3BSx
notes_C4: The state government has extended the state of health emergency through June 26, maintaining measures such as curfew hours in Greater Conakry and N'zerekore, during which all nonessential businesses must close, are reduced to midnight-04:00 as of May 27. All cultural and artistic activities, mass gatherings, baptisms, weddings, funerals, nightclubs and discos are prohibited/closed until further notice. Although some businesses are generally open but must comply with enhanced sanitation and other precautionary measures, such as enforcing social distancing guidelines. Facemasks remain mandatory in public areas, Religious gatherings are restricted to 50 people, while other gatherings, including cultural events, are restricted to 100 people.  http://web.archive.org/web/20210531111947/https://gn.usembassy.gov/u-s-citizen-services/covid-19-information/    http://web.archive.org/web/20210531150437/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/484301/guinea-authorities-extend-covid-19-related-state-of-health-emergency-through-june-26-curfew-hours-reduced-may-27-update-19
notes_C6: According to the US Embassy, a 23h00 to 0400 curfew for the greater Conakry area and N’zerekore has been re-instituted. Please see:  https://web.archive.org/web/20210322094321/https://gn.usembassy.gov/u-s-citizen-services/covid-19-information/
notes_H6: It seems like this should be coded as 3G since  the directive is that "masks must always be worn in public spaces." See: https://gn.usembassy.gov/u-s-citizen-services/covid-19-information/ [web archive unavailable, last updated 4th January 2021]
notes_H8: Curfew in place for all citizens https://archive.vn/j3BSx#selection-2331.0-2333.3
notes_C5: Public transport (already allowed to resume) can now operate without restrictions   https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/382936/guinea-authorities-announce-easing-of-certain-measures-september-22-update-11 [link not archivable]

name: Gambia
notes_H1: Ministry of Health and State Facebook pages begin sharing information including daily situation reports, WHO prevention information, etc.   https://web.archive.org/web/20200425182545/https://www.facebook.com/WHO/photos/a.167668209945237/2946038618774835/?type=3&theater=
notes_H2: Testing is typically available at the Gambian government-run sites Monday-Friday, and is provided at no cost.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210126023557/https://gm.usembassy.gov/u-s-citizen-services/covid-19-information/
notes_C7: There seem to be no restrictions on internal movement.     Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200903115325/https://gm.usembassy.gov/u-s-citizen-services/covid-19-information/
notes_E2: No debt or contract relief.   http://web.archive.org/web/20210618163354/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19
notes_C2: The Gambian government has lifted COVID-related restrictions, allowing businesses, markets, schools, restaurants, bars, gyms, cinemas, and night clubs to resume normal operations.    https://web.archive.org/save/https://gm.usembassy.gov/u-s-citizen-services/covid-19-information/?_ga=2.222803228.685612913.1606144271-1301692634.1606144271
notes_H3: The government claims to be carrying out comprehensive contact tracing, and maps out all transmission and the source of each case in weekly infographics posted on its official twitter page. It's unclear to what extent these 'situational report' graphics represent the completeness of the governments contact tracing efforts, and this doesn't represent a discrete policy change, but there is now _ostensibly_ comprehensive contact tracing being carried out in the country.    https://web.archive.org/web/20200615182016/https://twitter.com/Presidency_GMB/status/1272594265550524422/
notes_E1: No indication that the measures were extended. According to the WFP, the cash transfers ended in October - "Each household received D1,500 per month (USD $30) for a period of two months; October and November 2020." See https://web.archive.org/web/20210104233058/https://gambia.un.org/en/104227-wfp-supports-hardest-hit-covid-19-cash; see also https://web.archive.org/web/20210104101126/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19
notes_C1: The Gambian government has lifted many COVID-related restrictions, allowing businesses, markets, schools, restaurants, bars, gyms, cinemas, and night clubs to resume normal operations, and borders to be open.  https://web.archive.org/web/*/https://gm.usembassy.gov/u-s-citizen-services/covid-19-information/
notes_H7: Astrazeneca and Sinopharm  A,B, C  The COVID-19 vaccine is being extended to the following categories; - Security Apparatus (army, police, immigration, etc) - Teachers - Hoteliers (staff)  https://archive.vn/x4yJD (Twitter)
notes_C3: https://web.archive.org/web/*/https://gm.usembassy.gov/u-s-citizen-services/covid-19-information/  https://web.archive.org/web/20210524161429/https://crisis24.garda.com/insights-intelligence/intelligence/risk-alerts/wip10011886226/gambia-covid-19-related-entry-measures-remain-largely-unchanged-as-of-may-14-update-25
notes_C8: Since January 9th, (i) travellers coming from countries where the new strain of COVID-19 is identified will have to undergo testing for the COVID-19 virus upon arrival, in addition to the requirement to have a valid COVID-19 PCR test result of 72 hours; and (ii) these travellers will also have to undergo a mandatory quarantine at their own cost. https://web.archive.org/web/20210126023557/https://gm.usembassy.gov/u-s-citizen-services/covid-19-information/; https://web.archive.org/web/20210126024358/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/426521/gambia-officials-amend-covid-19-entry-measures-from-jan-9-update-20
notes_C4: Limited religious gatherings are permitted provided worshipers and houses of worship adhere to health protocols (this suggests that gatherings greater than 10 are now allowed).   https://web.archive.org/web/*/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/457086/gambia-health-officials-maintaining-covid-19-related-entry-measures-as-of-march-18-update-23
notes_C6: The Gambian government has lifted COVID-related restrictions, allowing businesses, markets, schools, restaurants, bars, gyms, cinemas, and night clubs to resume normal operations.    https://web.archive.org/save/https://gm.usembassy.gov/u-s-citizen-services/covid-19-information/?_ga=2.222803228.685612913.1606144271-1301692634.1606144271
notes_H6: Face masks become mandatory in public spaces.     Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200903121126/https://www.worldaware.com/covid-19-alert-gambia-makes-wearing-face-masks-public-mandatory-july-24
notes_H8: Gambian authorities have eased certain restrictions put in place to curb the spread of the coronavirus disease (COVID-19) after the nationwide state of emergency expired Sept. 17. Authorities relaxed the nationwide nightly curfew Sept. 18, although its exact status remains unclear. All markets will also be allowed to operate 0600-1800. Nonessential shops can resume regular operations. However, other nonessential business closures, including restaurants, bars, pubs, night clubs, music lounges, casinos, cinemas, gyms, remain in place. Nonessential public gatherings, such as sporting events, remain banned; limited religious gatherings are permitted provided health protocols are adhered to. The use of protective facemasks is mandatory in public spaces.  Link: https://archive.vn/bm2tJ
notes_C5: Public transport is operating.  http://web.archive.org/web/20210606073646/https://gm.usembassy.gov/u-s-citizen-services/covid-19-information/

name: Greece
notes_H1: First Public Info Video uploaded to government.gov.gr by Ministry of Health (Simple and Useful Instructions for protecting us from Coronavirus)  https://web.archive.org/web/20200504102900/https://government.gov.gr/aples-ke-chrisimes-odigies-gia-tin-prostasia-mas-apo-ton-koronoio/
notes_H2: COVID-19 tests are available at many major hospitals in Greece, as well as the Athens Eleftherios Venizelos Airport. Testing is paid by the individual being tested.  The cost for COVID-19 PCR tests is capped at 60 euros, and for antigen (rapid) tests at 15 euros.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210621214504/https://gr.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C7: Travel between regions in Greece is permitted as of May 14, 2021.  In continental Greece, self-tests are recommended for travel by land but not required.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210621214504/https://gr.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_E2: "State contribution for the repayment of loans with collateral in the main residence for borrowers who have been affected by the adverse effects of the coronavirus" implemented from August 4, 2020.   The State contributes to the repayment of all types of loans of private or legal entities to financial institutions, for up to 9 months. People who have been proven to be affected by the COVID-19 coronavirus pandemic are eligible, as well as their spouses and dependents. https://web.archive.org/web/20200808152748/https://covid19.gov.gr/synisfora-dimosiou-gia-tin-apopliromi-danion-me-ebragmates-exasfalisis-stin-kyria-katikia-gia-danioliptes-pou-echoun-pligi-apo-tis-dysmenis-synepies-tou-koronoiou/
notes_C2: Museums and Retail Reopening:  As of May 14, 2021, museums are allowed to reopen.  Retail stores may operate without requiring appointments, though limitations on capacity will apply to allow for social distancing.  Restaurants Reopened:  Restaurants are open for outdoor dining as of Monday, May 3, 2021.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210621214504/https://gr.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_H3: The first COVID-19 case was diagnosed in Greece on February 26th. Contact tracing was initiated on the first and all subsequent confirmed cases, with all contacts being tested and isolated. See: https://web.archive.org/save/https://eody.gov.gr/en/current-state-of-covid-19-outbreak-in-greece-and-timeline-of-key-containment-events/
notes_E1: In addition to prior support through the indemnity and focused income support, from 1 June until at least 30 September, the Greek government provides 60% income support through the COOPERATION program funded by European SURE initiative in the formal sector.  "The state undertakes the obligation of replacement by 60% of the employee's income for the time that the employee will not work. In addition, in the event that the net remuneration after the above adjustment falls short of the minimum wage, the difference will be fully covered by the state."  http://archive.fo/9J9Qv
notes_C1: Greece's high schools reopened on Monday (12th April) after a five-month closure to curb coronavirus infections with precautions including virus tests for students and teachers twice per week, the education minister said.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210517131911/https://www.france24.com/en/live-news/20210412-greek-high-schools-reopen-after-five-months-of-closure  https://web.archive.org/web/20210517132536/https://covid19.gov.gr/covid-map
notes_H7: Pfizer-BioNTech, Moderna, AstraZeneca, Johnson and Johnson / Janssen vaccines have been approved for use in Greece.     https://web.archive.org/web/20210621214504/https://gr.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/    Currently vaccinating:  Citizens aged 18 or over.  Citizens with underlying diseases, people at high risk from Covid-19 (vulnerable groups)    https://web.archive.org/web/20210621221608/https://emvolio.gov.gr/en
notes_C3: The government is also planning to reopen museums (14 May), conservatoires (17 May), outdoor theatres (21 May), and live concerts (28 May) until the end of the month.  https://archive.fo/tS7oC
notes_C8: As of Monday, April 19, 2021 travellers from all EU member states and members of the border-free Schengen area, the United States, the United Kingdom, the United Arab Emirates, Serbia and Israel, will be able to enter Greece without having to undergo a seven-day period of self-isolation after arrival only if:    A. you have a negative PCR test performed less than three days (72 hours) prior to arrival, This test is mandatory for all tourists (including children over the age of 5), regardless of the epidemiological situation prevalent in the country of departure.    Or    B. you have a vaccination certificate issued by a public authority in the English language, stating that 14 days have passed since the completion of your full vaccination for COVID-19.    In addition, completing a PLF form at least 24 hours prior to arrival continues to be a requirement prior to entry.    Still current at: 31 May 2021  Updated: 26 April 2021    https://web.archive.org/web/20210531204900/https://www.dfa.ie/travel/travel-advice/a-z-list-of-countries/greece/
notes_C4: Alert levels below red do not mention restrictions on gatherings; no regions are currently at alert level red.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210621220932/https://covid19.gov.gr/covid-map-en/
notes_C6: A curfew is in place from 12:30am to 5am    https://web.archive.org/web/20210621212959/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/greece/coronavirus
notes_H6: Updating indicator as masks are required in all indoor and outdoor areas without specification to the presence of other people.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210227154123/https://covid19.gov.gr/covid-map
notes_H8: General precautions apply
notes_C5: Masks are required while using public transportation and taxis. Taxis are limited to one passenger, except for minor children.https://web.archive.org/web/20210330075700/https://gr.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/

name: Greenland
notes_H1: Translated from Danish:   'On Thursday, the first SMS will be sent from the three authorities who jointly control the efforts to prevent the spread of infection - namely the Naalakkersuisut, the National Medical Association and the Greenland Police.    The SMS will encourage you to follow our advice - keep your distance and wash your hands frequently - because it slows down the spread of infection.'    https://web.archive.org/web/20200506123325/https://naalakkersuisut.gl/da/Naalakkersuisut/Nyheder/2020/03/2603_sms
notes_H2: Policy remains unchanged. Test available to anyone with symptoms.     Source:  https://web.archive.org/web/20201221152615/https://nun.gl/emner/borgere/coronavirus_emne/hvem_bliver_testet_for_covid_19?sc_lang=da
notes_C7: The government's 'Entry to Greenland' page archived on August 10th was "updated on the 21st of July", which is the date the "Self-Government Executive Order no. 26 of 20 July 2020 on conditions for entry to Greenland (Phase 2)" came into effect.   The code has changed from 1G to 0 on July 21st because there are no further restrictions, required or recommended, on internal movement, for those who aren't recent entrants to Greenland.  However, the Executive Order describes required quarantine upon arrival into Greenland and related restrictions on internal movement "before it is considered proven that they [entrants to Greenland] are not infected with Covid-19". This movement restriction is specifically an international travel policy and therefore accounted for under international travel restrictions. C8-2 shows there is a quarantine policy in place.  "Your trip depends on your final destination   If you have passed a negative COVID-19 test before departure and filled in the SUMUT form, you can travel to the following cities without further restrictions.   The 10 towns and two villages are:   Municipality of Sermersooq   - Nuuk   - Paamiut   Qeqqata Municipality   - Sisimiut   - Maniitsoq   - Kangerlussuaq   Municipality Kujalleq   - Qaqortoq   - Narsaq   - Narsarsuaq   Municipality Qeqertalik   - Aasiaat   - Qasigiannguit   - Qeqertarsuaq   Avannaata Municipality   - Ilulissat   If your final destination is not figuerer above list you   Stay in the city with health center that is closest to your final destination.   If you have a home address in Greenland, you can contact the authorities regarding accommodation facilities for test results.   If you do not have an address in your final destination, you must maintain the expenses that may be associated with overnight stays, rebookings, board and lodging.   Contact your local health center and order a COVID-19 test to be performed at 5 p.m.   In the event of a negative test result, you can travel on to your final destination.   3. In the event of a positive result, you must go directly into isolation. The health center will contact the National Board of Health for further clarification of your situation."   Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20200810150502/https://nun.gl/Emner/Borgere/Coronavirus_emne/Rejser_til_Groenland_fra_den_15_juni?sc_lang=da  (Entry to Greenland page) & http://web.archive.org/web/20201110102927/https://naalakkersuisut.gl/~/media/Nanoq/Files/Kundgoerelser/DK/2020/Bekendtgoerelser/Selvstyrets%20bekendtgrelse%20nr%2026%20af%2020%20juli%202020%20om%20betingelser%20for%20indrejse%20til%20Grnland%20Fase%202%20da.pdf (Executive Order)
notes_C2: Restaurants and cafes are open. For indoor dining, you will need to have a ‘corona pass’ (full vaccination, a negative test taken within 72 hours, a positive test taken between 14 days and 12 weeks ago). For outdoor dining, a ‘corona pass’ is not required.    Outdoor attractions, museums, libraries, cinemas, concert venues and gyms are open, but you will need a `corona pass’ for entry. Nightclubs remain closed.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210525121458/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/denmark/coronavirus
notes_H3: Complete contact tracing done for confirmed cases.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200803163259/https://arctic-council.org/en/news/coronavirus-in-the-arctic-it-is-imperative-to-keep-the-virus-out/
notes_E1: Salary compensation may be granted for the period 1 January 2021 to 30 June 2021. To qualify, claimants must work for a company capable of documenting a loss of turnover of at least 30% in 2020 compared to 2019 and the majority of workers for said company must be resident in Greenland.  Salary compensation is set at 90% of wage below a cap of DKK 20,190, per calendar month.     http://web.archive.org/web/20210209232639/https://www.businessingreenland.gl/~/media/Groenlands%20Erhvervsportal/Files/Hjaelpepakker%202021/DK%20Retningslinjer%20for%20arbejdsmarkedspakke%20pr%2029012021.pdf?la=da
notes_C1: Office of Medical Officer of Health maintains that schools are open across the country with safety measures in place (since an executive order was issued on 29 May) - website updated 11 June)  "Teaching is normal for primary schools throughout the country and in all the country's educational institutions under special instruction that takes into account:  as much space as possible around the pupils / students; Among other things, by utilizing all the school institution's areas, maximum utilization of the school day, etc.  that all advice on hygiene is observed as far as possible: physical distance, hand hygiene, hand alcohol.  that canteen - restaurant meets the requirements of shops"  http://archive.fo/tkZEq
notes_H7: Vaccinations (Pfizer/BioNTech) have been carried out in the main cities of entry, namely Nuuk, Ilulissat, Aasiaat, Sisimiut and Qaqortoq. The target groups have been everyone aged 65 and over, health and care workers, as well as people who are medically assessed to be at particular risk of serious illness. A successful co-operation project with the Arctic Command has also been carried out, where vaccinations have been carried out in Qeqertarsuatsiaat and Paamiut.    Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20210329104455/https://naalakkersuisut.gl/da/Naalakkersuisut/Nyheder/2021/03/2603_Vaccine    https://web.archive.org/web/20210329105554/https://covid19.trackvaccines.org/country/greenland/
notes_C3: It is not allowed to host or attend indoor events, activities etc. with more than 50 people gathered simultaneously at the same location.    It is not allowed to host or attend outdoor events, activities etc. with more than 100 people gathered simultaneously at the same location.     https://web.archive.org/web/20210525121438/https://en.coronasmitte.dk/rules-and-regulations/national-measures/events-and-gatherings
notes_C8: Updated restrictions to forbid travel to/from Denmark as well as all other regions. 'Based on the health professional recommendations and forecasts for potential spread of infection in society, the Naalakkersuisut has actively looked at reducing the number of travellers over Christmas and the New Year... The departures to and from Denmark on 21 and 22 December will be canceled as well as associated domestic connections.' Possibly extended until January 17th.    Source:  https://web.archive.org/web/20201221143722/https://naalakkersuisut.gl/da/Naalakkersuisut/Nyheder/2020/12/0212_lukning_aflysning
notes_C4: It is not allowed to host or attend indoor events, activities etc. with more than 50 people gathered simultaneously at the same location.    It is not allowed to host or attend outdoor events, activities etc. with more than 100 people gathered simultaneously at the same location.     https://web.archive.org/web/20210525121438/https://en.coronasmitte.dk/rules-and-regulations/national-measures/events-and-gatherings
notes_C6: General recommendations of limiting contact apply.
notes_H6: In Greenland, you are required to wear a bandage(mask) in the following situations:    1. For international and domestic flights.  This applies to everyone over the age of 12 as well as the cabin crew, with a few exceptions when on the plane, staying at airports or terminal areas.  When employed with passenger contact in terminal areas and the like, you must wear a bandage or visor if a plastic screen cannot be set up between employees and travelers. Reference is also made to § 6 and § 7 Self-Government Executive Order no. 37 of 29 September 2020 on conditions for travel to and in Greenland  2. If you are infected or at risk of being infected with a new coronavirus and exceptionally have to move out, eg because you need to be tested.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201006064205/https://nun.gl/emner/borgere/coronavirus_emne/rejser_til_groenland_fra_den_15_juni?sc_lang=da
notes_H8: General stay at home recommendations apply
notes_C5: No restrictions on public transport.    Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20210329182545/https://nun.gl/

name: Guatemala
notes_H1: On 6 March, Ministry of Education formally presented a COVID-19 informatoin campaign. https://web.archive.org/web/20200520190657/https://www.facebook.com/MineducGuate/posts/3113286355372814    The first video infomercial was posted on social media on 7 March  https://web.archive.org/web/20200520191313/https://www.facebook.com/MineducGuate/posts/3113001608734622  Further, a Presidential Decree formally instituted information campaigns on 16 March. See article 5 (Quinto) https://web.archive.org/web/20200520190730/https://legal.dca.gob.gt/GestionDocumento/VisualizarDocumento?verDocumentoPrevia=True&versionImpresa=False&doc=56869
notes_H2: Generally avaible  https://web.archive.org/web/20210525041919/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/guatemala/coronavirus  https://web.archive.org/web/20210525042705/https://gt.usembassy.gov/es/alerta-covid-19/
notes_C7: Restriction on internal movement lifted. The declaration only lasted until 28 Jan 2021.     http://web.archive.org/web/20210118093136/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/guatemala/coronavirus  http://web.archive.org/web/20210131065948/https://gt.usembassy.gov/alert-covid-19-2/
notes_E2: The government deferred income taxes for a quarter and further subsidized electricity  https://www.prensalibre.com/guatemala/politica/cuales-son-los-programas-del-gobierno-por-la-crisis-del-coronavirus-en-guatemala-y-a-quienes-beneficiara/  https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19
notes_C2: Although country-wide restrictions have mostly lifted, the 4-tiered risk classification system prohibits the operation of "bars, event venues, gyms, cinemas, and theaters" in red zones (110 municipalities as of the 5th of April).   https://web.archive.org/web/20210405221729/https://covid19.gob.gt/semaforo.html  https://web.archive.org/web/20210405221623/https://crisis24.garda.com/insights-intelligence/intelligence/risk-alerts/wip10011870930/guatemala-covid-19-restrictions-enhanced-through-at-least-april-6-update-29
notes_H3: On 14 Aug the govt announces the introduction of tracers to conduct contact tracing via phone calls:  https://web.archive.org/web/20201005023158/https://www.mspas.gob.gt/noticias/noticias-ultimas/5-noticias-mspas/1012-%C2%BFqu%C3%A9-es-un-rastreador-de-casos-y-contactos-covid-19.html    by 14 Sep the ministry of health counts with 444 tracers in 4 departments: https://web.archive.org/web/20201005023329/https://lahora.gt/salud-hay-444-rastreadores-de-covid-19-en-cuatro-departamentos/
notes_E1: The last day to withdraw a payment from the BonoFamilia was on January 19  https://web.archive.org/web/20210525022103/https://www.prensalibre.com/economia/bono-familia-si-aun-no-ha-retirado-su-dinero-esta-es-la-nueva-fecha-limite-para-hacerlo/
notes_C1: On March 31, the Ministry of Public Health and Social Assistance of Guatemala delegated to the Ministry of Education, establishments and parents the responsibility of returning to the classrooms on orange alert. This measure begins on April 1.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210517112252/https://www.prensalibre.com/guatemala/comunitario/salud-deja-al-ministerio-de-educacion-establecimientos-y-padres-de-familia-la-responsabilidad-de-regreso-a-las-aulas-en-alerta-naranja-breaking/  https://web.archive.org/web/20210517111603/https://lahora.gt/salud-registra-mas-de-100-colegios-que-buscan-regresar-a-modelo-hibrido/
notes_H7: A,C  Sputnik V  https://web.archive.org/web/20210510085552/https://guatemala.gob.gt/ejercito-de-guatemala-insta-a-la-poblacion-a-inscribirse-para-la-fase-2-de-vacunacion-contra-el-coronavirus-covid-19/  The Guatemalan Army, as part of the actions aimed at supporting the National Coronavirus Vaccination Plan, COVID-19, has deployed personnel from the different Brigades and Commandos throughout the Republic, in order to invite the population over the age of 70 to enroll in Phase 2 of the Plan, through the www.vacuna.gob.gt platform or by telephone to call center 1517 , as a first step in receiving immunization against this disease, a process that will begin on May 4.
notes_C3: Parties, concerts, and “any other activity that generates a congregation of people” in the municipalities with red and orange alerts are prohibited.  https://archive.fo/1R0v2
notes_C8: On April 17, the Ministry of Public Health and Social Assistance -MSPAS- declared limiting entry to the country to foreigners who have been in the countries of Brazil, the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland and South Africa in the last fourteen days. This measure applies from April 17 to April 30, 2021.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210418001645/https://www.mspas.gob.gt/noticias/noticias-ultimas/5-noticias-mspas/1259-alerta-sanitaria-se-limita-el-ingreso-al-pa%C3%ADs-a-personas-extranjeras-que-han-estado-en-los-%C3%BAltimos-14-d%C3%ADas-en-brasil,-reino-unido-de-gran-breta%C3%B1a-e-irlanda-del-norte-y-sud%C3%A1frica.html
notes_C4: "Attendance at funerals and burials is limited to a maximum of 10 attendees. Everyone should comply with the measures put in place in Guatemala to limit the spread of coronavirus (COVID-19)."    https://web.archive.org/web/20210301180837/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/guatemala/coronavirus
notes_C6: Guatemala lifts its curfew in order to curb the negative economic effects of the lockdown. It is coded as a 0 as the govt seems to push people out of their homes to spend more.  https://web.archive.org/web/20201005024827/https://www.infobae.com/america/agencias/2020/09/29/guatemala-permitira-abrir-bares-y-anuncia-fin-de-toque-de-queda-por-la-pandemia/
notes_H6: On April 30, the Ministry of Public Health and Social Assistance published the ministerial agreement 95-2021 in the Diario de Centroamérica in which it issues the Sanitary Provisions for strict compliance with the increase in the spread of covid-19 nationwide.  The proper use of a mask is mandatory for the entire population at all times and in any place.    https://archive.fo/1R0v2  https://web.archive.org/web/20210517105043/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/guatemala/coronavirus
notes_H8: Policy summary:  •	No policy specific to the elderly can be found in the government’s website’s News archive or policy archive for this period.   •	Also cannot find any such policy in news articles about government Covid policies from this period.    Archived URL:  Archive of legal / policy documents related to Covid:  No government press releases about Covid policies can be found in the News archive for October and November.  https://archive.vn/Wygsr  https://web.archive.org/web/20210206111440/https://guatemala.gob.gt/2020/11/page/8/    News articles:  (about policy updates taking effect Oct 1 2020). These no longer mention a recommendation for people over 60 to stay at home from 5am to 9pm)  https://archive.vn/3sR3E  https://archive.vn/z4Gyg
notes_C5: Public transport has reopened in Guatemala, however, there are a number of restrictions on capacity and access can still be very limited. https://web.archive.org/web/20200809075444/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/guatemala/coronavirus

name: Guam
notes_H1: "Honoring its commitment to keep the people of Guam safe, the Leon Guerrero-Tenorio Administration respectfully denied a request today from the U.S. State Department to accept entry of a cruise line vessel whose passengers may be infected with the 2019 novel coronavirus." Informed the public with developments etc. http://web.archive.org/web/20200523113902/http://dphss.guam.gov/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/JIC_2_7_2020-1.pdf  Also Governor Lou Leon Guerrero posts daily government updates on her facebook page:  https://www.facebook.com/govlouguam
notes_H2: GRMC (a private hospital) made testing generally available. At some point also drive-thru testing centres started offering testing for people without symptoms, but change is observable on daily reports, I could not find any announcement of the change in policy.    https://web.archive.org/web/20200605001304/https://ghs.guam.gov/jic-release-no-113-profiles-earlier-confirmed-cases-grmc-drive-thru-testing-available-dphss-updates    https://web.archive.org/web/20200605001343/https://ghs.guam.gov/jic-release-no-157-end-day-results-two-test-positive-covid-19-dphssgovernor-signs-executive-order
notes_C7: I can't find any present evidence of restrictions about traveling within Guam.
notes_E2: Ban on evictions lifted, as per Feb 19th executive order.     https://web.archive.org/web/20210302100438/https://dphss.guam.gov/wp-content/uploads/2021/02/21.0219-SSD-to-Speaker-Terlaje-re-Executeive-Order-No.-2021-04-Relative-to-Declaring-Pandemic-Condition-of-Readiness-3-PCOR-3.pdf
notes_C2: Due to today's public health order, most things seem to be open (from movie theatres to pools), although almost all businesses are operating with caps usually around 50% capacity.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210302102614/https://dphss.guam.gov/wp-content/uploads/2021/02/DPHSS-Guidance-Memo-2021-06-REV1-PCOR3-02.24.2021-FINAL.pdf
notes_H3: June 2 - The Department of Public Health and Social Services (DPHSS) will be using a remote monitoring system known as Symptoms Monitoring Service to monitor individuals identified as close contacts to confirmed COVID-19 cases and returning residents in 14-day home quarantine.    Link: http://web.archive.org/web/20200621122244/https://www.pncguam.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/JIC-Release-No.-156-DPHSS-Launches-Symptoms-Monitoring-Service-for-COVID-19-Expanded-Testing-Continues-.docx.pdf  http://web.archive.org/web/20200621122259/https://www.pncguam.com/public-health-deploys-covid-19-monitoring-app/  http://web.archive.org/web/20200621122309/https://www.pncguam.com/jic-156-dphss-launches-symptoms-monitoring-service-for-covid-19-expanded-testing-continues/    Previous coding info:    It was previously coded as 1 since contact tracing efforts were made on a case by case basis when a cluster was identified (e.g. the church incident in early April), but given the low numbers of cases in Guam, I belive that they managed to do contact tracing in most of the identified cases.    Most communicates contain the location of the identified cases and the travel history, but here is the only communicate that talks expressly about contact tracing: https://web.archive.org/web/20200605003557/https://www.ghs.guam.gov/jic-release-no-56-profiles-earlier-confirmed-cases-dphss-phone-calls-part-contact-tracing    Here a report on 3 June that says that new cases were discovered thanks to contact tracing: https://web.archive.org/web/20200605003635/https://www.postguam.com/news/local/one-covid-19-case-associated-with-significant-cluster/article_67f6e474-a543-11ea-b4e1-072251bba437.html
notes_E1: A stimulus package was initially in place for residents. There is currently no evidence of income support.   https://web.archive.org/web/20210405205248/https://sannicolas.house.gov/guam-covid-19-relief
notes_C1: Beginning January 19, 2021, all three models of instruction are anticipated to be offered, and parents may select which model their child will participate in.  THIS MODEL OF INSTRUCTION IS ANTICIPATED TO BEGIN ON JAN. 19, 2021:   Traditional (Face-to-Face): Guam Education Board has approved the District School Readiness Task Force recommendation of using an A- B or A-B-C alternating schedule, where either 1/2 or 1/3 of students attend classes on any given school day.    Link  https://web.archive.org/web/20210216115351/https://www.gdoe.net/District/Portal/covid-19-information
notes_H7: Vaccines are available to anyone over the age of 16.   Vaccines available: Pfizer-BioNTech, Moderna, Johnson & Johnson Janssen.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210405214151/https://www.ghs.guam.gov/jic-release-no-625-vappc-holds-virtual-meeting-seven-647-test-positive-covid-19covid-19-vaccination
notes_C3: Businesses and services not authorized for on-site operations include reservations to celebrate public and private functions (i.e., anniversaries, birthdays, weddings, graduations) at Eating and Drinking Establishments and other public venues where the total number of guests exceed one hundred (100) individuals.  https://archive.vn/qQsNM  http://web.archive.org/web/20210515130341/https://ghs.guam.gov/sites/default/files/dphss_guidance_memo_2021-15_auth_business_and_svcs_during_pcor_3_relative_to_e.o._2021-10_05.14.2021_1.pdf
notes_C8: Guam has reached its "path to half," but Gov. Lou Leon Guerrero announced Friday the easing of quarantine requirements will be delayed for at least two weeks as a result of recent community case clusters. Neither a negative test result nor full vaccination will exempt travelers from quarantine. Everyone entering Guam by air or sea is subject to a 14-day quarantine.  https://archive.vn/UOkYM
notes_C4: Congregation is permitted and shall be limited to no more than twenty-five (25) persons; and such that  Running, walking, biking, and other recreation and non-contact exercise is authorized on public roadways, beaches, and parks,   Recreational boating by single household unit, and boat charters, where 6 feet distancing can be maintained by everyone on board, is authorized.   The use of hotel ballrooms shall be restricted to a single public or private reservation to celebrate functions (i.e., anniversaries, birthdays, weddings, graduations)  Public and private swimming pools allow no more than twenty-five (25) individuals per group at poolside and must remain 6 feet distance if not from the same household.  Government of Guam parks and beaches shall be open to the public and congregations shall be limited to no more than twenty-five (25) persons.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210216141852/https://ghs.guam.gov/jic-release-no-556-dphss-issues-guidance-memo-2021-04homebound-covid-19-vaccination-schedule-dphss
notes_C6: No recommendation to stay home.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210518031122/https://ghs.guam.gov/sites/default/files/dphss_guidance_memo_2021-15_auth_business_and_svcs_during_pcor_3_relative_to_e.o._2021-10_05.14.2021_1.pdf
notes_H6: 10 May PCOR 2 level of reopening brought in, everyone required to wear a mask in public to enable safe reopening    https://archive.fo/3oygS
notes_H8: Cascading from C6.    No indication of stricter policies to protect the elderly.    https://archive.vn/JsTiU  https://archive.vn/JsTiU  https://archive.vn/wWXaA  https://archive.vn/yJx7C
notes_C5: Public transportation, including school buses; and others as determined by DPHSS are authorized to operate at 50% occupancy load.  https://archive.vn/qQsNM  http://web.archive.org/web/20210515130341/https://ghs.guam.gov/sites/default/files/dphss_guidance_memo_2021-15_auth_business_and_svcs_during_pcor_3_relative_to_e.o._2021-10_05.14.2021_1.pdf

name: Guyana
notes_H1: Ministry of Health starts public info campaign on Coronavirus in series of facebook posts; https://web.archive.org/web/20200509223634/https://www.facebook.com/photo?fbid=2262669330703267&set=a.1505704143066460; https://web.archive.org/web/20200509223630/https://www.facebook.com/photo?fbid=2261551327481734&set=a.1505704143066460; https://web.archive.org/web/20200509224113/https://www.facebook.com/photo?fbid=2260577827579084&set=a.1505704143066460; https://web.archive.org/web/20200509224112/https://www.facebook.com/photo?fbid=2261551327481734&set=a.1505704143066460
notes_H2: Public testing is only for people showing symptoms or who have been in contact with someone with COVID-19  https://web.archive.org/web/20210607212816/https://gy.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C7: There are no restrictions on intercity or interstate travel  https://web.archive.org/web/20210607212816/https://gy.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_E2: Relief focuses on bank transactions alone.   The Bank of Guyana has further encouraged financial institutions to consider the following measures:  1. Defer loan payments to assist customers in good standing;  2. Defer loan payments by companies to assist with their liquidity requirements;  3. Waive or reduce fees/penalties for transactions with ATMs, POS, EFT, debit cards, loan  processing, late payments on loans, etc. and;  NOTE: Licensed financial institutions will be responsible for evaluating, on a case by case basis,  the applicability to customers of the aforementioned measures.    https://web.archive.org/web/20200505024403/https://www.bankofguyana.org.gy/bog/images/communications/press_release/COVID19release.pdf
notes_C2: No updates since October 31, 2020  Employees in both the public and private sectors are instructed to work on rotation unless told by their manager to work from home.  https://web.archive.org/web/20201206171220/https://officialgazette.gov.gy/images/gazette2020/oct/Extra_31OCTOBER2020COViD19_11.pdf
notes_H3: Guyana's President, David Granger, confirmed the first case of the coronavirus (COVID-19) in Georgetown on Wednesday, March 11. Authorities are currently conducting contact tracing to limit community spread of the virus.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200521172042/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/322031/guyana-first-covid-19-case-confirmed-march-11
notes_E1: I am unsure for how long this policy has been in place because there is no evidence of it on the IMF policy page. However, $9000 GYD is currently being provided monthly under a public assistance plan. It is proposed to increase this amount to $12 000 GYD   source: https://archive.vn/wXbs1
notes_C1: Schools reopen 9th November for grades 10, 11, sixth forms, PIC and TVET institutions: /web/20201116115909/https://www.education.gov.gy/web/index.php/mediacenter/item/6209-schools-reopen-today-for-grades-10-11-sixth-forms-pic-and-tvet-institutions
notes_H7: The Government conducted a broad campaign where all people over 18 years old can be vaccinated besides those already targeted.    http://web.archive.org/web/20210430175851/https://dpi.gov.gy/persons-18-years-and-older-receiving-covid-vaccines-from-today/
notes_C3: No person shall host, attend or visit- a recreational or competitive sporting event;  a meeting of a fraternal society, private or social club or civic association or organisation; or any other social activity. Moreover, religious gatherings are banned except for funerals and weddings (limited to 10 attendees); measures in place until May 03; https://web.archive.org/web/20200427133043/https://dpi.gov.gy/covid-19-emergency-measures/
notes_C8: On January 30th, Guyana banned travel from Brazil for 30 days.  source: https://archive.vn/b0EPR
notes_C4: On the 30th of September the Government of Guyana released the Covid Emergency Measures No.10 to be effective from 1st October to 31st October, 2020. The document outlines that with the exception of religious gatherings, gatherings of more than ten people are not allowed  http://web.archive.org/web/20201001040713/https://officialgazette.gov.gy/images/gazette2020/sept/Extra_30SEPTEMBER2020COViD19_10.pdf
notes_C6: Stay at home requirements are in effect for everyone starting 1 August, except as stated in the notice.     Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200805231141/https://officialgazette.gov.gy/images/gazette2020/jul/Extra_30JULY2020COViD19_7.pdf
notes_H6: As part of the Third Phase, all persons are required to wear a face mask in public spaces at all times.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200908164018/https://www.stabroeknews.com/2020/07/17/news/guyana/mask-wearing-now-mandatory-in-public-under-updated-covid-19-measures/
notes_H8: Through March 31st, nobody is permitted to visit a resident of a nursing home or senior citizen home. On a case by case basis, the facility may determine whether visitors are permitted if they are known to not be infectious with COVID-19.  source: https://archive.vn/dEARo
notes_C5: No evidence of a policy change.

name: Hong Kong
notes_H2: On Friday 7 August Hong Kong announced that voluntary free virus tests will be available to all 7 million residents in order to achieve universal testing to identify asymptomatic carriers. News articles report that capacity is able to fulfil this.    Media source 1:   https://web.archive.org/web/20200810212626/https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-08-07/hong-kong-to-offer-free-virus-testing-to-whole-city-says-hk01    Media source 2:  https://web.archive.org/web/20200812091126/https://www.wsj.com/articles/hong-kong-offers-free-testing-as-china-sends-in-teams-to-contain-coronavirus-11596815359
notes_C7: Announced on November 30, the Government strongly urges all members of the public to stay at home as much as possible. Besides, High Speed Rail between Hong Kong West Kowloon Station and the Mainland have been suspended.  Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20201205074504/https://www.info.gov.hk/gia/general/202012/01/P2020120100061.htm  http://web.archive.org/web/20201205082117/https://www.td.gov.hk/en/special_news/spnews.htm
notes_E2: Government has implemented broad debt/contract relief, including issuing tax breaks, low-interest loans, waiving rates for residential properties and non-residential properties, and subsidizing utilities such as electricity and water. https://web.archive.org/web/20200402055542/https://www.info.gov.hk/gia/general/202002/26/P2020022600420.htm
notes_C2: Announced on 24th of November, effective from this day until 3rd of Dec, all pubs, public showers and night clubs will be closed.  https://web.archive.org/web/20201201012159/https://www.info.gov.hk/gia/general/202011/24/P2020112400893.htm
notes_H3: The first highly suspected imported case of novel coronavirus infection was reported in Hong Kong.   The Centre for Protection of Health has immediately commenced epidemiological investigations and conducted relevant contact tracing.    A hotline is set up for contact tracing.   Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20200124174136/https://www.info.gov.hk/gia/general/202001/22/P2020012200982.htm ; p.5, Annex 4, https://www.legco.gov.hk/yr19-20/english/counmtg/papers/cm20200219p-e.pdf
notes_E1: There're policies about sponsoring residents with different occupations, but no evidence about if the sponsorship is over 50% of the income.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201117050424/https://www.coronavirus.gov.hk/chi/anti-epidemic-fund.html
notes_C1: all kindergartens and kindergarten-cum-child care centres would start suspension of face-to-face classes and school activities for two weeks from this Saturday (November 14) until November 27 (Friday) owing to the outbreaks of upper respiratory tract infection.    https://www.info.gov.hk/gia/general/202011/12/P2020111200609.htm?fontSize=1  * The website of wayback machine didn't work, kept on giving me internal errors.
notes_H7: Biontech, Sinovac    The government announced the COVID-19 Vaccination Programme will be expanded to cover people aged 16 to 29.     https://archive.ph/JgTpz    About 1,222,800 doses of COVID-19 vaccines have been administered to the public, with about 806,600 people receiving their first dose and about 416,200 people getting their second dose.    https://archive.ph/q9OCL#selection-547.0-547.185
notes_C3: The leisure and cultural venues/facilities reopened earlier will be temporarily closed starting from July 15 (Wednesday) until further notice.  The recreational, sports and cultural programmes to be held in July will also be cancelled.  Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200713174115/https://www.info.gov.hk/gia/general/202007/13/P2020071300885.htm?fontSize=1
notes_C8: As of December 4, travel to Hong Kong is subject to entry restrictions. Specified conditions including negative test results are imposed on inbound travellers who have visited specified places.
