notes_H1: Public Communications on Covid-19, including posters, on social media from Ministry of Health.  http://web.archive.org/web/20200824054005/https://twitter.com/MOH_Kenya/status/1232361147904466949/photo/1
notes_H2: Rapid antigen tests will be used for symptomatic individuals and their immediate household and workplace contacts; health-care workers in high risk areas, rapid response teams, labs and A&E; in outbreaks associated with superspreader events; for prison remandees; and for high risk patients in health facilities.  Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20201214155230/https://www.health.go.ke/wp-content/uploads/2020/12/Interim_Antigen_Testing_Guide_COVID-19.docx-1.pdf
notes_C7: Travel inside the five county zone is also permitted.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210420071518/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/kenya/coronavirus
notes_E2: Quote (1):  "The government, as part of the FY2019/20 budget (ending June 30, 2020), initially earmarked Ksh40 billion (0.4 percent of GDP) for Covid-related expenditure, including health sector (enhanced surveillance, laboratory services, isolation units, equipment, supplies, and communication); social protection (cash transfers and food relief); and funds for expediting payments of existing obligations to maintain cash flow for businesses during the crisis. The FY2020/21 budget includes a Ksh56.6 million (0.5 percent of GDP) economic stimulus package that includes a new youth employment scheme, provision of credit guarantees, fast-tracking payment of VAT refunds and other government obligations, increased funding for cash transfers, and several other initiatives. A package of tax measures has been adopted, including full income tax relief for persons earning below the equivalent of $225 per month, reduction of the top pay-as you earn rate from 30 to 25 percent, reduction of the base corporate income tax rate from 30 to 25 percent, reduction of the turnover tax rate on small businesses from 3 to 1 percent, and a reduction of the standard VAT rate from 16 to 14 percent. Some of the tax measures, including the reduction of top PAYE rate, corporate income tax rate and VAT were reversed effective January 1, 2021."    Link (1): http://web.archive.org/web/20210424041427/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19#S
notes_C2: On 1 May 2021, the Government of Kenya confirmed that restaurants and eateries in the counties of Nairobi, Machakos, Kajiado, Kiambu and Nakuru would reopen to customers, provided they comply with Government of Kenya public health protocols. Bars...pharmacies and other shops selling essential products remain open, though business hours may be affected by the nationwide curfew.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210511083746/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/kenya/coronavirus
notes_H3: Page 9 of this report by the WHO shares information on strengthened capacity for contact tracing in the sub counties. Please see: http://web.archive.org/web/20210524172149/https://apps.who.int/iris/bitstream/handle/10665/334127/SITREP_COVID-19_WHOAFRO_20200902-eng.pdf
notes_E1: Quote (1):  "Kenya also has existing cash transfer programs targeting over a million people, that receive 2,000 Kenyan shillings, or $19, per month. The national treasury allocated an additional 10 billion shillings to this program for supporting vulnerable groups including the elderly and orphans during this pandemic period."    Link (1): http://web.archive.org/web/20210426145243/https://www.devex.com/news/cash-transfers-lead-the-social-assistance-response-to-covid-19-96949  _______________    Quote (2):  "The government’s COVID-19 Emergency Fund has raised more than KES 1 billion ($9 million), some of which will be sent as weekly stipends to low-income households in urban areas. "    "Still, the investment Kenya has made in its G2P payment infrastructure is already proving critical to mitigating the impact of the COVID-19 crisis on Kenya’s most vulnerable people. In April, the Ministry of Labour and Social Protection released four months’ worth of payments to current recipients, plus KES 500 million ($4.7 million) in arrears to people with severe disabilities."    Link (2): http://web.archive.org/web/20210426145324/https://www.cgap.org/blog/kenyas-expansion-g2p-becomes-lifeline-during-covid-19-crisis  _______________    Quote (3):  "The government, as part of the FY2019/20 budget (ending June 30, 2020), initially earmarked Ksh40 billion (0.4 percent of GDP) for Covid-related expenditure, including health sector (enhanced surveillance, laboratory services, isolation units, equipment, supplies, and communication); social protection (cash transfers and food relief); and funds for expediting payments of existing obligations to maintain cash flow for businesses during the crisis. The FY2020/21 budget includes a Ksh56.6 million (0.5 percent of GDP) economic stimulus package that includes a new youth employment scheme, provision of credit guarantees, fast-tracking payment of VAT refunds and other government obligations, increased funding for cash transfers, and several other initiatives. A package of tax measures has been adopted, including full income tax relief for persons earning below the equivalent of $225 per month, reduction of the top pay-as you earn rate from 30 to 25 percent, reduction of the base corporate income tax rate from 30 to 25 percent, reduction of the turnover tax rate on small businesses from 3 to 1 percent, and a reduction of the standard VAT rate from 16 to 14 percent. Some of the tax measures, including the reduction of top PAYE rate, corporate income tax rate and VAT were reversed effective January 1, 2021."    Link (3): http://web.archive.org/web/20210424041427/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19#S
notes_C1: Schools are to reopen for all years apart from Grade 4 at the start of the third school term.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210511083408/https://twitter.com/EduMinKenya/status/1390629235505745923
notes_H7: 'Kenya has offered free COVID-19 vaccines to all diplomats based there, including thousands of United Nations staff, even though it has not completed inoculating its own health workers, other frontline staff or elderly, drawing criticism from local medics.  ...  The government note said vaccinations would begin on March 23 and only accredited diplomats and their families were eligible.'    https://archive.vn/O6H7H
notes_C3: Across Kenya, the maximum number of persons permitted to attend meetings or events has been capped at 15, permitted to attend funerals has been capped at 50, weddings capped at 30, with all in attendance expected to abide by Ministry of Health protocols. Political gatherings have been suspended until otherwise directed Kenyan citizens have been advised to avoid crowded places and to work remotely where possible.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210511083746/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/kenya/coronavirus
notes_C8: Travellers from Brunei, Kuwait, Thailand, Pakistan and the Czech Republic are required to undergo 14 days of mandatory qurantine;   All passenger flights, whether commercial or charter, between Kenya and the UK are suspended, all passengers coming to Kenya from United Kingdom must have avalid COVID-19 vaccination certificate and a COVID-19 negative PCR test and must self-isolate on arrival for a period of seven days.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210511084855/https://kcaa.or.ke/sites/default/files/docs/covid_19/exempted_states.pdf  https://web.archive.org/web/20210411183025/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/kenya/entry-requirements
notes_C4: On 26 March 2021, the Government of Kenya confirmed that '[t]he suspension of large gatherings, in person meetings of any nature, congregational worship, conferences and political events have been suspended in the counties of Nairobi, Machakos, Kajiado, Kiambu and Nakuru until further notice.  In other counties the maximum number of persons permitted to attend meetings or events has been capped at 15, permitted to attend funerals has been capped at 50, weddings capped at 30, with all in attendance expected to abide by Ministry of Health protocols.'    https://archive.vn/fc0R8
notes_C6: Is a curfew in place? Yes  Curfew is from 10pm to 4 am.     https://web.archive.org/web/20210511084133/https://ke.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_H6: Mandatory wearing of masks in public remains in effect. The government will not provide services to individuals not wearing a mask    https://web.archive.org/web/20210511084133/https://ke.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/    The Government of Kenya has directed that face masks must be worn in public places, except when dining, or when adhering to social distancing in hotels, gardens or on beaches.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210511083746/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/kenya/coronavirus
notes_C5: Is public transportation operating? Yes  Individuals using public or private transport are required to wear a protective mask.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210511084133/https://ke.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/

name: Kyrgyz Republic
notes_H1: Evidence seen of a coordinated public information campaign.  ________________________________________________________________    Nationwide coordinated public campaign noted, as seen across several sites such as government sites, as well as local news outlets.    ______________________________    Link (1):  http://archive.today/2021.04.04-172231/https://akipress.com/coronavirus/    Link (2):  http://archive.today/2021.04.04-172434/http://www.ktrk.kg/kg
notes_H2: Quote (1):    "COVID-19 Testing    Are PCR and/or antigen tests available for U.S. citizens in the Kyrgyz Republic? Yes  If so, are test results reliably available within 72 hours? Yes   The Ministry of Health provides free testing only for symptomatic patients.  For those requiring a negative PCR test for travel, state laboratories in Bishkek and Osh can provide tests for a fee (approximately $20), depending on testing capacity.  Private COVID-19 testing is also available for a fee ($30) at Bonetsky Laboratory or Aqualab. "    Link (1):    http://archive.today/2021.04.03-155858/https://kg.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/  _________________________________________    Quote (2):  "Private laboratories are offering COVID-19 testing for people who are not showing symptoms of Coronavirus. Both PCR and antibody tests are available."    Link (2):    http://archive.today/2021.04.03-155331/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/kyrgyzstan/coronavirus
notes_C7: No restrictions on travel between cities/regions. However, SOPs have been implemented to avoid spread of cases.      Quote: "Movement Restrictions:    Is a curfew in place? No  Are there restrictions on intercity or interstate travel? No"    Archived Link  http://web.archive.org/web/20210425192110/https://kg.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/  ___________________________________________________________________    Quote: "With regard to domestic restrictions, inter-regional transport services, including flights between Bishkek and Osh, are operating, though passengers must undergo health screenings before boarding. "    Archived Link  http://web.archive.org/web/20210425183025/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/463696/kyrgyzstan-covid-19-related-restrictions-remain-largely-unchanged-as-of-april-5-by-comparison-with-early-february-update-17
notes_E2: Narrow relief seen for households.  _________________________________________    Quote (1):  "Key Policy Responses as of April 2, 2021    FISCAL:    -To mitigate the impact on the economy, the authorities have approved the first package of anti-crisis plan economic measures of $15 million (0.2 percent of GDP) including the postponement of tax payments, time-bound exemptions of property and land taxes, and temporary price controls on 11 essential food items. They prepared a second and a third package of economic measures of about $540 million (7 percent of GDP), including temporary tax exemptions for SMEs, support food security program to the vulnerable groups, and subsidized credit to banks to provide funding to small and medium-size enterprises through soft loans."    Link (1):  http://archive.today/2021.04.04-180818/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19%23K
notes_C2: Although '[m]ost businesses and public spaces in Kyrgyzstan have now reopened' (See Source 1, linked), some sectors are not yet allowed to open. 'Shopping centers, outdoor markets, catering establishments, hotels, spas, car dealerships, places of worship, and many other nonessential businesses are open subject to social distancing requirements. Some leisure facilities remain closed, including playgrounds, swimming pools, gyms, and public baths (See Source 2, linked).    Source 1: https://web.archive.org/web/20210517174055/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/kyrgyzstan/coronavirus  Source 2: https://web.archive.org/web/20210607212807/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/486721/kyrgyzstan-authorities-maintaining-covid-19-related-restrictions-as-of-june-4-update-19
notes_H3: Contact people are tested in case of COVID-19 symptoms are discovered.  Link: https://archive.vn/ib3Dl
notes_E1: Though income support has been seen in the past, there is a lack of evidence of continued income support.
notes_C1: Several schools in Bishkek have been closing down since April 19 due to COVID-19.   " Four schools have been closed for quarantine since today in Bishkek, Education Department Chief Elmira Imanalieva told a press brefing on April 19"  Archived article:  http://web.archive.org/web/20210425181324/https://akipress.com/news:657033:4_more_schools_closed_for_COVID-19_quarantine_in_Bishkek_since_today/  _______________________________________________________________________    "Twelve schools are closed for quarantine in Bishkek"  Archived Article  http://web.archive.org/web/20210425181246/https://akipress.com/news:657067:12_schools_closed_for_quarantine_in_Bishkek_due_to_Covid-19/  _______________________________________________________    "Fifteen schools in Bishkek are closed for quarantine due to COVID-19, Education Department's representative Gulmira Akmatova said."  Archived Article  http://web.archive.org/web/20210425181845/https://akipress.com/news:657182:15_schools_in_Bishkek_closed_for_quarantine_due_to_Covid-19/
notes_H7: Vaccine: Sinopharm + Sputnik V  As per latest update, the nation have also started administering Sputnik V vaccine. As per update, Sinopharm vaccine is available to all with SputnikV available to only those over 65 (limitation on administration of specific vaccine to certain groups)  Quote: "According to Kyrgyz Republic authorities Sinopharm is now available at government clinics for all those who wish to receive it. SputnikV is available only for those over 65 and those with chronic conditions."  Archive Link  http://web.archive.org/web/20210508035553/https://kg.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/  __________________________________________________________________  Quote: "Kyrgyzstan vaccinates almost 30,000 against COVID-19"   Quote: "3,551 people were vaccinated against COVID-19 for the past day, First Deputy Minister of Health and Social Development Aliza Soltonbekova said."  Archive Link  http://web.archive.org/web/20210502205509/https://akipress.com/news:657649:Kyrgyzstan_vaccinates_almost_30,000_against_COVID-19/  __________________________________________________________________________________  Quote: "Kyrgyzstan starts vaccination against COVID-19 with Sputnik V vaccine"  Archived Article  http://web.archive.org/web/20210502212706/https://akipress.com/news:657246:Kyrgyzstan_starts_vaccination_against_COVID-19_with_Sputnik_V_vaccine/  ___________________________________________________________________  Quote: "Over 5,500 vaccinated against COVID-19 for a month in Bishkek"  Quote: "Some 5,527 were vaccinated against coronavirus infection from March 29 to April 29 in Bishkek, United Family Medicine Center representative Dilara Iskakova told a briefing."  Archive Link:   http://web.archive.org/web/20210502211406/https://akipress.com/news:657561:Over_5,500_vaccinated_against_COVID-19_for_a_month_in_Bishkek/  ___________________________________________________  Quote: "On March 19, Kyrgyzstan took delivery of 150,000 doses of the Sinopharm COVID-19 vaccine that were provided by China, free of charge. The delivery enabled Kyrgyzstan to begin its vaccination campaign in Bishkek, Osh, and Chui oblast. The first phase is targeting healthcare workers."  Archive Link  http://web.archive.org/web/20210502205958/https://thediplomat.com/2021/04/kyrgyzstan-begins-covid-19-vaccination-campaign-with-free-chinese-doses/
notes_C3: Though it is unclear what size events are prohibited, 'Public gatherings are prohibited', thus this indicator as coded as a 2 under the assumption that public events are cancelled. (From Source 1, linked)    As a possible exception, places of worship appear to be open, subject to social distancing requirements. (From Source 1, linked)    There was also a mass protest in Kyrgyzstan's capital, Bishkek, on 8th April, but it is unclear whether this was permitted to take place. (From Source 2, linked)    Source 1: https://web.archive.org/web/20210405233954/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/463696/kyrgyzstan-covid-19-related-restrictions-remain-largely-unchanged-as-of-april-5-by-comparison-with-early-february-update-17    Source 2: https://web.archive.org/web/20210409060109/https://www.channelnewsasia.com/news/asia/hundreds-protest-in-kyrgyzstan-after-bride-kidnap-and-murder-14583162
notes_C8: Quote (1):  "International travel  There are regular flights to and from Kyrgyzstan, operated by a range of airlines. Tickets are available online and at local travel agents. However, there may be reduced flights on some routes."    Link (1):  http://archive.today/2021.04.03-155331/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/kyrgyzstan/coronavirus  ______________________________    Quote (2):  "Although international flights are operating, all persons entering Kyrgyzstan by air must produce proof of a negative COVID-19 polymerase chain reaction (PCR) test taken no more than 72 hours before arrival; exceptions will be made for passengers on flights that become delayed due to weather. Travelers without a negative test certificate will be tested at the border; those who test positive will be placed in a government quarantine facility for up to 14 days. Travelers entering the country through land border checkpoints are also required to produce a negative test certificate. Diplomats, international transport crews, freight drivers, and infants are exempt from this requirement."    Link (2):  http://archive.today/2021.04.03-160628/https://crisis24.garda.com/insights-intelligence/intelligence/risk-alerts/wip10011870117/kyrgyzstan-authorities-maintain-coronavirus-disease-related-international-entry-and-domestic-restrictions-as-of-feb-8-update-16    _____________________________________  Quote (3):  "Are health screening procedures in place at airports and other ports of entry? Yes"    "Quarantine Information: Are U.S. citizens required to quarantine? No"    Link (3):  http://archive.today/2021.04.03-155858/https://kg.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C4: Though the numbers of how many people can meet are unclear, 'Public gatherings are prohibited', thus this indicator is coded as a 4, though it could be less stringent than this.     Considering that some non-essential businesses are still not permitted to open, such as 'playgrounds, swimming pools, gyms, and public baths', 4 seems an appropriate code for this indicator.    Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20210405233954/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/463696/kyrgyzstan-covid-19-related-restrictions-remain-largely-unchanged-as-of-april-5-by-comparison-with-early-february-update-17
notes_C6: No "stay at home" policy was reported.
notes_H6: "If you are going to a public place you should wear a mask. Gathering in groups of more than three people, unless they are from the same household is forbidden. Minors should be accompanied by an adult." https://web.archive.org/web/20200526141611/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/kyrgyzstan/staying-during-coronavirus
notes_H8: No policy on elderly people was reported.
notes_C5: 'Public transport is operating at reduced levels.'     Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20210607212807/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/486721/kyrgyzstan-authorities-maintaining-covid-19-related-restrictions-as-of-june-4-update-19

name: Cambodia
notes_H1: MOH in cooperation with Unicef is distributing posters and billboards, there are radio and TV announcements, and until recently MOH was issuing text messages to mobile phones recommending safety steps (haven’t seen any for about 10 days now). For the materials funded by Unicef see:  http://web.archive.org/web/20200729232153/https://www.unicef.org/cambodia/ and click on ‘communication materials’ at top of page.
notes_H2: A broad testing strategy is being implemented nationwide, including testing all suspect cases meeting case definition and targeted testing of high-risk populations. Tests are also available for travelling purpose, any individuals seeking testing can pre-register at MOH's vaccination portal (https://www.nphl.niph.org.kh/covid19/en)    https://web.archive.org/web/20210518001500/https://www.who.int/docs/default-source/wpro---documents/countries/cambodia/covid-19/covid-19-joint-who-moh-sitrep-44.pdf    https://web.archive.org/web/20210518001500/https://www.who.int/docs/default-source/wpro---documents/countries/cambodia/covid-19/covid-19-joint-who-moh-sitrep-44.pdf  https://web.archive.org/web/20210517235958/https://kh.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C7: Travel from “Dark Yellow Zones” to “Yellow Zones” for the following is permitted: For those traveling to work in essential businesses; Up to two individuals per household are permitted to leave their residence to purchase food; Groups of up to four people may travel to seek medical care; Government, UN, international workers, and journalists must present ID and travel pass to move in and out of Dark Yellow Zones.  Certain areas in Phnom Penh have been designated as “Dark Yellow Zones” (effective through June 9).    https://web.archive.org/web/20210607172220/https://kh.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_E2: Different news articles call for govt stimulus packages, but no report about any support being given for 2021:  https://archive.vn/tfqWF
notes_C2: Starting April 29, lockdown areas have been designated as “Red Zones,” “Dark Yellow Zones,” or “Yellow Zones." (Please see archived docx file for geographic designations.)  In Red Zones: "All individuals within the “Red Zones” must not leave their residence, except for medical emergencies, for COVID-19 testing as directed by the relevant authorities, or to receive a second dose of the COVID-19 vaccine as determined by the relevant authorities. All markets, food sales, work and business activities are suspended except for a limited number of emergency and other services as determined by the authorities."  In Dark Yellow Zones: All individuals within the lockdown areas must not leave their residence for the duration of the lockdown period, with some exceptions. Certain essential businesses may remain open despite the lockdown, but may be subject to stricter requirements, such as minimizing their staffing to no more than 2%.  In Yellow Zones: All businesses are permitted to operate, except for schools and entertainment businesses (such as karaoke, beer gardens, clubs, discos, resorts and parks, massage, liquor stores, cinemas, theaters, museums, gyms, and sport centers).    https://web.archive.org/web/20210502000734/https://kh.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/  https://web.archive.org/web/20210503223835/https://kh.usembassy.gov/wp-content/uploads/sites/80/Phnom-Penh-and-Ta-Khmau-Zone-Classification-30-APR-2021.docx
notes_H3: "The MOH guidance on surveillance and contact tracing for COVID-19 has been updated with the inclusion of  an updated suspect case definition that incorporates living in an area with community transmission (updated  07 January 2021)"  https://web.archive.org/web/20210221195415/https://www.who.int/cambodia/internal-publications-detail/covid-19-joint-who-moh-situation-report-32
notes_E1: In December 2020, the government extended until the end of March this year: i) allowance subsidy for garment and tourism sectors; ii) tax exemption for tourism and aviation sector; and iii) cash relief program for poor and vulnerable families.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210308024659/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19
notes_C1: "On March 20, the Cambodian government announced comprehensive closures to include all public and private educational institutions at all levels throughout the country."    https://web.archive.org/web/20210322222100/https://kh.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_H7: (Sinovax, AstraZeneca, Sinopharm): Beginning May 1, the government of Cambodia has begun a targeted mass vaccination campaign for all adults within designated "Red Zones" within Phnom Penh. This vaccination effort is to prevent serious community transmission of COVID-19. Vaccinations will continue to include all residents of Phnom Penh and Kandal province during May and June.  In addition, other priority groups continue to be the elderly, the vulnerable, and frontliners including health workers, journalists, police and military personnel, government officials and factory workers.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210504020749/https://www.khmertimeskh.com/50848400/large-scale-covid-19-vaccination-campaign-for-red-zone-will-start-may-1st/  https://web.archive.org/web/20210504021301/https://www.khmertimeskh.com/50848724/revealed-vaccination-centres-in-the-four-red-zones-of-phnom-penh/  https://web.archive.org/web/20210504021318/https://www.khmertimeskh.com/50849863/pm-says-phnom-penh-and-kandal-vaccinations-will-be-done-by-june/
notes_C3: All gatherings continue to be prohibited in Red and Dark Yellow lockdown zones announced.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210517235958/https://kh.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C8: Since the last update by the US embassy it seems like everyone must abide by the 14 day quarantine, even if everyone entering the country has a negative test result:  "Cambodian authorities have also introduced the following requirements for prevention, containment, and response to the spread of COVID-19 for all travelers entering Cambodia by air, land, and water.? All arriving foreigners must:  Fully abide by locally enforced quarantine measures for 14 days at a hotel designated by the Government of Cambodia."  https://web.archive.org/web/20201124224049/https://kh.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C4: A curfew between 8pm and 3am remains in place in all zones and gathering with more than 10 people remains prohibited.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210524080836/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/cambodia/coronavirus
notes_C6: Certain areas in Phnom Penh have been designated as “Dark Yellow Zones” (effective through June 9). While there are no areas designated as “Red Zones” in Phnom Penh, individual buildings may be designated as subject to stricter lockdown measures. Non-designated areas permit in-person dining and are not subject to curfew measures, but prohibit gatherings of more than 15 people and prohibit certain “high-risk” businesses (such as schools, bars and other entertainment businesses, museums, resorts, massage parlors, cinemas, theaters, gyms, and sports centers), effective until June 16. Cambodian authorities have also announced lockdown measures and zone designations for and Sihanoukville (effective through June 4), Poipet (effective through June 5), and Kandal province subject to the aforementioned restrictions. Sihankouville and Poipet have further extended their curfew restrictions to apply between 8:00 p.m. and 5:00 a.m (not 3:00 a.m.).    Dark Yellow and Yellow Zones must remain home except for certain exceptions.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210607172220/https://kh.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_H6: As of March 12, 2021, under new Cambodian legal provisions, individuals who do not adhere to mandatory mask-wearing and social distancing may be subject to fines of $50 to $250.  Repeat offenders may be subject to a fine of up to $1,250. On March 23, the Cambodian government mandated the wearing of masks in geographic areas where there is an outbreak of COVID-19 in the community as determined by the Ministry of Health.  The mandatory mask-wearing and social distancing were earlier imposed on Phnom Penh and the provinces of Preah Sihanouk, Kandal, Prey Veng, Siem Reap, Svay Rieng and Banteay Meanchey. As of June 5, the Ministry of Health has made it mandatory for people in Kampong Speu, Takeo and Kampong Cham provinces to wear face masks at all times in public areas following an increase in new COVID-19 cases.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210607172220/https://kh.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/  https://web.archive.org/web/20210607202354/https://www.khmertimeskh.com/50852108/mandatory-face-mask-use-in-additional-three-provinces/
notes_H8: Certain cities and provinces have implemented curfews. The curfew suspends in-person restaurant and food stall service and forbids most types of gatherings and travel within the city during curfew hours. Exceptions to restrictions during curfew hours include travel for emergency medical need, gatherings with family members, and travel for work for those businesses permitted to remain open. Siem Reap province has imposed a daily curfew from 8:00 p.m. to 5:00 a.m. effective as of April 10 through May 21, 2021.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210524081735/https://kh.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/

name: Kiribati
notes_H1: Article suggests that Kiribati has a suspected case of Covid-19 (a person from Papua New Guinea who recently came to Kiribati on a flight from Fiji on 19th March).    The article also refers to the provision of information about Covid-19 on multiple media channels (radio, TV and internet) by the Ministry of Health and Medical Services (MHMS), hence the change of code for H1 from "0" to "2".  It is entirely possible that a coordinated campaign has been in existence prior to this, although no policy announcement about such a campaign has been found.    "People were also kept reminded by the MHMS over radio Kiribati, the media and tv of steps to combat with the deadly convid-19 on all levels.    On the island people had their hand-held mobile smart telephone on site with them for any current viral news for the corona virus updates. They can access the latest news with their mobile any moment."    http://archive.today/2021.01.24-161213/https://kiribatiupdates.com.ki/kiribati-is-now-on-level-2-in-the-convid-19-scale-in-tarawa/
notes_H2: Article from Kiribati updates.    Notes that a suspected Covid case (a captain of a ship) had been tested for Covid-19 and the results had come back negative.  This suggests a policy of testing is in existence and is likely to have been in place prior to 28th March, although no policy on testing has been found, so code prior to this has been left as "0".  The tests were carried out in Australia.  It is assumed that reliance on other countries for testing will mean that testing is limited to symptomatic / suspected cases and is not available more widely.      Link:  http://archive.today/2021.01.26-174948/https://kiribatiupdates.com.ki/convid-19-results-proof-negative-in-tarawa/    Subsequent Facebook posts by the Australian High Commission for Kiribati notes the delivery of testing supplies and equipment (GeneXpert) on 1st May, 21st May, 25th August and 9th November 2020 which suggests that testing capacity within Kiribati progressively increases over the coming months.  A further post by the High Commission on 12th November comments on support provided for Kiribati to develop a PCR lab at Tungaru Central Hospital which will reduce its need for sending samples overseas for testing.  Taken as a whole, these comments suggest that whilst testing capacity increases, it has remained limited and is therefore unlikely to meet coding criteria for "2" or "3" throughout 2020.    Additional context: borders remained closed from March 2020 and Kiribati has continued to report no confirmed cases of Covid-19 throughout 2020.
notes_E1: The specific measures include: unemployment benefit via partial income substitution, employer cost sharing for off-shore observers, sea farers, and fruit packers, reduction in social security contributions for both employers and employees, and loan support through government-owned financial intermediaries.  https://archive.vn/gxVRM#K
notes_C1: Previous note on 20th May suggested that all schools would be open by 7th June.  No further updates have been found and according to the Government website on Covid-19, the country is at Level 1 of its Covid response strategy "Business as usual"    http://archive.today/2021.06.14-175510/https://covid19.gov.ki/docroot/
notes_H7: Groups: A,C  Vaccine: AstraZeneca    Arrival of first shipment of 12,000 Astrazeneca vaccines on 25th May 2021    On Tuesday, 25 May, Kiribati received 12,000 doses of the AstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccine from the global COVAX facility. Another 12,000 batches of doses of the AstraZeneca vaccine is expected to arrive in the country within a month.    • These initial batches of vaccinations are catered only for 20% of the population covering essential and frontline workers as well as the most vulnerable, like elders and those with medical conditions.    However, the rollout of the recently arrived vaccinations started Wednesday, 26 May with Dr. Tabutoa Eria, championing the vaccination program by being the first person in the country to get vaccinated.    • An official government launch of the COVID-19 vaccine will be held at the end of this week (Friday, 28 May) at the Parliament premises in Ambo.    • In an interview with Radio New Zealand earlier this month, Health Minister Dr. Itinteang said the Kiribati government has also secured 10,000 doses of Sinopharm, due to arrive in the country at the next available flight.    Unable to archive link  https://www.facebook.com/humanofkiribati/posts/2935495383390632?__tn__=K-R
notes_C3: Restrictions were put in place in May following 2 confirmed cases of Covid aboard a fishing vessel.  The sailors were quarantined aboard a ship.  No further announcements have been found and the official Government Covid-19 page indicates that the country is at Level 1 state of preparedness which is described as "Business as normal".  It is therefore assumed that the restrictive measures have been lifted, although the precise dates are not known.    http://archive.today/2021.06.14-175510/https://covid19.gov.ki/docroot/
notes_C8: IMF: "borders have been closed on March 21, except for delivery of essential goods (quarantine requirements apply at all ports). "  https://web.archive.org/web/20200501002338/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19#K
notes_C4: Restrictions were put in place in May following 2 confirmed cases of Covid aboard a fishing vessel.  The sailors were quarantined aboard a ship.  No further announcements have been found and the official Government Covid-19 page indicates that the country is at Level 1 state of preparedness which is described as "Business as normal".  It is therefore assumed that the restrictive measures have been lifted, although the precise dates are not known.    http://archive.today/2021.06.14-175510/https://covid19.gov.ki/docroot/
notes_C6: Restrictions were put in place in May following 2 confirmed cases of Covid aboard a fishing vessel.  The sailors were quarantined aboard a ship.  No further announcements have been found and the official Government Covid-19 page indicates that the country is at Level 1 state of preparedness which is described as "Business as normal".  It is therefore assumed that the restrictive measures have been lifted, although the precise dates are not known.    http://archive.today/2021.06.14-175510/https://covid19.gov.ki/docroot/
notes_H6: From post on Facebook page for Kiribati Newsroom dated 27th May, also re-posted on FB page of Humans of Kiribati    In response to the recent confirmed COVID-19 cases of seafarers,   "Wearing of masks in public places including social distancing will be observed at all times. Personal hygiene such as washing hands with soap will be practiced at all times."  A previous comment in the same piece refers to measures being mainly for South Tarawa and Betio, however it is not clear if this applies also to face masks and so is coded as General.      Not possible to archive this link:  https://www.facebook.com/humanofkiribati/posts/2935495383390632?__tn__=K-R

name: South Korea
notes_H1: http://ncov.mohw.go.kr/en/
notes_E2: On March 17, 2020, the National Assembly Strategy and Finance Committee made an announcement on the “Amendment to the Restriction of Special Taxation Act” to minimize and to overcome the economic impact due to COVID-19.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200618215120/https://www.rsm.global/korea/tax-benefits-due-covid-19-korea  South Korean authorities in March 2020 approved tax relief in an effort to address the impact of the coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200618215233/https://home.kpmg/us/en/home/insights/2020/04/tnf-korea-tax-relief-includes-reduced-rates-temporary-increased-deductions.html
notes_H3: Extensive public information campaign, most notably location tracing apps. The Corona 100m (Co100) app launched on February 11 and, using government data, alerts users when they come within 100 metres of a location visited by an infected person. Coronamap website shows the travel histories of confirmed COVID-19 patients and Coronaita aims to function “like a search engine” for information on coronavirus-hit areas.   https://web.archive.org/web/20200330202823/https://www.smartcitiesworld.net/news/news/south-korea-to-step-up-online-coronavirus-tracking-5109   https://web.archive.org/web/20200330202916/http://www.korea.net/NewsFocus/Society/view?articleId=183129
notes_E1: Quotation: "President Moon Jae-in announced Monday during a meeting with a special task force that the government will pay about $820 to all households except for those in the top 30% income bracket, bringing the total amount to $7.4 billion."  Link: https://www.voanews.com/science-health/coronavirus-outbreak/s-korea-offer-emergency-payments-help-ease-impact-covid-19
notes_C1: ***Recoded from 2G to 1G. Under current restrictions, schools are open with restrictions. With the previous localized closure expired at the end of February, there is no evidence of any closures of any levels.     No change at social distancing level: Level 2 for Greater Seoul, Level 1.5 for non-Greater Seoul  https://archive.is/EnyfJ    In-person class attendance capped at one-third at level 2, two-third at level 1.5     Korean social distancing level: http://web.archive.org/web/20210211130346/http://www.koreaherald.com/view.php?ud=20201106000174
notes_H7: ***Recoded from 2G to 3G     As of Tuesday, seems three groups are being actively vaccinated - 1) key workers, 2) clinically vulnerable, and 3) elderly. See below:     "South Korea’s government on Tuesday began inoculating nearly 300,000 people at care hospitals and nursing homes who are 65 or older and medical workers there as it steps up its vaccination drive.    About 680,000 high-risk healthcare professionals and critically ill people have been vaccinated since the campaign kicked off at the end of February, according to the Korea Disease Control and Prevention Agency (KDCA)."     http://web.archive.org/web/20210328141508if_/https://www.reuters.com/article/us-health-coronavirus-southkorea-idUSKBN2BF02D
notes_C3: No change in level: https://archive.vn/p3b0h
notes_C8: ***Recoded from 3G to 2G. After restrictions lifted on UK from May 6, cannot find any evidence of bans. Flights restricted from India but still ongoing.   https://overseas.mofa.go.kr/gb-en/brd/m_8338/view.do?seq=761404&srchFr=&srchTo=&srchWord=&srchTp=&multi_itm_seq=0&itm_seq_1=0&itm_seq_2=0&company_cd=&company_nm=&page=1     See previous coding notes:   Government stops regular flight to India and only allows non-regular in condition of more than 90% of Korean passengers.    http://web.archive.org/web/20210516133920/https://en.yna.co.kr/view/PYH20210427178000315  Regular flights between South Korea and India were suspended in March last year over coronavirus concerns. Since then, only non-scheduled flights have been operated between the two countries. (Yonhap)  http://web.archive.org/web/20210516134742/https://en.yna.co.kr/view/AEN20210429008300320  Passenger jets bound for Incheon, South Korea's main gateway, from India are required to fill less than 60 percent of their seats, and the proportion of Koreans needs to exceed 90 percent of all passengers.    Measurement on special flight allowance for India continues.  Article reports operation of special flight from India.  https://archive.is/nZNYE
notes_C4: Previous directive of Stage 2.5 in metropolitan areas and Stage 2 in non-metropolitcan areas will be extended for two further weeks until January 17. In addition, measures to ban private gatherings from 5 people will be expanded nationwide and implemented for the two weeks.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210102055818/http://ncov.mohw.go.kr/tcmBoardView.do?brdId=&brdGubun=&dataGubun=&ncvContSeq=362858&contSeq=362858&board_id=&gubun=ALL
notes_C6: The two weeks from September 28 to October 11, when the Chuseok holiday begins, are planned to be set as a special quarantine period for the whole country and strengthen quarantine management in consideration of the high risk aspect. In religious facilities, all religious activities, including worship, mass, and court, should be conducted non-face-to-face, and that all face-to-face meetings, events, and group meals should be refrained.  http://web.archive.org/web/20201003225816/http://ncov.mohw.go.kr/tcmBoardView.do?brdId=&brdGubun=&dataGubun=&ncvContSeq=360146&contSeq=360146&board_id=&gubun=ALL  http://ncov.mohw.go.kr/tcmBoardView.do?brdId=&brdGubun=&dataGubun=&ncvContSeq=359862&contSeq=359862&board_id=&gubun=ALL (link can’t be archived)  [Previous note by coder added to this data point during review process]
notes_H6: Beginning October 13, 2020, face masks are compulsory in public places (public transportation, demonstration sites and in healthcare facilities). Failure to wear an appropriate mask that covers both nose and mouth could result in a fine of up to 100,000 won (approximately $100).   See: https://web.archive.org/web/20210503233246/https://kr.usembassy.gov/022420-covid-19-information/    Also, see: South Korea launches a 30-day grace period for mandatory masks in such spaces starting October 13. A fine of up to 100,000 won ($85.50) will be imposed on people who fail to wear face masks in public spaces and on transportation starting November 13.     Archived web: https://archive.vn/RqYGE    [Recoded from 2G to 3G on 3 May 2021 during review]
notes_H8: Nursing hospitals and nursing facilities will continue to take measures to prevent high-intensity infections, but will conduct non-contact visits from July 1. The Mayor or Province Governor will decide whether or not to allow visitations according to COVID-19 outbreak by region, and the institution operator (quarantine manager) should establish a visit plan to minimize the risk of infection of patients and residents if necessary.  Visitation guidelines are as follows: (1) Visiting is operated by reservation system in advance, and a separate meeting space is provided, and are notified of the visitation rules in advance with quarantine supplies and access list. (2) Visits must be conducted in a separate space or outdoors where a transparent barrier is installed, and direct physical contact or food intake other than indirect contact through vinyl, etc. is restricted.    https://archive.vn/DomUW#selection-2359.0-2367.248

name: Kuwait
notes_H1: From 18 Feb, the government has ramped up its public information activities in a coordinated manner.  On 18 Feb, the Ministry of Health allocated a hotline for citizens to answer any queries. A protocol of cooperation between Kuwait National Guard and Ministry of Health media office was activated on the same day to enhance awareness of the National Guard.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200504120433/http://www.arabtimesonline.com/news/hotline-allocated-to-answer-inquiries-on-coronavirus/  On 12 March, the government launched a website with all the latest updates and information.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200504120229/https://www.kuna.net.kw/ArticleDetails.aspx?id=2877656&Language=en  The Kuwait Ministry of Health has also been also providing regular updates in Arabic and English on its Twitter feed.
notes_H2: 'The Ministry of Health is randomly testing citizens and residents daily as part of its measures to curb COVID-19. Detailed instructions will be sent to those selected for a COVID swab via text message.'    https://web.archive.org/web/20201013195918/https://kw.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C7: Movement Restrictions:    Is a curfew in place? No.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210515162115/https://kw.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_E2: No change  https://web.archive.org/web/20210515164511/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19
notes_C2: As of May 23, restaurants and cafes are permitted to re-open seating areas for dine-in, with adherence to health regulations.  Commercial businesses are permitted to open from 5:00AM to 8:00PM  https://archive.is/s5vwQ
notes_H3: /web/20200409143715/https://twitter.com/KUWAIT_MOH/status/1236360623921008647  Screening to all people in contact with travelers.
notes_E1: "3. Establishing a mechanism to secure the minimum income that ensures facing the cost of living for workers affected by the current crisis and linked to contracts    4. Support the salaries of those under Chapter 5 in social Security in the affected sectors.    5. Assist owners of small, medium, industrial and agricultural projects by postponing the installments funded by the National Fund for Small and Medium Enterprises Development and the agricultural finance portfolio in the Industrial Park    6. Providing loans on concessional and long term to small and medium enterprises, through joint financing from local banks and the National Fund for Small and Medium Enterprise (SME) Development"  https://web.archive.org/web/20200501022530/https://www.kuna.net.kw/ArticleDetails.aspx?id=2882522&Language=en
notes_C1: On Feb 26, the Ministry of Education announced universities and schools would be suspended for a period of 2 weeks starting 01 March. /web/20200409075927/https://twitter.com/MOEKUWAIT/status/1232659575565885447  Kuwait has further extended the closure of schools and universities, with the latest update on 20 March when the government announced suspension until August 4.  Education Minister Saud Al-Harbi said the decision applies to public and private schools, and that teachers will be paid with full salaries in the duration of the suspension.  The minister said the next school year will begin in December 2020."    https://web.archive.org/web/20200426194131/https://www.arabnews.com/node/1644186/middle-east
notes_H7: KUWAIT CITY, May 9 (Xinhua) -- Kuwait launched on Sunday the second phase of the COVID-19 field vaccination campaign that provides vaccines for workers of shopping malls in the country.    In the first phase of the field vaccination campaign, more than 34,758 employees who have direct contact with the public have received vaccine through this service, he explained, noting they are from several bodies such as cooperative societies, mosques, banking sector, food factories, cinemas and others. When Kuwait’s vaccination registration site went live in December, authorities declared that health-care workers, older adults and those with underlying conditions would be first in line.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210515165452/http://www.xinhuanet.com/english/2021-05/09/c_139934430.htm    https://web.archive.org/web/20210525023812/https://www.newindianexpress.com/world/2021/apr/04/expats-struggle-to-get-coronavirusvaccines-in-kuwait-citizens-come-first-2285668.html
notes_C3: https://gulfbusiness.com/kuwait-begins-phased-plan-to-reopen-economy-over-a-million-expats-remain-in-lockdown/ mosques reopen but Friday prayers are not allowed. Public events remained cancelled
notes_C8: The Government of Kuwait has extended the ban on entry for non-Kuwaiti citizens until further notice. There are exceptions available for first-degree relatives of Kuwaiti citizens and domestic employees traveling with them. Details can be found at corona.e.gov.kw. Starting May 22, Kuwaiti citizens, first-degree relatives of Kuwaiti citizens, and domestic employees traveling with them are not permitted to travel from Kuwait unless they are fully vaccinated.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210515162115/https://kw.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C4: Kuwait reopens mosques after months of coronavirus closure.  http://archive.fo/muGeK
notes_C6: Movement Restrictions:    Is a curfew in place? No.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210515162115/https://kw.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_H6: 18th May 2020, Kuwait imposes mandatory wearing of masks in public, the country’s health ministry has revealed those who fail to adhere to the strict guidelines could be looking at up to three months in prison or be hit with fines of up to $16,200 (5,000 dinars).    https://web.archive.org/web/20200915055927/https://www.arabianbusiness.com/culture-society/446880-kuwait-imposes-mandatory-wearing-of-masks-in-public
notes_H8: no details found on elderly protections
notes_C5: Is public transportation operating? Yes.  Taxis are operating (no more than two passengers).    https://web.archive.org/web/20210515162115/https://kw.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/

name: Laos
notes_H1: The Prime Minister Exective order mentions about public awareness  through departments and official media. The Exective order implementation is from 30th March.  http://web.archive.org/web/20200618220009/https://www.norway.no/en/vietnam/norway-vietnam/news-and-events/order-of-laos-prime-minister//
notes_H2: The WHO report shows that the testing capacity is enhanced. Tests are being conducted everyday and there are no reports of laboratory or case reporting backlogs.   https://web.archive.org/save/https://www.who.int/laos/internal-publications-detail/covid-19-situation-report-for-lao-pdr-12-21---27-august-2020
notes_C7: Land and air transportation may resume between capital Vientiane and other provinces across the country for passengers who have been fully vaccinated with two doses of vaccine without a requirement of 14 days quarantine.  http://web.archive.org/web/20210621172559/https://www.thestar.com.my/aseanplus/aseanplus-news/2021/06/20/laos-extends-lockdown-measures-for-another-15-days
notes_E2: Recent mitigation policies include income tax exemption for both civil servants and employees of private sector with income less than 5 million kip per month for three months; profit tax exemption for microenterprises with annual income between 50-400 million kip for three months; duty fee exemption for imports of goods to be used towards the outbreak; deferring tax collection from tourism related businesses for three months; postponing mandatory contribution to social security by affected businesses for three months and extending the submission of the 2019 financial report (annual tax filing) by two months and road tax payment by three months.    Measures include, establishing a separate task force to address the economic impact of COVID-19. A new electricity tariff, to ensure supply of electricity, in effect from May 1, 2020 through December 31, 2025, is in place.     https://archive.vn/SIeH1
notes_C2: Laos has extended its lockdown Covid-19 prevention measures across the country for a further 15 days as the community spread of coronavirus in the capital continues.    Given the situation in neighboring countries and community spread in Lao capital Vientiane, the lockdown order would be extended until July 4, according to a notice issued by the Prime Minister's Office on Saturday.  Shopping malls, retail shops, supermarkets, minimarts, and fresh markets that comply with Covid-19 prevention measures may remain open.  Restaurants may continue to provide dine-in services in green zones, but must strictly comply with all Covid-19 prevention measures.  Outdoor exercise and non-contact sporting activities are permitted.  http://web.archive.org/web/20210621172559/https://www.thestar.com.my/aseanplus/aseanplus-news/2021/06/20/laos-extends-lockdown-measures-for-another-15-days
notes_H3: Appears to be comprehensive: https://web.archive.org/web/20200619232042/https://laotiantimes.com/2020/04/12/laos-confirms-19th-case-of-covid-19-infection/ http://web.archive.org/web/20200619232100/https://www.who.int/news-room/feature-stories/detail/support-for-lao-pdr-s-response-to-covid-19
notes_E1: Income tax exemptions, and income substitution - "The government agreed to compensate 60 percent of workers’ salary, who participated in the Social Security Scheme, and had their work suspended during May and June 2020."  https://web.archive.org/web/20210531112004/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19
notes_C1: On May 20, the Government of Lao PDR extended the previously announced lockdown through Friday, June 4.  All previously announced restrictions remain in place (see our April 21 MASCOT message).    https://archive.vn/msqHc#selection-2559.0-2563.10  Public schools will re-open for some grade levels;  https://archive.vn/Wl7WL
notes_H7: A, B, C:   The Ministry of Health is inviting members of the public for COVID-19 vaccination.  People in these groups will be given priority to get vaccines.  Healthcare workers Those at high risk of acquiring and transmitting infection including medical staff from the Ministry of Health, Ministry of Defense, Ministry of Public Security, laboratory staff, pharmacists, village health volunteers, health workers at private health facilities and medical students.  Older adults (=60 years old) People aged 60 years or above. The risk for severe illness and death from COVID-19 substantially increases with age, with older adults at highest risk.  People with underlying health conditions Those with underlying health conditions including lung or heart disease, diabetes, obesity, conditions that affect the immune system, and others.  Essential workers This group includes workers considered essential for maintaining the economy and providing services such as border control officers, security forces, teachers, civil servants, judges, transport, logistics, energy, mining, utilities, finance, communications, customs, and others.  Essential travelers Those currently in Lao PDR at risk of acquiring infection outside the home country and reintroducing infection upon return to home country. This group includes migrant workers, international students, business people, diplomats, international organizations, aid workers, and others.  https://archive.vn/PppkB  AstraZenac, Sinopharm, Pfizer   https://archive.vn/xW7J4
notes_C3: Meetings or gatherings of more than 10 people are prohibited, according to the notice  The Lao government has decided to extend the current nationwide lockdown to June 4 as COVID-19 cases in the Southeast Asian country continued to surge.  The Lao government will extend the lockdown for 15 days until June 4 as the COVID-19 situation in the country is not yet fully under control, according to a notice issued by the Prime Minister's Office on Thursday.  http://web.archive.org/web/20210524161019/http://www.xinhuanet.com/english/asiapacific/2021-05/20/c_139958697.htm
notes_C8: Are health screening procedures in place at airports and other ports of entry?  All travelers will be screened for COVID-19 at the airport on arrival and before departing Laos. There may be fees for each test, up to 1.2 million Lao Kip (approximately $130), depending on your visa class.   All entrants will be subject to COVID-19 testing and a 14-day self-quarantine requirement at a designated facility or hotel at their own expense.    https://archive.vn/msqHc#selection-2201.44-2203.1
notes_C4: Gatherings of no more than 20 people permitted.   https://web.archive.org/web/20210531195710/https://la.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C6: Laos has extended its lockdown Covid-19 prevention measures across the country for a further 15 days as the community spread of coronavirus in the capital continues.    Given the situation in neighboring countries and community spread in Lao capital Vientiane, the lockdown order would be extended until July 4  The notice outlines a gradual loosening of lockdown measures with certain strict measures to remain in place.  Shopping malls, retail shops, supermarkets, minimarts, and fresh markets that comply with Covid-19 prevention measures may remain open.  Outdoor exercise and non-contact sporting activities are permitted.  Restaurants may continue to provide dine-in services in green zones, but must strictly comply with all Covid-19 prevention measures.  http://web.archive.org/web/20210621172559/https://www.thestar.com.my/aseanplus/aseanplus-news/2021/06/20/laos-extends-lockdown-measures-for-another-15-days
notes_H6: Wearing masks required, per the below link.   https://web.archive.org/web/20210531195710/https://la.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_H8: Aside from vaccinations, there is no evidence of measures designed specifically with elderly people in mind, barring the generalised measures.   https://web.archive.org/web/20210531195710/https://la.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C5: Land and air transportation may resume between capital Vientiane and other provinces across the country for passengers who have been fully vaccinated with two doses of vaccine without a requirement of 14 days quarantine.  http://web.archive.org/web/20210621172559/https://www.thestar.com.my/aseanplus/aseanplus-news/2021/06/20/laos-extends-lockdown-measures-for-another-15-days

name: Lebanon
notes_H1: I could not find a specific date for an official public campaign beginning, but given that on Mar 6 the Health Minister stated "Lebanon is no longer in Coronavirus containment stage", and that on the same day the first domestic restrictions got into place, this seems like the proper time point.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200504213031/https://www.lbcgroup.tv/news/d/news-bulletin-reports/505703/health-minister-hassan-lebanon-is-no-longer-in-cor/en
notes_H2: Lebanon has a mixed approach to testing with symptomatic and eligible ppl able to access testing + population level random testing of ppl without symptoms or eligibility to attempt to estimate the population level of infection.     /web/20200608224645/https://www.executive-magazine.com/economics-policy/healthcare/coronavirus/testing-for-covid-19-in-lebanon On April 20, the Ministry of Public Health began population screening or what they called “random testing” (though it is not so random, see below) in different areas of Lebanon. "
notes_C7: From 21st August 2020, Lebanon has reinstated a nationwide curfew from 1800-0600 daily, during which internal movement will also be restricted (with the exception of travelling to and from the airport).   https://web.archive.org/web/20200826165912/https://lb.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_E2: """The ministry of finance announced the extension of all deadlines related to payment of taxes and fees""  ""Lebanon has also reportedly announced a general suspension of tax obligation deadlines with effect from 25 March 2020 until the end of the COVID-19 lockdown.""  https://web.archive.org/web/20210620190404/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19    https://web.archive.org/web/20210620192822/https://www.orbitax.com/news/archive.php/Lebanon-Providing-Tax-and-Soci-41885"
notes_C2: From 21st August 2020, malls, gyms and restaurants will be closed, although restaurants will be permitted to make deliveries 0600-1800. Grocery stores will be allowed to operate from 0600-1700.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200826165912/https://lb.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_H3: https://web.archive.org/save/https://www.middleeastmonitor.com/20200221-lebanon-confirms-first-case-of-coronavirus-2-more-suspected/
notes_C1: Schools are open since 21 April with a blend of face-to-face teaching and online learning.     Source:  https://web.archive.org/web/20210510084722/https://www.zawya.com/mena/en/life/story/Schools_in_Lebanon_reopen_after_threemonth_closure-SNG_208748397/
notes_H7: "A,B,C: Pfizer, AstraZeneca, Sputnik  The government launched a ""Pfizer Marathon"" vaccination campaign targeting individuals 55 years and older to receive the vaccine. On June 13, the Ministry of Public Healthannounced that the age requirement was lowered to individuals  53 and older to register for the vaccine through the vaccination event.  ""Pfizer and AstraZeneca are available through the Ministry of Public Health and Sputnik is available through the private sector.""  https://web.archive.org/web/20210621003308/http://www.dailystar.com.lb/News/Lebanon-News/2021/Jun-12/520906-lebanon-enjoys-strong-turnout-at-pfizer-vaccine-marathon.ashx    https://web.archive.org/web/20210621003103/https://www.facebook.com/mophleb/photos/a.1626551607654504/2629497367359918/      https://web.archive.org/web/20210620162345/https://lb.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/"
notes_C3: From 21st August, all public events are banned.  2020https://web.archive.org/web/20200826165912/https://lb.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C8: """If you’re travelling to Lebanon, you are required to take a PCR test at a laboratory certified by local authorities 96 hours before you travel, and to show the result at check-in at your departure airport. Children under 12 are exempt from this requirement. The government has announced that you are exempt from this requirement if you have received both doses of the COVID-19 vaccine more than 15 days prior to your departure to Lebanon.""  ""From 1 June, all travellers from the UK and Brazil to Lebanon will be subject to supplementary COVID-19 measures in addition to the ones already in place. Hotel quarantine: Passengers must have a hotel booking for 5 days/4 nights on arrival in a government-approved hotel where they must complete 5 days of quarantine before taking a PCR test. A hotel booking is required to board the plane. The current list of approved hotels is below. You should contact the Lebanese embassy for more information.""  https://web.archive.org/web/20210620185114/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/lebanon/entry-requirements
notes_C4: From 21 May, the Ministry of Public Health announced that "all events (weddings, conferences, exhibitions) within open spaces [are allowed] provided that the number of attendees does not exceed 100 people and 50% of its capacity" - https://web.archive.org/web/20210610042359/http://drm.pcm.gov.lb/Media/News/%D8%AA%D9%88%D8%B5%D9%8A%D8%A7%D8%AA-21-5-2021-%281%29.PDF
notes_C6: The nightly curfew from 9.30p to 5am remains in place. "Customers must obtain permission from the Government of Lebanon’s IMPACT platform to enter supermarkets, places of worship, and other crowded places." - https://web.archive.org/web/20210526051038/https://lb.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_H6: Fabric masks covering the mouth and nose must be worn when outside the home and in vehicles (unless travelling alone, or exercising).    Masks are required outdoors in all public spaces.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201114121008/https://lb.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/    https://web.archive.org/web/20201114120947/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/lebanon/coronavirus
notes_H8: Regarding to C6 the strict stay at home requirements also include the elderly.    Nightly curfew ( 20:00-05:00) remains in effect until further notice.    https://archive.vn/xhXtt    Lebanon has announced a total lockdown between April 3 and April 6 for Easter to prevent gatherings and avoid super spreader events.    https://archive.vn/ERx9A  https://archive.vn/1mTwR    During the month of Ramadan, from Monday 12 April to Wednesday 12 May, there is a nation-wide curfew in place between 9.30pm and 5am.  https://archive.vn/NF974  https://archive.vn/vZ6kC
notes_C5: Public transportation is operating at limited capacity. Starting April 12, there will be a curfew in place from 7:00 p.m. to 5:00 a.m  https://archive.vn/yMaT0    Public transportation has resumed operating nationwide, albeit with social distancing measures and passenger limits in place. As of April 12, a 21:30-05:00 nightly curfew is in effect for the duration of Ramadan.  https://archive.vn/vZ6kC

name: Liberia
notes_H1: https://web.archive.org/web/20210209010112/https://www.facebook.com/LiberiaMOE/posts/2893171400953833
notes_H2: "For all non-travelers, sample collection is free."  https://web.archive.org/web/20210111202132/http://moh.gov.lr/
notes_C7: The Revised Declaration (July 23rd)  (See C2 note for additional context) does not have any restrictions on internal movement. [1] Nor is there any reference to internal movement restrictions on the Ministry of Health website [2] or any proclamations from the President since the state of emergency expired on July 21st, 2020.     [1] https://web.archive.org/web/20210104065732/http://moh.gov.lr/press-release/2020/revised-covid-19-declaration-of-national-health-emergency-by-the-ministry-of-health/  [2] https://web.archive.org/web/20210104203113/http://moh.gov.lr/
notes_C2: State of emergency extended for 2 more weeks. The President said restaurants, stores selling food commodities, dry goods, building materials and electronic appliances, will be allowed to open, provided they take in 25% of their full occupancy at a time while observing social distancing.    https://web.archive.org/web/20200603170556/https://www.liberianobserver.com/news/compulsory-covid-19-testing-for-curfew-violators/     https://web.archive.org/web/20200603171219/https://www.liberianobserver.com/news/state-of-emergency-extended-for-yet-another-two-weeks/
notes_H3: "Liberia, hard hit by the Ebola epidemic in 2014, was one of the first countries to start screening for Covid-19 at airports and to adopt other control measures, such as rapid testing, complete contact tracing and quarantine."    https://web.archive.org/web/20210111204228/https://www.wsj.com/articles/which-countries-have-responded-best-to-covid-19-11609516800
notes_E1: For example, stimulus package that includes disbursement to private school teachers. See https://moe-liberia.org/ministry-of-education-continues-disbursement-of-stimulus-package-to-private-school-teachers/ [web archive unavailable]
notes_C1: According to the IMF, schools in Liberia have reopened since January 4, 2021.   https://web.archive.org/web/20210312173955/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19
notes_H7: Liberia has received 96,000 AstraZeneca vaccines via the COVAX initiative. A national COVID-19 vaccination campaign has commenced with three priority phases.    Phase 1: legislators; executive staff; judges; diplomatic missions; UN staff; traditional leaders; religious leaders; marketeers; healthcare workers.    Phase 2: people aged over 60 or with co-morbidities.    Phase 3: others, including teachers, military, immigration, police, hospitality sector, journalists. Foreign residents are eligible for vaccination.    The Ministry of Health has identified eight healthcare facilities in Monrovia where the vaccine will be administered: John F Kennedy Medical Center; Redemption Hospital; JDJ Memorial Hospital; 14 Military Hospital; St. Joseph’s Catholic Hospital; ELWA Hospital; SOS Clinic; and the UN Clinic. Mobile vaccine clinics are also available on request for groups of over 50 individuals.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210607202725/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/liberia/coronavirus    https://web.archive.org/web/*/https://www.unicef.org/liberia/press-releases/ministry-health-starts-vaccination-campaign-against-covid19-0    http://web.archive.org/web/20210517214344/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/liberia/coronavirus
notes_C3: Still in place.    SPORTING EVENTS, WEDDINGS, AND FUNERALS ARE ALLOWED PROVIDED PERSONS IN ATTENDENCE FOLLOW THE HEALTH PROTOCOLS LISTED IN COUNT 1 ABOVE.    http://web.archive.org/web/20201018192601/https://m.facebook.com/story.php?story_fbid=1026786474444887&id=699881103802094
notes_C8: A negative COVID-19 test (PCR and/or serology) isn’t required to enter the country. Health screening procedures are conducted at airports. Travellers will be tested for COVID-19 upon arrival at the traveller’s expense (75 $). Incoming travellers will have a mandatory temperature check. All passengers are required to wear a face mask and wash their hands.   Travellers who test positive for COVID-19 upon arrival will undergo treatment based on Liberia’s case management guidelines.  Travellers who test negative should self-quarantine for seven days and monitor their symptoms for a period of 14 days, beginning the day after arrival in Liberia.     https://web.archive.org/web/*/https://lr.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C4: LARGE GATHERINGS INCLUDING PARTIES OF MORE THAN 10 PEOPLE, SPORTING EVENTS, WEDDINGS, AND FUNERALS ARE ALLOWED PROVIDED PERSONS IN ATTENDENCE FOLLOW THE HEALTH PROTOCOLS LISTED IN COUNT 1 ABOVE.    http://web.archive.org/web/20201018192601/https://m.facebook.com/story.php?story_fbid=1026786474444887&id=699881103802094
notes_C6: The Revised Declaration (July 23rd)  (See C2 note for additional context) specifies that people must stay home when sick, but does not recommend the general public stay home. [1] Additionally, the ministry of health website does not include healthy people staying home as a recommendation to prevent catching COVID-19. [2]    [1] https://web.archive.org/web/20210104065732/http://moh.gov.lr/press-release/2020/revised-covid-19-declaration-of-national-health-emergency-by-the-ministry-of-health/  [2] https://web.archive.org/web/20210104203113/http://moh.gov.lr/
notes_H6: On April 24, on the advice of health professionals, the president extended the stay-at-home order’s application period and geography (to all 15 counties in the country). During this time, residents may leave their homes only to procure food or health items, an activity limited to one person per household for a maximum of one hour, so long as the person does not venture out of his or her local area. Anyone in public must wear a face-mask. See: https://blogs.loc.gov/law/2020/05/liberia-government-measures-to-contain-the-spread-of-covid-19/ (accessed 14th September 2020, web archive unavailable)
notes_H8: When the state of emergency expired on July 21st, restrictions on movement and any stay at home restrictions were lifted.     https://web.archive.org/web/20210104202802/https://www.emansion.gov.lr/2press.php?news_id=5178&related=7&pg=sp
notes_C5: 17th March    To ensure public safety, the Ministry of Transport and LNP have agreed that the full enforcement of the preventive measures shall commence effective on March 17, 2020.    Public Transport- taxis should carry no more than two passengers in the back and one in the front. motorbike/pempem should carry only one passenger.      https://web.archive.org/web/20200603180000/https://www.liberianobserver.com/news/mot-announces-preventive-measures-for-public-transport/    https://web.archive.org/web/20200603175325/https://emansion.gov.lr/doc/COVID-19%20Declaration%20of%20National%20Health%20Emergency%20-%20MoH.pdf

name: Libya
notes_H1: Authorities continue to conduct awareness campaigns on media, social media, public spaces, or elsewhere around hygiene methods, social distancing, of other measures.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210419125348/https://reliefweb.int/report/libya/libya-health-sector-bulletin-march-2021    For the latest information and advice for travel to Libya with regards to COVID-19, please visit Libya’s National Centre of Disease Control (NCDC) webpage at https://ncdc.org.ly/Ar/  https://web.archive.org/web/20210318005810/https://ly.usembassy.gov/u-s-citizen-services/covid-19-information/

notes_C2: Restaurants and cafes are allowed to reopen, however people are not allowed to dine inside. Barbershops, and non-essential businesses are closed until further notice. Public parks and meat markets are closed until further notice.     https://web.archive.org/web/20210118125325if_/https://visalist.io/emergency/lockdown/libya-country
notes_H3: Coding change as I am unable to find any contract tracing info for Libra. Prior notes from coders refers to testing labs and not contact tracing
notes_C1: Schools are fully open with precautionary measures in place.    https://archive.vn/WgxZH
notes_H7: A,B,C:   Libya kicked off its coronavirus vaccine drive in the capital Tripoli on Saturday.    At some health centres, there were queues of people waiting for their shots.    Some 430 centres have been approved across the country.    Priority for the vaccines has been given to the elderly (C) and those with health conditions (B) and health care workers (A).    Libya is using a mix of vaccines, such as Russia's Sputnik jab, the Oxford-AstraZeneca and the Chinese Sinopharm vaccine.    Those over 70 would get the AstraZeneca jab while the Russian Sputnik V vaccine would be administered to medical personnel and those aged 50-60, the National Centre for Disease Control said.    A total of 400,000 doses have arrived in Libya so far.    Some of those vaccines have come through the global Covax programme.    The vaccines are currently stored in medical supply stores, with plans to distribute them across the country imminently.    The government has urged people to register for the jab.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210510101746/https://www.africanews.com/2021/04/18/libya-kickstarts-coronavirus-vaccine-drive/
notes_C3: Public, cultural, sports and social events are banned.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201108112323if_/https://visalist.io/emergency/lockdown/libya-country
notes_C8: All Libya's air and sea borders are closed.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210329040943/https://www.tripsguard.com/destination/libya/
notes_C4: The Libyan Presidential Council of the Government of National Accord (GNA) has announced a curfew across Libya starting March 22 from 6.00 p.m. to 6.00 a.m. over concerns about Coronavirus possible outbreak. "All mosques, education institutions, cafes, restaurants, wedding halls, parks, clubs and shops will be closed and funerals and weddings as well as public transports will be banned."   http://archive.vn/xQyIN
notes_C6: Lockdown is indefinitely in Libya. A curfew is in place in Eastern Libya, between 17:00 and 7:00.  Non-essential attractions in most of Libya are closed.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210419123022if_/https://visalist.io/emergency/lockdown/libya-country  https://web.archive.org/web/20210329040943/https://www.tripsguard.com/destination/libya/
notes_H6: Face masks are required in all public spaces, to include all forms of public transportation.    Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20210531190014/https://ly.usembassy.gov/u-s-citizen-services/covid-19-information/
notes_H8: See C6.
notes_C5: Public transportation in Libya is operating but limited.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210329040943/https://www.tripsguard.com/destination/libya/

name: Liechtenstein
notes_H1: Hygiene measures are a must for everyone Strict adherence to the hygiene rules is still the best measure against a possible contagion in the unavoidable social contacts. The hands are  Wash thoroughly with soap, avoid shaking hands and kissing people and all you have to do is cough or sneeze into a handkerchief or the crook of your arm. People who have a fever and cough should stay at home.    Appeal to the population    The government appeals to all residents of the country who Government action with common sense and the greatest discipline implement. In case of doubt, the principle of caution should be applied. The government is aware of the fact that some of these measures have far-reaching consequences. But it is a question of solidarity with the elderly Generation and those with certain pre-existing conditions that we all share get together and cope with the tasks ahead of us together.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210110095401/https://www.regierung.li/media/attachments/120-corona-massnahmen-verschaerft-0316.pdf?t=637203447788083667
notes_H2: From March 15, testing in Switzerland and Liechtenstein is generally available for no cost to all citizens. Asymptomatic citizens may get tested for free.  source: https://archive.vn/JdsJJ  *note that according to the U.S. embassy, policies in place in Switzerland also apply to Liechtenstein
notes_C7: No new policy measures  http://web.archive.org/web/20210510093132/https://www.bag.admin.ch/bag/en/home/krankheiten/ausbrueche-epidemien-pandemien/aktuelle-ausbrueche-epidemien/novel-cov/empfehlungen-fuer-reisende/liste.html
notes_E2: http://web.archive.org/web/20210506145823/https://www.liechtensteinusa.org/article/measures-taken-in-liechtenstein-in-response-to-the-coronavirus-pandemic
notes_C2: On November 10, in light of rising levels of COVID-19 infections, the Liechtenstein Government extended measures taken in October to mitigate the spread of the virus through November 29.   - This included measures implemented on October 21 and 24, respectively that the wearing of masks are required inside all public buildings and the temporary closing of restaurants, bars and night clubs.     https://web.archive.org/web/20210501200344/https://www.regierung.li/files/attachments/588-corona-regierung-schliesst-gastronomie-1023.pdf?t=637555027160559197  https://web.archive.org/web/20210501184909/http://www.liechtensteinusa.org/article/measures-taken-in-liechtenstein-in-response-to-the-coronavirus-pandemic
notes_H3: No new policy change  http://web.archive.org/web/20210506145823/https://www.liechtensteinusa.org/article/measures-taken-in-liechtenstein-in-response-to-the-coronavirus-pandemic
notes_E1: http://web.archive.org/web/20210506145823/https://www.liechtensteinusa.org/article/measures-taken-in-liechtenstein-in-response-to-the-coronavirus-pandemic
notes_C1: Schools are scheduled to start slowly transitioning back from distance learning starting 11 May, with regular classes resuming on 18 May.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210315080200/http://www.liechtensteinusa.org/article/measures-taken-in-liechtenstein-in-response-to-the-coronavirus-pandemic
notes_H7: No new changes in policy measures  http://web.archive.org/web/20210510093149/https://ch.usembassy.gov/covid-19-info/
notes_C3: Beginning March 1, public events of up to 10 people will be allowed, but no food or drink are allowed to be served.     https://web.archive.org/web/20210315080200/http://www.liechtensteinusa.org/article/measures-taken-in-liechtenstein-in-response-to-the-coronavirus-pandemic
notes_C8: Due to Liechtenstein's customs union with Switzerland, Swiss pandemic laws, in most cases, apply to Liechtenstein.
