Incoming air travellers are required to:  •	Wear a mask.  •	Complete a form with contact information, travel history and health symptoms.   •	Present a negative COVID-19 test dated no more than seven days prior to arrival in Mali.  •	Any passenger who arrives without a negative COVID-19 test result or with a COVID-19 test result dated more than seven days before arrival will have their travel documents retained by airport officials and will be subjected to testing. Travelers must self-quarantine at home or at a hotel at their expense until the test result is available.  Anyone suspected of having COVID-19, despite presenting a negative COVID-19 test result, will be subject to testing.  If test results are positive, that person’s travel documents will be retained, and the traveler will be put into isolation at a government of Mali facility.  The travel documents will be returned once the patient is deemed free of COVID-19.  https://web.archive.org/save/https://ml.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C4: "On 25 March 2020, the Government declared a state of health emergency and a curfew from 21h to 5h in the morning which came to complete a set of measures previously adopted including (...) the prohibition, until further notice, of social, sports, cultural and political groups of more than 50 people"    Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200427090758/https://reliefweb.int/report/mali/mali-coronavirus-covid-19-situation-report-no-1-reporting-period-25-march-08-april-2020
notes_C6: "Is a curfew in place? No". However, general restrictions apply.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210308234507/https://ml.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_H6: As of 9th May 2020, Mali's government made mask wearing compulsory in public places.   https://web.archive.org/web/20200903122847/http://north-africa.com/2020/05/mali-ends-curfew-orders-mandatory-wearing-of-facemasks/
notes_H8: https://web.archive.org/web/*/https://covid19-ml.org/mesures-de-protection

name: Malta
notes_H1: on 9th March 2020, Maltese public health authorities set up a helpline, various web sites and an elevated coordinated public campaign.    http://web.archive.org/web/20201217074800/https://www.gov.mt/en/Government/DOI/Press%20Releases/Pages/2020/March/09/PR200435en.aspx
notes_H2: Swabs are generally available, even to asymptomatic or people wishing to swab on their wish.    https://www.independent.com.mt/articles/2020-03-24/local-news/Two-new-swabbing-hubs-to-open-in-Malta-tomorrow-6736221236
notes_C7: As from 10th May 2021, travel to Gozo is permitted once again without any restrictions.
notes_E2: From 13th March 2020, Government introduced, and maintained various narrow debt relief to households, from tax deferments to loan moratoria. This is in place up to at least 2021.    source: http://web.archive.org/web/20201217074334/https://www.gov.mt/en/Government/DOI/Press%20Releases/Pages/2020/March/14/pr200489.aspx  http://web.archive.org/web/20201217074531/https://timesofmalta.com/articles/view/moratorium-on-loan-repayments-to-extend-into-2021.839084
notes_C2: On 7 June 2021, Bars, Kazini, Cinemas and Theaters re-opened after around 7 months of closure. Source:    https://web.archive.org/web/20210608065350/https://timesofmalta.com/articles/view/chris-fearne-and-charmaine-gauci-to-announce-easing-of-covid-19-rules.869914
notes_H3: Maltese authorities prepared for eventual outbreaks from January. In fact, when the first cases popped up in March, comprehensive contact tracing took place for each case.    http://web.archive.org/web/20201217080015/https://www.gov.mt/en/Government/DOI/Press%20Releases/Pages/2020/January/19/pr200063.aspx
notes_E1: A wage supplement is introduced on 18th March 2020. This is committed to be provided at least till March 2021.    http://web.archive.org/web/20201217072939/https://www.gov.mt/en/Government/DOI/Press%20Releases/Pages/2020/March/18/pr200520.aspx
notes_C1: Schools Start to re-open gradually.  Monday, April 12:   • Childcare centres, kindergartens, primary schools reopen   Source:  http://web.archive.org/web/20210409115241/https://timesofmalta.com/articles/view/abela-fearne-gauci-announce-covid-easing-measures-schools.863055
notes_H7: From Monday 17th May, any individuals who are over 16 and willing to take the vaccine may register and receive the vaccine.    Vaccines being administered: Pfizer, Moderna, Astrazeneca, Johnson and Johnson    Source:   https://web.archive.org/web/20210517070939/https://www.maltatoday.com.mt/news/national/109580/people_aged_16_and_over_can_register_for_covid19_vaccine_from_monday
notes_C3: Government reintroduces public event ban    http://web.archive.org/web/20201216100018/https://www.gov.mt/en/Government/DOI/Press%20Releases/Pages/2020/July/31/pr201473.aspx
notes_C8: Although the border closure is now lifted, travel to several countries remain banned throughout. The list of countries that travel is restricted to is very fluid and changes across time.    http://web.archive.org/web/20201217072559/https://timesofmalta.com/articles/view/travel-ban-to-be-lifted-for-regions-in-italy-france-spain-hard-hit-by.801810
notes_C4: Malta restricts gatherings to fewer than 10 people, then to 6.    source: http://web.archive.org/web/20201217065445/https://www.maltatoday.com.mt/news/national/105023/covid19_group_gatherings_in_public_spaces_reduced_to_10_people
notes_C6: Stay at home requirements are removed completely.    http://web.archive.org/web/20201217083045/https://www.gov.mt/en/Government/DOI/Press%20Releases/Pages/2020/June/01/pr201038.aspx
notes_H6: Mask is mandatory as soon as a person leaves home.    source: http://web.archive.org/web/20201217080855/https://www.gov.mt/en/Government/DOI/Press%20Releases/Pages/2020/October/16/pr202014.aspx
notes_H8: Following high vaccination rates among the elderly and those living in LTCF, measures where relaxed, with some protections and rules still in place. Source:    https://web.archive.org/web/20210608064947/https://www.gov.mt/en/Government/DOI/Press%20Releases/Pages/2021/May/11/pr210884.aspx
notes_C5: Public transport operational as per normal, apart from some small requirements such as mask wearing.    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20201217070503/https://www.maltachamber.org.mt/en/malta-public-transport-releases-new-summer-schedule-with-436-additional-trips-per-day

name: Myanmar
notes_H1: On March 9th, the Ministry of Health and Sports launched an awareness campaign and COVID-19 tracking website.     They are:   "-publishing situation reports about Myanmar and other countries in the state-owned newspapers and the internet website of the Ministry (www.mohs.gov.mm) and social media pages (https://www.facebook.com/ MinistryOfHealthAndSportsMyanmar) and (https://www.facebook.com/ MyanmarCDC) , with taking response to the fake news  -coordination with relevant government agencies to lessen socioeconomic impacts resulted from COVID-19.  -awareness programmes with the use of handheld loudspeakers at the crowded places in Regions and States such as bus gates and markets, in cooperation with Myanmar Red Cross Society , civil society organizations and community based organizations."  Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20200604172504/https://www.globalnewlightofmyanmar.com/report-on-coronavirus-disease-2019-covid-19-3/    COVID-19 tracking website: https://web.archive.org/web/20200320234718/https://mohs.gov.mm/Main/content/publication/2019-ncov
notes_H2: Using the new code  - On the Myanmar Ministry of Health and Sports website there is a guideline for healthcare professionals on LFT testing. Version 3 was published on November 11, 2020, it's the item 11 of the list of guidelines. See in Ministry of Health and Sports, archived: https://web.archive.org/web/20210614144138/https://www.mohs.gov.mm/Main/content/publication/2019-ncov
notes_C7: Trains: A limited number of train routes are operating.  Buses: Intra-provincial bus service has restarted but may be limited due to COVID-19 travel restrictions. City buses are limited due to the ongoing civil unrest.  Residents of Yangon Region must abide by the following orders: 1.) stay at home unless going to/from work, 2.) employees of private organizations and businesses must telework (those working in banking and finance, gas stations, food and refrigeration services, production and manufacturing of pharmaceutical products, medical equipment production, and the distribution of drinking water and personal hygiene items are exempt), 3.) only one person per household allowed for grocery shopping, 3.) only two people per household allowed for medical treatment  http://web.archive.org/web/20210517163748/https://mm.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_E2: This seems like it should be coded as 2. For example, according to the IMF, as of October 8 2020, there were measures in place including: exemptions and subsidies of household electricity charges (MMK 109 billion); deferment of income and commercial tax payments due in the second and third quarters of the fiscal year to end of FY 19/20. See https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19  [accessed 19 October 2020, web archive unavailable]
notes_C2: Residents of Yangon Region must abide by the following orders: 1.) stay at home unless going to/from work, 2.) employees of private organizations and businesses must telework (those working in banking and finance, gas stations, food and refrigeration services, production and manufacturing of pharmaceutical products, medical equipment production, and the distribution of drinking water and personal hygiene items are exempt)  http://web.archive.org/web/20210517163748/https://mm.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_H3: http://web.archive.org/web/20210517165547/https://www.who.int/myanmar/emergencies/covid-19-advice-for-the-public/contact-tracing
notes_E1: E1 : updated to 1A from 1F as the relief is being provided to everyone in the "vulnerable" category.    In-kind and cash transfers to the *most vulnerable* population (MMK 325 billion)    Insured Fund for Workers: The Social Security Board, under the Ministry of Labor, Immigration and Population, will pay 40 percent of the salary to insured workers, as a family assistance fund, in accordance with the Social Security Law.  http://web.archive.org/web/20201029172716/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19
notes_C1: The government of Myanmar ordered all schools, including private ones, to close from 26 August. The date for re-opening has not yet been announced  https://web.archive.org/web/20200909015440/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/myanmar/coronavirus
notes_H7: A- Key workers, B- Clinically vulnerable groups  Myanmar receives free first batch of Covid-19, AstraZeneca’s vaccine manufactured by the Serum Institute of India. This is a gift from India to Myanmar  More than 110000 Healthcare workers and volunteers will be vaccinated as part of the initial phase. This will be followed by the government official and the elderly over the age of 65.   https://web.archive.org/save/https://www.deccanherald.com/international/myanmar-receives-first-batch-of-covid-19-vaccines-from-india-942168.html  https://web.archive.org/save/https://www.mmtimes.com/news/40pc-myanmars-population-be-vaccinated-against-covid-19-2021.html
notes_C3: The military regime has instituted a ban on gatherings of five or more people, and a nationwide curfew from 8:00 P.M. until 4:00 A.M. that supersedes previous COVID-19 policies.  http://web.archive.org/web/20210322060444/https://mm.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C8: C8 : updated to 4 from 3 as the land and air borders are closed as per link below.    Effective March 30, the Burmese government will no longer allow international commercial passenger flights to land at any airport in Burma. This suspension will last through November 30  On March 19, the Burmese government announced the temporary suspension of entry and exit of foreign nationals through land borders.  http://web.archive.org/web/20201109171739/https://mm.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C4: The military regime has instituted a ban on gatherings of five or more people, and a nationwide curfew from 8:00 P.M. until 4:00 A.M. that supersedes previous COVID-19 policies.  http://web.archive.org/web/20210322060444/https://mm.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C6: Residents of Yangon Region must abide by the following orders: 1.) stay at home unless going to/from work, 2.) employees of private organizations and businesses must telework (those working in banking and finance, gas stations, food and refrigeration services, production and manufacturing of pharmaceutical products, medical equipment production, and the distribution of drinking water and personal hygiene items are exempt), 3.) only one person per household allowed for grocery shopping, 3.) only two people per household allowed for medical treatment, 4.) a mask must be worn at all times when out of the home, 5.) only vehicles transporting people for one of the permitted activities are allowed to pass through other townships, 6.) in addition to the passenger(s), only one driver is allowed in a vehicle for the permitted activities,  http://web.archive.org/web/20210412175701/https://mm.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_H6: a mask must be worn at all times when out of the home,  http://web.archive.org/web/20210517163748/https://mm.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_H8: More than 380000 people over the age of 65 years has been vaccinated  http://web.archive.org/web/20210412181318/https://www.mmtimes.com/news/more-380000-myanmar-receive-covid-19-vaccine.html
notes_C5: On the 25th of September the Ministry of Health and Sports issued an order effective 26th September that, people residing in 11 townships of the four state and regions are required for “Stay-at-Home” in order to effectively control the spread of the disease.   http://web.archive.org/web/20201006141131/https://www.moi.gov.mm/moi:eng/announcements/1545

name: Mongolia
notes_H2: Are PCR and/or antigen tests available for U.S. citizens in?Mongolia??Yes???  If so, are test results reliably available within 72 hours??Yes??  https://web.archive.org/web/20210426075432/https://mn.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C7: Officials are resuming traffic management using quick-response (QR) codes for private vehicles and taxis; authorization is only possible for people required to work onsite and other exceptions. Residents of the capital must present a negative result from a COVID-19 test taken within the previous 72 hours to leave the city.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210510021011/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/475396/mongolia-officials-plan-to-ease-restrictions-nationwide-from-0600-may-8-update-23

These include: (i) ... and (iv) an increase in credit guarantees to SMEs and soft loans from the development bank to cashmere producers. On April 13, Parliament approved tax exemption measures as proposed by the cabinet.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200723211732/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19  https://web.archive.org/save/https://www.mongolbank.mn/eng/news.aspx?tid=1&id=2489

notes_H3: Mongolia is doing contact tracing through scanning QR codes at public places. Recently, the government has introduced the Exposure Notification System   https://web.archive.org/web/20210426075432/https://mn.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/  https://web.archive.org/web/20210426080044/https://montsame.mn/en/read/260941
notes_E1: No update in policy.   https://web.archive.org/web/20210503033812/https://mn.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/

notes_C3: '[D]ue to a rise in COVID-19 cases the Government of Mongolia has placed the country under lockdown and a “red all-out-readiness” status from 10 to 25 April.' Public events are not allowed during lockdown.    https://archive.vn/79EyE

Unvaccinated travelers returning from foreign?locations are subject to a?seven-day?institutional?quarantine while fully vaccinated travelers are?subject to?a seven-day home?quarantine?upon arrival.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210607064913/https://mn.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/

name: Mozambique
notes_H1: Ongoing communication campaign on the official government website.    http://web.archive.org/web/20210416071544/https://covid19.ins.gov.mz/
notes_H2: Testing policy is not explicitly stated, but limited test kit supply strongly implies that only suspected and eligible cases can be tested. "2,500 testing kits for COVID-19 available, and the government is negotiating with partners on receiving more testing kits, protective and other medical equipment."  https://www.netherlandsworldwide.nl/latest/news/2020/03/20/covid-information-mozambique-for-dutch-nationals (page cannot be archived)
notes_C7: In the Greater Maputo area and all provincial capitals there is a curfew in place from 10 p.m. to 4 a.m. every night.  The curfew also applies in Manhiça, Chokwe, Maxixe, Gondola, Moatize, Mocuba, Nacala, Montepuez, and Massinga.  Is a curfew in place? Yes  But there are no restrictions on intercity travel.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210426165431/https://mz.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C2: Commercial establishments will be open from 9 a.m. – 7 p.m. Monday – Saturday, and 9 a.m. – 6 p.m. on Sunday. Restaurants may remain open until 8 p.m. every day. Recreational and leisure sports and games are prohibited. Casinos, museums, theaters, galleries, and similar cultural venues may open up to 40% capacity. Discos, bars and stalls selling alcoholic beverages will remain closed.      https://web.archive.org/web/20210426165431/https://mz.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/  https://web.archive.org/web/20210426165338/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/466831/mozambique-authorities-maintain-covid-19-restrictions-as-of-april-14-update-13
notes_H3: Contact tracing for the first case in the country: The patient has mild symptoms, is in isolation at home and is undergoing clinical follow-up by the country's health authorities. At this moment, contacts are being tracked for the purposes of monitoring the transmission of the virus. https://web.archive.org/web/20200506214722/http://www.misau.gov.mz/index.php/100-primeiro-caso-de-coronavirus-confirmado-hoje-em-mocambique
notes_C1: From May 17th to May 30th, all schools in the country were open. See in UNESCO website, archived: https://web.archive.org/web/20210530161000/https://en.unesco.org/covid19/educationresponse
notes_H7: Didn't have anything news since 12th May in Ministry of Health's website. On this date, new members of the Ministry of Health were installed. But, the Bulletins Diary published on May 22 with numbers about covid-19. See in Ministry of Health's website, archived:   https://web.archive.org/web/20210530155048/https://covid19.ins.gov.mz/clipping/  https://web.archive.org/web/20210530155845/https://www.misau.gov.mz/index.php/covid-19-boletins-diarios
notes_C3: Gatherings of more than 20 people are banned   https://web.archive.org/web/20200816123245/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/mozambique/coronavirus
notes_C8: "On December 17, President Nyusi announced revised COVID-19 measures effective December 19. These measures include:    - All persons arriving in Mozambique must present a PCR negative test result undertaken in the country of origin up to 96 hours prior to departure;   -Tourist and visitor visas will be re-issued at all operational border posts"    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20201231180619if_/https://www.facebook.com/pg/CanadainMozambique/posts/
notes_C4: The SOPC (State of Public Calamity) will allow for the gradual resumption of the following activities:  - Private social events are permitted with up to 40 attendees  - Religious services are permitted at 50 percent capacity, up to 150 attendees  - Public and private institutions can conduct operations in conformance with social distancing and preventative measures including temperature checks, regular cleaning of facilities, ventilation, prohibition of sick staff entering facilities, and a limit of 40 people for events  Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20201115131525/https://mz.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C6: All persons displaying respiratory symptoms or fever must stay home.    http://web.archive.org/web/20210504121923/https://mz.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_H6: 5th May 2020, the Mozambican government tightened the preventive measures against the Covic-19 pandemic, by making it obligatory to wear face masks in public places and in any gatherings of people.    https://web.archive.org/web/20200901074214/https://clubofmozambique.com/news/mozambique-masks-now-obligatory-in-public-places-aim-report-159431/
notes_H8: All elderly people who is displaying respiratory symptoms or fever must stay home, as noted in C6 column.    http://web.archive.org/web/20210504121923/https://mz.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C5: A Level 3 State of Emergency was announced on April 1, which includes a provision for maximum of 1/3 of passenger capacity for public and private transport. This reflects a substantial reduction in capacity.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200502201909/https://mz.usembassy.gov/travel-alert-mozambique-covid-19-update-and-state-of-emergency-measures-april-6-2020/  ---  Furthermore:  Under the state of emergency declaration on April 1. . .In order to avoid distortions in the scope of the COVID-19 prevention measures in force, the National Institute of Land Transport should clarify the following:    The use of protective masks for the nose and mouth is mandatory in all public and private transport and in crowds of people, in accordance with the preventive measures approved in the Session of the Council of Ministers, of April 8, 2020.    For the application of this measure, public and private transport is understood to mean all remunerated passenger transport activity, whether privately or publicly owned.    Drivers of private vehicles that do not engage in paid passenger transport activities are not covered by the mandatory use of masks.    The National Institute of Land Transport urges all motorists and users of public transport to fully comply with the measures approved by the Government of Mozambique, collaborating with the inspection authorities to prevent the spread of COVID - 19 through the means of transport. (RM)  https://web.archive.org/save/https://www.portaldogoverno.gov.mz/por/Imprensa/Noticias/Covid-19-INATTER-esclarece-uso-de-mascaras-no-sector-dos-transportes

name: Mauritius
notes_H1: Mobile app launched on 26th March: https://web.archive.org/save/https://defimedia.info/besafemoris-une-application-gratuite-pour-des-informations-officielles-sur-le-covid-19

Patients must dial 605-1000 to book an appointment.  Results are available within 48 hours.  Cost of Rs.2500 (approximately $60 USD) must be paid in full by the patient.  Visit Wellkin Hospital’s COVID-19 announcement (French) for additional information.  https://archive.vn/Nd7GC#selection-1845.0-1849.37
notes_C7: Some areas have been declared red zones to limit the propagation of the virus, protect the health of the inhabitants and limit their movements.  http://web.archive.org/web/20210607162003/https://mu.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_E2: On September 7, BOM announced the extension to December 31, 2020 of the moratoriums granted to economic operators (including Small and Medium Enterprises), households and individuals under its COVID-19 Support Program. The terms and conditions of the moratoriums remained unchanged. On December 2, these, together with a number of other measures falling under the Support Program, were further extended to June 30, 2021. https://archive.vn/usdt8#selection-16089.283-16089.420
notes_C2: Per the official announcement graphic in the below article, certain businesses i.e. Beauty Salons, Dentists, are open, but others like gyms, shops, cultural activities, cinemas, schools are all required to remain closed.   https://web.archive.org/web/20210503071444/https://www.lexpress.mu/article/392489/covid-19-deuxieme-phase-deconfinement-partir-1er-mai-jusquau-1er-juin
notes_H3: It seems like contract tracing is comprehensive rather than limited. Since the time the number of cases climbed steadily and reached 128 on 30 March, health services prioritised contact tracing to identify people to test – that is, people who had been in physical contact with infected and identified patients – while anybody who had been quarantined and showed symptoms suggestive of COVID-19 infection was also tested. See: https://web.archive.org/web/20200521205121/https://voxeu.org/article/mauritian-response-covid-19
notes_E1: ii) Employment Support Scheme for SMEs to support 11,000 employees with a monthly payment of Rs10,200 per capita; iii) Recruitment by Landscope (Mtius) Ltd of some 2,000 technically unemployed people for the National Clean-Up Campaign;  https://archive.vn/usdt8#selection-16063.1533-16063.2558
notes_C1: As part of the restrictions, all activities will remain closed except for the police, port, airport, fire services, health, pharmacy, and security services. https://archive.ph/HJ3LX#selection-2605.0-2605.156  Effective March 10, 2021, the government of Mauritius has announced a nation-wide period of confinement until March 25thin response to COVID-19.  Supermarkets, shops, and bakeries will reopen subject to strict sanitary measures, including limited access through an alphabetical order system.  All schools, public places including beaches, shopping centers, and restaurants are closed until March 25th.  International flight arrivals have been suspended; however there are limited commercial departures to certain destinations.  https://archive.ph/7YQj1#selection-1817.72-1821.407
notes_H7: Vaccines are broadly available. Astra Zeneca and Covax.    http://web.archive.org/web/20210613111116if_/https://health.govmu.org/news/SitePages/vaccination.aspx
