Feb 8th: restaurants reopen to serve food with restricted times and public health precautions   Feb 15th: carwashes, tailor shops, non-essential theatres     Other foreseen sates for reopening of gyms, spas, movie theatres etc.     https://web.archive.org/web/20210215162210/https://pa.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_H3: The Ministry of Health reported, on August 29th, that “during this weekend, the regional directorates of the Ministry of Health (MINSA) throughout the country intensified the actions they carry out as part of the traceability work to detect new cases of COVID-19 and their contacts.” Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20200903174431/https://www.yomeinformopma.org/info_detail/189 On September 2nd, The Health Minister, Luis Francisco Sucre, “explained that it [traceability] is an investigation process of where a case starts and where it ends, to cut the chain of transmission of the virus. Once a positive case is found, everyone who was directly in contact with him or her is followed up. In addition to which were the places visited during the last three days and if among these people, we found a second positive case, we repeat the same procedure.” Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20200903165735/http://www.minsa.gob.pa/noticia/comunicado-ndeg-190
notes_E1: “On July 14, the Cabinet approved … (ii) an augmentation in social spending, including payments to affected workers and small business owners through the "Panama Solidarity Plan”. Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20200823141641/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19 The Panama Solidarity Plan includes transfers to formal and informal sector workers. The President of the Republic, Laurentino Cortizo Cohen, announced on Twitter, on the August 4: ““This week 360,978 Panamanians will receive their transfer of the digital voucher #PanamáSolidario. The first transfer is made today and the following on August 5, 6 and 7. #UnPanamáMejor” This includes “recharges to those who have previously received their digital voucher: districts of Arraiján, San Miguelito and Colón, Panamanians with suspended contracts, wallets, artists, trainers of the @InadehOficial, peddlers registered in @panamamunicipality.” Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20200823152111/https://twitter.com/NitoCortizo/status/1290615980280946690?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw%7Ctwcamp%5Etweetembed%7Ctwterm%5E1290615980280946690%7Ctwgr%5E&ref_url=https%3A%2F%2Fpanamapress.com.pa%2Frevisa-si-te-llego-inicia-el-pago-de-panama-solidario-anuncia-el-presidente-cortizo%2F “The Digital Voucher is for an amount of B / .100, which the beneficiaries can cash with their personal identity card in supermarkets or pharmacies to buy food and medicine” Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20200823151541/https://panamapress.com.pa/revisa-si-te-llego-inicia-el-pago-de-panama-solidario-anuncia-el-presidente-cortizo/
notes_C1: Panama City, May 31 (EFE).- A total of 78 schools, of the more than 3,100 in Panama, on Monday began blending in-person and virtual classes after more than a year of being closed due to the coronavirus pandemic  https://web.archive.org/web/20210615072525/https://www.laprensalatina.com/few-schools-reopening-in-panama-after-more-than-a-year-of-covid-lockdown/
notes_H7: A, B, C. Pfizer, Astrazeneca, Sputnik-V, Sinovax.  Over 1 million people have been given their first vaccince dose.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210615005031/https://anpanama.com/11041-Panama-logra-superar-el-millon-de-dosis-aplicadas-de-la-vacuna-contra-COVID-19.note.aspx  https://web.archive.org/web/20210615004134/https://pa.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C3: As of April 19, the public will be allowed to attend outdoor sports activities with a capacity of 25% and without sale of liquor.   https://web.archive.org/web/20210426233442/https://anpanama.com/10925-Panama-levanta-mas-restricciones-a-medida-que-controla-la-pandemia.note.aspx
notes_C8: Extra quarantine requirement from travellers from Latin America, South Africa and the UK.   https://web.archive.org/web/20210510223003/https://www.visitpanama.com/information/travel-guidelines/
notes_C4: all gatherings larger than 50 people banned     https://web.archive.org/web/20210118203235/https://pa.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C6: Targeted movement and stay home restrictions across Panama   https://web.archive.org/web/20210215162210/https://pa.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_H6: “On June 2, the Government of Panama’s Ministry of Health (MINSA) published a resolution stating that anyone leaving their residence must be wearing a mask that covers their nose and mouth. Any individual not wearing a mask is subject to possible detention and fine.” Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20200903161415/https://pa.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/#Movement%20Restrictions
notes_H8: No specific protection, but protection remains in place from national restrictions and curfews   https://web.archive.org/web/20210131143500/https://pa.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C5: Public transportation operation     As of Feb 8th, large group bus trips are not allowed   https://web.archive.org/web/20210215162210/https://pa.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/

name: Peru
notes_H1: The Ministry of Health starts a National Campaign using social media, TV spots, podcasts, radio, and others.    Campaign website: https://web.archive.org/web/20200131160919/https://www.gob.pe/institucion/minsa/campa%C3%B1as/699-protegete-del-coronavirus    Later, when the first case starts, the Government creates a page of daily-updated information on Coronavirus cases in the country  Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200315070841/https://www.gob.pe/coronavirus    Also, during the whole state of Emergency (from March 15), the President addresses the Nation daily at noon to give updates and announce new measures.  Videos from President's messages: https://www.facebook.com/pg/presidenciaperu/videos/ (unable to archive this link)
notes_H2: Peru is able to test for COVID-19 in country. Are available privately and by state hospitals.   Link:  https://web.archive.org/web/20210501171956/https://pe.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C7: Until May 19, the Ministry of Transportation and Communications establishes that transportation between cities can be carried out at all levels with particularities  in capacity (capacity between 50 - 100 %).according to the alert level . In extreme and very high there is also a ban of using private cars on Sundays.   Link:   https://web.archive.org/web/20210501155431/https://www.gob.pe/9862
notes_E2: No update:  /web/20201130215012/https://www.nht.gov.jm/nht-cuts-interest-rates-announces-measures-assist-mortgagors
notes_C2: From May 10 , according to the Peruvian goverment's restrictions to combat COVID-19, commercial have reduced capacity according to the alert level. For area with extreme level commercial establishments close 3 hours before curfew (21:00 - 4:00 am) and for areas with a very high level 2 hours before curfew. Clubs are banned.   Link:  https://web.archive.org/web/20210515030445/https://www.gob.pe/12365-coronavirus-medidas-para-enfrentar-la-pandemia-segun-nivel-de-alerta-y-region/
notes_H3: Health Directive No. 122-MINSA / 2020 / CDC "Health Directive for the Epidemiological Surveillance of Coronavirus Disease (COVID-19) in Peru. Contact tracing is not done for all the persons positive to COVID-19, because not all the people contact to ministery of health.   Link:  https://web.archive.org/web/20210501173049/https://www.gob.pe/institucion/minsa/normas-legales/1322786-905-2020-minsa
notes_E1: 16-March. The government disposes the transfer of around USD110 per family. This is not universalmeant for food expenses of vulnerable families for two weeks. As the State of Emergency has been extended this transfer has been disposed more times (same amount for every two weeks).    The transfer was then extended to some Independent Workers (many of them informal), which do not currently hold contracts.     On April 23, the President announced the same transfer but this time with "inverse targeting", meaning it would give the same amount for "everyone but the people in no need, who are currently receiving a salary". This is meant to reach 75% of the total population.
notes_C1: On April 19, after being closed for almost one year due the pandemic, 14 schools in rural areas of Arequipa region reopened their doors today to offer the educational blended learning mode. Additional, nine regions of the country have planned to return. https://web.archive.org/web/20210422170631/https://www.gob.pe/institucion/minedu/noticias/483589-mas-escuelas-de-nueve-regiones-evaluan-volver-a-clases-presenciales https://web.archive.org/web/20210424044343/https://www.gob.pe/institucion/minedu/noticias/483304-clases-semipresenciales-comienzan-en-14-escuelas-rurales-de-arequipa
notes_H7: A, B, C.   MINSA plans to immunize 22.2 million people, depending on the availability of vaccines and prioritizing the population at risk.  Phase 1  At this stage, it seeks to protect the integrity of the Health System and the continuity of basic services.  Phase 2  At this stage, the aim is to reduce the number of people at risk who can become ill and die.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210405165946/https://www.gob.pe/11796
notes_C3: From 12 March, all public events with 300 to more people are forbidden while the sanitary emergency is still in action (90 days). https://web.archive.org/web/20200401202244/https://busquedas.elperuano.pe/normaslegales/suspenden-otorgamiento-de-garantias-inherentes-al-orden-publ-resolucion-ministerial-n-297-2020-in-1864485-1/
notes_C8: Through Ministerial Resolution No. 335-2021-MTC / 01, from April 16 to April 30, flights from the United Kingdom, Brazil and South Africa or that have made a stopover in these places are banned.  Link:  https://web.archive.org/web/20210501162200/https://www.gob.pe/institucion/mtc/noticias/482662-mtc-extiende-prorroga-de-suspension-en-vuelos-procedentes-de-reino-unido-sudafrica-y-brasil
notes_C4: All social gatherings, including those held in homes with family are prohibited in all of Peru     https://web.archive.org/web/20210104174051/https://pe.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C6: From May 10 to May 30 according to the Peruvian government restrictions, strict mandatory social immobilization is established from 21:00 pm TO 4:00 am for areas with extreme alert and very high alert, high alert areas curfew from 22:00 to 4:00 am.  link:  https://web.archive.org/web/20210515030445/https://www.gob.pe/12365-coronavirus-medidas-para-enfrentar-la-pandemia-segun-nivel-de-alerta-y-region/
notes_H6: Everyone must wear face masks outside of homes, and must additionally wear facial protectors on public transport
notes_H8: The Peruvian Ministry of Health has been recommending that people over 60 years of age avoid crowded places, wash their hands, disinfect surfaces, avoid visits from people with respiratory symptoms, vaccination against pneumococcus.  Link:  https://web.archive.org/web/20210501193556/https://www.gob.pe/8778-cuidados-del-adulto-mayor-frente-al-coronavirus
notes_C5: The Ministry of Transport and Communications recommends taxi drivers that they may carry a maximum of 3 passengers per service. Passengers must cost masks and a face shield, it is also mandatory to have a division between the front and rear seats. In addition, for the use of public transport it is mandatory to keep the windows open, and the use of masks and face shield throughout the trip, in addition to respecting the rules established within trains and buses..  Link:  https://web.archive.org/web/20210501152447/https://www.gob.pe/institucion/mtc/noticias/488019-conoce-como-reducir-el-riesgo-de-contagio-de-la-covid-19-en-el-transporte-publico  https://web.archive.org/web/20210501151542/https://www.gob.pe/institucion/mtc/noticias/489987-si-vas-a-brindar-el-servicio-de-taxi-o-utilizarlo-debes-seguir-estas-recomendaciones

name: Philippines
notes_H1: https://web.archive.org/web/20200504205049/https://drive.google.com/file/d/1_MYCAYdPcKr-JbVxyCBXwBNoRveB6g2B/view
notes_H2: Real-Time Reverse Transcription-Polymerase Chain Reaction (rRT-PCR) and?antigen (rapid) testing?are?readily available throughout the country, including at?Philippine Department of Health (DOH) accredited testing centers.?In general, payment is in cash only prior to testing. Costs vary according to?the test given and the medical facility.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210426190737/https://ph.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C7: There is a curfew in place. "The timing for each curfew is set by the Local Governmental Unit (LGU) and varies by region.  ...  Checkpoints are in place and domestic air travel remains limited. LGUs my request information about your purpose of travel. In general, leisure travel is not permitted at this time."    https://web.archive.org/web/20210119020640/https://ph.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_E2: No current debt or contract relief for households.    The 60-day grace period on loan and credit card payments expired in December 2020.   The grace period on residential rent has expired.       https://web.archive.org/web/20201221224337/https://www.covid19.gov.ph/economic/rent    https://web.archive.org/web/20210303065851/https://www.covid19.gov.ph/static/resources/rent.pdf    https://web.archive.org/web/20210303064609/https://www.officialgazette.gov.ph/downloads/2020/09sep/20200911-RA-11494-RRD.pdf
notes_C2: Created sector category breakouts (1 - 3, other) with further restrictions of protected groups, listed at   https://web.archive.org/web/20210426191024if_/https://www.covid19.gov.ph/economic/establishments. Also noted that different areas are in different levels of quarantine: https://web.archive.org/web/20210426190737/https://ph.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_H3: Announced April 4, during the period of Enhanced Community Quarantine on provinces Bulacan, Cavite, Laguna, Rizal, and highly urbanized cities of the National Capital Region and Pateros municipality, improved contact tracing efforts will be implemented until April 11, 2021. Efforts include increasing capacity through utilization of personnel from the Department of National Defense/Interior and Local Government/Labor and Employment to supplement contact tracing efforts.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210405230551/https://pcoo.gov.ph/wp-content/uploads/2021/04/20210404-Resolution-108A-RRD.pdf
notes_E1: No announcement that the amelioration assistance from the national government during the one-week Enhanced Community Quarantine period has been extended.
notes_C1: No change to previous policy. Classes remain mandatory and are conducted virtually. The Department of Education in South Cotabato has identified 12 schools as of Friday as pilot sites for the face-to-face classes in hopes of resuming classes as blended learning.  Public schools nationwide can also conduct their graduation and moving up rites in July. Private schools may implement their graduation and moving up rites following the schedule in their school calendars.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210601033002/https://ph.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/  https://web.archive.org/web/20210601034535/https://www.pna.gov.ph/articles/1141840  https://web.archive.org/web/20210525081459/https://www.pna.gov.ph/articles/1141405
notes_H7: (AstraZeneca, Sinovac): As of May 26, a total of 4,495,375 Filipinos have received at least one dose of the Covid-19 vaccine, 1,029,061 of them now fully vaccination. Among those who have been fully vaccinated, about 581,797 are health services front-liners, 195,952 are senior citizens, 250,777 are individuals with comorbidity, and 535 are essential sector front-liners.  Priority Group A4 refers to informal essential workers who cannot work from home will begin vaccinations in June.  Sputnik V vaccines have also arrived but no mention that they have been distributed to the population yet.    “Most of those we’ve vaccinated, those in priority group A1, we’re already at 85 percent, first dose who are master-listed, second are the senior citizens at 12 percent only so we need to promote the A2 and A3 (groups). The vaccination of A4 may start on the first week of June), symbolic was May 1st for our OFWs and labor force who belong to the A4. But we’ll just do this in what we call NCR Plus 8, so that’s NCR, Bulacan, Cavite, Pampanga, Laguna, Batangas, Rizal, [Metro] Cebu and [Metro] Davao only, while the other regions continue with A1 to A3."    https://web.archive.org/web/20210601053739/https://www.pna.gov.ph/articles/1141516  https://web.archive.org/web/20210601053950/https://pcoo.gov.ph/news_releases/be-part-of-the-solution-get-vaccinated-palace/
notes_C3: “The NTF and the Department of the Interior and Local Government shall ensure that areas flagged for local action shall implement strict lockdown of areas in line with the Zoning Containment Strategy, strict enforcement of minimum health standards, and intensified tracing and quarantine of close contacts and isolation of confirmed cases,” the resolution read.    http://web.archive.org/web/20200906185101if_/https://www.onenews.ph/list-areas-under-gcq-starting-aug-16
notes_C8: They are not accepting international travelers. https://web.archive.org/web/20210301092440if_/https://www.covid19.gov.ph/
notes_C4: A numbered restriction on gatherings has been difficult to locate, however current mandates have reduction on capacity for many routine gatherings:  "Meetings, Incentives, Conventions, and Exhibitions (MICE) events in eligible venue establishments shall be allowed to resume up to thirty percent (30%) of venue capacity, while social events in the same establishments shall be allowed up to ten percent (10%) of the venue capacity; Outdoor tourist attractions shall remain allowed at thirty percent (30%) with strict adherence to minimum public health standards; Religious gatherings shall remain to be allowed up to thirty percent (30%) of the venue capacity;  Gatherings for necrological services, wakes, inurnment, funerals for those who died of causes other than COVID-19 shall be allowed, provided that the same shall be limited to immediate family members."    https://web.archive.org/web/20210601033002/https://ph.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/  https://web.archive.org/web/20210601041715/https://pcoo.gov.ph/wp-content/uploads/2021/05/20210531-IATF-RESO-118-A-RRD.pdf
notes_C6: Effective March 15-28, 2021, the National Capital Region (NCR) will be under curfew from 10:00 p.m. to 5:00 a.m. Only individuals aged 18-65 years old are allowed to go outside their residences amid the alarming rising number of COVID-19 cases in Metro Manila starting March 17, 2021    https://web.archive.org/web/20210318000507/https://ph.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_H6: The Philippine government mandated all persons to wear full-coverage?face shields together with face masks?while in public places.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210601033002/https://ph.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_H8: Curfew is in place in Metro Manila, Cavite, and Laguna from 10 p.m. to 4 a.m. Bulacan and Rizal curfew hours are from 8 p.m. to 5 a.m. Only individuals aged 18-65 years old are allowed to go outside their residences during non-curfew hours.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210601033002/https://ph.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C5: Public transportation remains in operation generally. Face masks or face shield however, are mandatory and reinforced on public transit. There is also a limit of passengers within one taxi.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210601033002/https://ph.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/

name: Papua New Guinea
notes_H1: This document uploaded on 12th April on website of Ministry of health mentions about comprehensive public awareness campaigns  https://web.archive.org/save/https://www.health.gov.pg/subindex.php?news=1
notes_H2: "COVID-19 Testing    Are PCR and/or antigen tests available for U.S. citizens in Papua New Guinea? Yes  If so, are test results reliably available within 72 hours? Yes  Symptomatic persons are generally able to obtain government-paid or government-subsidized testing services at Port Moresby General Hospital and the Taurama Aquatic Center drive-through testing site operated by St. John Ambulance service. Testing services outside of Port Moresby may be obtained by visiting a provincial hospital or by calling 1800 200 and asking for more information.  Non-symptomatic persons and persons who need testing services in connection with travel may obtain such services through approved swabbing centers and private medical facilities, including:  St John Ambulance  2K Medical Clinic  Pacific International Hospital  Aspen Medical  Sky Medical Services  Testing conducted through private medical facilities may cost as much as 250 USD.  Though electronic test results from such facilities are generally available within 24-48 hours, U.S. citizens who need tests in connection with travel are advised to request clear estimates of the turn-around and delivery methods for test results."    https://web.archive.org/web/20210119024845/https://pg.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C7: Interprovincial air travel is restricted to essential travel, including student travel, return to a habitual place of residence, essential business travel, and medical assistance and emergencies; or to persons who have approval from the Controller, the Controller’s delegate, or the provincial administrator from the traveler’s province of origin. Travelers should consult with their respective airline(s) prior to travel    https://web.archive.org/web/20210621214243/https://pg.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_E2: No change in policy    https://web.archive.org/web/20210621214844/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19
notes_C2: Most businesses are restricted to operating between the hours of 07:00-20:00 daily, while restaurants and service stations may stay open between 07:00-22:00.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210509145135/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/470911/papua-new-guinea-authorities-continue-a-number-of-covid-19-restrictions-on-international-travel-and-domestic-activity-as-of-april-24-update-29
notes_H3: The NCC measures do not list any comprehensive demands for contact tracing. Additionally, according to the situation report dated 12 April released by PNG National Department of Health and World Health Organization,     "Due to logistical difficulties, lengthy test turnaround time, public holidays, clinic shutdowns, and low testing capacity in PNG, there have been delays in swabbing, testing, and reporting of results, thus the number of cases reported in the last week is an underrepresentation of the situation that is occurring."    See the NCC's Measures, archived on Dropbox, at https://www.dropbox.com/s/xpqofo1aa2qcpj9/PNG-20210412-NCCMeasures.pdf  See the Situation Report by PNG National Department of Health and World Health Organization, archived on Dropbox, at https://www.dropbox.com/s/4h54j58m1mzv6vo/PNG-20210412-COVID19HealthSituationReport68.pdf
notes_E1: Couldn't find any indication of monetary support. Extending a credit line or allowing employees to dip into their provident funds cannot be counted here.  http://web.archive.org/web/20201221143702/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19
notes_C1: Schools in Papua New Guinea have reopened subject to adhering  "strictly to the COVID-19 measures". These include wearing face masks and hand sanitation.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210509141115/http://www.xinhuanet.com/english/asiapacific/2021-04/13/c_139877088.htm
notes_H7: A- Key Worker    Australia sent Papua New Guinea 8,000 doses of AstraZeneca’s COVID-19 vaccine last week after warning of a worsening humanitarian crisis. It has sent almost 8,500 vaccine doses to immunize frontline workers in its former colony and is considering distributing more once it begins to ramp up local production of the AstraZeneca shot.    Nikkei Asia Web Archived: web.archive.org/web/20210405011612/https://asia.nikkei.com/Spotlight/Coronavirus/Australia-vaccine-diplomacy-tested-as-COVID-slams-Papua-New-Guinea
notes_C3: Nonessential gatherings are limited to no more than 10 people.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210509145135/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/470911/papua-new-guinea-authorities-continue-a-number-of-covid-19-restrictions-on-international-travel-and-domestic-activity-as-of-april-24-update-29
notes_C8: International Travel RestrictionsAll arrivals must obtain written approval from the National Pandemic Controller's Office before entry. Approval is valid for 90 days for a single entry. International flights from Australia, Singapore, Japan, Hong Kong, the Philippines, Fiji, Solomon Islands, Nauru, Micronesia, Vanuatu, Cook Islands, Samoa, Palau, and Niue are available on specific carriers, though Air Niugini (PX) conducts most international flights. Inbound air passengers must obtain a negative result from a PCR COVID-19 test within seven days of travel and complete an e-Health Declaration Form no more than 24 hours before boarding flights. Authorities have banned all flights and vessels, and passengers who have traveled to India within 21 days of arrival.  http://web.archive.org/web/20210607123809/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/480906/papua-new-guinea-authorities-easing-some-covid-19-restrictions-nationwide-as-of-may-20-update-31
notes_C4: Gatherings related to religious activities, funerals, and haus krais are limited to no more than 100 people; gatherings for recreational sports are limited to no more than 4 people; and all other gatherings are limited to no more than 10 people.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210509145135/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/470911/papua-new-guinea-authorities-continue-a-number-of-covid-19-restrictions-on-international-travel-and-domestic-activity-as-of-april-24-update-29
notes_C6: According to the US Embassy in PNG,    "Movement Restrictions:        Is a curfew in place? An official national curfew not currently in place, but business operations are limited to prescribed hours. Note that curfews and other measures may be imposed by provincial government authorities."    See the US Embassy in PNG's website, archived at https://archive.vn/qBT0v
notes_H6: No social distancing or mask requirements as highlighted on the US embassy website.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210621214243/https://pg.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_H8: http://web.archive.org/save/https://www.abc.net.au/news/2020-12-07/familes-torn-apart-covid-19-png-saibai-island-border-closure/12951364  http://web.archive.org/save/https://www.rnz.co.nz/international/pacific-news/430526/papua-new-guinea-s-covid-19-cases-now-at-600
notes_C5: See Measure No. 11 of the National Pandemic Act 2020, updated 20th Jan 2021:    "2. Taxis may operate so long as the driver and all passengers are wearing a mask or face covering in a manner which covers their mouth, nose and chin.    3. All persons on public transport including the driver and passengers must at all times while on the public transportation wear a mask or face covering in compliance with the requirements in Measure 10."    Document archived on Dropbox, available at https://www.dropbox.com/s/mgizm9o5mojnlpg/PNGMeasure11-20210120.pdf

name: Poland
notes_H1: Health authority launches a 24/7 coronavirus hotline and a broader public information campaign: https://gis.gov.pl/aktualnosci/calodobowa-infolinia-nfz-o-koronawirusie/
notes_H2: Testing is widely available for those showing symptoms. Drive-through centers aroudn the country can perform the test for symptomatic individuals, although an appointment arranged by phone is needed.     https://web.archive.org/web/20200610224903/https://ug.edu.pl/news/en/295/first-covid-19-walk-thru-mobile-testing-center-poland-opened-university-gdansk
notes_C7: Restrictions return to previous levels following a ban of movement from December 31, 2020 to January 1, 2021, from 19:00 to 6:00.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210101210448/https://www.gov.pl/web/koronawirus/przedluzamy-etap-odpowiedzialnosci-i-wprowadzamy-dodatkowe-ograniczenia
notes_E2: According to the announcement of the Polish government:  - 90% reduction rents for tenants of premises and the so-called islands in shopping malls, as long as these facilities are prohibited from operating normally;  - exemption from charging contractual penalties for - related to the epidemic - delays in the execution of tenders;  - enabling municipalities to refrain from charging real estate tax on companies that have lost their liquidity due to the coronavirus epidemic.  Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200507081400/https://www.gov.pl/web/koronawirus/tarcza
notes_C2: From May 4, after a break caused by the restrictions related to the coronavirus pandemic, museums and cultural institutions conducting exhibition activities - while maintaining the applicable sanitary regime - can reopen to visitors.   https://web.archive.org/web/20210506225429/https://www.gov.pl/web/kulturaisport/muzea-i-instytucje-kultury-prowadzace-dzialalnosc-wystawiennicza-otwieraja-sie-dla-zwiedzajacych
notes_H3: Poland introduces an app to support contact tracing efforts in April 2020. notes_E1: Note: New 2020 budget - Wage subsidies for employees of affected businesses and self-employed persons. Businesses, regardless of their size, may apply for a three-month subsidy in the event of work stoppages or reduced working time. This subsidy covers social insurance contributions, and it ranges from 50 to 90 percent of the minimum wage for each employee, depending on recorded decrease in turnover in 2020. The subsidy includes furloughed employees. See: [web archive unavailable, accessed 28th September 2020]

notes_C3: Internal gastronomy - on the premises  max. 50 percent occupancy  distance between the tables (every second table can be occupied, the distance between the tables must be at least 1.5 m - unless there is a partition at least 1 m high between them, counting from the surface of the table).    Occasional events in the premises (including weddings and communions)  max. 50 people ( Important! Fully vaccinated people against COVID-19 are not counted)    Sports - indoor sports facilities, swimming pools  for everyone  50 percent facility occupancy (also applies to the audience, every second place in the audience)    Sports - sports activities and events outside of sports facilities  limit up to 250 people    Sport - gyms, fitness clubs, solariums  limit: 1 person per 15m2  sanitary regime  https://web.archive.org/web/20210524162548/https://www.gov.pl/web/koronawirus/przypominamy-majowy-harmonogram-lagodzenia-obostrzen
notes_C8: ***Recoded; upon review no evidence of a ban in place on arrivals. Quarantines are in some arrivals, and fully vaccinated people are exempt from quarantine as of December 28, 2020.     https://web.archive.org/web/20210305010658/https://www.gov.pl/web/coronavirus/temporary-limitations    Previous coding notes:   Rules for travelers coming to Poland from the Schengen area  Travelers will be quarantined unless they test negative for COVID-19. The test will have to be performed no later than 48 hours before the border is crossed.  Type of test: PCR or antigenic.  The new rules will apply to all means of transport: public and individual transport as well as crossing the border on foot.  Travelers who have been quarantined in Poland will be able to take a test, the negative result of which will release them from quarantine.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210402120444/https://www.gov.pl/web/koronawirus/od-30-marca-nowe-zasady-dotyczace-kwarantanny-dla-przyjezdzajacych-do-polski3    'We are prolonging the existing restrictions until Sunday, April 25, 2021.'  https://web.archive.org/web/20210421015920/https://www.gov.pl/web/koronawirus/Do-25kwietnia-przedluzamy-zasady-bezpieczenstwa-z-wyjatkami
notes_C4: From June 6, it will be possible to organize weddings and gatherings up to 150 people, as well as fairs and conferences, while maintaining the limit - 1 person per 15 m2. Children's playrooms will also be opened.   https://web.archive.org/web/20210607092646/https://www.gov.pl/web/koronawirus/czerwcowy-harmonogram-luzowania-obostrzen
notes_C6: The following restrictions will come into effect on Saturday, October 24:     - The entire territory of Poland will become a 'red' zone;     - Restaurant activity will be limited for two weeks to serving only takeaway food;    - Grades four to eight in elementary schools will switch to remote learning;     - Secondary schools and higher learning institutions will switch to remote learning.    - Between the hours of 8:00 a.m. and 4:00 p.m., children under the age of 16 will be allowed to leave their homes only in the company of an adult;    - Spectators will be banned from sporting events;    - There will be a 25-percent cap on audiences at all cultural events;    - Swimming pools, aquaparks and fitness clubs will be closed;    - Sanatoria will be closed;    - The number of people at retail premises of up to 100 square metres will be capped at five per checkout;     - The number of customers in retail premises above 100 square metres will be limited to one person per 15 square metres;    - Public transport will be limited to 50 percent of seating capacity or 30 percent of total capacity;    - Gatherings of more than five people will be banned, except for people living together in one home;    - Persons aged 70 and above are to encouraged to stay at home, apart from performing their professional activities, meeting their essential daily needs and participating in religious ceremonies.  https://web.archive.org/web/20201027185141/https://www.gov.pl/web/koronawirus/aktualne-zasady-i-ograniczenia
notes_H6: ***Recoded from 3G to 2G; while masks are required in many public spaces, they are not required at others (see list of exemptions below)     Covering the mouth and nose in public spaces is obligatory throughout the entire country!    It is mandatory to cover your mouth and nose in such places as:    -on streets, roads and in town squares, within cemeteries, promenades, boulevards, vehicle parking areas, forest car parks,  -in buses, trams and trains,  -in shops, malls, banks, markets and post offices  -in cinemas and theatres,  -at physician’s offices, in outpatient clinics and hospitals, in massage and tattoo parlours  -in churches, at schools and universities,  -In government offices (when going there to take care of certain matters) and other civic centres.    Where is it not mandatory to cover your mouth and nose? In forests, parks, green squares, botanical gardens, historic gardens, family community gardens and on beaches as well as while travelling by private car.    Important!  Exemption from the obligation to cover the mouth and nose is limited only to persons who have a medical certificate or a document confirming:    -a pervasive developmental disorder,  -a mental disorder,  -moderate, severe or profound intellectual disability,  -difficulties in uncovering the mouth or nose on their own.    http://web.archive.org/web/20210127093533/https://www.gov.pl/web/coronavirus/temporary-limitations
notes_H8: Senior, stay home! We call for limiting the movement of seniors - especially people over 70 years of age.   https://web.archive.org/web/20201104172405/https://www.gov.pl/web/koronawirus/aktualne-zasady-i-ograniczenia
notes_C5: https://web.archive.org/web/20201027185141/https://www.gov.pl/web/koronawirus/aktualne-zasady-i-ograniczenia

notes_H2: San Juan Airport Now Offering PCR Testing For All Passengers  The Luis Muñoz Marín International Airport in San Juan, Puerto Rico has is now offering PCR molecular COVID-19 tests for all passengers within the airport.     Done in partnership with CMT Group, this will comply with island entry requirements, as well as provide easy access to testing for those leaving the destination. While Puerto Rico is exempt from the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention’s (CDC) negative COVID-19 test requirement for re-entry into the U.S., travelers who still wish to get tested, will have the ability to do so without having to leave the airport.     Beyond facilitating testing, this offering will also allow for early detection of positive cases and serve as a preventative measure, furthering the Island’s commitment to the safety of visitors and residents, said Discover Puerto Rico.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210218230937/https://www.travelagentcentral.com/caribbean/san-juan-airport-now-offering-pcr-testing-for-all-passengers
notes_C7: Seems that restrictions on internal movement were lifted with local curfews on 24 May 2021.    https://archive.vn/rUW2o
notes_E2: Since March 16: “Payment plans moratorium. Taxpayers economically affected by COVID-19 and the closure order will not be required to follow the terms of a payment plan between the period March 16, 2020, and April 30, 2020. The PRTD will not be imposing interest and penalties for non-compliance with the payment plans. If there is a notice for interest and penalties, the taxpayer may submit a request to eliminate such charges.”  http://web.archive.org/web/20200501022500/https://home.kpmg/xx/en/home/insights/2020/04/puerto-rico-tax-developments-in-response-to-covid-19.html  Since March 23: “From Monday, March 23 through June 30, 2020, no income tax shall be withheld on payments for services rendered as required under Section 1062.03 of the PR IRC related to services rendered by residents of Puerto Rico carried out. This exemption will apply regardless of whether the recipient has a total or partial release of this withholding tax. AD 20-10 clarifies that this withholding exemption does not exempt the recipient from any income tax on the amounts received and the withholding agent of the reporting requirements for the amounts paid”. Here's the link:  http://web.archive.org/web/20200501020455/https://www.hlb.global/puerto-rico-tax-and-financial-measures-associated-with-covid-19/  Sine March 23: “No penalties will be imposed for missing or insufficient estimated tax payments, which are required by individuals and corporations for tax year 2020; the penalties will not be imposed if the first and second installment payments are timely made in equal amounts by the due dates of the next two estimated installments, together with the corresponding estimated income tax payments due. Withholding agents are not required to do the 10% income tax withholding at source on payments for services performed, but the service provider may choose to have the withholding continue; the waiver from the withholding is temporary during the period from 23 March 2020 to 30 June 2020.” Here's the link:  http://web.archive.org/web/20200501022937/https://www.ey.com/en_gl/tax-alerts/puerto-rico-s-treasury-department-announces-additional-extensions-for-various-returns-and-payments-and-provides-special-cash-flow-tax-relief-measures-because-of-covid-19  “"The Electric Power Authorities (PREPA) and the Aqueduct and Sewer Authority (AAA) cannot suspend the electricity and water service while the executive orders for the emergency are in force by COVID-19.”  http://web.archive.org/web/20200501023705/https://www.efe.com/efe/usa/puerto-rico/normativa-prohibe-el-corte-de-la-luz-y-agua-durante-emergencia-covid-19/50000110-4218441

Bars and nightclubs are still closed while supermarkets, gas stations and pharmacies are open. If you’re going on a tour or visiting a local attraction or spa, reservations may be necessary due to capacity limits—social activities, restaurants, casinos, malls and theaters are currently limited to 50% capacity and you may need to provide negative PCR or antigen test results or proof of vaccination before you can enter. ... notes_C8: https://web.archive.org/web/20210510121602/https://www.nytimes.com/2021/05/08/world/puerto-rico-covid-cases-restrictions.html
notes_C4: [Quote]  'On June 3, 2021, Puerto Rico Governor Hon. Pedro Pierluisi issued Executive Order (EO) 2021-043 to further relax COVID-19 restrictions and guidelines. The new EO will be in effect from June 7, 2021 until July 4, 2021.  ...  Private Sector Operations:  Private sector operations that serve the general public may be carried out from 5:00 a.m. to 12:00 a.m. Indoor private sector operations are allowed an occupancy limit of 75% of the maximum capacity, while outdoor establishments can operate without maximum capacity constraints. Both indoor and outdoor operations must comply with the six-feet social distancing requirement.   Private sector operations that do not serve the general public may operate without any time constraints but must comply with a maximum capacity limit of 75% and social distancing requirements.  All establishments must comply with protocols established by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), the Puerto Rico Department of Health (DOH), the Puerto Rico Occupational Safety and Health Administration (PROSHA) and the COVID-19 guidelines.  Indoor theaters, bars, coliseums, and convention centers can operate at a maximum capacity of 50%. Individuals that attend should be either fully vaccinated or have negative COVID-19 test results administered at least 72 hours prior to the event, and must comply with 6-feet social distancing requirements.  Even though screening visitors is now recommended by the new EO, a Regulation issued by the DOH still requires it. Businesses are still required to display a poster at the entrance of the establishment indicating the number of people allowed, based on their applicable maximum capacity limits, as well as the DOH contact information to report any non-compliance. Registering with the Contact Tracing and Case Investigation Municipal System is encouraged.    Social and Recreational Activities:  Social activities may be held from 5:00 a.m. to 12:00 a.m. Indoor social activities may be carried out at a maximum capacity limit of 75%, while outdoor social activities can be carried out without a maximum capacity limit. Both indoor and outdoor social activities must comply with the six-feet social distancing requirement. Participants must be either fully vaccinated or present negative COVID-19 test results administered at least 72 hours prior to the event.  Sports and recreational training activities are allowed as long as the general preventive measures are complied with. Beaches, pools and marinas can be used with a 10-feet social distancing requirement.'  [End of quote]    No restriction on gatherings is found.    https://archive.vn/FMhfL  https://archive.vn/GOWgs
notes_C6: Local curfews were lifted on 24 May 2021. Seems the public are not explicitly suggested to stay at home.    https://archive.vn/rUW2o

name: Portugal
notes_H1: Government launches website specific about coronavirus centralizing information from government  Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20210426052348/https://www.sabado.pt/portugal/detalhe/estamos-on-governo-lanca-site-sobre-como-responder-ao-novo-coronavirus
notes_H2: "Asymptomatic people (those without symptoms of the disease) or who have not had any exposure to SARS-CoV-2 will also be tested for covid-19 under the plan to promote the operationalization of the testing strategy in Portugal. This plan was already being operationalized but was now extended. The main objective is to detect possible cases of infection early.  In addition to testing symptomatic people or contacts of people with covid-19, which was already underway, the Dr. Ricardo Jorge Health Institute (INSA), which this Tuesday released the plan, says that “it matters, in the current epidemiological situation, expand and operationalize testing” (so-called screenings) to other groups. This testing strategy was already underway, for example, in schools, where teachers, non-teaching staff and students have been tested within the scope of schools reopening  (...) Also according to the document, the new strategy is based on three main axes: directed, programmed and generalized testing. Directed testing has as its main purpose “the screening in community or occupational contexts and is dependent on the epidemiological situation (incidence and growth trend of the epidemic, positivity and other indicators)”. (...) Examples of places to adapt this type of testing are educational or teaching establishments, mass events, sports clubs, travel/transport, municipal services and any other type of company."   Source: https://archive.vn/cLZqf
notes_C7: "Only in the Lisbon Metropolitan Area  (Alcochete, Almada, Barreiro, Amadora, Cascais, Lisbon, Loures, Mafra, Moita, Montijo, Odivelas, Oeiras, Palmela, Seixal, Sintra, Sesimbra, Setúbal, Vila Franca de Xira)  Circulation to and from the Lisbon Metropolitan Area is prohibited between 3pm on June 18th and 6am on June 21st, with the following exceptions:  - professional activities (provided that it is accompanied by a declaration);  - health reasons;  - attendance at school establishments;  - necessary circulation to leave the mainland national territory;  - circulation of non-resident citizens to places of proven permanence;  - return home."    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20210619000323/https://www.visitportugal.com/en/content/covid-19-measures-implemented-portugal
notes_E2: Parliament approved exceptional measures suspending evictions and cuts in the provision of water, gas, and electricity due to income loss caused by the coronavirus.    Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200509085737/https://www.publico.pt/2020/03/18/politica/noticia/medidas-excepcionais-aprovadas-nao-ha-despejos-corte-agua-luz-1908429    "sejam suspensas as acções de despejo durante o período em que vigorar a pandemia e que não possam ser cortados os abastecimentos de água, luz ou gás por falta de pagamento devido a desemprego, quebra dos rendimentos ou por o cliente sofrer de covid-19"
notes_C2: ""Effective March 15, 2021, the Government of Portugal will implement the following Deconfinement Measures for the entire country (...)    - Local Trade: Non-food retail and services must close at 9.00 pm on weekdays, and at 1.00 pm on weekends and holidays. Shop door sales, Fairs and Markets open to sell non- food products in accordance with municipality authorization.  - Grocery Stores and Supermarkets must close at 9.00 pm during weekdays, and may remain open on weekends until 7.00 pm.  - Restaurants, Bars and Cafes: Limited to take-away and home delivery only. Restaurants in shopping centers are closed. Take away of drinks permitted.  - Alcoholic Beverages can only be sold until 8.00 pm in all establishments, including supermarkets.  - Hairdressers, Manicurists, and Barbers open by appointment only.  - Bookstores, Libraries, Gardens and Open-air Leisure Spaces open to the public."    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20210314164727/https://pt.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_H3: The Prime Minister announced that "At the moment, fortunately, there are no overdue epidemiological inquiries, and all the delays that existed have been recovered. We can even reduce the number of people involved in tracking activities, namely from the Armed Forces military".      Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20210309231920/https://www.rtp.pt/madeira/politica/nao-ha-inqueritos-epidemiologicos-atrasados_55370
notes_E1: Government implements an extraordinary income support scheme to workers who need to stay home to take care of dependants and to those who had lost their income due to reduction in economic activity. This is caped at 50% of the income or the minimum wage for informal workers (700 euros per month).    Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200509072543/http://www.seg-social.pt/apoio-extraordinario-a-reducao-da-atividade-economica-de-trabalhador-independente  "É criado um apoio financeiro excepcional aos trabalhadores por conta de outrem que tenham de ficar em casa a acompanhar os filhos até 12 anos, no valor de 66% da remuneração base (33% a cargo do empregador, 33% a cargo da Segurança Social). Para os trabalhadores independentes, é criado um apoio financeiro excepcional aos que tenham de ficar em casa a acompanhar os filhos até 12 anos, no valor de 1/3 da remuneração média, bem como um apoio extraordinário à redução da atividade económica de trabalhador independente e diferimento do pagamento de contribuições"
notes_C1: "The prime minister announced this Thursday (April 15) that the deconfinement announced in March remains, which means that secondary schools and higher education establishments will resume face-to-face classes starting on April 19.    Pre-schools and primary schools (1st cycle), as well as day care centers, resumed on-site education on March 15. Middle schools (2nd and 3rd cycles), on the other hand,  reopened on April 5th, which means remote classes in Portugal came to an end.    The educational measures will always be at national level, explained the Prime Minister, António Costa, confirming that secondary schools and higher education institutions will open for face-to-face teaching even in the municipalities that will have to regress or stop in the deconfinement process."    Source: https://archive.vn/VyjPs    "(...) the Minister of Education underlined that all measures are being followed to prevent the spread of the new coronavirus and that the testing and new measures of the Directorate-General for Health bring additional security.    "What we see in our schools is a mechanism that protects students, that protects teaching and non-teaching workers. We see the use of masks (...), the use of alcohol gel, the cleaning of spaces", stressed the minister.    For Tiago Brandão Rodrigues, the testing actions are now "improving the protection of our schools and increasing resilience while mitigating the spread of the virus". The Minister also mentioned the importance of strengthening the DGS protocol, which "now goes further: cohabitants of students who are suspected cases and often also the risk contacts that exist in our schools are also being testing".    Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20210421153949/https://www.rtp.pt/noticias/mundo/covid-19-a-situacao-ao-minuto-do-novo-coronavirus-no-pais-e-no-mundo_e1313880
notes_H7: Starting this Friday, April 23, individuals aged 65 or above (including those without any pre-existing conditions) will be able to chose the date and place of vaccination in the Health Directorate General portal. They will be able to accept the date suggested by the portal, chose another one or stay on the waiting list. Those who register in this portal will have to wait for an SMS that will confirm the date, time and place.     According to the government, 2,015,225 people have already taken the first dose, while 689,329 (representing approximately 7% of the population) already have complete vaccination against the virus SARS-CoV-2. By age group, 91% of the elderly over 80 years old (617,566 people) are already vaccinated with the first dose and 58% (394,186) have already received both doses of the vaccine. In the age group between 65 and 79 years old, 42% (669,263) also received the first dose of the vaccine a percentage that drops to just 4% (59,658) if we consider those who have taken the two doses.    Note: Upgraded to 4 since, according to the codebook "Broad groups may include a large group of adults, for example those aged 50-65". In this case, includes those aged 65-79.    Sources: http://web.archive.org/web/20210514231120/https://www.jn.pt/nacional/pessoas-com-mais-65-anos-podem-agendar-vacinacao-a-partir-de-hoje-13603627.html  http://web.archive.org/web/20210514232113/https://www.publico.pt/2021/04/23/sociedade/noticia/65-anos-saiba-agendar-vacinacao-covid19-1959726
notes_C3: Only events with up 100 people are allowed.    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20210621233956/https://www.portugal.gov.pt/pt/gc22/comunicacao/noticia?i=governo-proibe-eventos-com-mais-de-cem-pessoas-e-consumo-de-alcool-na-rua
notes_C8: https://www.publico.pt/2020/03/10/economia/noticia/governo-suspende-voos-territorio-italiano-causa-coronavirus-1907157    Portugal suspends flights to Italy.     Bans flights from and to Spain.
notes_C4: On September 15, Portugal has entered into a state of contingency "in what the Prime Minister António Costa calls a “new phase”, and with that comes new measures to avoid the spread of the virus. Among the first measures adopted by the government, announced this Thursday, "are the reduction of the limit of people in gatherings as well as the number of people seated per table in restaurants.  After a Council of Ministers meeting, António Costa announced to the country what will change in the coming days. The main measures announced include a limitation of gatherings (up 10 people).  Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20201018213856/https://econews.pt/2020/09/10/portugals-state-of-contigency-is-coming-prime-minister-reveals-new-measures/ http://web.archive.org/web/20201018213429/https://www.sns.gov.pt/noticias/2020/09/10/covid-19-situacao-de-contingencia/
notes_C6: The President of the Portuguese Republic, Marcelo Rebelo de Sousa, announced that the sanitary fence in Odemira will be lifted immediately.  Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20210514225530/https://tvi24.iol.pt/politica/11-05-2021/marcelo-anuncia-fim-da-cerca-sanitaria-em-odemira-hoje-mesmo    At this stage the general principle is to stay at home whenever possible, but it is an individual decision, that is recommended by the Government.    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20210514220806/https://www.timeout.pt/lisboa/pt/coisas-para-fazer/o-estado-de-calamidade-foi-decretado-quais-sao-as-regras
notes_H6: Portugal's parliament on Friday passed a bill which imposed the mandatory use of a mask on the street and public spaces in an effort to contain the spread of the coronavirus.    The order was passed a day after authorities reported 3,270 new coronavirus cases, the highest single-day increase since the beginning of the pandemic. It will be in effect for at least 70 days.    The use of a mask is compulsory for all people "over ten years old to access, circulate or stay in public spaces and roads whenever the physical distance recommended by health authorities are impossible", according to the bill.    The obligation between "people from the same household, when they are not in the proximity of third parties" can be waived or by means of a "medical certificate" that the clinical condition or cognitive impairment does not allow the use of masks.    It is also not mandatory to wear a mask when "it is incompatible with the nature of the activities that people are carrying out."    Those who violate the order face fines of between 100 euros ($118) and 500 euros ($590). Other items such as visors will not be acceptable as substitutes.    The order will be reassessed following the expiry of the mandated period with a renewal a possibility."    These rules will be applied from Wednesday, October 28."    Sources: http://web.archive.org/web/20201028100351/https://newsaf.cgtn.com/news/2020-10-24/Portugal-s-Parliament-approves-mandatory-use-of-masks-in-outdoor-areas-UPMSI69oJy/index.html  http://web.archive.org/web/20201028100922/https://sicnoticias.pt/especiais/coronavirus/2020-10-27-A-partir-de-quarta-feira-vai-ter-de-usar-mascara-na-rua
notes_H8: May 26 - The minister of Labour, Solidarity and Social Security, Ana Mendes Godinho, requested nursing homes to allow residents to leave the facilities and have visitors. In this audience at the Parliamentary Committee, the Minister added that the Social Security Institute had made this request twice to these institutions and reminded that the rights of those living in these facilities should be respected and safeguarded. She also added that recalled that at this stage the majority of residents and workers working in these institutions have been vaccinated.    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20210605011402/https://rr.sapo.pt/2021/05/26/pais/governo-pede-que-seja-respeitado-direito-dos-utentes-dos-lares-para-sair-e-ter-visitas/noticia/240180/    Note: Coded on the day in which the article was published since the exact date in which the rules changed was not mentioned.    At this stage the general principle is to stay at home whenever possible, but it is an individual decision, that is recommended by the Government.    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20210514220806/https://www.timeout.pt/lisboa/pt/coisas-para-fazer/o-estado-de-calamidade-foi-decretado-quais-sao-as-regras
notes_C5: Limits in the number of passengers in public transport to 1/3 of capacity to ensure social distancing.   Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20200509093853/https://www.portugal.gov.pt/download-ficheiros/ficheiro.aspx?v=3f8e87a6-3cf1-4d0c-b5ee-72225a73cd4f

name: Paraguay
notes_H1: Since March 23 the Ministry of Health published campaign materials about COVID::  https://www.mitic.gov.py/noticias/coronavirus-covid19-materiales-de-comunicacion-para-empresas-y-organizaciones   See videos published by the Ministry of Health  here:  https://www.facebook.com/ministeriodesaludparaguay/videos/
notes_H2: COVID-19 testing in Paraguay is available through both public hospitals and private labs.  Those who have symptoms of COVID-19, have recently come in contact with someone with COVID-19, or have recently traveled internationally are eligible for testing at the following locations on the Ministry of Health website  https://web.archive.org/web/20210607215027/https://py.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information-2/
notes_C7: From 5 October, the government’s announcement ending the ‘social’ and ‘smart’ quarantine phases comes into force. The government has introduced new flexible quarantine measures on a nationwide level.  Inter-departmental circulation is allowed without restrictions.  https://web.archive.org/web/20201019214004/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/paraguay/staying-during-coronavirus
notes_E2: No evidence of a policy change.
notes_C2: In april 24, the Paraguay Government decreed that essential services would be able to work and restaurants, schools, colleges, event places and cultural activities would also be allowed, but these if following some restrictions. Those unable to follow the restrictions, will remain closed.       http://web.archive.org/web/20210519161729/https://www.mspbs.gov.py/dependencias/portal/adjunto/2a8bd1-5161.pdf
notes_H3: As informed previously, the government has kept doing limited contact tracing.
notes_E1: Ñangareko is a program of monetary transfers of G. 500.000 for the purchase of food and hygiene products. The target population were people with needs (workers or not) and those who did not benefit from other social programs such as Tekopora and pensions for the elderly. The population that started receiving the transfers since March 31. Until April 26, 328.045 individuals were notified of their inclusion in the programme. The monetary assistance was been transferred to 224.001 families.  With the programme the government is replacing less than 50% of lost salary of workers. Here’s the links of the news reports that explain the programme:   http://web.archive.org/web/20200504191513/https://www.lanacion.com.py/pais/2020/03/30/manana-inicia-transferencia-del-programa-nangareko/  http://web.archive.org/web/20200504183917/https://www.abc.com.py/edicion-impresa/suplementos/economico/2020/04/26/asistencia-social-y-la-experiencia-en-el-uso-de-medios-de-pago-electronicos-en-programas-nangareko-y-pytyvo/
notes_C1: In april 24, the Paraguay Government decreed that schools can work as presential or semipresential classes only if allowed by the 'Comité Educativo Institucional para la Gestion del Riesgo' with the requirement of following the "Protocol and Operative Guide for safe return in Educational Institutions - 2021", which requires sanitizing measures and specific infrastructures.      http://web.archive.org/web/20210519161729/https://www.mspbs.gov.py/dependencias/portal/adjunto/2a8bd1-5161.pdf
notes_H7: Currently, the Paraguayan government is vaccinating health care workers and individuals age 70 and above and allowing registration for individuals age 60 and above.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210607215027/https://py.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information-2/
notes_C3: In april 24, the Paraguay Government decreed that public events would only be allowed if limited to 50 people in closed spaces and 100 people in open spaced, with a combination of open and closed space forbidden.     http://web.archive.org/web/20210519161729/https://www.mspbs.gov.py/dependencias/portal/adjunto/2a8bd1-5161.pdf
notes_C8: The Paraguay Government requires testing and quarentining in specific hotels available in the country. Brazilian people must stay at their homes during 7 days after arrival, despite the test result.     https://web.archive.org/web/20210526203848/http://www.migraciones.gov.py/favicon.ico
notes_C4: From March 27th until April 4th:  "Social events in public and private spaces are permitted with up to 100 people, provided attendees practice social distancing of at least 2 meters (6 feet). Social events in private homes are limited to 12 people.  Up to four people may engage in outdoor physical activities together. Sports may also be played in groups of up to four people, although persons younger than 18 or older than 60 are prohibited from sports activities."  source: https://archive.vn/p3s7k
notes_C6: In nationwide Phase 2: "The existing isolation order for all persons in Paraguay to remain in their homes except for necessary travel to obtain food, medicine or cleaning supplies is otherwise still in effect."    https://web.archive.org/web/20200626105822/https://py.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information-2/
notes_H6: Wearing a facemask is mandatory at all times and observing sanitary measures (washing of hands and observing physical distance). https://web.archive.org/web/20210621212140/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/paraguay/coronavirus
notes_H8: No evidence of a policy change. The Ministry of Health recommends specific measures for individuals over 60 years old and those with co-morbidities. There is also a daily curfew in place. As such, this was coded as a 2.  source:  https://archive.vn/sJvcB
notes_C5: Public transportation is operating.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210607215027/https://py.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information-2/

name: Palestine
notes_H1: Through government announcements.  https://archive.vn/60TFV
notes_H2: Gaza Strip: Since 1  December,  although testing  for  people displaying COVID-19  type  symptoms continues, those who  have been in contact with confirmed positive cases are only tested if they are above 50 yearsof age, and for younger people,only if they have known underlying health conditions    Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20210118165002/https://reliefweb.int/sites/reliefweb.int/files/resources/sitrep_25-17-30_dec_2020.pdf
notes_C7: closing is required for every governorate, city, town, village, camp, or area where infections with Coronavirus increases. The competent authorities must follow up and monitor the number and percentage of infections in the homeland.  Movement and movement of citizens and all kinds of transportation between cities, towns, villages and camps are prohibited daily from eight in the evening until six in the morning.  https://archive.vn/lWKxI  https://archive.vn/E25N0  https://archive.vn/tLPqc
notes_E2: https://reliefweb.int/sites/reliefweb.int/files/resources/sitrep_21_covid_19.pdf
notes_C2: Palestinian authorities released  some new restrictions on March 20, 2021. Shops will open with the tightening of preventive measures, restaurants operate at a rate of emergency at a rate of 30% and according to divergence procedures, while cafes operate according to delivery services only, and penalties will be tightened in the event that the prevention measures and safety measures stipulated in accordance with the protocols of the Ministry of Health are violated. The closure continues on Friday and Saturday of every week, with the exception of pharmacies and bakeries .  This decision takes effect from Sunday, March 21-2021 , and ends by the end of Saturday, corresponding to 3-4-2021.    https://archive.vn/60TFV  https://archive.vn/PkPSt  https://archive.vn/w1T04
notes_H3: All travellers arriving from abroad will be required to complete a 14 day quarantine. This may be shortened to 10 days upon completion of two negative coronavirus tests (one upon arrival and one after 9 days of quarantine).  https://archive.vn/8mJts
notes_C1: According to the new preventive measures adopted by the government to confront the "Corona" virus during the holy month of Ramadan, the government decided to reopen school hours in all public, private and private schools for the basic grades from the first grade to the sixth grade, in addition to the twelfth grade “Tawjihi” starting from 11/4/2021. And continues with the distance education system according to what it has prepared The Ministry of Education plans and programs for this purpose for the rest of the grades.  Continuing education electronically in educational institutions “universities and institutes” and allowing face-to-face education for first-year students of all specializations, postgraduate students, and students of practical, clinical and laboratory courses that require the presence of students in attendance.  https://archive.vn/lWKxI  https://archive.vn/tLPqc  https://archive.vn/PMqZi  https://archive.vn/E25N0
notes_H7: The targets in the first place medical staff, patients of cancer and kidney failure, and the elderly above 75 years of age.  Pfizer/BioNTech vaccine and  AstraZeneca vaccine are applied.  https://archive.vn/tGAuy  Recently, beside Pfizer and AstraZeneca vaccines there are also Sinopharm and Moderna applied.  https://archive.vn/V8PjM    New Targeted groups have also vaccinated:  On April 7  Ministry of Health  announced the vaccination of more than 12,500 educational staff in the West Bank within 3 days.  https://archive.vn/pP5rn     on April 1st the Ministry of Health said that it began , to vaccinate the families of prisoners in the Ramallah and Al-Bireh governorate, and that this group will be vaccinated in the rest of the governorates next week.  https://archive.vn/wPZrS
notes_C3: On March 13, 2021 the Palestinian government updated some measurements regarding to events.  It is prohibited in any case to hold weddings or revive parties of all kinds and types, or to hold funeral homes, festivals, gatherings or events for any reason and in any form throughout the nation . There was also a comprehensive closure of all governorates, as of Monday morning March 15-2021, for a period of five days.  https://archive.vn/PFJrq  https://archive.vn/HgUpG
notes_C8: All travelers arriving in Gaza must quarantine at government-run facilities for 21 days. The Rafah border crossing between Egypt and the Gaza Strip is operating.  https://archive.vn/i40hm    The land crossing between Jordan and the Occupied Palestinian Territories is currently closed except in very limited circumstances.  https://archive.vn/98f26
notes_C4: On March 13, 2021 the Palestinian government updated some measurements regarding to events.  It is prohibited in any case to hold weddings or revive parties of all kinds and types, or to hold funeral homes, festivals, gatherings or events for any reason and in any form throughout the nation . There was also a comprehensive closure of all governorates, as of Monday morning March 15-2021, for a period of five days.  https://archive.vn/PFJrq  https://archive.vn/HgUpG
notes_C6: On March 21, 2020 the Palestinian government announced that the movement and movement of citizens and transportation of all kinds are prohibited in cities, towns, villages and camps every day from seven in the evening until six in the morning. Curfew start form 19:00 pm to 06:00 am.     https://archive.vn/60TFV  https://archive.vn/PkPSt
notes_H6: Facemasks and social distancing are mandatory in public; violators may be fined. Please see: https://web.archive.org/web/20210405162051/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/438971/palestinian-territories-authorities-lift-covid-19-related-nightly-and-weekend-curfews-in-the-gaza-strip-beginning-feb-4-update-43
notes_H8: A full lockdown will be imposed in Palestine every Friday and Saturday and that lockdown will also be imposed every day of the week between 7 in the evening and 6 the next morning for the next two weeks, starting January 3rd.  Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20210118162351/https://english.wafa.ps/Pages/Details/122703
notes_C5: On March 21,2021 the Palestinian government announced that movement and movement of citizens and transportation of all kinds are prohibited in cities, towns, villages and camps every day from seven in the evening until six in the morning. The closure continues on Friday and Saturday of every week, with the exception of pharmacies and bakeries.    https://archive.vn/60TFV  https://archive.vn/PkPSt

name: Qatar
notes_H1: https://web.archive.org/web/20200528231507/https://twitter.com/MOPHQatar/status/1243993841935491074
notes_H2: No change in policy  https://archive.ph/3oXI6
notes_C7: The Qatari government announced a plan to lift COVID-19 restrictions in four phases. As of the 28th of May, restaurants, cafes, shopping centres, gyms, public parks, cinemas, museums, and libraries can open at 30 % capacity. The wearing of facemasks in the public is mandatory.   https://web.archive.org/web/20210531161612/https://covid19.moph.gov.qa/EN/Precautions-for-lifting-restrictions/Business-Leisure/Pages/Shopping-Malls.aspx
notes_E2: No change found  Duty relief  Customs duty exemption for food, medical equipment (COVID-19):the General Authority of Customs in addressing the effects of the coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic has issued a directive exempting food and medical equipment from customs duties for a period of six months  The exemption from customs duty applies for 905 different items listed in the customs clearance system. These included basic food items and a number of medical devices  https://web.archive.org/web/20210322234308/https://home.kpmg/xx/en/home/insights/2020/04/qatar-government-and-institution-measures-in-response-to-covid.html

notes_E1: No change found  https://web.archive.org/web/20210322234308/https://home.kpmg/xx/en/home/insights/2020/04/qatar-government-and-institution-measures-in-response-to-covid.html
notes_C1: No change found  The Qatari government announced a plan to lift COVID-19 restrictions in four phases. As of the 28th of May, offer hybrid learning with school capacity limited to 30 %.   https://web.archive.org/web/20210531123046/https://covid19.moph.gov.qa/EN/Precautions-for-lifting-restrictions/Educations-Health/Pages/New-Academic-Year.aspx
notes_H7: As of March 30, 2021, the ministry of public health has announced to lower the age threshold for vaccine eligibility to 40 years of age. More than 765,000 doses have been already administered to older people, those with chronic conditions, healthcare worker and other key essential workers.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210405160302/https://www.moph.gov.qa/english/mediacenter/News/Pages/NewsDetails.aspx?ItemId=352
notes_C3: No change found  The Qatari government announced a plan to lift COVID-19 restrictions in four phases. As of the 28th of May,’ Only selected professional sports events are allowed to take place. No spectators to be allowed in indoor venues, while capacity in outdoor venues will be limited to a maximum of 30% and to only vaccinated spectators.’  https://web.archive.org/web/20210531124253/https://covid19.moph.gov.qa/EN/Precautions-for-lifting-restrictions/Outdoor-Professional-Sports/Pages/Professional-Sports-Events.aspx
notes_C8: No change found  ‘Travelers to adhere to quarantine rules.’  https://web.archive.org/web/20210518070939/https://covid19.moph.gov.qa/EN/Precautions-for-lifting-restrictions/Transport/Pages/Flights-Travel.aspx
notes_C4: The Qatari government announced a plan to lift COVID-19 restrictions in four phases. As of June 18, social gatherings are limited to a maximum of 10 vaccinated people, or 5 unvaccinated people indoors. No more than 20 vaccinated people, or 10 unvaccinated people can gather outdoors.  Mosques to remain open for daily prayers and Friday prayers. Toilets and ablution areas will remain closed. Children under 7 years old are not allowed.  Up to 10 people are permitted to gather at parks and beaches. Playgrounds and exercise equipment remains closed. Private beaches operate at 40 % capacity.  Weddings are permitted at hotels and wedding venues for up to 40 people of which at least 75% need to be vaccinated.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210621104245/https://www.gco.gov.qa/en/preventative-measures/
