name: Somalia
notes_H1: The Somali health minister on Monday has warned that the COVID-19 situation in the Horn of African country is "dire" and called for strict adherence to health measures in fighting the disease.    Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20210308161949/https://www.aa.com.tr/en/africa/somali-government-warns-covid-19-situation-is-dire/2160417
notes_H2: Testing is available at the country’s major medical facilities (Digfeer Hospital, Medipark Diagnostics, Sahal Transit Transportation Clinic, Dur-Dur Clinic, Aden Adde International Airport Clinic, and other private hospitals).  The charge for the test is approximately USD 30 (SOS 17,500).    Anyone can access free, rapid lateral flow tests (LFDs) for themselves and their families to use twice a week, in line with clinical guidance.    https://archive.vn/KAkjo   https://web.archive.org/web/20210621214539/https://www.councilofsomaliorgs.com/
notes_C7: No information to suggest a change in policy.
notes_E2: No Evidence of Policy Change.   https://archive.vn/A0Avx
notes_C2: Hotels, restaurants, bars, and businesses are generally open but subject to strict hygiene and social distancing measures.     https://archive.vn/jAmkG
notes_H3: According to the US embassy website, Somali authorities have established a quarantine unit at Aden Adde International Airport (AAIA) in Mogadishu to isolate passengers who demonstrate symptoms of coronavirus.  http://web.archive.org/web/20200829182419/https://so.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C1: It is difficult to find official information on the state of education provision in Somalia. Reports from 21 March (https://archive.vn/QO6uw) indicated that schools would be closed until April 3rd, and there is no evidence that the policy was extended after that date.     Reuters data indicates that there are no school closure policies in effect - https://web.archive.org/web/20210425172500/https://graphics.reuters.com/world-coronavirus-tracker-and-maps/countries-and-territories/somalia/    Anecdotal evidence such as https://web.archive.org/web/20210425173846/https://twitter.com/FENPS04/status/1380423418475122690 indicates that schools are open.
notes_H7: Oxford-AstraZeneca vaccine is available in Somalia.  On March 15, the Somali government started to vaccinate frontline healthcare workers, individuals above the age of 50 years, and individuals with chronic health conditions.    https://archive.vn/KAkjo
notes_C3: No indication of policy change.   http://web.archive.org/web/20210322120805/https://www.aa.com.tr/en/latest-on-coronavirus-outbreak/covid-19-schools-shut-for-2-weeks-in-somalia/2153590  http://web.archive.org/web/20210322114336/https://sunatimes.com/articles/6221/Thousands-died-Covid-19-in-Somalia-and-deteriorating
notes_C8: COVID-19 tests are required for incoming passengers. Travelers who do not carry a COVID-19 negative test certificate taken within 96 hours must quarantine for 14 days after arrival in Somalia.  https://archive.vn/v7LZw
notes_C4: "The government has banned public gatherings citing the pandemic"  Can't find information on the number of people. Take this to mean gatherings in this size range are banned.    Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20210228121759/https://www.independent.co.uk/news/as-somalias-covid19-cases-surge-a-variant-is-suspected-somalia-covid-patients-people-coronavirus-b1807811.html
notes_C6: No Evidence of any measures found.    http://web.archive.org/web/20210322120805/https://www.aa.com.tr/en/latest-on-coronavirus-outbreak/covid-19-schools-shut-for-2-weeks-in-somalia/2153590  http://web.archive.org/web/20210322132246/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/somalia/coronavirus  http://web.archive.org/web/20210322132246/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/somalia/coronavirus
notes_H6: Somalia on Monday [1st March] made the face masks mandatory after rise in COVID-19 cases amid a deadlier second wave.  Omar Mohamud Mohamed Filish, mayor of Mogadishu, the largest and most populated city in the country, announced the use of face masks in all public places mandatory amid the rising numbers of coronavirus cases and deaths.    Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20210308152335/https://www.aa.com.tr/en/africa/somalia-deadlier-2nd-wave-makes-face-masks-mandatory/2160893
notes_H8: No specific measures beyond those afforded the general public found, and a recommendation from the Ministry of Health that the public "particularly provide special care for the elderly and persons with underlying health conditions." - https://web.archive.org/web/20210425183618/https://moh.nomadilab.org/2020/04/11/how-often-should-you-visit-your-midwife/https://web.archive.org/web/20210425183618/https://moh.nomadilab.org/2020/04/11/how-often-should-you-visit-your-midwife/
notes_C5: There are directives on the use of public transportation but it is on social distancing. The use of masks was not mentioned but social distancing.     Please see:   http://web.archive.org/web/20210530143308/https://reliefweb.int/sites/reliefweb.int/files/resources/FGS%20FMS%20directives_Update%205%20final_eo%204.pdf

name: Serbia
notes_H1: Government launches Coronavirus website: https://covid19.rs/
notes_H2: Citizens can schedule tests via official website.   http://web.archive.org/web/20210406190108/https://rs.usembassy.gov/serbia-covid-19-information/
notes_C7: Proposed to change coding to 0 - no evidence of limitation of internal movement found.    http://web.archive.org/web/20210315131251/https://rs.usembassy.gov/serbia-covid-19-information/
notes_E2: The Minister of Finance announced the deferral of payment of payroll taxes and contributions for all private companies during the state of emergency, and for a minimum of three months, deferral of payment of income tax for the second quarter of 2020 and exemption from VAT for all those who donate and deal with donations. Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200501000306/https://www.srbija.gov.rs/vest/en/152964/state-sets-aside-51b-to-mitigate-coronavirus-economic-blow.php
notes_C2: After the session of the team, Kisic Tepavcevic said that this means that restaurants and bars will work every day until midnight, indoors and outdoors alike, and this measure comes into force tomorrow.    She said that the last cinema screenings can start at 23.00, which is the time until when box offices can work too.    http://web.archive.org/web/20210606083836/https://www.srbija.gov.rs/vest/en/173505/relaxation-of-epidemiological-measures-as-of-tomorrow.php
notes_H3: Predrag Kon (head of the Infectious Diseases Unit of the City Institute of Public Health and government spokesperson on epidemiology): "some parts of the health care system will be severely burdened simply because it is necessary to trace all those contacts. In this case, fortunately, because of his self-isolation and his independent decision to quarantine, we do not have such a huge number [of cases]"  -> This indicates the presence of comprehensive contact tracing for the first contact.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200407232501/https://balkaninsight.com/2020/03/06/serbia-confirms-first-case-of-coronavirus/
notes_E1: A supplementary budget with new support measures was adopted in April 2021. New measures include: (i) wage subsidies, including payment of ½ of minimum wages for all entrepreneurs and employees in SMEs and large companies for three months (RSD 69.8 billion); (ii) additional payments for employees in travel, hospitality, and art (RSD 4.4 billion); (iii) universal cash transfer of EUR 60 to each citizen over 18 years old, paid in two installments of EUR 30 each—in May and November (RSD 43.2 billion);(iv) a one-off payment of EUR 50 to all pensioners (RSD 10 billion);(v)a one-off financial assistance of EUR 60 to all the unemployed, paid in June (RSD 4.3 billion); and (vi) support for the transport sector and for city hotels (RSD 3.9bn).    https://web.archive.org/web/20210524002614/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19
notes_C1: Pupils of higher grades of elementary school and secondary school students return to classrooms as of 19 April. Restrictions still apply to universities – not more than 100 people are allowed in closed spaces (amphitheaters, lecture halls, etc. ).    http://web.archive.org/web/20210419210329/https://www.srbija.gov.rs/vest/en/171183/children-to-return-to-classrooms-as-of-19-april.php  https://archive.vn/xKGVR
notes_H7: Every citizen of Serbia can come to any vaccination site in the country and get vaccinated without making an appointment.  Vaccines used: Pfizer-BioNTech, AstraZeneca, Sputnik V, and Sinopharm.    http://web.archive.org/web/20210425195428/https://www.srbija.gov.rs/vest/en/171456/vaccination-without-appointment-at-all-sites-as-of-today.php  https://web.archive.org/web/20210425193037/https://rs.usembassy.gov/serbia-covid-19-information/
notes_C3: "Event: Soccer clubs Partizan and Red Star will play on May 25, 2021 at 7:00 PM at Red Star stadium. This is a high-risk event because of animosity between supporters affiliated with both teams, and frequent clashes between them in and around the stadium. This match will be played without an audience, but fans may gather near the stadium prior to the match. Expect traffic congestion and enhanced police presence in the area and around the city."    There was  a football match on 25th May. However, the number of people at the gatherings   https://web.archive.org/web/20210422235302/http://www.osac.gov:80/Content/Search
notes_C8: I propose to code 1 - a negative PCR test is required for most foreginers (those non-vaccinated).   The exeptions are:  - people entering from North Macedonia, Albania, Hungary and Bulgaria, who do not require a negative PCR test before entering Serbia (according to US embassy website also Bosnia and Herzegovina, and Montenegro are in this category)  - foreign citizens with temporary or permanent residence in Serbia, who may enter without a negative PCR test and quarantine for 10 days.      http://web.archive.org/web/20210412184749/https://www.srbija.gov.rs/vest/en/170506/regime-of-entry-into-serbia-has-not-been-changed.php  http://web.archive.org/web/20210412173001/https://rs.usembassy.gov/serbia-covid-19-information/
notes_C4: Newsagents and kiosks can work 00–24, whereas business and scientific congresses indoors will be allowed to gather a maximum of 200 persons, she said, noting that the previous maximum was 100 persons.    http://web.archive.org/web/20210606083836/https://www.srbija.gov.rs/vest/en/173505/relaxation-of-epidemiological-measures-as-of-tomorrow.php
notes_C6: From 24 November, the Serbian government adopted new measures to suppress the epidemic caused by the COVID-19 infectious disease, whose implementation will begin on 24 November 2020. Including, but not limited to:  Strict control of the implementation of home isolation, house quarantine (self-isolation), as well as all other anti-epidemic measures in force.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201219200700/https://www.srbija.gov.rs/vest/en/163819/government-passes-new-anti-coronavirus-measures.php
notes_H6: "The use of face coverings is required in all indoor locations, as well as outdoors when required physical distancing is not possible, for example waiting in line to enter stores or at bus stops.  Face coverings are recommended elsewhere outdoors."    http://web.archive.org/web/20200921080116/https://rs.usembassy.gov/serbia-covid-19-information/
notes_H8: From the 19 December US Embassy update:  - Visits to elder-care homes are limited to 15 minutes.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201219180525/https://rs.usembassy.gov/serbia-covid-19-information/
notes_C5: Public transport is operating. Nevertheless, mask is madatory.    http://web.archive.org/web/20210603225612/https://rs.usembassy.gov/serbia-covid-19-information/

name: South Sudan
notes_H1: President Salva Kiir Addresses the Nation on COVID-19 (sharing prevention strategies with the public) Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200601142549/https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Wm_x0scA4KI https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Wm_x0scA4KI
notes_H2: COVID-19 testing is available for those with symptoms in South Sudan, however it is limited due to a shortage of testing kits. Travelers arriving in South Sudan will receive a test if they exhibit active signs of COVID-19 infection. COVID-19 testing is available through the South Sudan Rapid Response Team by calling 6666 or by presenting to a health facility.  COVID-19 testing is available but limited for outbound international travelers who need a negative COVID-19 certificate for arrival to their destination. The John Garang Infectious Disease Unit in Juba has 250 tests for travelers available per day. Testing is available 7 days a week, 9:00 a.m.-2:00 p.m. Tests require pre-registration the day before the test is to be administered; pre-registration is done in person at 7am at the testing facility. Results are available 1-2 days after testing. Testing is free of charge.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201209215506/https://ss.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C7: Interstate and intercity public transportation is fully operational.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210607175739/https://sd.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C2: no mention on any site - archived the primary ministry site for reference: https://web.archive.org/web/20210607175102/https://fmoh.gov.sd/
notes_H3: There is contact tracing but it is limited.    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20210322122509/https://moh.gov.ss/single_daily_report.php?report=March+20th+Update.pdf
notes_E1: 28 April policy change is incorrect as it reflects a World Bank policy. Therefore changing this indicator to 0.
notes_C1: Confirmed by UNICEF - schools have finally reopened as of May 26. https://web.archive.org/web/20210607165630/https://www.unicef.org/southsudan/stories/grateful-each-student-can-now-study-using-hisher-own-textbooks  & https://web.archive.org/web/20210607153911/https://news.un.org/en/story/2021/05/1091262
notes_H7: see note on 6/7/21
notes_C3: no mention on any site - archived the primary ministry site for reference: https://web.archive.org/web/20210607175102/https://fmoh.gov.sd/
notes_C8: "All passengers, excepted as stated in the following bullet point, must possess a certified negative polymerise chain reaction (PCR) test certificate dated within 96 hours of arrival. Persons 6 years old and younger are exempt."    "Effective immediately, the Sudanese Civil Aviation Authority passengers who originate from or transit through the UK, South Africa, and the Netherlands must possess a certified negative polymerise chain reaction test certificated dated within 72 hours of arrival.  These passengers are subject to a mandatory 14-day home quarantine."    https://web.archive.org/web/20210118162213/https://sd.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/

name: Suriname
notes_H1: On Saturday, March 14, 2020, the government held a press conference that extensively discussed the latest state of affairs regarding the outbreak of the COVID 19 virus in our country. Every day at 6 p.m., the community can count on the latest news.  /web/20200510055526/https://covid-19.sr/corona-in-suriname/
notes_H2: Testing is available also for non-symptomatic people. However, such tests are not free of charge. https://web.archive.org/web/20210612102402/https://sr.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C7: There are no restrictions on intercity or interstate travel.    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20200923123510/https://sr.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information
notes_E2: The period of six months for debt relief has expired and no new policy has been assessed in this matter.    http://web.archive.org/web/20210424131327/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19
notes_C2: "The following sectors are open to the public under strict adherence to protocols:  a. Restaurants and other commercial food preparation and delivery venues.  ? Take out; From Monday to Thursday, the collection is possible until 7:00 PM and delivery until 11:00 PM. On Friday, the collection is possible until 5 p.m.  ? Delivery; This can be done daily from 05:00 to 23:00. (So ??also on Saturday and Sunday)  ? Outdoor Dining; From Monday to Thursday, a terrace visit is possible until 19:00. On Friday, this is possible until 5 p.m.  b. Supermarkets, bakeries, pharmacies, drugstores, polyclinics, butchers, malls, clothing stores and other retail stores.  c. Recreation places; For these places, they can only admit people belonging to the same family, individuals or groups of a maximum of 5 people.   These groups of 5 must not be in contact with each other. Places that rent out lodges can do that to persons belonging to a family. Again, different families are not allowed to come together and must keep a strict distance. The general COVID19 measures must be observed at all times at the resorts."    https://archive.vn/kRVky
notes_H3: You should immediately call number 178. Then the investigation process starts.  • Test material is taken from the patient (preferably at home) and then the material is tested to AZP and CL.  • If a person does not need extra care, home quarantine takes place for 14 days (possibly with surveillance), provided the test is positive.  • If a patient has complaints, that patient is taken to AZP (Paramaribo) or MMC (Nickerie). These clinics have trained personnel (SARI) in taking samples for the lab. And the patient is transferred to the quarantine unit.  • Housemates of the suspect case must also stay home under surveillance during the incubation period.  • Treatment must be done according to protocol.   /web/20200510170255/https://covid-19.sr/covid-19/
notes_E1: "Persons who have lost their jobs as a result of the COVID-19 pandemic are eligible for benefits or loans through the COVID-19 Emergency Fund to meet their most urgent needs." Persons fired by their employer, persons who have no / less work and income, persons who demonstrably have income problems as a result of COVID-19, persons where the company where they work is closed or partially closed due to COVID-19 measures and the turnover of the company has decreased significantly are all entitled to receive SRD 1.500 (USD 105.98) after approval by the Dismissal Committee.    https://archive.vn/7qalK  https://web.archive.org/web/20210404090105/https://covid-19.sr/uitkering-aan-werklozen-gestart/
notes_C1: Schools remain closed since 1st April due to Easter Holiday anticipation. This closure is planned until 11th April.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210404080146/http://education.gov.sr/media/1333/bekendmaking-paasvakantie.pdf    https://web.archive.org/web/20210403230608/http://education.gov.sr/media/1329/bekendmaking-hervatting-onderwijsproces.pdf
notes_H7: The groups currently being vaccinated are:   "Group 1: Health workers , frontliners in Covid care  Group 2: Other health professionals  Group 3: Residents of retirement homes and dialysis patients  Group 4: Persons over 60 years of age and essential services  Group 5: Persons based on medical indication ( 40 - 59 years ) (Diabetes mellitus, hypertension, sickle cells, cardiovascular disease, chronic lung disease, cancer)  Group 6: Persons based on medical indication ( 18 - 39 years ) (Diabetes mellitus, hypertension, sickle cells, cardiovascular disease, chronic lung disease, cancer)  Group 7: Other risk groups (e.g. people with medical indications other than those mentioned above). "  The available vaccine in the country is the AstraZeneca.    http://web.archive.org/web/20210425140350/https://laatjevaccineren.sr/vaccineren/  http://web.archive.org/web/20210425140808/https://laatjevaccineren.sr/vaccin/
notes_C3: he Government of Suriname has announced that it is instituting a “total” lockdown that will last from 1800 on Thursday, June 4, until 0600 hours on Friday, June 12. This means that all residents of the country should stay at home except for short trips for essential needs.  Linkhttps://web.archive.org/web/20200611101527/https://www.osac.gov/Content/Report/feb64421-b9e6-477b-9a97-18e1807ac1d7
notes_C8: All international borders remain closed.   source: https://archive.vn/CivJf  "All commercial passenger flights are banned from entry, with only cargo flights and specially permitted repatriation flights allowed. Domestic flights are also restricted to cargo transport, repatriations, and emergency flights."  source:https://archive.vn/DlaJW
notes_C4: "Gathering: maximum 10 people. This also applies to funeral services"  https://web.archive.org/web/20210111204403/http://health.gov.sr/actueel/2020/overheid-verscherpt-covid-19-maatregelen/
notes_C6: A daily curfew, from 8pm to 5am, is still in place. It will remain in place until further announcement by the Government of Suriname.    Sources: http://web.archive.org/web/20200923123510/https://sr.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information  http://web.archive.org/web/20200923123650/https://sr.usembassy.gov/health-alert-u-s-embassy-paramaribo-suriname-35/
notes_H6: It is mandatory to wear a face mask outside.  https://sr.usembassy.gov/health-alert-u-s-embassy-paramaribo-suriname-31/
notes_H8: Curfew in place from 8 pm until 5 am daily. No additional measures for protecting the elderly or in long term care homes.  Source:  http://web.archive.org/web/20200923123510/https://sr.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C5: Public transportation is prohibited. https://web.archive.org/web/20210612102402/https://sr.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/

name: Slovak Republic
notes_H1: No reliable source found.
notes_H2: "Once travelers register with the Regional Office of Public Health upon entry, they will receive information about where to get tested after their fifth day of home quarantine. The Slovak government pays for COVID-19 testing in these cases. Once they receive negative test results, free movement in Slovakia is permitted.  Private testing is also available at www.lab.online.sk or www.medirex.sk in various locations throughout the country. If not ordered by the Regional Public Health Authority or a medical provider, the fee for testing is paid by the traveler. The standard cost is €50-€60."    https://web.archive.org/web/20200914173717/https://sk.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C7: Is public transportation is operating, but masks are required on all forms of public transportation. Taxi and ride sharing app services are available, and also require the use of FFP2/K95/N95 face masks; source: /web/20210524141227/https://sk.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_E2: The government announced the possibility to defer mortgage and loan repayments by 1 to 9 months for sole proprietors, small and medium-sized companies  medium-sized companies. In addition it also announced an automatic postponement of the deadline for filing a tax return until the end of the month following the end of the pandemic period.    https://web.archive.org/web/20200518210520/https://korona.gov.sk/pomoc-zamestnancom/
notes_C2: "Following the nationwide testing and curfew, the pandemic commission decided on lifting some measures that were imposed to fight the coronavirus.      As a result, cinemas, theatres and churches were open on November 16, while some sports competitions were given a green light, although without spectators. On the other hand, restaurants, hotels and also schools remain closed for now."    Source: The Slovak Spectator, an independent English-language newspaper     http://web.archive.org/web/20201130220822/https://spectator.sme.sk/c/22536069/coronavirus-in-slovakia-measures-in-place-after-november-16.html
notes_E1: No update; source: https://web.archive.org/web/20210511104044/https://www.pomahameludom.sk/
notes_C1: partially open; source: /web/20210524101957/https://en.unesco.org/covid19/educationresponse
notes_H7: On April 29, 2021, the virtual waiting room for vaccination opened for everyone in Slovakia older than 16 (included).  https://web.archive.org/web/20210510104958/https://spectator.sme.sk/c/22560478/when-will-i-get-my-covid-vaccine-faqs-about-vaccination-in-slovakia.html
notes_C3: People will be allowed to travel from 8:00 p.m. to 1:00 a.m. only to work or to see a doctor, while all currently valid exceptions from the limits on movement will be effective only between 5:00 a.m. and 8:00 p.m. source: /web/20210524135612/https://www.reuters.com/article/us-health-coronavirus-slovakia-idUSKCN2AS0QS; Cultural and sports events scrapped, tourist attractions closed; source: /web/20210524140419/https://spectator.sme.sk/c/22354110/coronavirus-sports-and-cultural-events-cancelled-in-slovakia.html
notes_C8: With effect from 20 June 2020 (06:00), persons arriving in Slovakia from 25 health-safe countries can enjoy unrestricted crossing of borders. Persons arriving in Slovakia from countries other than health-safe countries continue to be required to prove themselves by a 96-hour-old negative test for COVID-19.    http://web.archive.org/web/20200625232503/https://korona.gov.sk/karantenne-opatrenia/
notes_C4: 1 January 2021     From January the 1st, under the partial lockdown restrictions, family units are not allowed to mix with others from outside of the household.   https://web.archive.org/web/20210118155140/https://sk.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/     Due to the rising number of COVID-19 cases people were no longer allowed to form bubbles after 1 January 2021. While the decree that sets out the rules for movement and gatherings since 1 January does not explicitly ban gatherings. The rules governing the movement of people are strict and make it nearly impossible for people to gather without breaking any of the movement restrictions.   https://web.archive.org/web/20210125115028/https://www.slov-lex.sk/pravne-predpisy/SK/ZZ/2020/453/20201231      At the same time, the limit for people attending christenings, funerals and weddings remains at 6, see:     https://web.archive.org/web/20210114175952/http://www.minv.sk/swift_data/source/verejna_sprava/vestnik_vlady_sr_rok_2021/ciastka_2_2021.pdf
notes_C6: "Slovakia will shut most of its schools and require the population to stay home apart from work, essential shopping and nature trips, in a partial lockdown to slow the spread of the coronavirus"  https://web.archive.org/web/20201029225257if_/https://www.reuters.com/article/idUSKBN2772PF
notes_H6: Several measures will be lifted from 19 April 2021 as the country will switch to the dark red tier of its Covid automat alert system:  - All shops and services can reopen, with 1 customer per 15 square metres; customers must show a negative Covid test no older than 7 days to enter.  - It will be possible to travel between districts - travellers must have a negative Covid test no older than 7 days.  - Church services will be allowed, with one person per 15 square metres and a negative test no older than 7 days.  - Swimming pools can reopen for no more than 6 people, with a negative test no older than 7 days.  - Hotels will be opened for people from one household or a maximum of 2 adults per room, and a negative test no older than 7 days. Restaurants in hotels will remain closed.  - Museums, zoos and botanical gardens will reopen for individual excursions and visitors with a negative test no older than 7 days, with 1 person per 15 square metres.  - Libraries will open for no more than 6 people.  - People will still be required to wear masks and FFP2 respirators both outside and inside public buildings. Masks outside will not be obligatory as long as people are more than five metres apart or they live together in one household. Teachers and pupils do not have to wear a respirator, only a mask.  - Home office will be recommended, not mandatory.  - The schools will follow the regional alert system from April 26.  - The regime at the borders and conditions of obligatory quarantine will change.    http://web.archive.org/web/20210419194702/https://spectator.sme.sk/c/22637661/measures-will-be-lifted-from-april-19-what-will-open.html?ref=njctse  http://web.archive.org/web/20210419193643/https://sk.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_H8: no sound data source found
notes_C5: From the 3rd of June, it will be possible to turn on the air conditioning for the customer. Customers have been told to ride in the back seat previously with no air-conditioning. The mandatory 15-minute break between journeys is also canceled. Disinfection of the vehicle premises will continue to be required.    Please see: http://web.archive.org/web/20200629151131/http://www.uvzsr.sk/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=4328%3Auvz-sr-pristupujeme-knaliemu-vyraznemu-uvoovaniu-opatreni&catid=250%3Akoronavirus-2019-ncov&Itemid=153#

name: Slovenia
notes_H1: COVID-19 Website  Link: https://www.gov.si/en/topics/coronavirus-disease-covid-19/    Coronavirus: Preparedness and measures in Slovenia and COVID-19 Helpline  Link: https://www.gov.si/en/topics/coronavirus-disease-covid-19/koronavirus-preparedness-and-measures-in-slovenia/    Coronavirus: Preventing infections  Link: https://www.gov.si/en/topics/coronavirus-disease-covid-19/coronavirus-preventing-infections/    Coronavirus: Symptoms of infection and treatment  Link: https://www.gov.si/en/topics/coronavirus-disease-covid-19/coronavirus-symptoms-of-infection-and-treatment/    Government measures  Link: https://www.gov.si/en/topics/coronavirus-disease-covid-19/government-measures/    Recommendations for washing hands cough etiquette  Link: https://www.gov.si/assets/vlada/Koronavirus-zbirno-infografike-vlada/Infografike/Anglescina/Recommendations-for-washing-hands-Cough-etiquette.pdf    Quotation: So far Slovenia has prepared hospital isolation rooms and urged citizens to be particularly careful with hygiene. Many hospitals have prohibited or limited visitations in recent days. (4th March 2020)  Link: https://www.reuters.com/article/us-health-coronavirus-slovenia-idUSKBN20R33X    COVID-19 Press Conference: Official updates on the occurrence of the coronavirus infection (7 March 2020)  Link: gov.si/en/news/2020-03-07-official-updates-on-the-occurrence-of-the-coronavirus-infection/    Latest information about coronavirus (Covid-19) in Slovenia (9 March 2020)  Link: https://www.gov.si/en/news/2020-03-09-latest-information-about-coronavirus-covid-19-in-slovenia/    Quotation: The National Institute of Public Health (NIJZ) has drafted a leaflet with key information about the coronavirus, which will be distributed to all Slovenian households via the Post of Slovenia (10 March 2020)  Link: https://www.gov.si/en/news/2020-03-10-measures-to-contain-the-spread-of-coronavirus-are-in-force/
notes_H2: Testing is available for both foreign nationals and Slovenians.  No appointment is required for the rapid antigen tests (RAT), and they are available throughout the country, including Ljubljana airport.  For the PCR test, available at the Ljubljana Clinical Center, an appointment is required, but is usually available within a day.  For foreign nationals, cost for RAT is 25-30 euro; cost for PCR is 93 euro.  Results for both tests will be provided to you electronically within 24 hours.     Link: https://archive.vn/QeWgS
notes_C7: There is no curfew, intercity and interstate restriction in Slovenia.     http://web.archive.org/web/20210521084649/https://si.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_E2: As part of an economic stimulus package of € 1 billion (2.2 percent of GDP) announced on March 9, the authorities have adopted some tax and spending measures, including (i) tax deferrals for up to 24 months or tax payments in installments in 24 months; (ii) wage subsidies for suspended workers due to pandemic-related closures and quarantined people as at July 22 and before.   Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20200730012123/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19
notes_C2: The offering and sale of catering and accommodation services to consumers is only allowed provided that employees who offer and sell catering and accommodation services are tested once a week with a SARS-CoV-2 RAT or PCR test and have a negative test result. Testing is not necessary if they have a certificate proving that the have recovered from the illness or that they have been vaccinated.   The preparation and service of food and drinks in accomodation facility is permitted in all statistical regions between 5:00 and 22:00.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210607211916/https://www.gov.si/en/topics/coronavirus-disease-covid-19/measures-to-contain-the-spread-of-covid-19-infections/
notes_H3: Infected people are ought to call epidemiologists so that they would be able to start contact tracing. There is also an application for this. However the level of cases has exceeded the capacity at which tracing is occuring.    http://web.archive.org/web/20210607203654/https://si.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_E1: No change found.   On February 3, 2021, an eight package (EUR 320 mn) was approved, which extends the furlough till April and the short-time work scheme till June. The wage subsidy under the furlough was increased from 80 to 100 per cent under certain conditions. In addition, the government will cover part of the minimum wage increase for affected businesses and will pay one-off allowances to certain vulnerable groups:    https://web.archive.org/web/20210517132036/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19
notes_C1: Classes for primary and secondary school students are to be held on school premises.  Activities in secondary schools are running according to Model B, i.e. on school or other educational institution premises, and students can stay in residential facilities full time. All classes at higher vocational colleges can be conducted face-to-face. There are no changes regarding mask-wearing and employee testing.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210607211916/https://www.gov.si/en/topics/coronavirus-disease-covid-19/measures-to-contain-the-spread-of-covid-19-infections/
notes_H7: A, B, C. Pfizer/Biotech vaccine, AstraZeneca, Moderna and Janssen.    Increased vaccine supply has accelerated the vaccination of the population. Slovenia has administered at least 1,324,824 doses of COVID vaccines so far. Assuming every person needs 2 doses, that’s enough to have vaccinated about 31.7% of the country’s population. By the end of June, Slovenia should therefore reach the target of 60-per cent vaccination coverage of the entire population.   https://archive.fo/gQbVv  https://web.archive.org/web/20210607200609/https://www.gov.si/en/news/2021-06-03-the-zvem-web-portal-as-main-access-point-to-acquire-a-digital-covid-certificate/
notes_C3: The governement is relaxing restrictions on sports and culture. Participants are to submit a negative COVID 19 test result or a certificate of vaccination or evidence proving they have aready recovered from COVID 19. At the cenet, 50 per cent seating capacity limit applies. The number of persons in the event is limited to one participant per 10 square metres. Spectators must wear protective face masks at sports events and in enclosed public space.    http://web.archive.org/web/20210423192345/https://www.slovenia.info/en/plan-your-trip/all-you-need-to-know-for-a-healthy-and-safe-vacation-in-slovenia
notes_C8: - A negative PCR test for COVID-19 that is not older than 48 hours  - Certificate of positive result of a PCR test that is older than 10 days and not older than six months, or medical certificate of recovery from COVID-19  - Certificate of vaccination against COVID-19    If these conditions can not be pplied, quarantine is obligatory.    http://web.archive.org/web/20210423192345/https://www.slovenia.info/en/plan-your-trip/all-you-need-to-know-for-a-healthy-and-safe-vacation-in-slovenia  http://web.archive.org/web/20210521091314/https://www.gov.si/en/topics/coronavirus-disease-covid-19/border-crossing/
notes_C4: "he Government also decided that from Saturday, 15 May, attending events and gatherings is allowed with up to a maximum of 50 participants."    http://web.archive.org/web/20210515222235/https://www.gov.si/en/news/2021-05-13-government-complements-the-plan-for-the-release-of-covid-measures/
notes_C6: There is neither curfew nor restriction on intercity and interstate travel in Slovenia according to the US Embassy in Slovenia. But passengers are ought to wear face masks.     https://web.archive.org/web/20210517133015/https://si.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_H6: Mask or other forms of protection covering mouth and nose are mandatory: in all closed public spaces, on public transport, in open public spaces or outside and in personal vehicles.  Masks or other forms of protection covering mouth and nose are not compulsory for: children younger than six years of age; pupils in primary schools and students in secondary schools but only when they are in their classrooms; preschool teachers and their assistants when they interact with children, primary school teachers up to and including the fifth grade when they interact with children or pupils; teachers at higher vocational colleges and universities if they lecture behind a protective barrier made of glass or similar material; persons practising individual sports if a distance of at least three metres is maintained; persons or members of the same household when taking a walk on green spaces or practising sports or recreational activities if a distance of at least three metres is maintained at all times; in personal vehicles when more than one person or member of the same household is in the vehicle.     https://archive.vn/oiqSn
notes_H8: Partial lockdown introduced:  "Restrictions of movement  Under the Ordinance, for the purpose of prevention of the spread of the infectious disease known as COVID-19, movement is restricted between 9.00 p.m. and 6.00 a.m., except in the following cases:   averting imminent danger to health, life or property, travel to and from work and the performance of urgent work-related tasks, access to and provision of emergency services."  http://web.archive.org/web/20210318150356/https://www.gov.si/en/news/2020-10-19-prohibition-of-gatherings-of-more-than-six-people-and-restriction-of-movement-between-9-00-p-m-and-6-00-a-m/
notes_C5: There is neither curfew nor restriction on intercity and interstate travel in Slovenia according to the US Embassy in Slovenia. But passengers are ought to wear face masks. From 23 April 2021, the restriction on movement between statistical regions has been lifted; movement between all statistical regions is now permitted.     https://archive.vn/Z54UT   https://web.archive.org/web/20210517133015/https://si.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/

name: Sweden
notes_H1: On the 4th of March, FHM, together with the National Board of Health and Welfare (Socialstyrelsen) and the Swedish Civil Contingencies Agency (Myndigheten för Samhällsskydd och Beredskap, MSB), begins their daily press conferences every weekday at 14.00 in the afternoon on weekdays. These daily conferences are broadcast live by all major media organisations in Sweden and watched by millions of Swedish viewers every day. It is used as the government's main information output regarding the covid-situation in Sweden.     The official decision to make them daily affairs was made by the Government on the 5th of March: "FHM is given the task to develop their coordination and information efforts ... by various channels and at daily press briefings"    https://web.archive.org/web/20200304012811/https:/www.folkhalsomyndigheten.se/smittskydd-beredskap/utbrott/aktuella-utbrott/covid-19/riskbedomning/
notes_H2: The Government announced that it would provide free testing for anyone showing coronavirus symptoms, and conduct contact tracing for those who are infected.   https://archive.vn/wip/LpKn5
notes_C7: In force from 14 December, the Public Health Agency replaced its regional advice with national regulations and general advice, in light of the upcoming Christmas holidays. This means that previous regional advice that explicit recommended against internal travel is no longer in force. I have not changed the code (only from T to G), because the new nation-wide advice, though less explicit compared to the regional advice, still seeks to limit travel incl travel between regions, e.g. "think through whether planned trips are really necessary to carry out".     https://web.archive.org/web/20201214164556/https://www.folkhalsomyndigheten.se/smittskydd-beredskap/utbrott/aktuella-utbrott/covid-19/skydda-dig-och-andra/jul-och-andra-hogtider/
notes_E2: No change:  http://web.archive.org/web/20210409194349/https://www.forsakringskassan.se/english/the-coronavirus-covid-19---applicable-regulations
notes_C2: Coded as 1 to reflect that even though they are open, there are still restrictions in place for almost all workplaces which limit the number of visitors/customers.    From 1 June, all workplaces can open again in some capacity. Until then, amusement parks of a permanent nature and amusement facilities (rides) in zoos and theme parks had been covered by the ban on public gatherings, requiring them to remain closed, but these now fall under the regulations that require them to calculate the maximum number of visitors so that each visitor has at least 20m².    Shops, gyms, indoor sports facilities, and swimming facilities must calculate the number of visitors so that each person gets at least 10m². They must have clear signage that clarifies for visitors how many people may visit the premises at the same time.    Restaurants, cafés and bars can, from 1 June, be open until 22.30 and alcohol can be served until 22.00. Takeaway of food and of non-alcoholic drinks is allowed later than that.  The size of a dining party allowed to sit at one table is limited to four people. If a party is larger, they must be divided between several tables with at least one metre between them.  Venues serving food and drink have to implement hygiene measures incl the prevention of crowding.     http://web.archive.org/web/20210604185413/https://www.folkhalsomyndigheten.se/smittskydd-beredskap/utbrott/aktuella-utbrott/covid-19/verksamheter/tillsynsvagledning-for-verksamheter/    http://web.archive.org/web/20210604185422/https://www.krisinformation.se/en/hazards-and-risks/disasters-and-incidents/2020/official-information-on-the-new-coronavirus/restriktioner-och-forbud
notes_H3: Report from 23 March suggest that Public Health Agency thinks that contact tracing would no longer be as effective and have shifted resources to focus on risk groups. The official government website as on 05 April stated that contact tracing is the responsibility of the doctors treating covid-19, and news sources indicated that some form of tracing was ongoing. Sources: 1. https://web.archive.org/web/20200406132606/https://www.thelocal.se/20200320/fact-check-has-sweden-stopped-testing-people-for-the-coronavirus 2. https://web.archive.org/web/20200406132712/https://www.thelocal.se/20200313/what-you-need-to-know-about-the-coronavirus-outbreak-in-sweden-your-questions-answered 3. https://web.archive.org/web/20200406132847/https://www.folkhalsomyndigheten.se/the-public-health-agency-of-sweden/communicable-disease-control/covid-19/  Other news reports seems to suggest that contact tracing has since been stopped as it is no longer considered effective or practical. However, this could not be verified officially.  Source:https://web.archive.org/web/20200423094726/https://www.thelocal.se/20200421/the-swedish-words-weve-learned-during-the-coronavirus-outbreak
notes_E1: Quotation: "To reduce the risk of the virus spreading in society, the qualifying day for sick pay will be discontinued between 11 March and 31 May, in that central government will pay sickness benefit for the first day of sickness.    Central government will temporarily assume responsibility for sick pay for two months."  Link: https://www.government.se/press-releases/2020/03/crisis-package-for-swedish-businesses-and-jobs/
notes_C1: Schools are open, but principals of upper secondary schools (gymnasieskolor) have the possibility to switch to distance learning if necessary based on the local conditions, which will typically be reflected in regional recommendations.    http://web.archive.org/web/20210531152756/https://www.skolverket.se/regler-och-ansvar/coronaviruset-och-covid-19---regler-for-skolor-och-forskolor/coronaviruset---fragor-och-svar-utifran-skollagstiftningen    http://web.archive.org/web/20210531152729/https://www.folkhalsomyndigheten.se/smittskydd-beredskap/utbrott/aktuella-utbrott/covid-19/verksamheter/information-till-skola-och-forskola-om-den-nya-sjukdomen-covid-19/    Code changed from 1T to 0 because regions which had stricter restrictions in place did not extend these with regard to schools.
notes_H7: All regions now appear to be in Phase 4 (all adults, offered in a staggered way, opening up to five-year age groups at a time): everyone over 50 (and in many regions younger than that, too) is now eligible to get vaccinated.     Details per region:   http://web.archive.org/web/20210604185515/https://www.thelocal.se/20210414/where-is-the-vaccination-programme-up-to-in-swedens-21-regions/  http://web.archive.org/web/20210604185525/https://www.krisinformation.se/detta-kan-handa/handelser-och-storningar/20192/myndigheterna-om-det-nya-coronaviruset/regional-information-om-coronaviruset    Type of vaccine: Pfizer, Moderna, AstraZeneca    - Details on delivery of the 3 vaccines in use: http://web.archive.org/web/20210604185803/https://www.folkhalsomyndigheten.se/smittskydd-beredskap/utbrott/aktuella-utbrott/covid-19/statistik-och-analyser/leveranser-av-vaccin/  - The use of the Janssen vaccin is suspended for all age groups. "The vaccine is not recommended for people under 65, and those over 65 will have received other vaccines before Janssen's vaccine can be delivered." http://web.archive.org/web/20210507150759/https://www.krisinformation.se/nyheter/20212/april2/fortsatt-paus-for-janssens-vaccin   - The recommendation to only use AstraZeneca for people over 65 remains: http://web.archive.org/web/20210507150801/https://www.folkhalsomyndigheten.se/nyheter-och-press/nyhetsarkiv/2021/april/rekommendation-om-aldersgrans-pa-65-ar-for-astrazenecas-vaccin-kvarstar/   But anyone under the age of 65 who has already received a first dose of Astra Zeneca's vaccine can also receive their second dose of the same vaccine if they specifically request it. The recommendation to offer the mRNA vaccine as a second dose still applies. http://web.archive.org/web/20210507150836/https://www.folkhalsomyndigheten.se/nyheter-och-press/nyhetsarkiv/2021/april/tillatet-att-valja-astra-zeneca-for-de-yngre-som-tidigare-fatt-en-forsta-dos/      Vaccinations are still taking place:  http://web.archive.org/web/20210603070741/https://www.folkhalsomyndigheten.se/smittskydd-beredskap/utbrott/aktuella-utbrott/covid-19/statistik-och-analyser/statistik-over-registrerade-vaccinationer-covid-19/
notes_C3: Coded as 1 to reflect that some public events can take place, but that significant restrictions remain in place.      From 1 June, the rules on maximum numbers of participants in general gatherings and public events have changed:   - For indoor events with designated seating, the limit was raised to 50 participants. For indoor events without designated seating, the limit remains at 8 participants.   - For outdoor events with designated seating, the number of participants was increased to 500 people. For outdoor events without designated seating, the limit was raised to 100 people.  - At outdoor sports and competition events, such as races, the number of participants was increased to 150 people.  - The Public Health Agency has the opportunity to decide on lowered participation ceilings regionally.     http://web.archive.org/web/20210604185436/https://www.krisinformation.se/en/news/2021/may/adapted-restrictions-to-be-introduced-1-june     http://web.archive.org/web/20210604185429/https://www.folkhalsomyndigheten.se/smittskydd-beredskap/utbrott/aktuella-utbrott/covid-19/skydda-dig-och-andra/max-antal-deltagare-i-sammankomster-och-i-olika-lokaler/
notes_C8: On the 2nd of March, the government revoked Iran Air's permission to land airplanes in Sweden, effectively banning direct travel between Iran and Sweden. This is in wake of a major outbreak in Iran and fears of international spread.     https://web.archive.org/web/20210614163945/https://transportstyrelsen.se/sv/Nyhetsarkiv/2020/stopp-for-flygningar-mellan-sverige-och-iran-pa-grund-av-coronavirus/
notes_C4: On 24 Nov, a new ban on public gatherings over 8 people came into effect. For private gatherings, people are "strongly recommended" to follow the regulations for public gatherings.     https://web.archive.org/web/20201130190632/https://www.krisinformation.se/en/hazards-and-risks/disasters-and-incidents/2020/official-information-on-the-new-coronavirus/restriktioner-och-forbud
notes_C6: FT. As of 25 Mar.  "Swedish authorities have banned public gatherings of more than 500 people, closed universities and higher education colleges, and advised workers to stay at home if possible."     Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20200523152613/https://www.ft.com/content/31de03b8-6dbc-11ea-89df-41bea055720b
notes_H6: In the region of Västra Götaland, from 17 February, disposable masks have to be worn on public transport at all times, not just during rush hours, as well as in situations where close contact, e.g. for extended periods of time in an indoor environment, is unavoidable.  Although this is still a mere recommendation, it is a much stronger one than the mask recommendation elsewhere in the country (limited to rush hours on public transport), so I have coded it as 2T to reflect the policy change as a result of which in practice, in this region, people will be wearing masks much more often than before.   https://web.archive.org/web/20210217212115/https://www.vgregion.se/aktuellt/nyhetslista/nya-regionala-rekommendationer-i-vastra-gotaland/  ***Updated to add note that policy language seems stronger than a recommendation
notes_H8: ***Updated to further explain code shift - Överkalix municipality had a ban on visits from 24 February 2021 to 9 March 2021. Ban is up so switch from 3T to 2G https://web.archive.org/web/20210226210115/https://www.folkhalsomyndigheten.se/smittskydd-beredskap/utbrott/aktuella-utbrott/covid-19/information-till-varden/personal-inom-aldreomsorg/lokala-besoksforbud-pa-aldreboenden/lista-pa-kommuner/  The general recommendations for visitors of elderly homes include:  - Do not visit if you have symptoms of covid-19, even mild symptoms. - Before the visit - talk to the staff about what applies to the specific nursing home. - During the visit - wash your hands, and even if the person you are visiting is vaccinated, you need to keep your distance from other residents, and also from the staff. http://web.archive.org/web/20210312201038/https://www.folkhalsomyndigheten.se/publicerat-material/publikationsarkiv/f/forebygg-smittspridning-av-covid-19-vid-besok-pa-sarskilda-boenden-for-aldre/
notes_C5: "On April 1, Swedish Public Health Agency expanded guidance for individuals and organizations to comply with Sweden’s Law on the Prevention of the Spread of Infectious Diseases:  - Public transport companies should limit the number of passengers and adapt their schedules to avoid crowds."  Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20201112192626/https://se.usembassy.gov/covid-19-coronavirus-information/

name: Eswatini
notes_H1: Swazi government has a dedicated spokesperson, advisories, public info/guidance on COVID-19. Since the government does actually start messaging on Coronavirus after this day (e.g. https://web.archive.org/web/20200302152522/https:/twitter.com/EswatiniGovern1/status/1234481721447452672), 2 is maintained as coding; https://web.archive.org/web/20200229191745/https:/twitter.com/EswatiniGovern1/status/1233771535556579330
notes_H2: The Ministry of Health wishes to emphasize that the definition of a suspect case has  changed due to the fact that Eswatini has an established local transmission. This means all flu-like illnesses must be considered suspect cases of Coronavirus infection hence the public is encouraged to seek health care as soon as they can. https://web.archive.org/web/20200611234729/http://www.gov.sz/images/CORONA/Health-statement-5-May-COVID19.pdf
notes_C7: Movement Restrictions:  •	Is a curfew in place? Yes. Non essential traveling between 8PM and 4AM is prohibited.  •	Are there restrictions on intercity or interstate travel? Yes. There are roadblocks between cities where temperatures are checked.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210426131959/https://sz.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_E2: No change - Revenue measures to mitigate the impact of the virus include: (i) taxpayers projecting losses will file loss provisional returns and no payment will be required; (ii) extension of returns filing deadlines by 3 months before penalties kick-in; (iii) payment arrangements for taxpayers facing cash flow problems; (iv) waiver of penalties and interest for older tax debts if principal is cleared by the end of September 2020; and (v) up to E90 million (0.13 percent of GDP) in tax refunds for SMEs that have complied with tax obligations, retain employees, and continue to pay them during this period.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210426125901/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19
notes_C2: As of August 28th, the July 3rd PM statement is still the most recent on the SZ gov website. Per that statement, as of July 13 Casinos, cinemas, gyms, health and beauty spas and auctioneers have been allowed to open subject to hygienic measures.     In further research, I could not find any evidence that other businesses are still closed.     http://web.archive.org/web/20200716175048/http://www.gov.sz/images/CORONA/PM-statement-3-July-2020-final.pdf
notes_H3: Contact tracing is being done for all suspected cases in all regions. Contact tracing kiosks have been established in selected areas.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210529055555/http://www.gov.sz/images/CORONA/ESWATINI_COVID-19-SITREP_-12.05.2021.pdf
notes_E1: Government is also continuing with compensatory relief to workers who suffered loss of earnings as a result of being laid off due to the devastating effects of COVID-19.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210228231850/https://translate.googleapis.com/translate_static/css/translateelement.css
notes_C1: Schools are fully open with regulations in place. Regular screenings are occurring. in educational facilities. No updates regarding rotational approach to school attendance.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210529063116/https://en.unesco.org/covid19/educationresponse    https://web.archive.org/web/20210529055555/http://www.gov.sz/images/CORONA/ESWATINI_COVID-19-SITREP_-12.05.2021.pdf
notes_H7: According to the APM Statement of 23 April, health workers, the elderly and people with co-morbidities have taken the COVID-19 vaccine jab over the past few weeks. Phase 1 of the vaccination exercise using the first batch of the AstraZeneca vaccine has been high paced and very successful. https://web.archive.org/web/20210426132544/http://www.gov.sz/images/APM-Statement-23-April-2021.pdf
notes_C3: Gatherings remain prohibited except for funerals, community meetings, weddings, professional low-contact sports and religious services. Gatherings are limited to 2 hours, with a maximum of 100 people.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210426131739/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/eswatini/coronavirus
notes_C8: Specific conditions must be met in order to enter Eswatini:    A COVID-19 test must be performed no more than 72 hours before departure and you must be able to demonstrate a negative test result on entry  Upon arriving in Eswatini, you will be screened for COVID-19 symptoms and asked about your country of origin and any transit stops  If you do not present a negative COVID-19 result on entry, or if you display COVID-19 symptoms, you will be required to take a COVID-19 test on arrival at your own cost  You may be required to undergo a quarantine period not exceeding 14 days, or isolation as advised by the port health officers  https://web.archive.org/web/20210104091520/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/eswatini/entry-requirements
notes_C4: Gatherings for funerals, community meetings, weddings, professional low-contact sports, entertainment and religious services are permitted. Gatherings are limited to 2 hours. The maximum number of people permitted at an outdoor entertainment event has been increased to 500. For an indoor event, the limit will be 300 people, considering the size of the venue and social distancing protocols.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210529061434/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/eswatini/coronavirus
notes_C6: Non-essential gatherings such as for funerals, community meetings, weddings, professional low-contact sports, entertainment and religious services are now permitted with restrictions.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210529061434/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/eswatini/coronavirus
notes_H6: It is compulsory to wear a mask everywhere, even when travelling alone in a vehicle. There is a requirement for 1.5 metres of social distance with others.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210322080913/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/eswatini/coronavirus
notes_H8: No advice specific to the elderly found - interpreted from other restrictions in place.
notes_C5: No known change from the March 18th statement from Acting Prime Minister, Themba Nhlanganiso Masuku.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210529060118/http://www.gov.sz/images/CORONA/Health-Statement-Vaccines-update-27-May-2021.pdf

name: Seychelles
notes_H1: https://web.archive.org/save/https://data.humdata.org/dataset/acaps-covid19-government-measures-dataset, General recommendations for social distancing and hygienic practices.
notes_H2: Tests widely available with results available within 48 hours. Cost is borne by the patient.   https://web.archive.org/web/20210614161951/https://mu.usembassy.gov/covid-19-seychelles/
notes_C7: Recommended to limit movement outside of the home, but no restrictions on internal movement in place.   https://web.archive.org/web/20210614161951/https://mu.usembassy.gov/covid-19-seychelles/
notes_E2: The CBS also announced that commercial banks, the Development Bank of Seychelles (DBS) and the Seychelles Credit Union have agreed to consider a moratorium of six months on the repayment of principal and interest on loans to assist businesses in impacted sectors.    https://web.archive.org/web/20200608135237/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19  https://www.cbs.sc/Downloads/covid19/PolicyMeasures/Press%20Conference%20Presentation%20-%20Private%20Sector%20Relief%20Scheme.pdf (Not archivable)
notes_C2: Earlier closure of bars and casinos at 7pm  Closure of all shops at 7pm    https://web.archive.org/web/20210524201648if_/https://www.facebook.com/mohseychellesofficial/photos/a.666791056855362/1735744449960012/
notes_H3: Contact tracing and testing by the Seychellois authorities will begin on Monday 15 March. Members of the public are reassured that public health officials have begun contact tracing, the process of identification of all persons who may have come into contact with an infected person and, to continue to follow the guidelines advocated by the Department of Health.     https://web.archive.org/save/http://www.health.gov.sc/index.php/2020/03/16/seychelles-records-first-cases-of-covid-19/    https://web.archive.org/web/20200408225720/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/seychelles/coronavirus
notes_E1: In April 2020, the government has announced a measure - The Financial Assistance for Job Retention (FA4JR) program – to subsidize wages for companies facing distress caused by COVID-19. From July, Seychelles Employee Transition Scheme (SETS) was set up to facilitate the reskilling and placement in an economic activity of persons made redundant as a result of COVID-19. This program works alongside the wage subsidy to aid the transition to a post-COVID economy. Initially planned to last 3 months, wage subsidy has been fully extended to February 2021. In March 2021, it will be phased out by reducing the scope of beneficiaries and fully abolished as of April 2021.  https://archive.vn/GCYPM
notes_C1: Schools closed.  https://archive.ph/P3FhQ  https://web.archive.org/web/20210614161951/https://mu.usembassy.gov/covid-19-seychelles/
notes_H7: No policy change.   A, B, C: Sinopharm and AZ.    Vaccination began in January. After those on the front line were vaccinated, the elderly were given priority. The shots are given in hospitals, clinics, pharmacies and some businesses. Now all residents can get inoculated, except for those under 18 years with the target of reaching herd immunity in the near future.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210322233149/https://apnews.com/article/seychelles-herd-immunity-mid-march-eba7c404b4530e9cc15d2e5dd1df6f58    https://web.archive.org/web/20210329142318/https://www.scmp.com/lifestyle/travel-leisure/article/3124000/seychelles-days-away-herd-immunity-after-coronavirus
notes_C3: The re-introduced restrictions include earlier closure of shops, bars and casinos, a ban on commemoration gatherings, shows, group sporting activities and conferences. Non-essential workers who can are also being encouraged to work from home. The 11 pm curfew will remain in force.  https://archive.ph/p8Phr
notes_C8: There is a ban on people travelling from some countries Travellers from Brazil are not permitted to travel to or enter Seychelles.   https://archive.ph/H8glz#selection-1019.3-1019.77
notes_C4: From 23 January, visits outside the immediate household are banned, social gatherings are not permitted.  Link: https://archive.vn/cVoJE
notes_C6: Is a curfew in place? Yes    From 10pm to 4am extended until further notice.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210428201007/https://mu.usembassy.gov/covid-19-seychelles/
notes_H6: Masks are required on public transportation. Buses are instructed to reduce maximum capacity.  https://archive.vn/BaTw5#selection-3091.0-3091.93  The use of facemasks is compulsory in public spaces https://archive.vn/BaTw5#selection-2767.0-2767.51
notes_H8: No measures specific to elderly people aside from existing measures.   https://web.archive.org/web/20210614161951/https://mu.usembassy.gov/covid-19-seychelles/
notes_C5: Is public transportation operating? Yes  Buses are instructed to reduce maximum capacity.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210428201007/https://mu.usembassy.gov/covid-19-seychelles/

name: Syria
notes_H1: Various organizations continue to provide and support the ministry of health in public health campaigns, whether on ground in households, as a part of training or in camps, or on social media platforms. This is not in all parts of Syria, thus I believe that this should be coded as "Targeted".    https://web.archive.org/web/20210315230433/https://reliefweb.int/report/syrian-arab-republic/syrian-arab-republic-covid-19-humanitarian-update-no-24-3-march-2021
notes_H2: https://web.archive.org/web/20200518202732/https://reliefweb.int/report/syrian-arab-republic/syrian-arab-republic-covid-19-response-update-no02-6-may-2020  OCHA  “On 16 April, the WHO Regional Office for the Eastern Mediterranean (EMRO) shared information indicating that a 53-year-old man from Al-Hasakeh City who had been admitted to Qamishli National Hospital on 27 March had died on 2 April. A test for the virus subsequently tested positive.”
notes_C7: "Beginning today, the government will lift an overnight curfew and allow movement between its provinces."  https://web.archive.org/web/20200527094103/https://www.al-monitor.com/pulse/originals/2020/05/syria-coronavirus-curfew-uptick-cases-damascus-idlib.html    "Restrictions remain in place at most other crossing points inside Syria. Abu Zendin, Um Jloud and Awn Dadat in Aleppo remain closed, as do Akeirshi and Abu Assi crossing points in Ar-Raqqa. Ghazawiyet Afrin and Al-Taiha in Aleppo are reported open for commercial traffic; the latter is also reported to be currently open for university students to move into GoS areas, in addition to some medical cases (...)"    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20201110223052/https://reliefweb.int/sites/reliefweb.int/files/resources/Syria_COVID-19_Humanitarian%20Update%20No%2011_30May2020_FINAL.pdf
notes_C2: In NES, in response to rising cases, from 3 April local authorities announced that all restaurants, cafes, schools, universities and institutions must also close, although essential shops, groceries and services can remain open    https://web.archive.org/web/20210406125247/https://reliefweb.int/report/syrian-arab-republic/syrian-arab-republic-covid-19-humanitarian-update-no-25-5-april-2021
notes_H3: "There are two parallel surveillance systems for infectious diseases in Syria with the Early Warning, Alert and Response System (EWARS) covering areas under government control since 2012, and EWARN predominantly operating in areas outside of government control since 2013. In March 2020, the NWS COVID-19 Task Force was established with the aim of addressing lab testing, contact tracing, "    https://web.archive.org/web/20210316001135/https://www.journalofinfection.com/article/S0163-4453%2821%2900046-3/fulltext  https://web.archive.org/web/20210316002120/https://www.wired.co.uk/article/coronavirus-contact-tracing-syria-idlib
notes_C1: In NES Syria from 3 April, the Ministry of Education announced an early end to the school year from kindergarten to Grade 8; Grade 9 and secondary school students will continue to attend classes. Also on 3 April, the Ministry of Higher Education and Scientific Research suspended all universities and institutes from 5 to 17 April.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210406125247/https://reliefweb.int/report/syrian-arab-republic/syrian-arab-republic-covid-19-humanitarian-update-no-25-5-april-2021
notes_H7: A:  "Syria's health ministry said on Monday (1st of March) it had started administering COVID-19 vaccinations to frontline healthcare workers."  "They did not specify the brand, source or quantity of the jabs."  https://web.archive.org/web/20210316012557/https://www.jpost.com/middle-east/syria-begins-covid-19-vaccinations-with-healthcare-workers-660570  https://web.archive.org/web/20210316024051/https://www.arabnews.com/node/1815791/middle-east
notes_C3: Required; source: /web/20210412184354/https://ourworldindata.org/grapher/public-events-covid?country=FIN~KAZ~MYS
notes_C8: "Syria has reopened Damascus International Airport for commercial flights after six months of closure due to the coronavirus pandemic, saying it had imposed strict health measures.    (...) Mansour noted that Aleppo, Lattakia and Qamishli airports will resume their operations after evaluating the procedures taken at Damascus airport to guarantee precautions against the COVID-19 pandemic."    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20201110220350/https://www.presstv.com/Detail/2020/10/02/635494/Syria-reopens-Damascus-international-airport-after-months-of-closure-over-COVID-19
notes_C4: In NES, in response to rising cases, from 3 April local authorities announced that mass social gatherings are prohibited.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210406125247/https://reliefweb.int/report/syrian-arab-republic/syrian-arab-republic-covid-19-humanitarian-update-no-25-5-april-2021
notes_C6: "In NES, in response to rising cases, from 3 April local authorities announced a partial curfew from 6 p.m. to 6 a.m. from 6 to 12 April. All restaurants, cafes, schools, universities and institutions must also close, although essential shops, groceries and services can remain open. A total curfew was also announced in Ar-Raqqa, Qamishli, and Al-Hasakeh cities, with similar exemptions."    https://web.archive.org/web/20210406125247/https://reliefweb.int/report/syrian-arab-republic/syrian-arab-republic-covid-19-humanitarian-update-no-25-5-april-2021
notes_H6: In NES, Mask wearing will also become mandatory in public places from April 3.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210406125247/https://reliefweb.int/report/syrian-arab-republic/syrian-arab-republic-covid-19-humanitarian-update-no-25-5-april-2021
notes_H8: Unable to locate any information specific to the elderly, the linked article highlights the challenges faced by everyone in the region.  https://web.archive.org/web/20201222133217/https://www.amnesty.org/en/latest/news/2020/11/syria-lack-of-adequate-covid-19-response-puts-thousands-of-lives-at-risk/  Nearly eight months into the COVID-19 pandemic, the Syrian government is failing to adequately protect its health workers, still lacks a robust response to the spread of the disease, and is refusing to provide transparent and consistent information about the country’s COVID-19 outbreak, Amnesty International said today.
notes_C5: In GoS-controlled areas, the daily curfew and the travel ban between and within governorates were lifted from 26 May (...) Public and private transportation services have also resumed."    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20201013163547/https://reliefweb.int/sites/reliefweb.int/files/resources/Syria_COVID-19_Humanitarian%20Update%20No%2011_30May2020_FINAL.pdf

name: Chad
notes_H1: Changing the coding as per almost all the sites referenced below the Chad government has made mask wearing compulsory as well as asking to respect social distancing and prevention measures.  Additionally a State of Emergency still remains in place so that governors can reimpose measures, including curfew to respond to COVID outbreaks.    -------  https://web.archive.org/web/20210425173452/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19  https://web.archive.org/web/20210425180331/https://www.smartraveller.gov.au/destinations/  https://web.archive.org/web/20210425180321if_/https://graphics.reuters.com/world-coronavirus-tracker-and-maps/countries-and-territories/chad/africa/chad  https://web.archive.org/web/20210425180432/https://td.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/  https://web.archive.org/web/20210425180413/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/chad/coronavirus
notes_H2: Per US Embassy site both tests are available for anyone showing symptoms.  ----------------------  https://web.archive.org/web/20210214194213/https://td.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C7: A States of Emergency remain in effect through out the region permitting governors to impose curfews and other measures to respond to local COVID outbreaks.  Additionally the AU site references a national curfew is now in place from 8ap to 5am.   -------  https://web.archive.org/web/20210425173452/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19  https://web.archive.org/web/20210425180331/https://www.smartraveller.gov.au/destinations/  https://web.archive.org/web/20210425180321if_/https://graphics.reuters.com/world-coronavirus-tracker-and-maps/countries-and-territories/chad/africa/chad  https://web.archive.org/web/20210425180432/https://td.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/  https://web.archive.org/web/20210425180413/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/chad/coronavirus
notes_E2: Per IMF's site there are fiscal measures to help business weather the shock to include reducing 50% of all business licensing fees along with presumptive tax for 2020 as well as breaks such as carry forward losses and delays in tax payments will be offered.  I coded to narrow as it seems to be a manual process so seems harder as there seems to be not be a specified criteria.    -------  https://web.archive.org/web/20210425173452/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19
notes_C2: I am unable to find any information that supports workplace closure in Chad.  US Embassy - Shows all markets are fully open.  I see the information about the quarantine measures in the capital from UK Government site but it calls out restricting entry and exit, restricting movement & public gatherings, but all information suggests business are open as long as all prevention measures & social distancing is respected as enforced by the government.  But I also found this IMF site that shows as of January 20th restrictions that have been gradually lifted for everything.  I am coding to the no measures as 2 out of 3 sources support the opening.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210214194719/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19  - https://web.archive.org/web/20210214194118/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/chad/coronavirus  - https://web.archive.org/web/20210214194213/https://td.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/  - https://web.archive.org/web/20210214194719/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19
notes_H3: The Chadian government reported to the WHO that “As of February 26, 847 contacts associated with the confirmed cases, of which 846 have been followed.” A 19 February OCHA quick alert notes that “In the provinces, most cases are contact cases whereas in N’Djamena they are travelers” alluding to contact tracing. An existing library of daily situation reports prepared by the Chadian government for the WHO and OCHA report consistent contact tracing since March 2020.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210301020941/https://www.humanitarianresponse.info/sites/www.humanitarianresponse.info/files/documents/files/sitrep_covid-19_n340_26_fevrier_-_2021.pdf    - https://web.archive.org/web/20210301023332/https://reliefweb.int/report/chad/chad-quick-alerts-19-february-2021     Library of Daily OCHA/WHO Situation Reports:  https://web.archive.org/web/20210301022341/https://www.humanitarianresponse.info/en/operations/chad/documents/themes/covid-19

But I also found this IMF site that shows as of January 20th restrictions that have been gradually lifted for everything. notes_C8: Entry rules in response to coronavirus (COVID-19)  Entry to Chad  Airports have re-opened for commercial flights. All passengers from the UK are banned from entering Chad until further notice due to the new COVID-19 variant.All international travellers need to present a negative COVID-19 PCR test certificate dated no more than 72 hours prior to arrival in Chad.    If you enter Chad and are planning to stay for 7 days or more, you will need to surrender your passport, quarantine at home for 7 days and take a COVID-19 test on the seventh day. Passports will be returned upon presentation of the COVID-19 test receipt. If you’re staying in Chad for less than 7 days you will not be need to quarantine.    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20210308184644/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/chad/entry-requirements

Conflicting information, coding to no measures as 2 of the authorities out of 1 show that restrictions have been lifted as long as preventative measures are followed.  - https://web.archive.org/web/20210214194118/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/chad/coronavirus  - https://web.archive.org/web/20210214194213/https://td.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/  - https://web.archive.org/web/20210214194719/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19- https://web.archive.org/web/20210214194118/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/chad/coronavirus  - https://web.archive.org/web/20210214194213/https://td.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
