name: Thailand
notes_H1: https://thailand.prd.go.th/main.php?filename=index
notes_H2: Testing is expanded to asymptomatic people in vulnerable groups, and to some random testing of the general population. However, it is still not generally available.    https://web.archive.org/web/20200511213623/https://uk.reuters.com/article/us-health-coronavirus-thailand/thailand-to-expand-coronavirus-testing-as-new-cases-dwindle-idUKKBN22J0HG
notes_C7: https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/thailand/coronavirus
notes_E2: https://www.channelnewsasia.com/news/asia/covid-19-thailand-migrant-workers-left-out-unemployment-12637164
notes_C2: Prime Minister Prayuth Chan-Ocha approved loosening restrictions from the first week of February to allow businesses and schools to reopen.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210209080024/https:/www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19
notes_H3: 23rd Jan 2021: No recent evidence could be found to suggest that Thailand has a comprehensive contact tracing system in place. The Thai government does use contract tracing Apps MorChana and ThaiChana .    https://web.archive.org/web/20210123121330/https://www.xn--b3czh8ayeuf.com/faq.html      A recent Thai PBS News article covered the APP: "A closer look at Thailand’s (non-mandatory) contact tracing apps"https://web.archive.org/web/20210109053728/https://www.thaipbsworld.com/a-closer-look-at-thailands-non-mandatory-contact-tracing-apps/
notes_E1: "The Cabinet has approved the extension of two COVID-19 relief schemes, to deliver 78 billion baht of extra funding to some 41.5 million people.  Government spokesman Anucha Burapachaisri said one is a 67-billion-baht extension of the "Rao Chana" scheme and the other is an 11.7-billion-baht new phase of the "Section 33 Rao Rak Kan" scheme. Under the Rao Chana scheme, an additional 1,000 baht will be given to eligible people each week for two weeks."  https://web.archive.org/web/20210524160357/https://thainews.prd.go.th/en/news/detail/TCATG210512110443787
notes_C1: Schools have reopened, although some are to remain closed until cases have abated. Thus schools in Bangkok, Nonthaburi, Pathum Thani and Samut Prakan are to remain closed.  https://archive.fo/vjFni  https://archive.fo/sbGld
notes_H7: A,B. Astrazeneca, Siam Bioscience, Sinovac, Johnson & Johnson.    Medical personnel, MPs and senators, some government officials, security officers and high–risk groups, such as members of crowded communities and those with seven underlying Non-Communicable Diseases are vaccinated.    https://archive.fo/7A2qV  https://web.archive.org/web/20210531152857/https://www.thaipbsworld.com/vaccine-explainer-thailands-vaccines-and-timeline/
notes_C3: 23/01/2021 - Bangkok restriction on gatherings coded on on 21st of December was announced as being in place for a fortnight.  Additionally this appears to have been for the Bangkok Metropolitan area only.   http://web.archive.org/web/20210104062002/https://thailand.prd.go.th/ewt_news.php?nid=10520&filename=index     While not specifically mentioning public events, The  Bangkok Communicable Disease Committee Meeting No. 3/2021, relaxed restriction measures on 22nd Jan 2021. "For today's meeting, the meeting agreed to provide relief. 13 types of establishments can be opened from tomorrow (22 Jan '64) onwards as follows: 1. Arcade game venues 2. Gaming cafes and Internet cafes 3. Elderly care facilities 4. All types of race fields except the field Horse boxing 5. Property catering Banquet Location Including any other places that are similar. 6. Field amulets Amulet Center 7. Beauty Salon (Non-medical clinic) place for tattooing or piercing the skin or any part of the body 8. Exercise place, fitness 9...."  https://web.archive.org/web/20210123082710/http://www.bangkok.go.th/main/page.php?3-=&type=detail&id=114335    No other evidence of canceling public events could be found except for political gatherings. The Thailand Government Public Relations Department published a release on 19th Jan 2021 stating: "Government Spokesperson Anucha Burapachaisri, in light of the recent political gathering, disclosed that with the Emergency Decree and Communicable Diseases Act being enforced to control the spread of COVID-19, the Government would like to seek cooperation from the public to refrain from attending any mass gathering. While the Government has been putting utmost effort to implement various economic stimulus measures to relief the plight of people as a result of the current phase of outbreak, the least that it would want to happen is an increased number of infected patients, especially from any political gathering."   https://web.archive.org/web/20210123102347/https://thailand.prd.go.th/more_news.php?offset=20&cid=2&filename=index    Because it appears that there is a nation wide ban on political gatherings and it is stated that this is due to COVID-19, have coded G2 from 19th Jan.
notes_C8: Thailand’s Centre for COVID-19 Situation Administration (CCSA) has temporarily suspended all arrivals of non-Thai citizens from India, Pakistan and Bangladesh, in an escalated effort to prevent the spread of a new COVID-19 variant into Thailand. Arrivals of Thai nationals from these three South Asian countries are allowed, but they are subject to 21-day mandatory state quarantine, instead of 14.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210510144609/https://thailand.prd.go.th/more_news.php?offset=60&cid=2&filename=index
notes_C4: Restrictions on all public gatherings  https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/thailand/coronavirus
notes_C6: https://ddc.moph.go.th/viralpneumonia/eng/situation.php
notes_H6: With effect from Monday 26 April until further notice you must wear a mask in all indoor and outdoor public spaces in Thailand. If you do not wear a mask you may have to pay a fine.  https://archive.fo/qqvjq
notes_H8: Bangkok reopens elderly day care centres, meaning the previous coding of 1G (for national guidelines for LTCF) comes into effect once again.  https://www.bangkokpost.com/thailand/general/2054835/curbs-lifted-for-13-types-of-businesses (reopening news story that mentions daycare for the elderly, not archived due to Waybackmachine exception)
notes_C5: Public transport available, providing people social distance and wear masks   https://web.archive.org/web/20210308164400/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/thailand/coronavirus

name: Tajikistan
notes_H1: Worries that the Health Ministry is not reporting all positive COVID-19 results (See Source 1, linked)    'After months of insisting they had won the battle against COVID-19, authorities finally caved to reality on June 21, albeit blaming the public for the fresh outbreak as they did so.' 'The Prime Minister's office issued a statement on June 21 saying that cases of COVID-19 had been detected in the country's healthcare institutions'. (See Source 2, linked)    This is coded as a 1 instead of a 2, as the government does not appear to communicating clearly about COVID-19 to its citizens.    Source 1:  https://web.archive.org/web/20210621235609/https://eurasianet.org/tajikistan-covid-strikes-again-despite-official-denials  Source 2: https://web.archive.org/web/20210621235337/https://eurasianet.org/tajikistan-covid-19-crisis-escalates-forcing-government-to-drop-denials
notes_H2: Quote: "COVID-19 PCR tests, the type of test required for international air travel from Tajikistan, are available in Dushanbe. Diamed clinic (44-601-90-16) provides next-day results at a cost of 167 TJS (approximately $15), paid by the patient. Diamed clinic does not provide English-language services. Prospekt clinic (48-702-44-00) charges 360 TJS (approximately $32) with results in two days. Travelers will need to collect a physical copy of their results from the clinic."  Archive Link  http://web.archive.org/web/20210530180948/https://tj.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/  ______________________________________________  Quote: " Testing for COVID-19 is carried out for severe cases only in Tajikistan."  Archived Link  http://web.archive.org/web/20210320152442/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/tajikistan/coronavirus
notes_C7: There are no restrictions on intercity or interstate travel. See:  https://web.archive.org/web/*/https://tj.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_E2: No evidence of current policies concerning debt and contract relief for households. The below source tracks what has happened historically; there is a lack of evidence that this is still being continued.  ____________________________________  No changes found.   https://web.archive.org/web/20210613143605/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19
notes_C2: Non-essential businesses 'including shopping centers, markets, and restaurants, are operating subject to social distancing mandates'. This is coded as a 1 despite the fact the workplaces are open as it reflects that restrictions are still in place.    Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20210426221012/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/465796/tajikistan-authorities-maintain-covid-19-measures-as-of-april-12-update-10
notes_H3: No contact tracing policy has been reported. The country is celebrating the victory over the COVID-19. Link: https://archive.vn/L94MD https://archive.vn/An4AE
notes_E1: No evidence of continued income support for households. The below source, although updated to show facts from 7th May 2021, tracks what has happened historically. The below source shows there has been income support given to workers in 2020, but there is a lack of evidence that this is still being continued.   ____________________________________  Quote:" Key Policy Responses as of May 7, 2021  The Government is providing VAT exemptions on essential imports, lump-sum assistance equivalent to minimum wage to vulnerable households and other socially disadvantaged groups. Health workers are to receive supplemental pay, while tariff increases on electricity, water, and communal services have been postponed until end of 2020. Government is providing free medical care to citizens placed under medical care and COVID-19 patients, as well as sick leave and compensation benefits. Government is providing grain, seed and fuel to farms to boost food security, and time-bound tax holidays and relief to targeted industries and small businesses until September 1, 2020. Anti-COVID measures also include financial support to SMEs and subsidizing food for population. "  Archive Link  http://web.archive.org/web/20210530195843/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19
notes_C1: Schools have reopened with social distancing measures  https://web.archive.org/web/20210112084049/https://www.unicef.org/eca/stories/children-tajikistan-return-safer-schools-amid-covid-19   https://web.archive.org/web/20200818060839/https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2020/08/tajikistan-reopens-schools-measures-prevent-covid-19-200817193947792.html
notes_H7: AstraZeneca  Vaccination of three groups: 'medical workers... people over 60 and people with chronic diseases'. Some 'high profile public health figures' also received the vaccine. (See Source 1, linked)     Although there is talk of Tajikistan receiving doses of the Sputnik V and CoronaVac vaccines from Russia and China respectively (See Source 1, linked), at present there is evidence only that the AstraZeneca vaccine is being administered (See Source 2).    It is said to be free of charge but there are reports that people are being charged and also being told that vaccination is compulsory (See Source 3).    Source 1: https://web.archive.org/web/20210622113245/https://p4h.world/en/news/vaccination-against-covid-19-tajikistan-role-joint-efforts  Source 2: https://web.archive.org/web/20210426231328/https://www.unicef.org/tajikistan/covid-19-vaccination-campaign-started-tajikistan  Source 3: https://web.archive.org/web/20210622113300/https://cabar.asia/en/covid-19-vaccination-in-tajikistan-rumours-and-reality
notes_C3: On 31 January, Tajikistan celebrated a national holiday - Sada - by organizing public fairs.   Links: https://archive.vn/XnHgX https://archive.vn/89HsW
notes_C8: No new measures.     Limited passenger flights operating, including connection to Uzbekistan, Kazakhstan, Belarus, Turkey and Russia. Land borders with Afghanistan, China, Kyrgyzstan and Uzbekistan are closed, but some border crossings with Kyrgyzstan and Uzbekistan are open for freight vehicles.   A negative COVID-19 test is required for entry issued within 72 hours of arrival. All travelers may be subject to PCR testing at the airport. If the result is positive, travelers may be transferred to a government quarantine facility. Travelers without a negative COVID test will be tested and subject to quarantine until return of negative test results. But practically, authorities will not allow passengers to board flights without documentation of a negative PCR test issued with 72 hours of arrival.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210530182909/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/477706/tajikistan-authorities-maintain-covid-19-measures-nationwide-as-of-may-12-update-11  https://web.archive.org/web/20210613133253/https://tj.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C4: The previously cited source has been updated and now shows no indication of current restrictions on gatherings. No evidence of current restrictions on gatherings found elsewhere.    Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20210621225702/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/489456/tajikistan-authorities-maintain-covid-19-related-entry-restrictions-as-of-june-11-update-12  ____________________________________  No changes found.   https://web.archive.org/web/20210530182909/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/477706/tajikistan-authorities-maintain-covid-19-measures-nationwide-as-of-may-12-update-11
notes_C6: "There are no local restrictions or localised lockdowns in place, however you must wear a face covering in public spaces, including in vehicles. Breaches of regulations can result in fines or eventually imprisonment." https://web.archive.org/web/20210320152442/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/tajikistan/coronavirus
notes_H6: Quote from article 1:  "Public places and services  Public places and services in Tajikistan were allowed to re-open in mid-June. Local regulations, including wearing of face masks, should be observed at all times."    Archived link 1:  http://archive.today/2021.03.22-034432/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/tajikistan/coronavirus    ____________________________________    Quote from article 2:  "Masks are required on public transportation."    "Fines for Non-Compliance:    The Tajik government has mandated the use of masks in public. Failure to wear a protective face mask in public may result in a fine."    Archived link 2:  http://archive.today/2021.03.22-034409/https://tj.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/    ____________________________________    Quote from article 3:  "Facemasks are mandatory in public places, including in vehicles and on public transport." notes_C5: No restrictions on public transport have been reported recently. The US Embassy website from December 29 says that public transport is operating. Moreover, on January 26 Tajikistan President announced that the country does not have COVID-19 cases and the country completely defeated the COVID-19. The President urged citizens to follow hygiene rules.  Links: http://web.archive.org/web/20201231113810/https://tj.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/ https://archive.vn/L94MD https://archive.vn/L94MD https://archive.vn/An4AE

name: Turkmenistan

notes_H2: Covid Tests are generally available to anyone who wants or requires it. The test costs 100 manat for citizens of Turkmenistan and $43 for foreign citizens." name: Timor-Leste
notes_H1: In the period from June 16th to June 20th in addition to the archived web document, no recommendations for the general population were found. See in Ministry of Health’s website, archived: https://web.archive.org/web/20210621171838/http://www.mj.gov.tl/jornal/public/docs/2021/serie_2/SERIE_II_NO_23.pdf
notes_H2: Use the re-coding: In the period from June 16th to June 20th no have new informations about this indicator in the Ministry of Health website. See in Ministry of Health website, archived: https://web.archive.org/web/20210621171838/http://www.mj.gov.tl/jornal/public/docs/2021/serie_2/SERIE_II_NO_23.pdf
notes_C7: Is a curfew in place? No  Are there restrictions on intercity or interstate travel? Yes  The government has restricted travel to and from the municipalities of Bobonaro and Cova-Lima with the other Timor-Leste municipalities through March 3, 2021, with limited exceptions.  http://web.archive.org/web/20210222182612/https://tl.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_E2: According to the information provided on IMF Policy Responses COVID-19 page the debt/contract relief measure have ended.  "On April 20, the government approved a stimulus package (US$150 million, about 10.5 percent of GDP) to manage economic and financial risks from the COVID-19 including: (i) cash transfers with a monthly basic income to over 214,000 households, worth US$100 per month per household, lasting for 3 months; wage subsidies (60 percent of the wage cost) for formal sector employees (for 30,000 workers); (...) (iv) waiving for three months (for low-income households) the payment of electricity (up to US$15 per month), water bills, property rental payments owned by the government and social security contributions;(v) provide stipends to over 4,200 Timorese students studying overseas; and (vi) deferral of tax payments for two months."  Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20201116114529/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19
notes_C2: obligation of all individuals residing in Timor-Leste to keep a distance of, at least, three feet from other individuals with whom they do not live in common economy. They are also still obliged to wear a face mask that covers the nose and mouth when having access to or staying in public or private places of collective use and to wash their hands when entering commercial, industrial or service provision establishments or buildings where public administration services operate. Everyone is also obliged to avoid crowding in public places.    http://web.archive.org/web/20210616174635/https://tl.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/  http://web.archive.org/web/20210616174640/http://timor-leste.gov.tl/?cat=10&lang=en  http://web.archive.org/web/20210616174701/https://tl.usembassy.gov/health-alert-u-s-embassy-dili-timor-leste-june-2-2021/
notes_H3: There's no new data regarding contact tracing.     http://web.archive.org/web/20210616174635/https://tl.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/  http://web.archive.org/web/20210616174640/http://timor-leste.gov.tl/?cat=10&lang=en  http://web.archive.org/web/20210616174701/https://tl.usembassy.gov/health-alert-u-s-embassy-dili-timor-leste-june-2-2021/
notes_E1: The government of Timor-Leste announced a stimulus package of US$ 150 million (approximately 10.5% of GDP) to respond to the crisis, and placed a strong emphasis on supporting livelihoods through social security and social assistance. Measures included paying 60% of the wages for formal economy workers placed on reduced working hours (approx. 30,000 people), waiving utility bills and social security contributions for low-income households for three months, and introducing a benefit for students studying abroad.  http://web.archive.org/web/20210604180110/https://www.social-protection.org/gimi/gess/ShowCountryProfile.action;jsessionid=4jHmczYPIkb0u3vZdRZ91BiGMVZOamkkekzxXcKf2fjh14PinAqV%21445242879?iso=TL&lang=RU
notes_C1: According to the latest information, more than 1500 schools have already resumed the face-to-face educational process, which means a percentage of 95% in pre-school and basic education, and 96% in general and technical-vocational secondary education.    http://web.archive.org/web/20210604182015/https://ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/jquery/1.4.2/jquery.min.js
notes_H7: In the period from June 16th to June 20th no have new informations about this indicator in the Ministry of Health website. See in Ministry of Health website, archived: https://web.archive.org/web/20210621171838/http://www.mj.gov.tl/jornal/public/docs/2021/serie_2/SERIE_II_NO_23.pdf  See too in Gavi – The Vaccine Alliance’s website, archived:   https://web.archive.org/web/20210621185004/https://www.gavi.org/covax-vaccine-roll-out/timor-leste  Vaccines: Astrazeneca
notes_C3: Everyone is also obliged to AVOID crowding in public places. Although, the last meeting record of Timor Leste government doesn't bring new information about public events, only says that religious gatherings are allowed by now, but doesn't properly explain about public events in general.     http://web.archive.org/web/20210604182258/https://ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/jquery/1.4.2/jquery.min.js
notes_C8: A State of Emergency (SOE) is in effect for all of Timor-Leste through 23:59 on July 1.  During this period, airports, ports, and land borders will remain temporarily closed, with the following exceptions:  Timorese citizens can re-enter; transit of diplomatic or consular personnel, members of international organizations and bilateral cooperation agencies, workers in the petroleum sector, and other international workers whose work is relevant to Timor-Leste’s national interest; Operation of medical evacuation; and international transportation of goods.    http://web.archive.org/web/20210616174635/https://tl.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/  http://web.archive.org/web/20210616174640/http://timor-leste.gov.tl/?cat=10&lang=en  http://web.archive.org/web/20210616174701/https://tl.usembassy.gov/health-alert-u-s-embassy-dili-timor-leste-june-2-2021/
notes_C4: In the Municipality of Dili the imposition of general home confinement of all persons residing or presently in the Municipality of Dili also remains in place until June 15th, except for the reasons previously defined, namely for reasons of health, work and for access to basic goods and services. There is only one change, whereby collective religious celebrations and other collective worship events are now allowed, provided that those attending the ceremonies maintain a distance of at least one meter from third parties with whom they do not live in common economy and wear a face mask covering the nose and mouth.     http://web.archive.org/web/20210616174635/https://tl.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/  http://web.archive.org/web/20210616174640/http://timor-leste.gov.tl/?cat=10&lang=en  http://web.archive.org/web/20210616174701/https://tl.usembassy.gov/health-alert-u-s-embassy-dili-timor-leste-june-2-2021/
notes_C6: Are there restrictions on intracity or intrastate travel? Yes  SOE restrictions impose a general stay-at-home order for those not receiving or assisting in the delivery of essential goods and services in Dili, Baucau, Viqueque, Ermera, Covalima, and Ainaro Municipalities.     https://web.archive.org/web/20210419184940/https://tl.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_H6: Mandatory mask in public and private places of collective use.  Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20210305172230/http://www.laohamutuk.org/Justice/2021/Covid/GovPRCom2Mar2021PtEn.pdf
notes_H8: The elderly people is currently receiving priority in vaccination process and also is forbidden of receiving visitors in institutions.     http://web.archive.org/web/20210616174635/https://tl.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/  http://web.archive.org/web/20210616174640/http://timor-leste.gov.tl/?cat=10&lang=en  http://web.archive.org/web/20210616174701/https://tl.usembassy.gov/health-alert-u-s-embassy-dili-timor-leste-june-2-2021/
notes_C5: obligation of all individuals residing in Timor-Leste to keep a distance of, at least, three feet from other individuals with whom they do not live in common economy. They are also still obliged to wear a face mask that covers the nose and mouth when having access to or staying in public or private places of collective use and to wash their hands when entering commercial, industrial or service provision establishments or buildings where public administration services operate. Everyone is also obliged to avoid crowding in public places, including public transports.     http://web.archive.org/web/20210616174635/https://tl.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/  http://web.archive.org/web/20210616174640/http://timor-leste.gov.tl/?cat=10&lang=en  http://web.archive.org/web/20210616174701/https://tl.usembassy.gov/health-alert-u-s-embassy-dili-timor-leste-june-2-2021/

name: Tonga
notes_H1: In website of Ministry of Health in the period from June 15th to June 20th have a quiz about Covid-19. Tonga declares itself free territory of Covid-19 as it has been without cases since April 18, 2021See in Ministry of Health website, archived:   https://web.archive.org/web/20210621131003/https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/bootstrap@3.4.1/dist/css/bootstrap.css
notes_H2: First suspected case of Covid-19 in Tonga.  Article refers to testing, however at this time, Tonga did not have testing equipment and so the samples were sent abroad.      http://archive.today/2020.12.12-192144/https://matangitonga.to/2020/03/04/suspected-case-coronavirus-tonga
notes_C7: The easing of restrictions from 12th April include the reopening of "most" public services, schools and businesses.  There is no reference to restrictions on internal movement (other than curfew which is coded under C6) and so C7 is coded as "0" (no measures)    http://archive.today/2020.12.16-170315/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/331721/tonga-authorities-extend-restrictive-covid-19-measures-until-april-17-update-4
notes_E2: See earlier note for E2 on 6th May
notes_C2: To date, the codes "2G" and "1G" have largely reflected restrictions placed on the opening of bars, night clubs and kava bars.  However, with the further easing of restrictions, such venues are permitted to open Mon-Sat between the hours of 5am - 11pm.  A code of "0" (no measures) was felt to reflect the new policy.    http://archive.today/2020.12.16-193122/https://matangitonga.to/2020/05/29/tongas-covid-19-restrictions-eased-further
notes_H3: First suspected case of Covid-19.  Article refers to contact tracing.  "He said Health had started to track down people she might have had contact with here in Tonga, from passengers on the aircraft she arrived on from Sydney on Monday, and people close to her."    http://archive.today/2020.12.12-192144/https://matangitonga.to/2020/03/04/suspected-case-coronavirus-tonga
notes_C1: Between June 15th to June 20th schools are fully open.  See in UNESCO website, last updated June 20th, 2021 archived: https://web.archive.org/web/20210621133025/https://en.unesco.org/covid19/educationresponse
notes_H7: In the period from June 15th to June 20th no have new informations about this indicator in the Ministry of Health website. Tonga declares itself free territory of Covid-19 as it has been without cases since April 18, 2021. See in Ministry of Health website, archived:   https://web.archive.org/web/20210621131003/https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/bootstrap@3.4.1/dist/css/bootstrap.css    Vaccines administrated: Astrazeneca. Groups:  frontline workers including staff from the Health Ministry, Tonga Police, Majesty’s Armed Forces, Tonga Fire and Emergency Services, ports and airport staff. See in WHO website, archived:  https://web.archive.org/web/20210621151756/https://www.who.int/westernpacific/about/how-we-work/pacific-support/news/detail/31-03-2021-kingdom-of-tonga-receives-24-000-doses-of-covid-19-vaccines-through-the-covax-facility
notes_C3: Announcement on SoE restrictions    "Night clubs, clubs, bars and kava clubs may be opened for business on Fridays and Saturdays only; from 5:00am to 9:00pm.  Kava drinking sessions prior to church services are permitted on Sundays only.  Daily early morning church services and on Sundays are allowed.     Mass gatherings under the restrictions, which are limited to only 20 people indoors and 40 people outdoors, does not apply to religious services and educational institutions.  All gyms, sporting events and activities, celebration of birthdays, marriages and other recreational or related gatherings shall be permitted, but they shall not exceed the maximum number defined as Mass Gatherings: not exceeding 20 people indoors and 40 people outdoors.  Events such as bingos and contact sports are prohibited.  Funeral gatherings shall be restricted to 20 people indoors and 40 people outdoors."    http://archive.today/2020.12.15-200143/https://matangitonga.to/2020/05/02/tonga-relaxes-covid-19-restrictions-under-state-emergency    In this announcement, there is no general reference to public events other than specific examples such as church gatherings. However,  the limitations on gatherings (20 inside/40 outside) suggests that there are likely to be limits on the type of public event that would meet the policy requirements.  As such, it is coded as "1" recommended rather than "2" (required) or "0" (no measures)
notes_C8: In the period from June 15th to June 20th no have new informations about this indicator in the Ministry of Health website. Tonga declares itself free territory of Covid-19 as it has been without cases since April 18, 2021See in Ministry of Health website, archived:   https://web.archive.org/web/20210621131003/https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/bootstrap@3.4.1/dist/css/bootstrap.css
notes_C4: "Tonga declares State of Emergency"  "Starting today, Friday 20 March, at 8:00 pm:   Public gatherings are restricted.   People are to practice social distancing.   Concerts, sports events, funerals, weddings and birthdays are banned."  "The State of Emergency applies to all the land and sea areas of Tonga starting today, March 20 to April 17, unless further renewed."  "This extends to public gatherings, restricted to a maximum of 20 people inside a building or 40 people outside, and people are to practice social distancing. Concerts, sports events, funerals, weddings and birthdays are also banned."  Link: http://archive.today/2020.12.12-162440/https://matangitonga.to/2020/03/20/tonga-declares-state-emergency
notes_C6: Restoration of curfew (Midnight-5am).  See 21st December for policy announcement
notes_C5: "The government is, however, easing some restrictions, and has stated that certain activities now deemed essential, such as most public services, schools, businesses, and trade operations, will be permitted to reopen. These operations are set to resume normally as of 13:00 on Sunday, April 12. "    It is assumed that the reopening of "most public services, schools, businesses and trade operations" will include public transport, hence the change of code to "0" (no measures)    http://archive.today/2020.12.16-170315/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/331721/tonga-authorities-extend-restrictive-covid-19-measures-until-april-17-update-4

name: Trinidad and Tobago
notes_H1: Government begins releasing daily 'Trinidad and Tobago COVID-19 (Novel Coronavirus) Updates'.   https://web.archive.org/save/http://www.news.gov.tt/content/trinidad-and-tobago-covid-19-novel-coronavirus-update-1#.XpRoalNKg1I
notes_H2: According to the Ministry of Health's guidelines, a PCR test will be conducted if a public health official decides so.    In accordance with the guidance provided by the WHO, not everyone with flu-like symptoms needs to be tested. If a person does not fit the criteria, testing will not be performed and factors such as clinical history, travel history and/or contact with a COVID-19 positive patient are considered.    http://web.archive.org/web/20200901013919/http://www.health.gov.tt/sitepages/default.aspx?id=305
notes_C7: Restrictions on intercity or interstate travel as of April 30, 2021 there are three daily flights on the air bridge, while the ferries on the sea bridge each operate a daily sailing at 25 percent capacity until July 4, 2021; public transportation is operating as of May 08, 2021 all public taxis are operating at 50 percent capacity until July 04, 2021; source: /web/20210606174232/https://tt.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_E2: Following Tamoi's note, there is no evidence of a debt/contract relief program in the country from 1 August onwards.
notes_C2: Restaurants, bars, cinemas, casinos and all non-essential retail are closed. All places of worships, gyms, spas, hairdressers and clubs or theatres are closed. Supermarkets, pharmacies and other essential retail remain open under restricted operating hours. https://web.archive.org/web/20210621173213/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/trinidad-and-tobago/coronavirus
notes_H3: Prime Minister states "Our protocols have been operationalized for some time now. We had tested over fifty cases and this is the first one that tested positive. Contact tracing is taking place. Our professionals have been and are handling the situation and situations."    (https://web.archive.org/web/20200413122852/https://www.opm.gov.tt/prime-minister-dr-the-hon-keith-rowleys-parliament-statement-on-covid-19/)
notes_E1: A new public assistance program was announced on February 26th. It was coded on this day as it is unclear when it will begin.   “This agreement will support minimum income for those affected by the coronavirus in the immediate period and during the recovery. The agreement does not see Trinidad and Tobago taking on additional debt but instead redirects existing uncommitted loan resources to new and urgent high priority public investment areas that require financing during this critical period” stated Minister West.  The programme will see US$24.45 million deployed for the creation of COVID-19 management measures aimed at ensuring that basic needs are met for vulnerable persons.  It will directly benefit vulnerable populations in the form of:  (1) Protection using existing cash transfer programmes and  (2) Protection for the vulnerable population not on the rosters of transfer programmes, working in the informal sector."    source: https://archive.vn/CKS3w
notes_C1: Secondary schools re-opened on February 8th for Forms 4-6 students only using a hybrid system.  "Online classes for teaching to continue as far as possible  Students to report to school for the completion of Practicals, SBAs and Internal Assessments  Physical teaching classes to be held only where absolutely necessary"  source: https://archive.vn/txRx0
notes_H7: government has approved a COVID-19 vaccine for use; AstraZeneca and Sinopharm available;  Phase 1 of the vaccine is being administered to health care workers, people over 60 years and  people under 60 with non-communicable diseases; source: /web/20210606183344/https://tt.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C3: Beaches, rivers and public pools are also off-limits for members of the public. Outdoor sports or exercise in public places is currently prohibited. https://web.archive.org/web/20210621173213/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/trinidad-and-tobago/coronavirus
notes_C8: "National Security Minister Stuart Young has announced the closure of all borders effective midnight on Sunday. He said no international flights would be allowed to enter the country. This will apply to both nationals and non nationals."  (https://web.archive.org/web/20200413134259/https://trinidadexpress.com/newsextra/t-t-s-borders-closed-to-all/article_5061e42c-6b8b-11ea-8328-3f8003c18b6f.html)
notes_C4: Public gatherings are limited to groups of 5 people (10 for weddings and funerals). https://web.archive.org/web/20210621173213/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/trinidad-and-tobago/coronavirus
notes_C6: no sound data found, but a curfew is in place from 9:00 p.m. to 5:00 a.m. Monday to Thursday and 7:00 p.m. to 5:00 a.m. Friday to Sunday; source: /web/20210606174232/https://tt.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_H6: It is a legal requirement for all individuals aged 8 years and over to wear a mask in public spaces, including when traveling in private vehicles. https://web.archive.org/web/20210621173213/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/trinidad-and-tobago/coronavirus
notes_H8: 22 June  On 22 June the country moved into phase five, lifting the majority of the remaining restrictions in place. Beaches, rivers, parks and gymnasiums, bars, restaurants, and casinos have reopened. This indicates there is no longer a recommendation to stay at home.  UK FCO Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20200706162609/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/trinidad-and-tobago/coronavirus  Ministry of Communications Trinidad and Tobago Facebook announcement: http://archive.vn/hukbD    Recommendations to protect the elderly and be mindful of them remain
notes_C5: Public transport is operating at 50% capacity. https://web.archive.org/web/20210621173213/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/trinidad-and-tobago/coronavirus

name: Tunisia
notes_H1: Dedicated Public Health information Website gives out general advice for the public.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200608201759/https://covid-19.tn/blog/%d9%81%d9%8a%d8%b1%d9%88%d8%b3-%d9%83%d9%88%d8%b1%d9%88%d9%86%d8%a7-%d8%a7%d9%84%d8%ac%d8%af%d9%8a%d8%af-%d9%86%d8%b5%d8%a7%d8%a6%d8%ad-%d8%b9%d8%a7%d9%85%d8%a9/
notes_H2: "If you think you have COVID-19 symptoms, you should call 190 (emergency services SAMU). They will ask a series of questions to assess whether it is likely that you have COVID-19. If COVID-19 is suspected, then they will arrange for someone to come to your home or hotel to conduct a test and they will advise you to self-isolate. COVID-19 PCR tests are only offered free if you are displaying symptoms. You can also pay for a test, if required for travel purposes, at the Institut Pasteur."    https://web.archive.org/web/20200806161617/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/tunisia/coronavirus
notes_C7: Intercity and inter-governorate travel is permitted as of May 14. https://web.archive.org/web/20210610062404/https://tn.usembassy.gov/health-alert-tunisian-government-announces-general-lockdown-from-may-9-to-may-16-2/
notes_E2: no change since last update   https://archive.is/KkSWz#T
notes_C2: As of June 3, Authorities in Sidi Bouzid Governorate have introduced measures related to COVID-19 in several delegations, including Souk Jdid, Mazouna, and Ouled. These restrictions include the closure of weekly markets, wedding and sports halls, public baths, and Friday prayers through at least June 16.  Authorities will likely implement localized restrictions throughout Tunisia, particularly across regions that experience a rise in COVID-19 cases.  https://archive.vn/pIUYB
notes_H3: Authorities require all travelers to download the E7mi tracking application upon arrival in the country.    https://archive.vn/e0sGS  https://archive.vn/LFN7G  https://archive.vn/1Csmr
notes_E1: A 2.5 billion TND emergency plan ($0.71 billion or 1.8 percent of GDP) was announced on March 21. From the social side, this also includes cash transfers for low income households, disabled and homeless people (450 TND million for three months). The plan also includes a support for those who will be on temporary unemployment because of the COVID19 shock (300 TND million).   Sources:    https://web.archive.org/web/20200608195445/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19   https://web.archive.org/web/20200608195532/https://home.kpmg/xx/en/home/insights/2020/04/tunisia-government-and-institution-measures-in-response-to-covid.html
notes_C1: Both schools and universities have re-opened following the general lockdown. https://web.archive.org/web/20210610062404/https://tn.usembassy.gov/health-alert-tunisian-government-announces-general-lockdown-from-may-9-to-may-16-2/
notes_H7: The vaccine campaign against COVID 19 began on March 13, 2021.     The three group of A,B,C have been selected to receive the vaccine. Pfizer vaccine has been used in Tunisia.    https://archive.vn/bbk95  https://archive.vn/1VRRt  https://archive.vn/ApzIp
notes_C3: Although dormitories, mosques, and malls are open, All gatherings remain banned closed until further notice.  https://archive.vn/qq5rQ  https://archive.vn/pIUYB
notes_C8: As concerns the international travel situation, Tunisia's land, sea, and air borders are open. However, all incoming travelers must provide a negative result from a COVID-19 polymerase chain reaction (PCR) test taken no more than 72 hours before departing for Tunisia, regardless of their point of origin. Health officials also perform random COVID-19 testing at airports.    In response to COVID-19 variants, Tunisia has suspended all flights with Australia, Brazil, Denmark, South Africa, and the UK until further notice. The suspension includes flights transiting Tunisia.  https://archive.vn/qq5rQ
notes_C4: All modes of public transport (taxis, buses, trains and others) are permitted to operate. There are restrictions on travel between regions. You should follow the advice of local authorities.    The Tunisian authorities have announced that wearing a face mask in public places is mandatory. This includes public transport, health and educational institutions, shopping centres, sports and cultural venues as well as places of worship. Failure to wear a mask may result in a fine or imprisonment.    On 23 January, the Tunisian authorities revised the national health measures to combat the speed of transmission of the virus.    There is a national curfew in all regions across the country, from 8pm to 5am. During the curfew you are only allowed to leave your residence in case of an emergency.  Cafes and restaurants are open at a reduced capacity. After 4pm they are only open for takeaway service.  Gatherings are banned.  Movement between cities is banned.  https://archive.vn/sn4Nq  https://archive.vn/DwEUI
notes_C6: "Tunisia has tightened precautionary measures amid a rapid spread of COVID-19 across the country, according to a statement released by the government on Thursday.    The measures, taken after a meeting between Tunisian Prime Minister Hichem Mechichi and members of Tunisia's committee to confront COVID-19 and several ministers, included the extension of the night curfew, suspension of the collective prayer, a ban of gatherings and suspension of classes.    Mechichi authorized all 24 governors to announce a curfew in their provinces, from Monday to Friday between 8 p.m. to 5 a.m. local time and on Saturday and Sunday from 7 p.m. to 5 a.m."    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20201031131417/http://www.xinhuanet.com/english/2020-10/29/c_139476377.htm
notes_H6: Public places have hygiene measures in place, including obligatory face masks, taking a temperature check and sanitizing hands upon entry.    https://archive.vn/ZdkTj    All over the country, mouth and nose protection is mandatory in public buildings, hotels and shops; in the greater Tunis area in all public spaces. This also applies when driving a car with a passenger or more.  https://archive.vn/GSDyO    Protective face coverings or masks are mandatory in public areas. Failure to wear one could result in a fine or imprisonment.  https://archive.vn/1Csmr  https://archive.vn/LFN7G
notes_H8: A curfew is in effect from 22:00 to 05:00 daily through June 27.  https://archive.vn/BLSLQ  https://archive.vn/Cc5DP
notes_C5: Public transportation are permitted and operates with 50% capacity to avoid crowding.     https://archive.vn/iH2v4  https://archive.vn/0vQI1

name: Turkey
notes_H1: Turkish Ministry of Health informs about Coronavirus in a series of videos; https://web.archive.org/web/20200211204229/https://twitter.com/saglikbakanligi/status/1225755162737827841, https://web.archive.org/web/20200210073346/https://twitter.com/saglikbakanligi/status/1225737365160939520, https://web.archive.org/web/20200211032634/https://twitter.com/saglikbakanligi/status/1225759617629577218,  https://web.archive.org/web/20200210133127/https://twitter.com/saglikbakanligi/status/1225696129578258432,  https://web.archive.org/web/20200313112513/https://twitter.com/saglikbakanligi/status/1225731397022879745
notes_C7: According to President Erdogan's speech about Ramadan restrictions following decisions made to be applied in Ramadan:     Intercity travels will not be allowed during curfews, except in compulsory circumstances.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210419090109/https://www.dw.com/tr/t%C3%BCrkiyede-14-nisanda-k%C4%B1smi-kapanma-ba%C5%9Fl%C4%B1yor/a-57188256
notes_C2: Under the gradual normalization plan, restaurants and cafes are now allowed to offer indoor dining under certain restrictions between 7 a.m. and 9 p.m, while their delivery services will continue until midnight.  Eateries will serve only two customers at the same table inside the venues while there will be a maximum of three people to a table in outdoor seating.  Gyms also reopened on June 1, while movie theaters are allowed to operate at 50 percent capacity. Shopping centers will operate from 7 a.m to 9 p.m. but will be closed on Sundays.  http://web.archive.org/web/20210615144321/https://www.hurriyetdailynews.com/turkey-eases-coronavirus-curbs-as-vaccination-drive-continues-165170
notes_E1: In terms of economic support, the government doesn't give any support to those who lost their jobs. But those who normally work but because of the covid-19, the firms cannot pay them, for those people there were two options Cash payment support and short-time working allowance/work.     First is Cash payment support which is given to workers who are currently in unpaid time-off (due to covid-19, firms cannot fire the employers, so they are sending their workers to unpaid time-off). In one month its max pay time is 30 days and the daily wage is 47.70 TRY (The currency is changing rapidly in these weeks, so to avoid the wrong amount, I didn't write in USD form). This support is ending on 05/17/2021 if there won't be any extension.     The second way is a short-time working allowance/work. In this payment, the workers who are currently working (who are not in time-off or any other absence situation) and be approved by the Turkish Employment Agency are getting %60 of their daily gross earnings. This support ended on 03/31/2021 but within the new presidential decree, it extended to 06/30/2021.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210122131003/https://www.iskur.gov.tr/isveren/kisa-calisma-odenegi/genel-bilgiler/ https://web.archive.org/web/20210122191037/https://www.iskur.gov.tr/is-arayan/issizlik-sigortasi/nakdi-ucret-destegi/ https://web.archive.org/web/20210325135853/https://www.cnnturk.com/ekonomi/nakdi-ucret-destegi-ne-zaman-bitiyor-ucretsiz-izin-maas-destegi-ne-zaman-bitecek   http://web.archive.org/web/20210422214717/https://www.cumhuriyet.com.tr/haber/resmi-gazetede-yayimlanan-kararla-kisa-calisma-odenegi-3-ay-sureyle-uzatildi-1830299
notes_C1: Primary school students on June 1 returned to classrooms. They will attend in-person lessons two days a week, but this will not be compulsory.   http://web.archive.org/web/20210615144321/https://www.hurriyetdailynews.com/turkey-eases-coronavirus-curbs-as-vaccination-drive-continues-165170
notes_H7: Vaccine: Sinovac    http://web.archive.org/web/20210323220648/https://covid19asi.saglik.gov.tr/TR-77707/asi-uygulanacak-grup-siralamasi.html
notes_C3: Indoor and outdoor wedding ceremonies can be held in line with virus rules. At indoor venues, the number of guests is limited to 100 people.    http://web.archive.org/web/20210615144321/https://www.hurriyetdailynews.com/turkey-eases-coronavirus-curbs-as-vaccination-drive-continues-165170
notes_C8: Foreign tourists who are in Turkey for a temporary period within the scope of touristic activities will be exempted from all restrictions provided that they have their passports with them.    PCR test requests from Hong Kong, China, Vietnam, Australia, New Zealand, Singapore, Thailand, South Korea, Japan, United Kingdom, Latvia, Luxembourg, Ukraine, and Estonia to enter Turkey from 15 May 2021. will not be.    Passengers arriving from Brazil and South Africa and arriving in Turkey were suspended temporarily. Passengers from countries other than these countries, who have been in Brazil or South Africa in the last 10 days, will be quarantined for 14 days in a place to be determined by the Turkish official authorities. These passengers will be re-tested on the tenth day of the quarantine period, and their quarantine will be terminated if the test result is negative.      https://web.archive.org/web/20210118205014/http://www.turob.com/tr/haberler/yabanci-turistler-sokaga-cikma-kisitlamasindan-muaf-tutulacaktir    https://web.archive.org/web/20210518094150/https://www.indyturk.com/node/353481/haber/t%C3%BCrsab%E2%80%99dan-i%CC%87%C3%A7i%C5%9Fleri-bakanl%C4%B1%C4%9F%C4%B1-genelgesine-tepki-mant%C4%B1kl%C4%B1-bir-izah%C4%B1-savunulacak    https://web.archive.org/web/20210518095218/https://www.anadolujet.com/en
notes_C6: Curfews, which previously came into effect at 9 p.m., will be in place between 10 p.m. and 5 a.m on weekdays and Saturdays, while a full lockdown will be imposed on Sundays.  http://web.archive.org/web/20210615144321/https://www.hurriyetdailynews.com/turkey-eases-coronavirus-curbs-as-vaccination-drive-continues-165170
notes_H6: “As of 8 September the wearing of masks is mandatory at all times outside the home throughout Turkey. This includes, but is not limited to, all public places, including streets, side streets, parks, gardens, picnic areas, markets, sea side and public transportation including Metro, buses, taxis and ferries. Masks are also mandatory in all shops, restaurants, hairdressers and barber shops.” Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20200909213906/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/turkey/coronavirus
notes_H8: Turkish citizens and residents aged 65 and older are restricted to their place of residence (allowed outside only between 10:00 and 13:00) and Intercity travel permits are required. Additionally, the use of all means of public mass transport in Istanbul has been banned for persons over 65 part of COVID-19 restrictions. On 28th of January, the vaccination of the citizens at the age of 75 and above was started with Chinese Sinovac vaccine from CoronoVac firm. On 11th of February started the vaccination of people over 70 years old. Those over the age of 65, including their spouses over 60, started to receive the vaccine on 12th of February.        Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20210201020353/https://www.dailysabah.com/turkey/coronavirus-vaccination-in-turkey-begins-for-citizens-75-and-above/news, https://web.archive.org/web/20210315180248/https://archive.fo/aKTPz and https://web.archive.org/web/20210315180555/https://archive.fo/QTiA9
notes_C5: According to President Erdogan's speech about Ramadan restrictions following decisions made to be applied in Ramadan:     People over 65 and under 18 are prohibited from using public transportation in the city.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210419090109/https://www.dw.com/tr/t%C3%BCrkiyede-14-nisanda-k%C4%B1smi-kapanma-ba%C5%9Fl%C4%B1yor/a-57188256

name: Tanzania
notes_H1: The Tanzanian government has not released aggregate numbers on COVID-19 cases or deaths since April 2020. The use of masks, social distancing, and other prevention strategies are largely absent throughout Tanzania  https://archive.vn/2m2Gy#selection-2965.0-2965.213  with the change in president the ministry of health has a traveller health surveillance form and a new travel advisory https://archive.ph/d5vWl  New pdfs added https://archive.vn/QeMt1  and https://archive.vn/gjjLm
notes_H2: U.S. citizens can book a COVID-19 test through the Tanzanian Ministry of Health, Community Development, Gender, Elderly, and Children (MoHCDEC) website: https://pimacovid.moh.go.tz/#/booking. COVID-19 test costs vary but are generally between $100 and $200.   https://archive.ph/2m2Gy#selection-3027.0-3031.67
notes_H3: Tanzania is definitely denying any spread of the virus. A foreign citizen has resulted positive to the virus weeks after the country was declared covid-free. Despite him knowing of at least other 25 people getting COVID, there was no attempt by the govt to trace contacts.  http://archive.fo/zQhLc
notes_C1: No closures in place, as the government is still denying the presence of COVID-19.   Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20210222191241/https://www.bbc.com/news/world-africa-55900680
notes_C3: According to the IMF website, effective June 1, 2020, the authorities allowed the opening of upper-secondary and tertiary schools and the resumption of sport activities and events. On June 29, 2020 all other educational institutions reopened. As a result, all the restrictions due to Covid-19 have been lifted by July 2020.  http://web.archive.org/web/20200928023258/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19
notes_C8: As of May 4, 2021, all flights to and from India are banned in Tanzania with limited exceptions.  https://archive.vn/2m2Gy#selection-2995.0-2995.96
notes_C4: According to the IMF website, effective June 1, 2020, the authorities allowed the opening of upper-secondary and tertiary schools and the resumption of sport activities and events. On June 29, 2020 all other educational institutions reopened. As a result, all the restrictions due to Covid-19 have been lifted by July 2020.  http://web.archive.org/web/20200928023258/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19
notes_H6: The Tanzanian government has not released aggregate numbers on COVID-19 cases or deaths since April 2020. The use of masks, social distancing, and other prevention strategies are largely absent throughout Tanzania.  https://archive.ph/eLxWW

name: Uganda
notes_H1: video prevention campaign: @MinofHealthUG   appeals to the general public to remain vigilant and look out for the symptoms of #Coronavirus. (https://twitter.com/MinofHealthUG/status/1223616070080245760)
notes_H2: widely available & tracked https://web.archive.org/web/20210524171407/https://covid19.gou.go.ug/
notes_C7: There are no restrictions on internal movement anymore.    http://web.archive.org/web/20210531115312/https://ug.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information-page/
notes_E2: There seems to be no new information concerning this placeholder.
notes_C2: "Shopping arcades, hairdressers and salons will be open from 22 July. Shopping malls, supermarkets and pharmacies are open. Hotels and restaurants are open with social distancing measures in place and food delivery services (such as Jumia) remain operational outside of curfew hours." Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20200820114638/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/uganda/staying-during-coronavirus "Museveni said business arcades must have temperature checks and traders must wear masks, ensure social distancing, and follow other safety guidelines" Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20200820114007/https://www.aa.com.tr/en/africa/businesses-to-reopen-as-uganda-eases-virus-lockdown/1918466
notes_H3: Still no real mention on their sites of the concept of contract tracing: https://web.archive.org/web/20210524171407/https://covid19.gou.go.ug/
notes_C1: The return of fully open schools has been delayed as a result of increasing case numbers. It is now planned for P1, P2 & P3, P6, S3, and S5 years to return on June 7th for a Special Term of June 7th - July 24th.    http://web.archive.org/web/20210526174929/https://www.independent.co.ug/full-reopening-of-schools-in-doubt-again-after-covid-19-surge/
notes_H7: 2nd round has now been reported: https://archive.vn/yIqIg & https://archive.vn/NlNSV  additional investment by UNICEF: https://archive.vn/QUZMZ
notes_C3: Cinemas, gyms, and massage parlors have been permitted to open  https://archive.vn/REAbt#selection-1917.239-1917.374
notes_C8: as of May 1, there is a BAN on Indian travelers (Indian strain has been detected in Uganda) https://web.archive.org/web/20210524184007/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19#U
notes_C4: Restrictions imposed by the Ministry of Health include allowing gatherings of no more than 200 persons provided masks are worn and social distancing of 2 meters is followed.     http://web.archive.org/web/20210531115312/https://ug.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information-page/
notes_C6: A nation wide curfew is in place between 21:00 and 5:30. Breaching of the curfew rule is only permitted for those with a flight during these hours.    http://web.archive.org/web/20210531121648/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/uganda/coronavirus
notes_H6: Masks are required to be worn in all public areas.    http://web.archive.org/web/20210531121648/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/uganda/coronavirus
notes_H8: Coding in line with C6 with the 21:00 to 5:30 curfew. No specific protection of the elderly rules in place.    http://web.archive.org/web/20210531121648/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/uganda/coronavirus
notes_C5: Public transportation is operating. Public transport operators are expected to provide sanitisation, passengers are required to wear masks, and seating is limited to half regular capacity.     http://web.archive.org/web/20210531115312/https://ug.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information-page/

name: Ukraine
notes_H1: The Ukrainian Government has created a special information page with all relevant information in addition to daily briefings by the chief medical officer and government officials: https://web.archive.org/web/20200414005009/https://covid19.gov.ua/en
notes_H2: The Ministry of Health of Ukraine states "Diagnostic testing will only be carried out in cases that meet the epidemiological and clinical definition of the disease outlined in the WHO guidelines. The testing will be conducted by the Virology Reference Laboratory of the Public Health Center of Ukraine. It is impossible to buy a diagnostic test kit for independent use."     (However, the website of the US Embassy in Ukraine claims "Covid-19 tests are widely available at the expense of the individual.")    Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20210411195738/https://covid19.gov.ua/en  https://web.archive.org/web/20210402235231/https://ua.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C7: Are there restrictions on intercity or interstate travel? No  In the regions with high infection rate it is allowed to transport up to 10 people at a time.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210515112321/https://ua.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/  https://web.archive.org/web/20210515105753/https://covid19.gov.ua/en
notes_E2: No new measures available  http://web.archive.org/web/20210616160139/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/483816/ukraine-authorities-maintaining-covid-19-related-restrictions-as-of-may-27-update-27  http://web.archive.org/web/20210616160201/https://covid19.gov.ua/en  http://web.archive.org/web/20210616160259/https://vaccination.covid19.gov.ua/
notes_C2: Workplaces can open since following the instructions : with marking to maintain a distance between visitors of more than 1.5 meters; with the provision of employees with personal protective equipment and the implementation of proper control over its use; in case of customer service through pick-up windows, terraces, etc; with ensuring centralized collection of used personal protective equipment; Urgent measures for hospitalization, if due to their postponement there is a significant risk to the life or health of people; Activities of hotels, health resorts, institutions providing social services, rehabilitation institutions for people with disabilities, inpatient departments of primary and complex prosthetics; Activities of gyms, fitness centers with occupancy of less than 1 person per 10 sq. m, swimming pools — less than 4 people on one track for individual classes or less than 6 people for a group.     http://web.archive.org/web/20210616160139/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/483816/ukraine-authorities-maintaining-covid-19-related-restrictions-as-of-may-27-update-27  http://web.archive.org/web/20210616160201/https://covid19.gov.ua/en  http://web.archive.org/web/20210616160259/https://vaccination.covid19.gov.ua/

The testing will be conducted by the Virology Reference Laboratory of the Public Health Center of Ukraine. It is impossible to buy a diagnostic test kit for independent use.    http://web.archive.org/web/20210616160139/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/483816/ukraine-authorities-maintaining-covid-19-related-restrictions-as-of-may-27-update-27  http://web.archive.org/web/20210616160201/https://covid19.gov.ua/en  http://web.archive.org/web/20210616160259/https://vaccination.covid19.gov.ua/

notes_C1: The 2020/2021 academic year for schoolchildren and students continues in a remote format. The External Independent Evaluation will take place from June 25 to July 17. International   students who come to take the exams are exempt from passing observation or self-isolation.     http://web.archive.org/web/20210616160139/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/483816/ukraine-authorities-maintaining-covid-19-related-restrictions-as-of-may-27-update-27  http://web.archive.org/web/20210616160201/https://covid19.gov.ua/en  http://web.archive.org/web/20210616160259/https://vaccination.covid19.gov.ua/
notes_H7: Among the priority groups are people who are most vulnerable to COVID-19 or on whom the country`s life, provision of assistance to citizens and their protection depend. For the most part, these groups include those who interact with a large number of people, health care workers, and anyone at risk of serious complications. The available vaccines are Pfizer, Astrazeneca, Sinovac and Novavax.   http://web.archive.org/web/20210616160139/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/483816/ukraine-authorities-maintaining-covid-19-related-restrictions-as-of-may-27-update-27  http://web.archive.org/web/20210616160201/https://covid19.gov.ua/en  http://web.archive.org/web/20210616160259/https://vaccination.covid19.gov.ua/

notes_C8: Air traffic in Ukraine has been renewed. There is no ban on entry to Ukraine for foreign citizens and stateless persons. Regular international passenger service has been renewed. Citizens of other countries need to have an insurance policy that covers the cost of treatment COVID-19.     When crossing the border or checkpoint, a person agrees to self-isolation. You need to download and subscribe to mobile electronic service “At Home”. Follow the instructions from the mobile app and follow the rules of self-isolation.  In self-isolation, a person determines where they plan to stay for 14 days.    http://web.archive.org/web/20210616160139/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/483816/ukraine-authorities-maintaining-covid-19-related-restrictions-as-of-may-27-update-27  http://web.archive.org/web/20210616160201/https://covid19.gov.ua/en  http://web.archive.org/web/20210616160259/https://vaccination.covid19.gov.ua/

name: Uruguay
notes_H1: Website with al relevant information on coronavirus and what the government is doing:  /web/20200430214429/https://www.gub.uy/sistema-nacional-emergencias/comunicacion/noticias/informacion-interes-actualizada-sobre-coronavirus-covid-19-uruguay
notes_H2: Tests are generally available through insurance companies.    Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20210510142606/https://uy.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C7: The president said that mobility increased compared to previous months. "What we ask, as far as possible, is that people do not move, that they move as little as possible"    https://web.archive.org/web/20210509200049/https://www.presidencia.gub.uy/comunicacion/comunicacionnoticias/lacalle-pou-conferencia-prensa-7-abril
notes_E2: No changes in this policy. Uruguayan electricity provider UTE has extended "until May 31, 2021, the benefits to the activity sectors: Hotels, Restaurants, Gastronomy, Party Halls, Cultural Institutions and Travel Agencies. The discount applies to the entire fixed charge and power charge for customers with contracted power less than or equal to 40 kW and provides a proportional discount with respect to the consumption of the same month of the year 2019, prior to the effects of the pandemic, to the customers with power greater than 40 kW."    http://web.archive.org/web/20210417140608/https://www.presidencia.gub.uy/comunicacion/comunicacionnoticias/medidas-gobierno-economia-emergencia-sanitaria-covid19
notes_C2: No changes found.
notes_H3: The Ministry of Public Health announced it would trace individuals coming from high risk areas. https://www.elpais.com.uy/informacion/politica/delgado-hay-casos-sospechosos-departamentos-aislamiento.html (Archived version: https://web.archive.org/web/20200417034706/https://www.elpais.com.uy/informacion/politica/delgado-hay-casos-sospechosos-departamentos-aislamiento.html)
notes_E1: The Executive Power, through the Ministry of Labor and Social Security, created a special unemployment subsidy scheme for private-sector workers affected by the health emergency due to the COVID-19 disease. The subsidy to be received will be up to 25% of the monthly average of the computable nominal salaries received in the six full months of effective work prior to setting the cause, depending on the number of days of suspension or reduction. As of April, the amount to be received, which includes the subsidy and the amount paid by the company for the period actually worked, will in no case be less than 75% of the average monthly wages of the last six months taken for the profit calculation.     http://web.archive.org/web/20210416204720/https://www.bps.gub.uy/16874/subsidio-especial-por-desempleo-parcial.html  http://web.archive.org/web/20210416193621/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19
notes_C1: Face-to-face classes are resumed gradually as of May 3    Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20210510133059/https://www.presidencia.gub.uy/comunicacion/comunicacionnoticias/conferencia-lacalle-pou-da-silveira-presencialidad
notes_H7: A new official report shows the wide application of vaccines in the population over 18.    CoronaVac, Pfizer-BioNtech and AstraZeneca    https://web.archive.org/web/20210607202033/https://www.gub.uy/ministerio-salud-publica/sites/ministerio-salud-publica/files/documentos/noticias/Informe%20Vacunas%20COVID-19.pdf
notes_C3: No changes
notes_C8: From December 21 to January 10, 2021, border will be closed, entry to the country will be suspended, except for Uruguayans who have purchased their ticket on December 16, and the transport of cargo. notes_C6: According to the government news, the president said that the Government "defends tooth and nail" not to establish a mandatory confinement of the population. "The 'stay at home' is worn out, everyone knows what they can do," said Lacalle Pou. "If people can stay at home, let them stay, but it is not mandatory," which indicates recommended but not required stay-at-home measure.   Source:  http://web.archive.org/web/20201217232814/https://www.presidencia.gub.uy/comunicacion/comunicacionnoticias/conferencia-prensa-luis-lacalle-pou-medidas-diciembre-covid
notes_H6: Mandatory for users and staff to wear a face covering on public transport, along with other safety measures.    https://web.archive.org/web/20200831120003/https://www.impo.com.uy/bases/resoluciones-mtop/SN20200603001-20200
notes_H8: Although this policy has not been broadly explained, the Ministry of Public Health and the Ministry of Social Development are coordinating inspections on long-stay centres for the elderly.      http://web.archive.org/web/20210417222641/https://www.gub.uy/ministerio-desarrollo-social/comunicacion/comunicados/comunicado-sobre-estafas-establecimientos-larga-estadia-para-personas   http://web.archive.org/web/20210417222844/https://www.presidencia.gub.uy/comunicacion/comunicacionnoticias/medidas-gobierno-Sanitaria-emergencia-sanitaria-covid19
