name: United States
notes_H1: The President's Coronavirus Guidelines for America https://web.archive.org/web/20200322010504/https://www.whitehouse.gov/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/03.16.20_coronavirus-guidance_8.5x11_315PM.pdf
notes_H2: First drive-through testing site introduced in New York    https://web.archive.org/save/https://www.pbs.org/newshour/show/new-york-launches-drive-thru-testing-site-for-covid-19    https://web.archive.org/save/https://www.pbs.org/newshour/show/new-york-launches-drive-thru-testing-site-for-covid-19
notes_C7: Some limitations continue.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210523000047/https://www.aarp.org/politics-society/government-elections/info-2020/coronavirus-state-restrictions.html
notes_E2: CARES Act, signed into law on 27 March 2020, implemented targeted debt relief based on Federal jurisdiction (e.g. eviction freezes for federal housing programs, mortgage forbearance for federally-backed mortgages, etc.). Primary source (U.S. House of Representatives, Financial Services Committee, archived link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200430040220/https://financialservices.house.gov/news/documentsingle.aspx?DocumentID=406472    Debt/contract relief also implemented at state level (e.g. eviction freezes, rent increase freezes, utility bill late charge waivers, etc.), but case-specific and not captured in this coding scheme.
notes_C2: An executive order issued by Gov. Kevin Stitt on March 12 lifted all statewide restrictions on events and residents. This includes any occupancy restrictions for offices.     https://web.archive.org/web/20210607215752/https://www.northstarmeetingsgroup.com/News/Industry/Coronavirus-states-cities-reopening-COVID-19-new-cases#Oklahoma    https://web.archive.org/web/20210425023830/https://www.sos.ok.gov/documents/executive/1992.pdf (previous order which was replaced by the order below)  https://web.archive.org/web/20210425030825/https://www.sos.ok.gov/documents/executive/1984.pdf (new order which makes no mention of any restrictions to residents or offices anymore)
notes_H3: "Contact tracing was used in Seattle and parts of California early on in their coronavirus outbreaks, but as community spread took hold, many cities and states switched to a "mitigation" approach, like closing schools and other social distancing measures." https://web.archive.org/web/20200414010434/https://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2020/04/10/831200054/cdc-director-very-aggressive-contact-tracing-needed-for-u-s-to-return-to-normal
notes_E1: Changed to 1 to reflect the fact that Pandemic Unemployment Assistance is only available for 13 weeks. Non-formal workers can apply.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210522091749/https://www.dol.gov/coronavirus/unemployment-insurance
notes_C1: Burbio lists between 1.5% - 3.5% of students attending class fully online, with an additional 20-35% attending hybrid-type classes as of May 24. While a majority of students is attending class in-person, this  almost assuredly remains a 2T. Additionally, as of 07 June 2021, New York City has only partially opened all schools, with full services only fully planned to return with the new school year in September. Other evidence also points to potential school closures in American Samoa, Bureau of Indian Education schools, Montana, and Wyoming.     https://web.archive.org/web/20210607201137/https://info.burbio.com/school-tracker-update-may-24/    https://web.archive.org/web/20210607201125/https://www.npr.org/2021/05/24/999825807/new-york-city-schools-will-fully-reopen-with-no-remote-option-this-fall?t=1623096665316    https://web.archive.org/web/20210607195535/https://www.edweek.org/leadership/map-coronavirus-and-school-closures-in-2019-2020/2020/03
notes_H7: As of Monday 19th April , CDC announces that COVID-19 vaccines are available to every American over 16years who wants a shot.   CDC - https://web.archive.org/web/20210507223725/https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/vaccines/How-Do-I-Get-a-COVID-19-Vaccine.html
notes_C3: A significant number of states have at least some restrictions still in place. However, North Carolina has lifted all event restrictions (including social distancing requirements) on May 14. Utah has no firm restrictions in place, only recommendations for events. New Jersey has lifted all event restrictions (other than enforcing social distancing) on indoor and outdoor events on June 4th. Hence, 1T is the correct coding.     https://web.archive.org/web/20210607215752/https://www.northstarmeetingsgroup.com/News/Industry/Coronavirus-states-cities-reopening-COVID-19-new-cases
notes_C8: As of March 2, foreign nationals who have travelled to Iran within the past 14 days are denied permission to enter the US.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200410104600/https://edition.cnn.com/travel/article/coronavirus-travel-restrictions/
notes_C4: Alabama, Idaho, Indiana, Missouri and South Dakota allow gatherings of any size, while other states have very strict measures in place. The most restrictive are New Mexico with max 5 people and Oregon with max 6 people from max 2 households.     Overview (last updated Nov 17): http://web.archive.org/web/20201123193939/https://www.northstarmeetingsgroup.com/News/Industry/Coronavirus-states-cities-reopening-COVID-19-new-cases  New Mexico: http://web.archive.org/web/20201123192402/https://cv.nmhealth.org/public-health-orders-and-executive-orders/frequently-asked-questions/  Oregon: http://web.archive.org/web/20201123193338/https://govstatus.egov.com/OR-OHA-COVID-19
notes_C6: Though most states have ceased to give any blanket recommendations, at least the state of Massachussets continues to state the following in their COVID guidance: "Even if you do not have symptoms, stay home as much as you can and practice social distancing if you must go out."    https://web.archive.org/web/20210606135614/https://www.mass.gov/info-details/covid-19-prevention-and-treatment
notes_H6: Governor Wolf in Pennsylvania:    Expanding on the business safety order signed by Secretary of Health Dr. Rachel Levine in April that requires the wearing of masks in businesses, Governor Tom Wolf today announced a new order signed by Dr. Levine that takes the mask-wearing directive one step further.    With this order, signed under Dr. Levine’s authority under the Disease Prevention and Control Act, masks must be worn whenever anyone leaves home. The order takes effect immediately.    https://web.archive.org/web/20200923054840/https://www.governor.pa.gov/newsroom/gov-wolf-sec-of-health-signs-expanded-mask-wearing-order/
notes_H8: On March 13, CMS issued guidance that advised nursing homes to restrict visitors, helping prevent introduction of the virus into these facilities. CMS released a Guidance for Infection Control and Prevention of Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19) in Nursing Homes.   “Facilities should restrict visitation of all visitors and non-essential health care personnel (“HCP”), except for certain compassionate care situations, such as an end-of-life situation.” In end-of-life situations, visitors should be limited to a specific room. LTC Facilities are expected to convey these restrictions to potential visitors and advise they defer visitation until further notice. CMS also noted that if a state were to further limit visitation to apply even in end-of-life situations, a LTC Facilities’ compliance with the state requirement would not result in a citation for noncompliance with CMS’s visitation requirements.  Source - https://archive.vn/AbZ50    Refer to link for the CMS Guidance document. http://web.archive.org/web/20201216063424/https://www.cms.gov/files/document/qso-20-14-nh-revised.pdf
notes_C5: Public transport in some parts of the country are operating without any restrictions. While ridership is lower than pre-pandemic, this is not the case because of restrictions but rather due to a higher share of telecommuters.     https://web.archive.org/web/20210607224109/https://apnews.com/article/coronavirus-government-and-politics-environment-and-nature-politics-lifestyle-56d36574e38cec038f77339ef12076bc    https://web.archive.org/web/20210607215752/https://www.northstarmeetingsgroup.com/News/Industry/Coronavirus-states-cities-reopening-COVID-19-new-cases#Oklahoma

name: Uzbekistan
notes_H1: Government launched an official website with up-to-date information on fighting Coronavirus: https://web.archive.org/save/https://coronavirus.uz/ru
notes_H2: Individuals showing symptoms undergo testing through government facility as per update  Quote: "Individuals who are showing COVID-19 symptoms will undergo testing at government facilities."    Archive Link  http://web.archive.org/web/20210502231541/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/uzbekistan/coronavirus  ___________________________________________________________  Quote: "COVID-19 Testing:  Are PCR and/or antigen tests available for U.S. citizens in Uzbekistan?  Yes   If so, are test results reliably available within 72 hours?  Yes    COVID-19 PCR tests are available at clinics and medical facilities throughout Uzbekistan.  The cost of testing is typically between 200,000 and 350,000 Uzbekistani Soum ($20-$35 USD), and is paid by the patient prior to testing. "  Archive Link  http://web.archive.org/web/20210502214431/https://uz.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C7: No restrictions on intercity or interstate travel.   http://web.archive.org/web/20210620143602/https://uz.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_E2: Government assistance (e.g. Anti-Crisis fund) provided (since 2020 and continuing on into 2021) for several different areas including individual loan repayments.    ______________________________________________  Quote from linked article 1:  "Liquidity support   On 14 April 2020, the Central Bank of the Republic of Uzbekistan (the “Central Bank”) has reduced the refinancing rate from 16% to 15% to stimulate liquidity support for the economy due to financial crisis caused by the coronavirus pandemic.     Under the Decree 5978, the Central Bank has:   allowed the extension of loan repayments by individuals and individual entrepreneurs due in the next six months of 2020 valued at UZS 4.7 trillion (equivalent of USD 470 million)."    and    "the deadline for payment of property tax and land tax for individuals is extended until 15 October 2020;    Individuals have been granted the right to an interest-free deferral (installment plan) of tax payments, accrued on income from personal real estate leased to individuals and commercial real estate leased to businesses affected during the quarantine period, until 1 April 2021;"    Web archived link 1:  http://archive.today/2021.03.02-051226/https://www.whitecase.com/publications/alert/covid-19-uzbekistan-government-financial-assistance-measures  _______________________________________________________________________________    Quote from linked article 2:  "The authorities also temporary reduced social contributions for individual entrepreneurs, postponed the payment of property and land taxes, extended a moratorium on tax audits, and delayed tax declarations for 2019 income taxes. The central government also asked local governments to reduce taxes by 30 percent and provide a 6-month grace period on paying property tax."    Web archived link 2:  http://archive.today/2021.03.02-051441/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19%23U
notes_C2: The UK Embassy states that hotels, motels, and guest houses have reopened (but are subject to special health and safety rules) following the easing of restrictive measures. From 15 August, all shopping malls, clothing markets, restaurants, cafes, beauty salons, and larger shops, as well as gyms, swimming pools, private kindergartens, and education centers have reopened.  Link: https://archive.vn/hMl5w
notes_H3: Evidence on active contact-tracing was conducted earlier on in 2020, although it is still being done, there is little evidence to show it is as robust as before. A mobile app was introduced with nothing more substantial to show comprehensive contact-tracing is still being done.  ___________________________  Quote (1):  "06-Apr-20: Testing strategy: all symptomatic cases, contacts and those under quarantine are being actively tested. Testing kits are being provided by WHO, the Russian Federation and China. The website of the Ministry of Health includes a section where the population can conduct a test to assess their need for testing." notes_H7: Vaccines: Vaxzevria (also known as Astra Zeneca) and the Uzbek-Chinese vaccine ZF-UZ-VAC2001  Uzbekistan government have approved vaccines and started vaccinations as of April 1st according to latest update. The first shipment of AstraZeneca vaccine have been received on March 17th with the aim to provide initial doses to individuals older than 65, medical personnel, people with chronic diseases, schoolteachers and kindergarten teachers, and law enforcement and military personnel as per the update,  "Has the government of Uzbekistan approved a COVID-19 vaccine for use? Yes  Are vaccines available in Uzbekistan for U. S. citizens to receive?  Yes, although supplies are still very limited.  Which vaccines are available in Uzbekistan?  Vaxzevria (also known as Astra Zeneca) and the Uzbek-Chinese vaccine ZF-UZ-VAC2001  According to Uzbek health authorities, the government’s initial vaccination campaign against COVID-19 began on April 1 with the first residents of Tashkent and regional capitals getting their shots.  The Health Ministry said on Telegram that people in district capitals and smaller settlements will start getting vaccinated on May 1, while vaccine doses will arrive in more remote areas in June.  The ministry said the British-Swedish Vaxzevria (formerly known as AstraZeneca) and the Chinese-Uzbek ZF-UZ-VAC 2001 vaccines are initially being used.  The initial rollout is for individuals older than 65, medical personnel, people with chronic diseases, schoolteachers and kindergarten teachers, and law enforcement and military personnel."    Archived article   http://web.archive.org/web/20210409031018/https://uz.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/  ______________________________________________________________________________________________________________________    A latest update also reported that the government started mass vaccination as per news, "An official statement says that "3,138 vaccination centers and 862 mobile medical brigades have been set up across the country for the vaccination campaign...[and] more than 4,000 doctors and more than 11,000 nurses are involved in the vaccination program."    Also, "The ministry said the British-Swedish Vaxzevria (formerly known as AstraZeneca) and the Chinese-Uzbek ZF-UZ-VAC 2001 vaccines are initially being used to guard against COVID-19 among the country's 32 million people.    The initial rollout is for individuals older than 65, medical personnel, people with chronic diseases, teachers of schools and kindergartens, and law enforcement and military personnel."  Archived Link   http://web.archive.org/web/20210410190425/https://www.rferl.org/a/uzbekistan-mass-vaccination-covid-19/31181553.html  _________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________    As per update, these vaccinations are conducted free of charge as per news, "Vaccination plan has been developed for the immunization of the country’s population, according to which 4.1 million people will be vaccinated in the first stage: people over 65 years old, medical workers, people with chronic diseases, teachers, kindergarten employees, law enforcement agencies. They will be vaccinated in state institutions and free of charge."    Archived Link  http://web.archive.org/web/20210411215518/https://www.asinta.com/news/uzbekistan-covid-19-employer-resources/
notes_C3: The government allowed to hold concert and entertainment events from January 28. However, the halls can only be 50% full, and visitors must wear masks and follow social distancing.  Link: https://archive.vn/2isaA
notes_C8: As per latest update, limited restrictions are placed as of June 2 which comprises of division of entry restrictions based on color zones; green , yellow and red. These color zones differentiates and applies restrictions based on the countries and specific restrictions ranging from screening, and quarantine. Those in the red zone may enter Uzbekistan through counties allocated for green and yellow zone but are required to quarantine.       Quote: " Uzbekistan is maintaining COVID-19-related international entry restrictions as of June 2. All arrivals must present evidence of a negative polymerase chain reaction (PCR) COVID-19 test taken within 72 hours before arrival. All international arrivals are also screened for COVID-19 and could face mandatory isolation in a government facility if they display symptoms.    While international travel is permitted, flight suspensions with several countries, including the UK, remain in place. Additionally, due to low demand, flights from several other destinations have been effectively suspended.  Authorities have designated countries Green, Yellow, or Red, depending on their assessment of the epidemiological threat in each. As of the most recent review, the designations are as follows:    Arrivals from Green locations are permitted to enter without restriction. Green locations include China, Thailand, Malaysia, South Korea, Georgia, Hungary, Finland, Latvia, Austria and Japan.    Travelers who have visited any Yellow location within the previous 10 days must self-isolate for 14 days on arrival. Yellow locations include Azerbaijan, Belarus, UAE and the EU (except and Spain).    All other countries have been designated as Red locations. Passengers who have visited a Red country within the previous 10 days may be subject to a second PCR COVID-19 test upon arrival. Persons who fail the second test may be quarantined in a state facility. Arrivals must also complete a passenger form specifying their accommodations for 14-day self-isolation. While flights with several of these countries have been suspended, travelers from Red locations may enter Uzbekistan by transiting a Yellow or Green location. Uzbek nationals returning from a Red country will be quarantined in a state facility for 14 days."  Archive Link  http://web.archive.org/web/20210607171303/https://www.garda.com/fr/crisis24/alertes-de-securite/486001/uzbekistan-health-officials-maintain-covid-19-related-entry-and-domestic-restrictions-as-of-june-2-update-27  ______________________________________________________  Quote: "Some countries have closed borders, and any country may further restrict travel or bring in new social distancing rules with little warning."  " Commercial flights to and from the UK to Uzbekistan have been suspended and flights to and from some other European countries have also been suspended. Check with your travel company or airline for the latest information."  Archive Link  http://web.archive.org/web/20210516202031/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/uzbekistan/coronavirus

Priority should be given to severe cases, people with comorbidities, pregnant women and healthcare workers (See page 4).    https://drive.google.com/file/d/1yrv5ec-LAdelzvTIf1RIhstTIduxEp3C/view  See "ESQUEMA TERAPÉUTICO ESPECÍFICO PARA TRATAMIENTO DE PACIENTE" in https://web.archive.org/web/20200406095426/http://www.mpps.gob.ve/index.php/sistemas/descargas

Income support measures include:  *The "Stay at Home" bonus for solidarity support for workers from private companies will be resumed from this week. notes_C2: **Code changed to 1G because even though the current phase in effect is the "Safer at home" phase where Non-essential businesses open and bars are closed, Governor Albert Bryan Jr. issued a 24th Supplemental Executive Order on the 25th of May allowing patrons to sit at the bar in restaurants and clubs.  https://archive.vn/7bUP4  https://archive.vn/3Cnn9
notes_H3: The specific testing benchmark beyond 2% will likely vary considerably by state and dependent upon local disease burdens. The Harvard Global Health Institute has suggested two methods to assess whether testing is adequate. Their benchmark is based on how much testing would be needed for a state to test all infected people and contacts that at predicted burdens. A testing capacity to test all symptomatic people and their close contacts (contact-tracing) is critical to prevent epidemic transmission. The second benchmark that the Harvard Global Health Institute suggests is that communities that demonstrate positivity rates (total positives/total tests) of 10% or lower are likely testing adequately.     http://web.archive.org/web/20201014190157/https://www.covid19usvi.com/sites/default/files/2020-05/Lab%20Faqs.pdf
notes_E1: $300 of benefits available to those unemployed 'through no fault of their own' through the Lost Wage Assistance (LWA) scheme.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210323135225/https://www.vidol.gov/unemployment-insurance/

name: Vietnam
notes_H1: Gov't created Covid-19 Website for information, followed by numerous information sources.     First press release on site dated for Jan 29. May have been released earlier.     https://ncov.moh.gov.vn/web/guest/-/bo-y-te-ra-khuyen-cao-moi-nhat-huong-dan-7-cach-phong-ngua-virus-corona
notes_H2: "As of mid-November, Viet Nam had 86 laboratories nationwide which are capable of providing confirmatory testing for COVID-19, according to the Ministry of Health.  The total include 37 in the North, eight in the Central, three in the Central Highlands and 38 in the South.   In late August, the Government agreed with the Ministry of Health’s proposal to allow public and private medical establishments to conduct COVID-19 testing."    https://web.archive.org/web/20201118111536/http://news.chinhphu.vn/Home/86-establishments-capable-of-providing-confirmatory-testing-for-COVID19/202011/42164.vgp
notes_C7: Several provinces with large volumes of daily interstate travel, including Ho Chi Minh City, are establishing checkpoints to screen travelers. Individuals coming from areas considered high-risk or having COVID-19 symptoms may be required to follow the specific COVID-19 outbreak prevention policy of the checkpoint province, including mandatory COVID-19 testing and quarantine, or may be asked to return to their point of departure.  Bac Giang Province has suspended all public transport services from May 21.  Quang Ngai, Quang Nam, and Quang Tri have temporarily suspended passenger bus routes to and from COVID-19 outbreak areas.  Other localities may apply similar measures without prior notice.  Saigon Railway continues to suspend train routes between HCMC and Phan Thiet/Nha Trang/Da Nang.  From May 20, Bac Ninh has suspended all public buses and taxis.  Before any intercity or interstate travel, all passengers using public means of transport (buses, taxis, trains, planes, ships, etc.) must complete an online health declaration    https://web.archive.org/web/20210525051040/https://vn.usembassy.gov/u-s-citizen-services/covid-19-information/
notes_E2: According to IMF, the SBV has issued guidelines to commercial banks to reschedule loans, reduce/exempt interest, and provide loan forbearance.   Newly approved measures include deferring excise tax on domestically produced cars, lowering land rental, cutting or exempting various fees and charges, cutting CIT rate for small and micro firms, and raising PIT deduction.  Financial institutions are also exempting and reducing fees. Affected firms are eligible to concessional loans from Vietnam Social Policy Bank (VSPB) with no interest for making salary payment to their workers who temporarily stopped working.   http://web.archive.org/web/20200723164138/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19
notes_C2: Hanoi has closed nightclubs, karaoke lounges, outdoor cafeterias, cinemas, fitness centers and massage parlors; primary and high schools in the city have also been closed; Hanoi’s government advised its residents not to leave their house unless necessary.    Ho Chi Minh City has closed schools and a wide range of non-essential businesses, including nightclubs, karaoke lounges, massage parlors, cinemas, video game centers, indoor sports service centers (gym, fitness, yoga, billiards, etc.), wedding halls, buffet restaurants and events/festivals of over 30 participants.    Da Nang has closed schools, nightclubs, karaoke lounges, massage parlors, cinemas, fitness centers, festivals, and sporting events.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210511091421/https://vn.usembassy.gov/u-s-citizen-services/covid-19-information/

notes_C8: Jan 4, 2021: "Vietnam's heath ministry has proposed suspending or limiting incoming flights from at least 34 countries and territories that have detected cases of the new COVID-19 variant first found in Britain, the government said on Monday."    https://web.archive.org/web/20210104201902/https://www.usnews.com/news/world/articles/2021-01-04/vietnam-proposes-suspending-all-flights-from-countries-with-uk-covid-19-variant      "Sources from the Vietnam Aviation Authority- Ministry of Transport said that so far, no flight has been permitted to bring Vietnamese citizens from countries around the world to their home in January 2021. notes_C6: Curfews in certain areas remain in place.   Da Nang are requiring its residents not to leave their house unless necessary and banned public gatherings of over 5 people outside of offices, schools and hospitals.  Hanoi’s government advised its residents not to leave their house unless necessary.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210518001047/http://baochinhphu.vn/Xa-hoi/Da-Nang-yeu-cau-nguoi-dan-han-che-ra-khoi-nha-khong-tap-trung-qua-5-nguoi-noi-cong-cong/431157.vgp  https://web.archive.org/web/20210517232529/https://vn.usembassy.gov/u-s-citizen-services/covid-19-information/
notes_H6: "Hanoi city’s government announced November 11 that wearing a face mask is mandatory at the following locations: 1) hospitals; 2) parking lots; 3) public transportation; 4) shopping malls; and 5) supermarkets and traditional markets.  Other localities in Vietnam may take similar measures without prior notice."    https://web.archive.org/web/20201130194455/https://vn.usembassy.gov/u-s-citizen-services/covid-19-information/      Mandatory wearing of masks in public, especially the 5 places enumerated above.  "Theo dó, Phó Ch? t?ch UBND Thành ph? Ngô Van Qúy d? ngh? các don v? ti?p t?c tuyên truy?n nh?t là vi?c b?t bu?c deo kh?u trang noi công c?ng; qu?n lý ch?t ch? các khu cách ly, các tru?ng h?p nh?p c?nh trái phép. 5 d?a di?m: B?nh vi?n, b?n bãi d? xe, phuong ti?n công c?ng, trung tâm thuong m?i, siêu th?, ch? ph?i b? trí ngu?i ki?m soát ch?t ch?, ai không có kh?u trang không cho vào, b? trí di?m bán kh?u trang ngay ? c?a."     https://web.archive.org/web/20201130201649/http://thanglong.chinhphu.vn/khong-duoc-vao-5-dia-diem-neu-khong-deo-khau-trang
notes_H8: Elderly are on the top of the list of the vaccination but no other measurements were found.   https://archive.vn/pVYlZ  http://web.archive.org/web/20210602075309/https://vn.usembassy.gov/u-s-citizen-services/covid-19-information/
notes_C5: May 17, Da Nang suspended all taxis and ride-hailing services, including food delivery, in the city.  From May 20, Bac Ninh has suspended all public buses and taxis.  Bac Giang Province has suspended all public transport services from May 21.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210525051040/https://vn.usembassy.gov/u-s-citizen-services/covid-19-information/

name: Vanuatu
notes_H1: Not sure about the starting date. I am considering the state of emergency declaratory http://web.archive.org/web/20200614235155/https://covid19.gov.vu/
notes_H2: Only those who meet the case definition will be able to be tested for COVID-19. This Includes people who have clinical symptoms, and travel history or contact with a COVID-19 case. People with clinical symptoms without travel history or contact with COVID-19 case will not be tested.  http://web.archive.org/web/20200614235453/https://covid19.gov.vu/images/Information-Sheets/Community_messaging_lab_testing_v2.pdf
notes_C7: "As of 1st December 2020, Vanuatu has no active cases of COVID-19. According to the the COVID-19 Health Sector Preparedness and Response Plan, Vanuatu is now in Scenario 1 (no cases)."    "Scenario 1 (no cases):   - No restrictions on schools, workplaces, public or private gatherings.  - Installation of handwashing stations.  - Preparation of response plans.  - Follow hygiene and prevention measures."    "Inter-islands travel restrictions" apply only for Scenario 3 (Community Transmission).    https://web.archive.org/web/20201204143207/https://covid19.gov.vu/index.php
notes_E2: Hardship loans were provided in 2020, but the loan facility closed in May 2020. Commodity Support Grants, Shipping Support Grants and other support available for businesses from April, but applications closed November 30 2020.     See IMF Covid-19 Policy Responses (https://web.archive.org/web/20210215151708/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19#V).
notes_C2: No measures.    https://web.archive.org/web/20200828083359/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/vanuatu/coronavirus
notes_H3: In previous comments, the absence of confirmed cases was noted and the code H3=1 has been unchanged for several months.  The first confirmed case on 10th November was followed up by detailed contact tracing as described in Situation Report 27 on the Ministry of Health Covid-19 website.      The details provided on contact tracing suggest that it is comprehensive:    "CONTACT TRACING AND QUARANTINE OF CLOSE CONTACTS OF THE CONFIRMED CASE  • Contact tracing commenced on 11 November 2020 following confirmation of the first COVID-19 case.  • The case was interviewed to identify people with whom they were in close contact*.  • Of the 152 other passengers on the same flight, 17 were identified as close contacts as they sat within two rows of the case on the plane; no other close contacts were identified.  • All close contacts have been in quarantine since arrival on 4 November 2020 and will remain so under health clearance is provided. All close contacts had received daily health monitoring and had been tested for SARS-CoV-2; all tests were negative. Subsequent tests will be conducted as per established quarantine protocols. "    In addition, workers at the airport:    "AT RISK ASSESSMENT FOR OCCUPATIONAL EXPOSURE^  • Investigations commenced on 11 November 2020 also targeted workers involved in the repatriation process (including airline, airport, customs, immigration, biosecurity, health, transport and hotel staff) so as to identify those who were at occupation risk.  • 19 people have so far been identified and all were interviewed on 11 November 2020. 12 people met the screening criteria for potential exposure; all reported low-risk exposure and proper use of personal protective equipment.  • As a precautionary measure, tests were conducted for the 12 at risk people; all results were negative. All are currently in quarantine."    The report is a PDF (Situation Report No.27, dated 12th November)  Link:  http://archive.today/2020.11.16-171059/https://covid19.gov.vu/index.php/situation-reports
notes_E1: Employment Stabilization Payment came to an end in June. The Vanuatu Chamber of Commerce and Industry (VCCI) has requested that an extension of a minimum of three months be made to the Employment Stabilization Payment (ESP) so that affected businesses can retain staff (but this has not yet been confirmed) http://archive.fo/IY1og
notes_C1: "The Ministry of Health confirmed on 11 May 2020 that there are no confirmed cases nor suspected cases of COVID-19 in Vanuatu since the first declaration of State of Emergency on 26 March 2020. Thus, the MoET announced the re-opening of the schools to students on Monday 18 May 2020. The schools are required to resume all classes and to have good hygiene and hand washing practices in place for students and staff." https://web.archive.org/web/20200618131359/https://www.gov.vu/index.php/events/news/72-schools-to-reopen-on-monday-18-05-2020
notes_H7: A, B, C - AstraZeneca  "On 2 June 2021, the Ministry of Health launched the COVID-19 Vaccine roll-out. The first batch from COVAX Facility  is being prioritised to health workers, front line workers (e.g. border workers, quarantine facility staff,  public transport drivers), the elderly (55 and above), and people over 35 with existing medical conditions."  http://archive.today/2021.06.15-154330/https://covid19.gov.vu/images/Situation-reports/Vanuatu_COVID19_NHEOC_SitRep_38_03062021b.pdf
notes_C3: Move to Scenario 1 on the Vanuatu COVID-19 Disaster Response Plan. This means that no restrictions on public events, indeed between 23-30th mass celebrations for 40th anniversary of Independence  http://web.archive.org/web/20210321111107/https://covid19.gov.vu/images/docs/MOH_COVID_HSPRP_2_.pdf
notes_C8: All borders closed from state of emergency /web/20200615003756/https://www.theguardian.com/travel/2020/mar/24/coronavirus-travel-updates-which-countries-have-restrictions-and-fco-warnings-in-place
notes_C4: Move to Scenario 1 on the Vanuatu COVID-19 Disaster Response Plan. This means that no restrictions on gatherings or gathering sizes, indeed between 23-30th mass celebrations for 40th anniversary of Independence  http://web.archive.org/web/20210321111107/https://covid19.gov.vu/images/docs/MOH_COVID_HSPRP_2_.pdf
notes_C6: Move to Scenario 1 on the Vanuatu COVID-19 Disaster Response Plan. This means that no restrictions on leaving the house  http://web.archive.org/web/20210321111107/https://covid19.gov.vu/images/docs/MOH_COVID_HSPRP_2_.pdf
notes_H8: The state of emergency was extended until December 31. However, there is no stay-at-home policy in place.   Link: https://archive.vn/fTBbB
notes_C5: Move to Scenario 1 on the Vanuatu COVID-19 Disaster Response Plan. This means that no public transport restrictions  http://web.archive.org/web/20210321111107/https://covid19.gov.vu/images/docs/MOH_COVID_HSPRP_2_.pdf  http://web.archive.org/web/20210321111107/https://covid19.gov.vu/images/docs/MOH_COVID_HSPRP_2_.pdf

name: Yemen
notes_H1: "The Ministry of Public Health and Population announces the state of comprehensive health mobilization for doctors, health personnel, technicians, and preventive quarantine experts, in preparation for facing the Coronavirus." (Translated from Arabic)  http://web.archive.org/web/20200510135933/http://www.moh.gov.ye/news_details.aspx?id=2264
notes_H2: Authorities in Aden setup a new specialized field hospital in Al Mualla district for patients with fever. On 04 October 2020, a COVID-19 examination unit opened at the isolation center in Ataq, Shabwah Governorate. Fifteen sea border points and three land border points are partially open for movements. There have been ten transit points for public movement between southern and northern governorates. Since the COVID-19 pandemic outbreak, the Yemeni authorities have put additional preventive measures and health screenings for people passing through these transit points, specifically at points located in Taizz and Al-Bayda. For Yemeni returnees from KSA through the Al’Wadeeah border entry point, carrying a COVID PCR test report is mandatory by the Yemeni authorities. Authorities at Al’Wadeeah entry point have established and installed a PCR testing facility at the entry point for travelers who arrive without a PCR test report.  https://web.archive.org/web/20201029155117/https://displacement.iom.int/yemen
notes_C7: in response to the COVID-19 pandemic, the local authorities of Yemen declared a nationwide health emergency and introduced many preventative measures similar to those adopted by rest of the world starting in March 2020 in order to reduce the transmission of COVID-19. These measures include the adoption of restrictions on movement countrywide.     https://web.archive.org/web/20201029155916/https://reliefweb.int/report/yemen/covid-19-movement-restrictions-yemen-mobility-restriction-dashboard-14-21-october-2020
notes_C2: "The committee called on the government to “declare a (public) health state of emergency in all provinces, prepare health centers and hospital, and provide medical staff with personal protective equipment.”  The committee called for the implementation of a “partial curfew” and for the closure of wedding halls, shopping centers and mosques outside of prayer times."  https://archive.vn/2S5bv
notes_C1: No change found  https://archive.vn/HXzCA
notes_H7: It appears that all citizens can go get vaccinated: "For his part, the Director of the Aden Health Office, Dr. Ali Abdullah, stressed the safety and security of the vaccine, calling on all citizens to go to the vaccination centers to take the first dose of it, especially the elderly, to preserve their safety and their lives from the symptoms of corona infection."  https://web.archive.org/web/20210531082708/https://pmo-ye.net/post/1319   https://archive.vn/xQHLS  https://archive.vn/FDI63
notes_C3: "The committee called on the government to “declare a (public) health state of emergency in all provinces, prepare health centers and hospital, and provide medical staff with personal protective equipment.”  The committee called for the implementation of a “partial curfew” and for the closure of wedding halls, shopping centers and mosques outside of prayer times."  https://archive.vn/2S5bv
notes_C8: Flights to/from India remain suspended:   Source: https://archive.vn/R2XcY   "The majority of land, sea and air ports in Yemen are closed until further notice, with only very limited international flights taking place. Exemptions are in place for humanitarian relief and essential goods.  All travellers arriving into Yemen are required to enter quarantine facilities for 14 days."  https://archive.ph/6FYPM
notes_C6: No change in policy, "Authorities in the governorate of Ma’rib imposed a curfew from 09 p.m. until 04 a.m. in an attempt to combat the spread of COVID-19."   https://archive.vn/2021.06.21-132622/https://displacement.iom.int/system/tdf/reports/20210606_COVID19_DTM%20Yemen%20Mobility%20Restrictions%20Dashboard%20DRAFT_%252325_V2.pdf?file=1&type=node&id=11658
notes_H6: While mask recommendations still stand, sources indicate compulsory mask wearing at universities. Changing to 2G.    https://archive.vn/WfmqI   https://archive.vn/DpVh2  https://archive.vn/xQHLS
notes_H8: Carrying over C6   https://displacement.iom.int/system/tdf/reports/20210606_COVID19_DTM%20Yemen%20Mobility%20Restrictions%20Dashboard%20DRAFT_%2325_V2.pdf?file=1&type=node&id=11658

name: South Africa
notes_H1: 5 March 2020 - South Africa's President Cyril Ramaphosa has warned that the coronavirus will turn into a "national crisis" and its impact will be "huge".  His warning came after the first case of the coronavirus was detected in South Africa.     https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-africa-51752974     https://www.gov.za/Coronavirus
notes_H2: The National Institute of Communicable Diseases (NICD) recommends that hospitalised patients, in addition to anyone who displays symptoms of COVID-19, and individuals who are close contacts of confirmed cases should be tested.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210621234053/https://www.nicd.ac.za/diseases-a-z-index/covid-19/frequently-asked-questions/
notes_C7: Since 16 June 2021, under Alert level 3, travel between provinces is prohibited, with few exceptions.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210622001736/https://www.gov.za/covid-19/individuals-and-households/travel-coronavirus-covid-19
notes_E2: There are continued protections against eviction without court order.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210613223825/https://www.gov.za/coronavirus/alert-level-2
notes_C2: According to the U.S. Embassy in South Africa, as of June 1, 2021,  many retail shops and services, supermarkets, pharmacies, and businesses continue to operate in line with safety protocols, but will be strictly enforcing mask rules.    The government is asking businesses to allow workers to stay home where possible under Alert Level 2.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210613195451/https://za.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information-2/    https://web.archive.org/web/20210613223825/https://www.gov.za/coronavirus/alert-level-2
notes_H3: 7th March- tracing of all members of a group of 10 from Italy from which one tested positive.  The public must be notified that we have information and know the whereabouts of all the other 10 people who were part of the group that had travelled to Italy. All those who came back to South Africa, are currently being tested. We are now awaiting their test results to come out. Since being traced, they have remained in isolation to avoid any further contact with third parties.  	https://web.archive.org/web/20200406162441/https://sacoronavirus.co.za/2020/03/07/confirmation-of-second-case-of-covid-19-in-south-africa/
notes_E1: No policy change has occurred. COVID-19 Social Relief of Distress (SRD) grants amounting to R350 are offered to those unemployed and not receiving unemployment benefits.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210622001954/https://www.gov.za/covid-19/individuals-and-households/social-grants-coronavirus-covid-19
notes_C1: Schools are open with precautionary measures in place. Primary school students and students with special needs will return to the traditional format on July 26 2021.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210613213829/https://www.gov.za/speeches/basic-education-issues-directions-%C2%A0date-return-all-learners-primary-schools-29-may-2021
notes_H7: In phase 2 of the vaccination rollout, the vaccine is being offered to essential workers, persons older than 60 years old, and adults over 18 with co-morbidities.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210621235702/https://sacoronavirus.co.za/vaccine-updates/  https://web.archive.org/web/20210618114516/https://vaccine.enroll.health.gov.za/
notes_C3: According to the U.S. Embassy in South Africa, as of June 1, 2021, public gatherings are allowed with attendance restrictions. Outdoor events are allowed up to 250 people and indoor events are allowed up to 100 people. COVID-19 health and safety protocols must continue to be followed at all times, including observance of guidelines for social distancing of 2 meters, sanitation and hygiene, and use of appropriate personal protective equipment, like cloth face masks, as determined by the South African National Department of Health. Sporting events are permitted with restrictions.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210613195451/https://za.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information-2/    https://web.archive.org/web/20210613223825/https://www.gov.za/coronavirus/alert-level-2#gatherings
notes_C8: Effective 2-15-20221 20 land borders will reopen on Monday, says Motsoaledi. Valid negative Covid 19 test required.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210215191542/https://www.voanews.com/covid-19-pandemic/south-africa-reopen-20-land-border-crossings-next-week
notes_C4: According to the U.S. Embassy in South Africa, as of June 1, 2021, public gatherings are allowed with attendance restrictions. Outdoor events are allowed up to 250 people and indoor events are allowed up to 100 people. COVID-19 health and safety protocols must continue to be followed at all times, including observance of guidelines for social distancing of 2 meters, sanitation and hygiene, and use of appropriate personal protective equipment, like cloth face masks, as determined by the South African National Department of Health. Sporting events are permitted with restrictions.    No more than 50% capacity of a venue can be exceeded in any case outside of hotel accommodation as outlined by Alert Level 2.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210613195451/https://za.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information-2/    https://web.archive.org/web/20210613223825/https://www.gov.za/coronavirus/alert-level-2#gatherings
notes_C6: According to the U.S. Embassy in South Africa, as of June 1, 2021, a nationwide curfew exists from 11:00 PM to 4 AM.     https://web.archive.org/web/20210613195451/https://za.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information-2/
notes_H6: Facial coverings required in all public places. This is a change from previous coding, but policy has not changed — the way this is coded is in line with the coding interpretation guide.     Adjusted Alert Level 3 in place until 15 February (https://web.archive.org/web/20210201183707/https://twitter.com/PresidencyZA/status/1348697788679397377/photo/1), see government website for guidance on alert level 3 (https://web.archive.org/web/20210201185402/https://www.gov.za/covid-19/about/alert-level-3-during-coronavirus-covid-19-lockdown).
notes_H8: Visits to older persons' residential facilities are prohibited under Alert level 2 except to the extent directed by a relevant cabinet member. The elderly will be prioritized for future vaccination capacity.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210613195451/https://za.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information-2    https://web.archive.org/web/20210613223825/https://www.gov.za/coronavirus/alert-level-2    https://web.archive.org/web/20210613223030/https://www.gov.za/
notes_C5: According to the U.S. Embassy in South Africa, as of June 1, 2021, public transportation is operating at a reduced level with health measures.    Public rail, minibus taxi, and bus services have resumed at reduced levels subject to social distancing and mandatory use of face masks for passengers and drivers. Minibus taxis and buses must reduce their maximum licensed passenger seating capacity to 70% a vehicle, e-hailing services that are licensed to carry up to four passengers are limited to carrying 50% of their permissible passenger carrying capacity. Transport services are required to provide adequate sanitizers for washing of hands of all passengers. Operators must ensure that their vehicles are sanitized before picking up and after dropping off passengers.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210613195451/https://za.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information-2/

name: Zambia
notes_H1: Zambia’s Ministry of Health (MoH) has implemented several measures as of Friday, February 21, to prevent the spread of coronavirus (COVID-19) into the country. Health workers have deployed to points of entry to conduct temperatures scans and a hospital in Chilanga district has been designated as an isolation center for treating possible cases.    https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/316201/zambia-coronavirus-screening-measures-implemented-as-of-february-21
notes_H2: Testing generally available at multiple private cites, for a fee.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210621155217/https://zm.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information-2/
notes_C7: Movement Restrictions:    Is a curfew in place? No  Are there restrictions on intercity or interstate travel? No  Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20201004153230/https://zm.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information-2/
notes_E2: No mention of it here https://archive.vn/ebt7h#selection-26063.0-26063.6
notes_C2: Entertainment businesses closed.   https://web.archive.org/web/20210621155617/https://www.theeastafrican.co.ke/tea/rest-of-africa/zambia-closes-schools-restricts-social-functions-as-it-battles-covid-third-wave-3440526
notes_H3: No evidence of contact tracing, per US Embassy.   https://web.archive.org/web/20210621155217/https://zm.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information-2/
notes_C1: Schools closed amid an increase in cases.   https://web.archive.org/web/20210621155617/https://www.theeastafrican.co.ke/tea/rest-of-africa/zambia-closes-schools-restricts-social-functions-as-it-battles-covid-third-wave-3440526
notes_H7: AstraZeneca approved, and Johnson&Johnson has been secured. Information on the recipients of vaccinations is sparce, only suggesting that key workers are receiving vaccines.   https://web.archive.org/web/20210615080230/https://www.moh.gov.zm/  https://web.archive.org/web/20210621155217/https://zm.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information-2/  https://web.archive.org/web/20210621155217/https://zm.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information-2/  https://web.archive.org/web/20210621164634/https://africa.cgtn.com/2021/06/18/zambia-to-procure-3-million-doses-johnson-johnson-covid-19-vaccines/  https://web.archive.org/web/20210621155217/https://zm.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information-2/
notes_C3: "Zambia’s secretary to the Cabinet, Simon Miti, said public gatherings and social functions would be restricted while entertainment joints will only operate from Thursday to Sunday."  https://web.archive.org/web/20210621155617/https://www.theeastafrican.co.ke/tea/rest-of-africa/zambia-closes-schools-restricts-social-functions-as-it-battles-covid-third-wave-3440526
notes_C8: Zambia on Friday reintroduced the COVID-19 test on arrival and the mandatory 14-day quarantine for travellers from 15 countries.    According to a joint statement from the Health Ministry and Public Health Institute in the capital Lusaka, the affected countries are South Africa, Tanzania, Kenya, Ethiopia, Egypt, Tunisia, India, Iran, Turkey, France, Germany, Russia, Italy, Brazil, and Argentina. The ministry said the list would be reviewed and updated regularly.    Otherwise international travel screening remains in place. A negative PCR test is required within 72 hours before departure to Zambia. Limited screening is in place at Lusaka airport which involves temperature checks as well as antigen tests if required. Symptomatic passengers may be asked to self-isolate for 14 days. No exit requirements are demanded by the Zambian government though airlines and destination countries may have their own health requirements.    http://web.archive.org/web/20210524163018/https://zm.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information-2/  http://web.archive.org/web/20210524165314/https://www.aa.com.tr/en/africa/zambia-reimposes-covid-19-restrictions-for-travelers/2249909
notes_C4: "Zambia’s secretary to the Cabinet, Simon Miti, said public gatherings and social functions would be restricted while entertainment joints will only operate from Thursday to Sunday.  Funerals and weddings will be attended by a maximum 50 people, while churches have been asked to reduce the number of meetings to two per week."  https://web.archive.org/web/20210621155617/https://www.theeastafrican.co.ke/tea/rest-of-africa/zambia-closes-schools-restricts-social-functions-as-it-battles-covid-third-wave-3440526
notes_C6: No stay at home requirements appear to be in place.    Note: Recent comments by the Minister of Health do not mention any recommended staying at home.    http://web.archive.org/web/20210524163018/https://zm.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information-2/      http://web.archive.org/web/20210524164431/https://zm.usembassy.gov/launch-of-zambia-population-based-hiv-impact-assessment-2021-survey-ministry-of-health/
notes_H6: Masks are required to be worn in public and on public transportation, although this rule does not appear to be enforced.  https://archive.ph/Xv7b8#selection-2279.0-2279.120
notes_H8: No specific measures for the protection of elderly people. Coding also aligns with the general public restrictions in C6.    http://web.archive.org/web/20210524163018/https://zm.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information-2/
notes_C5: Public transport still operating.     https://web.archive.org/web/20210621155217/https://zm.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information-2/

name: Zimbabwe
notes_H1: From today (Friday), in Zimbabwe Covid-19 awareness messages will be broadcast on two national radio stations in three local languages, reaching five million people (this is sponsored by Goal Global, an NGO)  https://web.archive.org/web/20200504143836/https://www.goalglobal.org/stories/irish-humanitarian-aid-agency-goal-leading-fight-against-spread-of-covid-19-in-zimbabwe/
notes_H2: Testing is widely available through several government-approved laboratories.     https://web.archive.org/web/20210222151527/https://zw.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information-2/
notes_C7: "Currently a curfew is in effect from 10:30 p.m. to 5:00 a.m." Intercity travel is restricted for non-essential purposes. "Intercity travel is permitted but only for vehicles operated by the State, local authorities, ZUPCO and operators who are specially registered by the Commissioner of Road Transport. All journeys operate under current COVID-19 restrictions"  https://web.archive.org/web/20210621104206/https://zw.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information-2/  https://web.archive.org/web/20210418081304/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/zimbabwe/coronavirus
notes_C2: With the updated lockdown rules, most workplaces have been allowed to open under strict WHO guidelines. Beerhalls, bars, nightclubs, and gyms remain closed.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210315090029/https://zw.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information-2/
notes_H3: There is no data to support information on contact tracing.
notes_E1: There is no current data to support any evidence of income relief.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210308204707/https://www.worldbank.org/en/country/zimbabwe/brief/monitoring-covid-19-impact-on-households-in-zimbabwe
notes_C1: All schools reopened in a staggered manner as planned under health and safety guidelines. Exam classes returned on the 15th March with the rest of school years returning on the 22nd March.    Lessons are now running normally and all students are now allowed to come to school.      http://web.archive.org/web/20210517093150/https://allafrica.com/stories/202105050449.html    http://web.archive.org/web/20210517093353/https://allafrica.com/stories/202103030501.html
notes_H7: "Sinopharm’s?BBIBP-CorV, Sinovac’sCoronaVac,?and Bharat Biotech’s COVAXIN" are all approved for use. A donation of J&J's vaccine was rejected, despite the fact that supply issues are rampant, and the rollout of the vaccine has ceased. Groups A, B and C appear to be eligible for the vaccine, but reports cite that the country has run out of vaccines, indicating no availability.   https://web.archive.org/web/20210621152313/https://www.theeastafrican.co.ke/tea/rest-of-africa/zimbabwe-runs-out-of-covid-19-vaccines-3444874
notes_C3: It is still the general rule that people are not allowed to assemble in public places in groups of more than two, except when allowed by the Lock-down Order.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210308202748/https://www.thezimbabwean.co/2021/03/public-health-lock-down-order-relaxation-of-lock-down/
notes_C8: Negative PCR test from the last 48 hours required. Quarantine also required for all entering Zimbabwe.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210621104206/https://zw.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information-2/  https://web.archive.org/web/20210310145324/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/zimbabwe/entry-requirements
notes_C4: Funeral gatherings remain restricted to 30, while other gatherings including church meetings are limited to 50 people.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210308201320/https://www.bbc.com/news/topics/crr7mlg0rpvt/zimbabwe
notes_C6: Starting 22 July, security forces will enforce a curfew between 6pm-6am local time. All non-working people will be required to stay at home, except to buy groceries and seek medical attention. Business hours will be limited to 8am to 3pm, apart from those performing essential services.  http://web.archive.org/web/20200730220048/https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2020/07/zimbabwe-imposes-curfew-spike-coronavirus-infections-200722052647613.html
notes_H6: Everyone in a public place must observe social distancing (i.e. keep at least one metre apart) and wear a face mask.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210308202748/https://www.thezimbabwean.co/2021/03/public-health-lock-down-order-relaxation-of-lock-down/
notes_H8: No evidence of measures specific to elderly people beyond general measures.   https://web.archive.org/web/20210621104206/https://zw.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information-2/
notes_C5: Public transport still operating, but it is recommended to limit movement. Additionally, movement is forbidden within curfew hours. https://web.archive.org/web/20210418081304/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/zimbabwe/coronavirus

name: Taiwan
notes_H1: Despite the current outbreak from mid-May, Taiwan's official website for covid-19 has not been updated since 10 May.    https://archive.vn/lyu2O
notes_H2: "On May 23, the Central Epidemic Command Center (CECC) announced that it gradually eased restrictions on applicants for coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) testing considering that domestic coronavirus situation is under control.  The decision allows members of the public to undergo COVID-19 testing at their own expense at designated hospitals due to emergency situations, as well as work and studying abroad requirements, and obtain documents proving they have done the testing. Members of the public who are eligible for requesting COVID-19 testing at their own expense are as follows: 1.    Those under home isolation or quarantine who need to attend a funeral of a deceased first or second degree relative or visit such relative with serious illness; 2.    Those who need to visit other countries/regions for an emergency involving their relatives overseas, including accidents or serious illness; 3. Those requesting COVID-19 testing for work; 4.  Those requesting COVID-19 testing for studying abroad; 5. Foreign nationals, mainland Chinese, Hong Kong or Macao residents requesting COVID-19 testing for departure; 6.    Family members of those listed above.  Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200526054841/https://www.cdc.gov.tw/En/Bulletin/Detail/zvqg0FiEVgQDWcL3ftogcA?typeid=158"
notes_C7: On 15 May 2021 Taipei and New Taipei City raised their alert levels for the first time to tier three in the four-tier system due to the recent local outbreak. 'Several other cities and counties, including Changhua, Taichung, Tainan and Kaohsiung, also raised alert levels and tightened controls on social gatherings, with the Kaohsiung city government banning its officials from visiting Taipei and New Taipei until after May 28.'    https://archive.vn/WYEhp
notes_E2: The Bank of Taiwan (BOT) has made financial assistance measures available to loan clients who are experiencing payment difficulties due to coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19). Until June 30, BOT's existing borrowers who have previously repaid principal and interest on schedule can apply for up to a six-month principal repayment extension. Borrowers must submit documents showing suffering and economic impact from COVID-19, such as proof of revenue decline, non-voluntary unemployment, or leave without pay. Borrowers must continue paying monthly interest during the extension period.  Loan Extension: Companies or individuals can apply to defer principal repayment or extend loan. Credit card payment deferral at public banks: Individuals can apply to defer card payment without penalty and interest.   https://web.archive.org/web/20200722174919/https://www.mof.gov.tw/eng/singlehtml/f48d641f159a4866b1d31c0916fbcc71?cntId=4ea6929857b04241aa6df34003fd9c25  https://web.archive.org/web/20200722174815/https://home.kpmg/xx/en/home/insights/2020/04/taiwan-government-and-institution-measures-in-response-to-covid.html
notes_C2: On 15 May 2021, when Taiwan reported 180 new local cases, the government announced that cinemas, sports stadiums, recreation centres and libraries will all be closed until at least May 28. 'Taiwanese President Tsai Ing-wen appealed to the public for calm and to work with the government to keep the pandemic at bay.'    https://archive.vn/62C57  https://archive.vn/WYEhp
notes_H3: Taiwan centers for disease control  https://web.archive.org/web/20200414072715/https://www.cdc.gov.tw/File/Get/LO4IJGwYKrJ5urP3CQeLbw  On January 23, 2020, level 2 of the CECC was established due to the fact that the first case of COVID-19 was confirmed on January 21, 2020.  3. Surveillance and Laboratory Diagnosis: (1)We began to identify people who developed fever, cough or other acute respiratory symptoms and who had a past 14-day travel history or close  contact with the above mentioned people. They are all required to report to the health authorities and provide a lab specimen for further laboratory diagnosis. (2)When a person seeks medical attention using his or her National Health Insurance (NHI) card, the person’s travel history to areas affected by COVID-19 will display on the system because immigration data is linked to the National Health Insurance Administration. This system helps remind a physician to pay attention to past 14-day travel history and inquire and examine the person accordingly. This can effectively prevent failing to detect a potential case.(3)Since February 16, 2020, we have enhanced COVID-19 case finding by proactively seeking out patients with severe respiratory symptoms who had tested negative for influenza and retested them for COVID-19. In addition, patients who are highly suspected as COVID-19 infection by the physicians as well as medical staff with pneumonia or cluster are also subject to provide specimens for further laboratory diagnosis. (4)In order to have specimens tested quickly, we have improved our laboratory diagnosis capacities from 12 laboratories for 520 cases per day to 34 laboratories for 3,200 cases per day.
notes_E1: Starting from 21 April, companies suffering a 50% reduction in income when compared to the same period over the past two years qualify to apply for salary subsidies.   The government will subsidise 40% of wages of an employee up to a limit of NT$20,000 per month for three months.  Sources: https://web.archive.org/web/20200511214349/https://thetaiwantimes.com/taiwans-unheralded-covid-19-financial-response/2587 ; https://web.archive.org/web/20200425120520/https://udn.com/news/story/120974/4508657
notes_C1: As the daily number of cases keep surging in Taiwan, the Central Epidemic Command Center 'on Tuesday (May 18) announced that schools at all levels will suspend face-to-face classes and switch to distance learning from May 19 to 28.'    https://archive.vn/jGN9n
notes_H7: Taiwan 'announced that the government-funded COVID-19 vaccine would be available to ... essential personnel who maintain the normal functions of society such as police and military police officers, and staff and people receiving care at long-term care institutions, social welfare institutions and in the social welfare system on April 23, 2021.'  This means group [C], the elder groups, also started to receive vaccines.    https://archive.vn/aMuaN
notes_C3: GOV.UK:    Taiwan’s Central Epidemic Command Center (CECC) has announced that from 19 May 2021, the COVID-19 alert has been raised to Level 3 across Taiwan.    A Level 3 alert means the following measures are now in place:    1. Wearing of masks at all times outdoors  2. Indoor gatherings limited to five people, outdoor gatherings limited to 10 people  3. Completing contact tracing procedures when entering restaurants, shops and some public places  4. Some places of business and public venues are closed, with the exception of essential services, police departments, hospitals, and government buildings. The authorities have said that work places and schools will continue to operate as long as pandemic plans are in place, and flexible working is being encouraged [The fact is that the government has closed all schools from 19 to 28 May]  5. Masks and social distancing required at all businesses or venues that remain open [and]  6. In areas where community transmission has taken place, residents are restricted to a set perimeter and must submit to COVID-19 testing    https://archive.vn/kJs94  https://archive.vn/jGN9n
notes_C8: http://archive.is/kNP0H  Taiwan Centers for Disease Control  “From June 22, short-term business travelers are allowed entry and can apply for shortened home quarantine period”
notes_C4: GOV.UK:    Taiwan’s Central Epidemic Command Center (CECC) has announced that from 19 May 2021, the COVID-19 alert has been raised to Level 3 across Taiwan.    A Level 3 alert means the following measures are now in place:    1. Wearing of masks at all times outdoors  2. Indoor gatherings limited to five people, outdoor gatherings limited to 10 people  3. Completing contact tracing procedures when entering restaurants, shops and some public places  4. Some places of business and public venues are closed, with the exception of essential services, police departments, hospitals, and government buildings. The authorities have said that work places and schools will continue to operate as long as pandemic plans are in place, and flexible working is being encouraged [The fact is that the government has closed all schools from 19 to 28 May]  5. Masks and social distancing required at all businesses or venues that remain open [and]  6. In areas where community transmission has taken place, residents are restricted to a set perimeter and must submit to COVID-19 testing    https://archive.vn/kJs94  https://archive.vn/jGN9n
notes_C6: GOV.UK:    Taiwan’s Central Epidemic Command Center (CECC) has announced that from 19 May 2021, the COVID-19 alert has been raised to Level 3 across Taiwan.    A Level 3 alert means the following measures are now in place:    'Avoid, unnecessary travel, activities and gatherings'. Interpreted this as a recommendation to stay at home.    'In areas where community transmission has taken place, residents are restricted to a set perimeter' (Hence the 2T code)    https://archive.vn/kJs94  https://archive.vn/jGN9n  https://web.archive.org/web/20210524110653/https://focustaiwan.tw/society/202105150013  https://archive.vn/kPhx9
notes_H6: On 15 May 2021 Taipei and New Taipei City raised their alert levels for the first time to tier three in the four-tier system due to the recent local outbreak. Island-wide measures were announced on 15 May, including mandatory wearing of face masks outdoors.    https://archive.vn/WYEhp
notes_H8: People returning to Taiwan from overseas must quarantine in hotels rather than their own homes if there is at least one person aged 65 or above live at home.    https://archive.vn/fG4tW

name: Kosovo
notes_H1: the public campaign website can't be accessed for several weeks  https://kosova.health/
notes_H2: Testing available at the main public hospital (free) plus at private clinics (for a charge)    https://web.archive.org/web/20210416072551/https://xk.usembassy.gov/coronavirus/
notes_C7: No restrictions on internal movement.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210416072551/https://xk.usembassy.gov/coronavirus/
notes_E2: Quote: "? Lease subsidies  Further financial support is available for lessors in the  form of a lease subsidy of up to (50%) of the value of  the lease for small and medium-sized enterprises, for  April and May. Total value: €12million.  The lessee, after completing and uploading the form  through the EDI electronic system, no later than 15  May 2020, must prove that the lease contract was  concluded before 1 March 2020. They must prove  that their activity has been negatively affected by the  emergency situation.  In order to receive a subsidy of up to 50% for the  payment of rent, the lessor must have a bank account  in one of the commercial banks of Kosovo.  For this measure, the tenants who have prepaid  annual rent will not benefit, only those who have the  obligation of unpaid rent for two months from the  beginning of the pandemic."  Link: https://assets.ey.com/content/dam/ey-sites/ey-com/en_al/generic-content/pdf/ey-government-support-package-albania-and-kosovo.pdf  Property tax  Pursuant to Kosovo Law on the Tax on  Property (essentially taxing  companies/individuals based on  properties held), a decision has been  issued on the postponement of  issuance of property tax bills, including  the postponement of payment of first  installment for 2020 and  postponement of deadline for filing of  complaints on property tax bills and  certificates of assessed values.  Customs duties and VAT  All production business entities  registered in Kosovo (or their  contractors), who deal with the import  of raw materials, including wheat and  flour, for the production of bread and  bread products are exempt from  customs duties and VAT on these  supplies. The impact of these  measures on the businesses should be  considered on a case by case basis.  Business tax  The deadline for filing tax returns,  reports and payments, as well as  handling and adjudicating claims for  refunds related to the implementation  of applicable tax legislation, has been  extended from 31 March 2020 until  30 April 2020.
notes_C2: After the lockdown from 7-18 April, the restaurants and leisure facilities, shopping malls and gyms will be allowed to reopen. All employees, with the exception of systemically important employees, are still obliged to work from home. However, the number of people allowed to attend meetings such as seminars, meetings or training sessions has been increased from 10 to 30.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210427103008/https://www.wko.at/service/aussenwirtschaft/coronavirus-situation-in-kosovo.html
notes_H3: https://web.archive.org/web/20210603080337/https://www.wko.at/service/aussenwirtschaft/coronavirus-situation-in-kosovo.html
notes_E1: Quote: "Salary compensation  Financial support to companies in financial distress as  a result of their decline in activity due to a public  health emergency situation, as follows:  • Coverage of monthly salaries of employees in the  amount of €170 per employee, for April and May.  Total value: €41million;  In order to benefit from this measure, the following  criteria must be met:  — The employer, through the electronic EDI system,  must complete and upload the form and list  designed by TAK (Tax Authorities of Kosovo), no  later than 15 May 2020.  — The employer must prove that their activity was  negatively affected directly or indirectly by the  health emergency situation with the decisions of  the Government of Kosovo to prevent the spread  of the virus, proving financial difficulties through  the cash book, bank balance sheet and other  similar evidence.  — The employee can only benefit from this scheme  from their primary employer if they have more  than one employer, for the period to February  2020."  Link: https://assets.ey.com/content/dam/ey-sites/ey-com/en_al/generic-content/pdf/ey-government-support-package-albania-and-kosovo.pdf
notes_C1: After the lockdown from 7-18 April, classroom instruction is again permitted in all schools and universities in accordance with the relevant guidance of the Ministry of Education.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210427103008/https://www.wko.at/service/aussenwirtschaft/coronavirus-situation-in-kosovo.html
notes_H7: AstraZeneca being used. It appears that key workers, those with chronic conditions, and people over 80 are currently being vaccinated (A, B, C).   "With the arrival of today’s second batch, the rollout of the national deployment and vaccination plan will continue to priority groups such as remaining health workers, people with chronic diseases, and other priority groups as detailed in the plan."  Source: https://archive.vn/4hysm     "Phase one: Vaccination of high-risk groups consisting of health workers, residents and health workers of nursing homes, age groups 80+ and a part of the population with chronic diseases (people on dialysis, people with diabetes, diseases cardiovascular)."   https://archive.vn/WnteN    "April 15 - The Ministry of Health (MoH) through an announcement has announced that on April 16 in Kosovo will begin vaccination of persons aged 75-79 years with chronic diseases...Meanwhile, vaccination of people over the age of 80 and health professionals is continuing."  Source: https://archive.vn/NgtJO
notes_C3: (Order 18)  All gatherings with high risk of spreading the infection, more than 30 people (meetings, seminars, trainings) are prohibited. Regardless of the number of persons, holding a reception / consolation reception and organizing weddings is prohibited.     https://web.archive.org/web/20210422143703/https://kryeministri-ks.net/wp-content/uploads/2021/04/Vendimet-e-Mbledhjes-se-7-te-te-Qeverise-se-Republikes-se-Kosoves.pdf
notes_C8: Arrivals must either have a current negative PCR test (<72 hours old). Arrivals from India, Brazil and South Africa have been banned (Kosovo citizens must go in quarantine).      https://web.archive.org/web/20210603085252/https://prishtinainsight.com/new-covid-19-measures-enter-into-force-on-monday/
notes_C4: (Order 18,20)  All gatherings with high risk of spreading the infection, more than 30 people (meetings, seminars, trainings) are prohibited. Regardless of the number of persons, holding a reception / consolation reception and organizing weddings is prohibited.    Funerals are allowed only with the participation of close family, not more than 30 people.     https://web.archive.org/web/20210422143703/https://kryeministri-ks.net/wp-content/uploads/2021/04/Vendimet-e-Mbledhjes-se-7-te-te-Qeverise-se-Republikes-se-Kosoves.pdf
notes_C6: Curfew requirements lifted as at 31-May-21    https://web.archive.org/web/20210603085252/https://prishtinainsight.com/new-covid-19-measures-enter-into-force-on-monday/
notes_H6: "1. Wearing a mask covering the nose and mouth is mandatory, in all cases except:  11.1.When driving alone or with close family members;  11.2. During running and cycling;  11.3 When walking outside residential areas and not in groups with more than 4 people of the same family."  https://archive.vn/7XOeO
notes_H8: The following restriction on elderly and vulnerable populations was introduced:  Older citizens (over the age of 65 years) and citizens with chronic diseases (diabetes, hypertension and heart disease, chronic lung disease, patients with kidney disease, patients with suppressed immunity, oncology patients, etc.) can go out in public only in the early morning hours (from 05:00 to 10:00) and in the evening (from 18:00 to 21:00);  These restrictions are even stricter than the curfew guidelines for the general population, thus seek to further protections for elderly and vulnerable populations.  Additionally:  All residents of the Republic of Kosovo shall be obliged to wear face masks in all activities outside their homes/apartments, as well as to maintain a physical distance of 2m in joint areas outside their homes/apartments (employers shall be obliged to create conditions for this distance to be applied in work environments); All public and private institutions shall be obliged to possess hand sanitizers and face masks in accessible places, at the entrance of the building, which can be used by the employees of the institutions and visitors; It is forbidden to gather citizens more than 5 people in public squares, parks and the like.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210329203727/https://kryeministri-ks.net/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/ENG-Vendimet-13.docx
notes_C5: As of 29 July, Public transportation is now required to operate at half capacity to enable riders to follow social distancing guidelines while traveling. Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20200809121054/https://www.oecd.org/south-east-europe/COVID-19-Crisis-in-Kosovo.pdf
